Enjoy the the Baroque and Renaissance elements of the elegant Palais Garnier opera house and the spacious the Place Vendôme and the Concorde squares. Ride down the grand the Champs Elysées avenue. Pass by the iconic Louvre Museum. 
Marvel at the imposing Notre Dame cathedral. See the red windmill of the Moulin Rouge cabaret. Uncover lesser-known sights as you drive along. Finish your tour where it began in Place du Carrousel square.

name: Olfactory Escape Workshop
description:
As a first walk in the world of perfume, this workshop will allow you to familiarize yourself with perfumery.
Smell, then choose your favorite fragrances among the 180 exclusive notes of our perfume organ, and take home your customized creation of 30 mL (1.014 fl oz).
The perfumer will be at your disposal to guide you and share his expertise

name: Paris: Louvre Must-See Tour with Reserved Entry Ticket
shortDescription: Get an expert introduction to one of the world’s most popular museums on a 2.5-hour tour of the Louvre in Paris. Skip the ticket line for a private tour of masterpieces such as the Mona Lisa and Venus de Milo, as well as some lesser known gems.
description:
Home to more than 35,000 works of art, and artifacts from antiquity, the Louvre in Paris is one of the world’s best known and most loved museums. Covering more than 60,000 square feet of exhibition space, tackling this monument to art history on your own can be overwhelming.

Book this 2.5-hour private tour and you will save valuable time and stress by being taken to some of the landmark paintings and sculptures. Designed as an introduction for first time visitors, the intimate tour navigates the halls in the company of an entertaining guide.

They will lead you to some of the most celebrated pieces and answer any questions you have en route. Pose with the Venus de Milo, see the enigmatic Mona Lisa, and learn which works have made the most significant contributions to the evolution of art and civilizations.

You will also discover some of the lesser known gems buried deep within the museum's galleries. Skip-the-ticket-line access means you will spend more time admiring the art and less time queuing, and you are free to stay on and continue exploring at the end of your guided tour.

name: Paris Eclairs and Cream Puffs Small-Group Cooking Class
description: Learn the techniques and traditions of French pastry-making on this 3-hour cooking class in Paris. Follow step-by-step guidance from your instructor to make choux pastry and Chantilly cream. Master key skills such as ensuring an even rise in the oven and piping cream into your pastries. Make your own chocolate éclairs and cream puffs, they enjoy them over a cup of tea or coffee. Hear entertaining stories from the world of French pastry and enjoy personal attention from your instructor on this small-group tour, limited to eight people.

name: Paris 2-Hour Wine Tasting Session with Expert Sommelier
description: Discover France in six glasses and gain insight into the country’s famous wine regions on this 2-hour wine tasting in Paris. Learn about five of France’s primary winemaking regions and the wines for which they are famous. Gain insight into the links between flavor, grape and region, and hear how to recognize a wine’s origin without checking the label. Then, sample five wines and one type of Champagne during a blind tasting session. Enjoy personal attention from your guide, an expert sommelier, on this small-group tour, limited to 16 people.

name: Paris Croissant Making Small-Group Class
description: Gain insight into the fine art of French "patisserie" on this 3-hour croissant-making class in Paris. Prepare your dough with guidance from your instructor and learn how to fold correctly for light, fluffy croissants. Bake fresh pain au chocolat to satisfy your sweet tooth and hear handy tips for great results every time. Then, take your pastry creations from the oven and savor them with a cup of tea or coffee. Enjoy personal attention from the instructor on this small-group tour, limited to eight people.

name: Paris 2-Hour Wine and Cheese Pairing Small-Group Class
description: Sample regional French produce and learn the concept of "terroir" on this 2-hour wine and cheese pairing class in Paris. Taste four types of wine and one style of Champagne with your instructor, an experienced sommelier. Try five different types of cheese and gain insight into their characteristics. Hear the origins of the wine and cheese tasted during your class, and learn how to pair them for the best flavor combinations. Practice sabering a Champagne bottle and enjoy personal attention from your guide on this small-group tour, limited to 16 people.

name: Paris Macaron Making Small-Group Class with Advance Option
description: Master the art of making one of France’s most delicate pastries on this 3-hour macaron-making class in Paris. With step-by-step guidance from a helpful instructor, choose from a range of vibrant colors and create your elegant meringue shells. Whisk up the soft buttercream filling then carefully pipe it in. Relax as your macarons slowly bake in the oven, then taste them with a cup of tea or coffee. Enjoy personal attention from the instructor on this small-group tour, limited to eight people. Upgrade your booking for an advanced macarons class.

name: Une soirée au Diva's Kabaret in Paris
description:
Vivez une expérience parisienne classique en assistant à un spectacle de cabaret

Découvrez le cadre remarquable du Diva's Kabaret, une cave voutée du 12ème siècle, vestige des templiers.

Réservez des billets à l'avance pour garantir vos places et éviter toute déception

name: Paris Full-Day Small Group or Private Tour: Become a Parisian for a Day
description: A bit of glamour, a dose of history, a dash of quirk, and a lot of food—this total Paris tour is packed with everything you could ever need to see, do, and taste in order to be an honorary Parisian for the day. Start in the Paris fashion district, and walk with an insider guide past the Louvre and enjoy a macaroon tasting. See Centre Pompidou, sample some wine, enjoy cheese and pastries, and walk through the Marais. This tour is limited to 12 people to provide a small-group experience.

name: Flavors of Paris Original Tour
description:
Stroll through the neighborhood of Saint Germain and visit local shops, markets and restaurants sampling the finest in French fare, from the simplest crisp-crusted baguettes and velvety chocolates to exquisite olive oils, and other seasonal surprises. And not to mention memorable variations on the age-old theme of great wine and fabulous cheeses.

We’ll fascinate and delight you with what you’re tasting, as we share wonderful stories about the local cuisine and lively historical anecdotes about the quarter’s restaurants and cafés. (When you’re done, consider yourself a “Germanopratin”, or an honorary native of Saint-Germain.)

name: Quiz Room Odéon
description: Quiz Room, c'est une activité unique au monde où vous pourrez buzzer comme à la télé mais avec votre groupe d'amis, votre famille ou votre entreprise. A l'immersion dans un décor de plateau TV s'ajoute une dimension fun : des manches et des jokers qui favorisent les interactions entre les participants et qui vous permettront, également grâce à des questions accessibles et amusantes, de passer un moment inoubliable !

name: Musée d'Art et d'Histoire du Judaïsme
Private or Small Group Paris: 3 Hour Morning Cheese, Art, and Local Life Tour
description: Cheese? Check. Macarons? Check. Art? Check. Join a local guide on this private Paris tour to experience the mindblowing gastronomic feats, instantly recognisable architectural icons, and secret spots that make Paris so endearing.

name: Musée de la Magie - Musée des Automates
2 hour outdoor group activity in Paris: SAINT GERMAIN
description: Foxtrail is unique. During the activity you will encounter permanent installations that the fox has hidden around the city. They combine creativity with technology, producing fun and original challenges. Clues will require both intelligence and teamwork to solve, similar to an Escape Room. However you are free to complete the trail at your own pace, so you can fully appreciate the sights and unexplored corners of the city you will discover along the way.

name: Galerie du Credit Municipal de Paris
Sunrise Run & Sightseeing in Paris
description:
Choose your distance: 6 km (4 m) or 10 km (6 m), and let's go! We’ll be chasing the sunrise on a gentle run (your pace), plunging you into an unexpectedly empty Paris. At this time of the day, most people are still sleeping and the rising sun colours the monuments and buildings with nuances of pink and gold. This is Paris as you’ve probably never seen before!

We’ve carefully planned every step of this running tour for you to learn inside stories and fun facts, have a great time and work out before breakfast. You don’t have to lift a finger: only to move your legs!

Some reasons for joining a RUNRUN TOUR:
✔️Get to know Paris from a top-class local runner, learning things that you can't find in a guide book
✔️We're "the glamping of running": Bottled water, healthy snacks and a waterproof running jacket in case of rain are provided
✔️Work out before breakfast, feeling free to earn later the calories burned
✔️Relax and don't worry about getting lost or planning a running route by yourself

name: Jardinet De La Rue Des Ursins
Run the Lights
description:
Paris reveals itself in all its splendor at night! In this experience, we’re going to jog along a 6km/10 km (3m/6 m) route passing by illuminated streets, bridges and monuments that make Paris deserve the title of City of Lights.

The starting point of the tour will be Saint-Michel square, in the very heart of Paris. From there, your running guide will lead you on a round tour, at your own pace, past some shiny landmarks of Paris, such as Paris City Hall, the Notre Dame cathedral, the Louvre Museum, the Concorde square, the Champs-Elysées avenue, the Eiffel tower, and much more!

Some quick pauses are planned for pictures and refreshments along the way. Your running tour host will carry your belongings (small items only) inside his/her backpack and will have water and snacks ready for you whenever you feel like it. All you have to do is to put on appropriate running gear and to lace up your trainers!

name: Louvre Museum Small Group English Guided Tour
description: 2-hour Louvre tour with a professional English speaking guide. Small group with a maximum of 6 people. Quick access at the museum without queuing. Louvre ticket reusable after the visit.

name: Seine River Cruise on board Vedettes du Pont Neuf
description: Discover Paris in a different way: Embark for a Seine Cruise onboard the famous Vedettes du Pont Neuf! From the Louvre Museum to the  Notre-Dame Cathedral, passing by the Eiffel Tower, discover the most beautiful monuments in Paris the time of a cruise along the Seine. The cruise departs from Paris’ oldest bridge, the Pont-Neuf, lasts an hour and is commented by our guides in French and English. During the day or at night, feel free to make your cruise at any time according to your wishes and program.

name: Giverny Half Day Guided Trip with Monet's House & Gardens Tour from Paris
description: Transportation from Paris with a professional guide to visit Monet's House and fabulous Gardens. Entrance ticket included.

name: Mont St Michel Small Group Guided Day Tour from Paris
description:
Travel from Paris to Mont St-Michel on a minivan tour limited to just eight people to provide a small-group experience and reduced transfer time, compared to larger coach tours.

This day trip is designed for those with limited time in France who want to discover, in just one day, the marvels of Mont St-Michel, a medieval village perched on a tiny island off the coast.
- Entrance to the hilltop abbey with an audio guide is included
- Historical Museum visit with audioguide : This visit permits you discovering the jails, lugubrious dungeons and Mont Saint Michel oubliettes.
- Cider and Calvados tastings at "L'auberge de la Mère Poulard" : You will be welcomed in the "Piano" room with a beautiful Bay view, tasting 3 glasses of artisanal ciders (hard, sweet and rosé) and one calvados tasting. During your tasting, you will enjoy some "Mère Poulard" biscuits.
- Free time to explore the old streets of the village, and take in views of the bay

name: Loire Castles Guided Tour from Paris
description:
Take a 1-day guided tour from Paris to discover the three more prestigious castles of the Loire Valley: Chenonceau, built on the Cher River, Cheverny, private castle and Chambord, jewel of the Renaissance.

CHENONCEAU CASTLE:

Model of the Renaissance traditions, the Chenonceau Castle is an architectural masterpiece. Known as the "Château des Dames", five women played a part to the interior decoration, making Chenonceau one of the most romantic castle in the Loire valley.

CHAMBORD CASTLE:

Considered as the largest and most majestic castle of the Loire valley, Chambord Castle was commissioned as a hunting lodge by François I. The main attraction remains the intricate "double revolution" staircase attributed to Leonardo de Vinci.

CHEVERNY CASTLE:

The Cheverny Castle is the private property of the Vibraye family. During the visit, you could admire its wonderful 17th century furniture.

name: Bruges Guided Day Tour from Paris
description:
Discover Bruges, a famous medieval city, also called "the little Venice of the North". During the tour, you will enjoy the city's grace and beauty. You will be surprised by the region of the Flanders with its specific architecture, colourful charm, art of living and its hundred year old traditions. Classified as part of UNESCO Heritage, the city of Bruges is well-known as "the little Venice of the North " because of its numerous canals which cross the city.

During your pedestrian tour, you will discover "le Beffroi, la Grand'Place, la Basilique Saint-Sang , le Béguinage, ... " Another way to enjoy the charm of the city is one hour cruise on its famous canals. During the winter, the cruise is replaced by a visit of the gothic style town hall. At last, you will have free time to stroll through the colourful lanes and places of interest and you will look for typical specialities from Bruges such as chocolates...

name: Visite Guidée du Louvre en Français et en Petit Groupe
description:
Une visite guidée de 2 heures des oeuvres essentiels du Louvre (La Joconde, La Venus de Milo, La Victoire de Samothrace, la Galerie d'Apollon, le Sacre de Napoléon ....) en compagnie de notre guide conférencier.

Cette visite guidée est limitée à 6 participants (maximum) pour une approche plus personnalisée et une interaction avec le guide.

Vous bénéficierez d'un accès coupe-file au Musée et disposerez de temps libre, après votre visite guidée, pour continuer à découvrir le Musée, jusqu'à l'heure de fermeture.

name: Versailles Audio Guided Tour from Paris
shortDescription: Discover the Palace of Versailles at your own pace on a full or half-day tour from Paris. Walk the grounds and gardens, tour the interior, and admire the beauty of the French Baroque architecture, all while learning about the history of the royal family.
description:
Enjoy a day trip from Paris to the Palace of Versailles, an architectural beauty. Cross the western districts of Paris before taking the motorway to the Versailles town, a royal château located in a former village. The Palace of Versailles was the de facto capital of the kingdom of France over a century. Now it is known as the wealthy suburb of Paris.

You can discover Versailles on your own as you tour the inside and wander the grounds. You will be given audio guides on arrival to enrich your visit with commentary, and this architectural masterpiece will enchant you through its beauty and historical richness. Visit the Royal State Apartments including the Hall of Mirrors, King’s apartments, and Queen’s apartment, followed by a leisurely stroll in the Palace gardens.

name: Musee d'Orsay: Small Group Semi-Private Tour
shortDescription: Visit the Parisian’s favorite museum, and the largest collection of Impressionist art in the world. The Musée d’Orsay is home to some of the world’s greatest masterpieces – this magnificent museum is a hidden gem that should not be missed!
description:
“My dear friend, your train station looks like a Palace of Fine Arts while our Palace of Fine Arts looks like a train station” is what the architect Victor Laloux heard in 1900 when his spectacular station was inaugurated. Nowadays this wonderful light and airy space is home to the Musée d’Orsay. Dedicated to the art of the second half of the 19th century, one of the most exciting and daring periods in artistic history, you will discover how the Impressionist movement burst onto the scene and changed the face of art forever.

Follow your guide and step into a world of color and light. Monet, Manet, Van Gogh, Cezanne and Renoir, this museum is home to some of the greatest, and most recognizable works of art in the world. Witness up close the swirling colors of the artistic revolution, as your expert guide explains not only the artworks, but also the incredible changes that were also taking place in French society at the time.

Learn about the colorful and often unconventional lives of the mythical artists represented here, many of whom lived and worked in Paris. It’s not surprising that this visit is also one of your guides’ favorites! Benefit from a small group visit with only 7 people or fewer, allowing for a relaxed and intimate visit of this spectacular collection.

name: From Paris: Full-Day Champagne Tour
shortDescription: This day trip from Paris takes you to Reims and Épernay to explore vineyards and prestigious champagne houses. You will also visit Hautvillers village, made famous by Dom Pérignon.
description:
Discover the secrets of how the king of wines is made. This full-day trip from Paris takes you to the French Champagne region to immerse yourself in the effervescent culture of this remarkable drink.

The first stop on your champagne tour is a visit to one popular champagne house, Moet & Chandon, Mercier or Taittinger on the sparkling hillsides of Épernay. Moët & Chandon was established in 1743, and their champagne became famous in the 1750s when King Louis XV demanded sparkling wine.

From there, your tour continues to the village of Hautvillers, located just north of Épernay on the banks of the bubbling river Marne. Hautvillers is where Dom Pérignon worked to improve the quality of wine and champagne in the 1670s.

Continuing north, your guide will take you for champagne tastings at a family producer

name: Paris: Louvre Museum Skip-The-Line Tour
shortDescription: Discover a world of treasures on a skip-the-line tour of the Louvre Museum in Paris. See works of art from antiquity to the early 19th century, such as the “Nike of Samothrace,” frescoes by Botticelli, early Renaissance paintings from Florence, and more.
description:
Explore the vast galleries of the Louvre Museum, and admire timeless works of art from Ancient Egypt and Greece, to the early 19th century. Your guide will lead you around the rich collection of paintings, statues, and more to see some of the building’s many highlights.

The tour concentrates on the 3 different periods of the Renaissance, Neoclassicism, and Romanticism. View the breathtaking statue of the “Nike of Samothrace,” a 2nd-century BC marble sculpture of the Greek goddess Nike (Victory). Marvel at Botticelli’s fresco of “Venus and the Three Graces Presenting Gifts to a Young Woman.”

Renaissance highlights include Mantegna's “Saint Sebastian,” while Leonardo Da Vinci is represented by paintings such as the “Mona Lisa.” Admire the vast painting by Veronese of the “Marriage at Cana,” the largest in the Louvre, and learn about the Romanticism of Gericault's “Raft of Medusa.”

You will also see Delacorix's “Liberty Leading the People,” commemorating the July Revolution of 1830, the sinuous nude of Ingres' “Une Odalisque,” and Jacques-Louis David’s “Crowning of Napoleon,” and “The Oath of The Horatii.”

name: Paris Latin Quarter 2-Hour Private Walking Tour
shortDescription: Visit the oldest part of Paris on a guided walk and get an idea of what the city looked like during the Middle Ages. In this center of university life you’ll feel the youthful energy that flows through the Latin Quarter's ancient streets and monuments.
description:
This 2-hour guided walking tour of the Latin Quarter takes you to the very heart of medieval Paris, and you’ll get an idea what this area, now renowned for its elegance and sophistication, used to be like.

As you walk along the cobblestone streets, you’ll come across many students who attend the district’s various universities, including the Sorbonne, world-famous for its high standards and centuries-old traditions.

The area exudes a youthful spirit of rebellion and progressive ideas, which are in contrast with the ancient streets and churches of the medieval era. This is Paris where tradition truly meets the future.

Your tour takes you through the many layers of the Latin Quarter. Along with the historic monuments and beautiful, old-world architecture, you’ll find the hottest jazz clubs of Paris, as well as nightclubs, cocktail bars, and hip restaurants.

Principal sites visited on the tour include Shakespeare and Company, Rue Saint-Séverin, the Church of Saint-Séverin, Hôtel de Cluny, La Sorbonne, the Panthéon, Church of Saint-Étienne-du-Mont, and the Luxembourg Gardens.

name: Paris: 3-Hour Private Segway Tour
shortDescription: See the highlights of Paris by self-balancing bike on a 3-hour Segway tour. Glide serenely past iconic monuments such as the Eiffel Tower and Place de la Concorde. Marvel at Les Invalides and the romantic Pont Alexandre III over the River Seine.
description:
Segway past some of the most magnificent sights in Paris on a 2 to 3 hour tour by self-balancing bike.

Meet your guide on Avenue Duquesne for a short orientation session on how to operate the 2-wheel electric vehicles. Then, follow a route that takes in landmarks such as the Eiffel Tower, Champ de Mars, National Residence of Les Invalides, Pont Alexandre III, Place de la Concorde, and Louvre Museum.

Travel in a small group for a more intimate experience, and get fascinating facts from a knowledgeable guide along the way. The personal transporter will ensure easy navigation throughout the city, making it possible to cover more ground than you could on foot, as well as access places you couldn’t by sightseeing bus.

name: Marais District of Paris Guided Walking Tour
shortDescription: Discover the secrets behind Paris’s former royal neighborhood on this 2.5-hour tour of the Marais. Your guide will lead you through the tiny streets, courtyards and mansions that make up this quintessentially Parisian district.
description:
Start your tour of the Marais by learning about its historic importance. This district once lay beyond the center of Paris. Today, it is at the heart of the city. Discover the Church of Saint Paul and Saint Louis before walking through the courtyard of the majestic Hotel de Sully.

Continue experiencing the royal history of the Marais by exploring the pristine Place des Vosges, a public square with unparalleled beauty in Paris. Afterwards, move forward in time to learn all about the bustling Jewish community that put the Marais on the map through the 18th and 19th centuries. Wander past the bakeries and boutiques of the Pletzl before strolling the shop-laden rue des Francs Bourgeois. All the while discover mansion after mansion, former homes to nobility that once called the Marais home. Some are now museums, like the highly worthwhile Musée Carnavalet.

The tour may also introduce you to both the Hotel de Ville, or City Hall, and the Pompidou Center, both architectural masterpieces from very different periods.

name: Paris: City Tour with Louvre Tickets & Cider with a Crepe
shortDescription: Discover the history, culture, and gastronomy of Paris on this private walking tour. Visit Notre-Dame, taste a Parisian crêpe, and explore the Louvre with time-saving skip-the-line tickets.
description:
Follow your guide to uncover the hidden parts of Paris that only the locals know on this walking tour. See city highlights like ‘Ile de la Cité’ island, Pompidou Center, and the Tuileries Gardens. Make the most of your time by skipping the line at the popular Louvre Museum. 
Feel like a local as you stroll through picturesque neighborhoods like the beautiful Seine island of ‘Ile de la Cité.' Stop at Notre Dame to experience this jewel of French medieval architecture for yourself. 
Head to the Church of Sainte Chapelle to admire the stunning stained glass work. Take in the bohemian atmosphere as you cross the romantic Seine river. Get a taste of modern architecture at Pompidou Centre.
Eat like a local at a creperie restaurant as you savor an authentic Parisian crêpe paired with cider. View the playful figures in the Stravinsky fountain as you eat. Walk through the beautiful Tuileries Gardens and marvel at the glamorous Garnier Opera House. 
Find out where Marie Antoinette was beheaded. No trip to Paris is complete without a trip to the Louvre Museum. Avoid wasting time in line at this popular attraction with your direct access tickets. Uncover facinating information about the artwork with an audio guide.

name: Paris: Private Customized City Highlights Golf Cart Tour
shortDescription: Embark on a customized private guided city highlights golf cart tour and see another side of Paris. Marvel at sights such as the Eiffel Tower, Louvre Museum, and other iconic sights.
description:
Climb aboard an eco-friendly Golf Cart for a different sightseeing tour of Paris and explore the famous streets by electric vehicle. Choose from short tour option to get a good overview of the city, or upgrade to the half, petit and full-day tours for a more comprehensive experience.

Benefit from pick-up at your hotel and the option to customize your itinerary to suit your interests. Take up to 3 of your friends on a tour by Golf Cart for 1 to 4 people. See all the landmarks and tell the driver where you want to stop and for how long as you drive through the city.

name: How to interact like a Parisian in a real situations
shortDescription: Feel like a local on a guided walking tour in Paris while learning the language. Learn French words and phrases, and have full blow conversations with local bakers, waiters and shopkeepers.
description: If you find speaking French in France a bit intimidating, this Paris walking tour is for you. With the help of a local Parisian, learn how to express yourself like a French person while visiting bakeries, shops, and restaurants. Start on the right foot with instruction on how to express yourself in different everyday situations including ordering at bakeries and restaurants, taking public transport, and going shopping.  Your local guide will teach you both formal and informal French so you can sound like a Parisian. There is no judgement here, no need to worry about your accent or pronunciation. Learn common phrases and local slang you won’t find in guidebooks. Having learnt some essential phrases, its now time to practice them. Visiting a bakery, bar, restaurant or store you can try out your new skill with your guide on hand to help. This is a fantastic opportunity to practice and improve your French, and to know the real Parisian life with a local. Leave the tour more confident with your French language skills and having seen a different side of Paris through the eyes of a local.

name: Parc Asterix: Private Transfer from/to CDG Airport
shortDescription: This is a private transfer service to/from Parc Asterix from/to Charles de Gaulle Airport. Benefit from 24-hour tourist assistance for your whole stay.
description: Leave the stresses of airport transfers behind by booking a comfortable and relaxing private transfer between Charles de Gaulle Airpor and Parc Astérix. Transfer service is available every day, from 4:00 AM until midnight, except for December 24 and 31, when it’s available until 6:00 PM.

name: Paris: Bohemian Montmartre Guided Walking Tour
shortDescription: Join a guided walking tour to discover the history of one of the most famous bohemian districts of Paris: Montmartre. Visit the famous Basilica Sacré-Coeur and discover the secrets of this area.
description:
Discover another world hidden inside Paris on this guided walking trip through Montmartre. Explore this bohemian area with sex shops, cabarets, famous restaurants, windmills, wine yards, and painters. Hear local secrets and learn about the different artists who’ve called this place home. 
After meeting your guide, hit the Montmartre streets. Walk through the famous Lepic Street and admire the characteristic architecture. Find out why Napoleon changed the usual direction to the top of the hill. 
Spot the building where Van Gogh lived and where he got inspired for one of his masterpieces. Then, learn about the most popular Parisian cabaret Moulin Rouge, from how they started to how they work today. 
See the place where the word bistrot (bistro) was born and learn about the story behind its creation. After an unbeatable view of the city, you'll learn the history of the church that you can see from everywhere in Paris, Sacré-Coeur.

name: Paris: 90-Minute Boules Game in the Park
shortDescription: Enjoy a game of boules in the historic surroundings of la Bastille. The fun game is a traditional French sport that every man, woman and child loves to play. Become a local for the evening in serene surroundings.
description:
You have heard the expression “When in Rome, do as the Romans do.” Well, when you are in Paris you should do as the Parisians do. That means playing a game of boules, the relaxing activity the French like to think of as a “sport.”

Every man, woman and child in France has played the game and played to win. It is as French as “pommes frites” and as amusing as a 2CV. Your playground for the evening is one of the most intimate gardens in Paris, just steps from the Louvre.

You will learn how to throw the boules in the company of expert Parisian instructors, who will also provide that other essential French ingredient, a glass of wine (or soft drink if you prefer).

So sign up for this amusing activity “ce soir.” It takes place every evening at 5.30 pm and requires no special equipment or experience. Just bring your enthusiasm and prepare for a laugh.

name: Paris: Invalides Dome - Skip-the-Line Guided Museum Tour
shortDescription: Discover France’s turbulent and illustrious military history on this tour of the Musée de l’Armée. Housed inside the gold-domed building known as the Hotel des Invalides, this museum will reveal secrets and stories of Napoleon and Louis XIV.
description:
Your guide will lead you through the epic courtyard of the Invalides, discussing its 17th century roots as a veteran’s hospital under King Louis XIV. You’ll visit the cathedral that Louis built for his former troops, who found respite here after returning from battle.

After discussing the Sun King’s contributions to France’s military history, you’ll learn all about the nation’s most elite leader, Napoleon Bonaparte. A brilliant general and audacious emperor, he is synonymous with France’s golden days of military conquest. Ultimately pushing too far, Napoleon died in exile, though his remains are interred underneath the magnificent gold dome. See his tomb up close, as well as the tombs of those closest to him, while basking in the ornate homage to this leader.

Spend some time in the museum to learn all about this man, beyond his famous stature, through artifacts, recreations and military maps that walk you through his many wins and defeats.

name: Paris: Private Transfer from CDG Airport to Disneyland
shortDescription: Enjoy a private transfer for arrivals at Charles de Gaulle Airport to Disneyland Paris. Make the most of your vacation with easy transportation and enter a magical world.
description: Avoid the stress of finding a taxi or sharing a shuttle when you land at Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport and enjoy a hassle-free arrival with a private transfer service. You will meet your local driver inside the airport and relax on the way to Disneyland Paris. A one-hour wait service is also included in case of delay. Book a private Paris airport transfer including taxes and parking fees. Leave the driving and mapping in the hands of a local professional. After a long and tiring air journey, enjoy a ride in a clean and sanitized private vehicle.

name: Paris: 2.5-Hour Multicultural Foodie Tour
shortDescription: Get to know the international side of Paris on a guided tour. Try French, Italian, Argentinian, Japanese, Basque, and other types of cuisine with a local foodie expert.
description:
You will make minimum three stops.

French tapas (bouchées) and seafood.
Starters,
Main dishes,
Desserts.

Examples of some dishes that you might try include:
Italian and Spanish hams,
Basque specialties,
French Duck Foie Gras,
Duck Magret,
Crêpes,
Ceviche,
Olives,
Argentinian and French Beef,
French regional dishes,
Cheeses.
All included with wines.

Your guide, Francois, opened the Cordon Bleu in Japan 30 years ago. But he is first Engineer in viticulture, Champagne owner, oenologist, and winemaker. He lives in central Saint-Germain-des-Prés and knows all the hidden gems and good plans.

name: Paris: Skip-the-Line Private 2-Hour Louvre Tour
shortDescription: Discover the stories behind the world’s most famous works of art. Hear all the gossip about Mona Lisa, Venus de Milo, Winged Victory, and more. Choose your itinerary with your private guide.
description:
Admire the beauty of this iconic museum on a 90-minute tour that hits all the high spots and gives you the lowdown on famous paintings, sculptures and artifacts. Your tour begins at the controversial Pyramid, next to the Tuileries Garden, where a pesky little red ghost has lived for hundreds of years.

Once inside, head back in time to the period when the Louvre was a fortress, as you walk through the shadows of the Medieval Foundations. Soon you will come face to face with the Great Sphinx of Tanis whose riddles have puzzled for thousands of years. Throughout your tour you will walk past thousands of paintings, sculptures and artifacts, and hear scandalous tales of murder and cannibalism.

Your tour has been carefully planned to stop at over a dozen of the world’s most well-known works of art, all of which hold secrets and gossip, bringing it all to life in a new way you never imagined. The tour concludes at the most famous lady of them all, Mona Lisa. From here, once you tear yourself away from the bewitching Mona Lisa smile, you are free to stay in the museum as long as you wish and your tour guide will provide handy tips for other marvels to behold on your own.

name: Paris Combo: Bike Tour, Seine Cruise & Eiffel Tower Ticket
shortDescription: Experience the ultimate day in Paris with this exclusive tour. Unlike any other tour, this combo tour includes three unique ways to see Paris: by bike, by boat, and from high above.
description:
See the absolute best Paris has to offer with this incredible tour combination. Get a great overview of Paris by bike as you get up close and personal to some of the world's most famous attractions. See Paris from the river with an unforgettable cruise down the Seine River. Finally, discover one of the most well-known attractions in the world with skip-the-line access to the Eiffel Tower.

Your day kicks off with a visit to Paris' most famous monument: the Eiffel Tower. Your ticket allows you to skip the notoriously long lines and go straight to the 2nd level before ascending to the very top.

After a break for lunch, it's time for the bike tour which starts at 3:00 PM. This tour is a fabulous way to visit Paris on a comfortable cruiser bike. Whether you're a Paris rookie or seasoned veteran, the goal is to not overwhelm you with monotonous facts you can find in any guidebook. Instead, the tour offers the famous local attractions, local knowledge, educational information, great photo opportunities, and heaps of fascinating stories from your tour guide.

Included in this combo tour is a 1-hour cruise on the River Seine - the perfect compliment to your day out in Paris. On the boat, you will pass beneath Paris' most famous bridges and by many of its most popular attractions including Notre Dame, Musée d'Orsay, and more. This ticket allows you to join a cruise whenever you'd like, so you are welcome to join a boat cruise following your bike tour, or on another day during your time in Paris.

name: Paris: Versailles Golf Cart & Bike Tour with Palace Entry
shortDescription: Discover the Palace of Versailles and Gardens on this tour. Explore the gardens on a golf cart tour, bike down the Grand Canal, enjoy a French picnic, and visit the Palace with a skip-the-line ticket.
description:
Explore the Palace of Versailles and its gardens on an educational yet fun guided day trip. Tour the Palace of Versailles Gardens on a golf cart. Cycle to the Petit Trianon and Grand Trianon. Enjoy a typical French picnic lunch with wine. Then, skip the line to tour inside the palace on your own.
Our journey begins at the main entrance of the Palace, at Place d'Arme, located at the foot of the majestic golden gate (Grille Royale). We will first head towards the south parterre, located on the opposite side of the Palace, where our rides (Golf Carts) will be waiting for us (If you wish to drive the Golf Cart please bring your driving license or a picture of it on your mobile).
Our Golf Carts are the perfect way to travel through the amazing Royal Gardens and discover all the wonderful hidden groves and fountains created by the infamous André Le Nôtre. Sit back and relax or take the wheel and enjoy the beauty of formal French Gardens while our Guide tells you all about it.
After our hour-long journey through the Groves and the Apollon Pond, we’ll arrive at the Grand Canal. We will then trade our carts for bikes (we have hundreds of bikes suitable for children, teenagers, and adults) and pedal along the Grand Canal to the Domain of Trianon. There, we'll park the bikes, and our guide will provide you with fascinating historical information about the Petit Trianon and the Queen's Hamlet which you will have free time to explore on your own.
You will discover the amazing rustic retreat built for Marie Antoinette, inspired by the traditional architecture of rural Normandy, and the Petit Trianon, where Marie-Antoinette would regularly come to escape the formality of court life and shake off the burden of her royal responsibilities.
After the visit to the Petit Trianon, it will be time for our typical French picnic-lunch break from the iconic Angelina tearoom and restaurant. Get some rest and enjoy a choice of white, rosé, or red wine while our guide continues telling you fun and historical facts about French Monarchy.

Once we have regained our strength, we will cycle to the Grand Trianon, and you will have free time to explore this amazing pink marble Palace. Louis XIV used this enchanting palace to get away from the court and pursue his affair with Madame de Montespan.
We will then cycle along the Grand Canal and enjoy the breathtaking view further from the Palace. Then we’ll head to the Neptune fountain where we will leave our bikes and make our way back to the front of the Palace, crossing through more beautiful Groves, such as the marvelous Bosquet des trois fontaines.
You can then access the Palace on your own, at the end of the Tour, when it is less crowded, with a skip-the-line ticket. From there you will be able to explore, at your own pace, the iconic royal residence of the French Monarchy and its most famous room: the magnificent hall of mirrors.

name: Paris: Daytime or Sunset Eiffel Tower Tour
shortDescription: Head up the iconic Eiffel Tower with elevator access. Embark on a 60-minute guided tour and hear about the structure and its creation for the International Exposition of 1889.
description:
Visit the Eiffel Tower with a local guide and a direct access ticket. This activity will save you valuable time and make sure you get the most out of your visit to Paris' most iconic landmark. Take the elevator up to the second floor or the summit, depending on the option selected.
The Eiffel Tower is a symbol of France and the brainchild of an engineer named Gustave Eiffel who built it between 1889 and 1891 for the World Exhibition. During your visit, your guide will tell you anecdotes and important facts in an engaging manner.
Climb the elevators and arrive directly on the second floor where your guide will tell you about the different monuments that you see like the Arc de Triomphe, the Pont Alexandre III, the Invalides, Sacré Coeur, and Montmartre as well as the Louvre and much more.
If you have chosen the option with the visit to the top, you must change the elevators; otherwise, you will visit the first and second floors. This activity promises to make for an unforgettable experience during your visit to Paris.

name: Paris: Chocolate and Pastry Tour with Tastings
shortDescription: Experience the sweet side of Paris on this chocolate and pastry tour through the streets of Montmartre. Try unique French sweet and pastry specialties with your passionate, local English-speaking guide — guaranteed to satisfy a sweet tooth.
description:
Follow your friendly guide through Montmartre — the epicenter for pastry and chocolates in Paris. Walk down traditional Parisian streets and discover local cafés, brasseries, art galleries and small museums on the way. Eat like the locals do as your passionate guide takes you to all the best local spots.

The walking tour will last between 2 and 2.5-hours with five or six stops to try the best French chocolate and pastries in the area. Leave the tour with a stomach full of delectable treats, local knowledge, sightseeing tips and memories that will last a lifetime.

name: Paris: Murder Mysteries Group Walking Tour
shortDescription: Experience a walking tour through Paris with an experienced English-speaking guide and learn all about the the darker side of the City of Lights.
description:
On this 2-hour walking tour you will learn about the city’s darker side as you glance into its macabre underbelly. Paris has a long and tragic history of murder and execution, of rampant disease among the lower classes, and of bitter wars fought against a corrupt monarchy. The tour rips open the cloak of darkness, as you wind down alleyways and cut through the hushed night.

Your English-speaking guide will take you to sites such as the Place de la Vert Gallant, where the last of the Knights’ Templar was burned at the stake. You will visit St Germain de Auxerrois, where estimates say some 30,000 people were killed in the St. Bartholomew’s Day Massacre.

Your guide will point out places of interest as you stroll, leaving no stone unturned. As you delve into stories of ritual worship, you will learn about characters like Napoleon Bonaparte, Marie Antoinette and Henry IV, as well as the serial killers that once stalked these ghastly streets.

name: From Paris: Private Normandy D-Day Beaches Tour
shortDescription: A one day trip to discover the incredible history of thousands of soldiers who landed in Normandy on 6th June 1944. Depart from Paris, then your chauffeur will drive you to the Memorial of Caen, Colleville Cemetery, and Pointe du Hoc.
description:
Depart from your hotel in Paris and then, after 2.5 hours driving, arrive at Colleville Cemetery. Nearly, 9387 American soldiers died during the landing and you will see the perfectly aligned gravestones across this expansive green lawn. The Cemetery visitor center is also very helpful if you wish to know more about the details of Operation Overlord.

Omaha Beach was the code name for one of the five sectors of the Allied invasion. the beach is just under the cemetery and was the theater of one of the most intense periods of fighting. The beach was nicknamed the Bloody Beach. You will stop by Arromanche, the seaside city which was a priority target of Allied troops. You will be able to have lunch at one of the restaurants that your driver will recommend to you.

To end the visit, you will be driven to Pointe du Hoc. Symbolizing the courage of the young American soldiers involved in its storming, the famous Pointe du Hoc was one of the strongest German fortifications and was taken by force on the morning of 6th June by Colonel Rudder’s Rangers. The site, full of emotional memories, has been completely redeveloped; its impressive appearance bears witness to the intensity of the battle which took place here. You will then return to Paris.

name: The Orsay Museum: Guided Visit for Families with Children
shortDescription: Visit the Orsay Museum as a family with a friendly guide. The museum, housed in a former train station, is steeped in history and contains a wealth of artwork from the 19th century.
description:
Specifically adapted to accommodate for children's shorter attention spans this tour is perfect for families with children. Your guide will adapt their language to hold the attention of the children while simultaneously answering any questions you may have. You will feel welcomed as a family while discovering the richness of the museum’s collections in a beautiful setting.

In terms of collections, the museum is a prime spot to discover the Impressionist movement. It features painted and sculpted masterpieces by famous artists, including Monet’s Poppies, Manet’s The Luncheon on the Grass and Olympia, Renoir’s Dance at Le moulin de la Galette; Degas’ dancers and Cezanne’s The Card Players.

Each work of art in the museum has a story and significance, but your guide will avoid overwhelming you and focus on selected major works. If you or your children are art enthusiasts, your guide will adapt the tour to any requests you may have. What better way to experience the Orsay than to visit as a family?

name: Paris: Best Ever Food Tour
shortDescription: Treat your taste buds on an unforgettable 3-hour food tour of Paris, and savor the flavors of France in artisan stores tucked away on winding streets. Explore picturesque neighborhoods to find gourmet shops, and sample cheese and chocolate along the way.
description: Go on a culinary adventure into the heart of Paris to discover designer incredible baguette, yogurt, artisan cheeses, tasty charcuterie, croissants and much more.

name: Paris Small-Group Half-Day Bike Tour
description: Experience Paris charming back streets, local neighborhoods and amazing monuments as you cruise leisurely through the city of lights. Perfect for all ages and fitness levels, this bike tour is a fantastic orientation to Parisian culture and local secrets. Discover areas like the Marais, Bastille , Seine riversides, the Latin Quarter and secret passageways.

name: Romantic Cruise "The Old Paris" on the Canal Saint Martin
description:
This romantic and out of the ordinary trip of around 2.30 hours offers an opportunity to hear the history of the districts of the "Parisians Paris" as you cruise along the calm waters of this canal, lined with hundred year old trees and spanned by elegant footbridges.

You will slide under the mysterious and spectacular vault of the Bastille, where the light is there magic.

This cruise, which will take you through four double locks with swirling waters and two swing bridges, will allow you to experience the "atmosphere" of the Hotel du Nord created by Marcel Carné, Arletty and Louis Jouvet and share the pleasure of the walkers strolling along the banks lined with pretty boutiques and charming retro style cafés.

Before arriving at the Parc de la Villette (City of Sciences, The Géode, City of Music and themed gardens) you will cross the Bassin de la Villette, formerly a trading port now redeveloped to form the setting for the Rotonde de la Villette.

name: Wine & Cheese
description: Stefan, le plus charmant et le plus humble professionnel du vin de Paris. Toujours avec le sourire, il aime transmettre sa passion du vin, sa connaissance des vignobles et des terroirs. Partager ses nouvelles découvertes et rassembler les gens autour d’une bonne bouteille, telle est sa vocation.

name: Paris Eiffel Tower Neighbourhood Tour With A Local
description:
Get your camera ready, join a local guide and prepare for some epic views of the Eiffel Tower. But not just any views – these are the views only locals know about. In addition to amazing photo ops you’ll also explore off the beaten path to discover the charming area of Passy, with its pedestrian streets and hidden alleyways. Stop in a local market, enjoy a decadent pastry, and cap off your tour with a glass of wine in an unexpected venue. What could be better?

During the tour you will hear about the water fountains in Paris and how to fill up your bottle instead of buying new ones. You will also learn about the “weird” or “scandalous” social housing policy of this wealthy neighbourhood.

name: Paris Small-Group Food Tour of the Marais
description: Wander through the best preserved medieval neighbourhood in Paris. Sample a selection of some of France’s best wines or brandies. Indulge in plates of cheese or charcuterie and taste a creation from Paris's most famed macaron chef. Discover the centre of the city’s Jewish and gay communities. Spot the hidden squares, tucked-away alleyways, and marvellous churches of Marais. This small group tour is limited to maximum 12 guests.

name: Paris City Sightseeing Bus Tour
description:
Best deal !

Discover Paris during two hours within a double-decker bus totally revisited with translucent roof, retractable windows ... and individual audio guides (9 languages : French, English, Spanish, Italian, Russian, Japanese, Portuguese, German) ... and second floor heating.

Two hours of discover even if it is raining!

You will admire the main 40 tourist sites and monuments in Paris : from the Louvre to the Tour Eiffel going by the Champs-Élysées and Arc de Triomphe, Notre-Dame, Invalides, Pont Alexandre III ... An unbelievable moment just magic !

name: Mont Saint Michel Guided Tour with Abbey Visit from Paris
description:
A guided tour, specially designed to discover, in one day, the Mont Saint-Michel's marvels. Transportation from Paris by bus or minivan. Entrance and visit of the Abbey included with audioguide.

During this day trip, you will take the most impressive "Marvel of the Western world", the Mont-Saint-Michel which is erected in the heart of a large bay surrounded by the sea and spring tides.

You will discover the medieval city, the Abbey, and all tourist places of the site. You will travel by comfortable bus or minibus with air conditioning with a professional guide who will trace the history of Mont Saint-Michel and guide you through the medieval town and its ramparts.Enjoy a visit of the famous abbey World Heritage of UNESCO, audio guide and ticket included with time to wander at your own pace, around the old city and its streets.

This tour will let you discover Normandy as well, a rich region in history with charming landscapes all along the way

name: Paris Seine River Champagne Evening Cruise
description:
1h30 Night Seine Cruise (the most complete circuit in the Seine River)

1 glass of Champagne included (adults only)

Pass in front of the Eiffel Tower during the lights show

Live comments

Bar and snacks on board

A boat with a terrace in a Parisian Bistrot ambiance

Boarding in the center of Paris (Ile de la Cité)

Special Curfew: guaranteed return at 10:00 p.m.

name: Loire Castles Small Group Guided Tour from Paris
description:
A guided tour from Paris with only 8 participants (max) especially designed to discover the three more prestigious castles of the Loire Valley: Chenonceau, built on the Cher River, Cheverny, private castle and Chambord, jewel of the Renaissance.

Air conditioned and comfortable minivan for a reduced transfer time and therefore a more complete visit, dedicated guide for the small group.

Model of the Renaissance traditions, the Chenonceau Castle is an architectural masterpiece, one of the most romantic castle in the Loire valley.

Considered as the largest and most majestic castle of the Loire valley, Chambord Castle was commissioned as a hunting lodge by François I. The 365 chimneys, 440 rooms, 14 staircases and 800 turrets and capitals give an insight of the magnificent period architecture.

During the visit, you could admire Cheverny Castle which is also remarkable because of the inspiration for Hergé's famous Moulinsart castle in the Tintin comics.

name: Paris: Full-Day Cooking Class with 3-Course Lunch
shortDescription: Learn classic French cooking techniques at a 5-hour cooking class in the Latin Quarter of Paris, using fresh produce from the local market to turn into a memorable 3-course meal cooked by you! Enjoy a glass of wine, or two, along the way.
description:
Discover some of the secrets to French cuisine at a small group cooking class in Paris. Held in the Latin Quarter, the class is typically limited to between 3 and 7 people to keep things intimate and personal.

You wlll be welcomed at 10:30 once your hosts have returned from a local market armed with fresh produce for you to cook. Head to the kitchen and start building a menu based on what ingredients were available. This will include an appetizer, main course, and dessert using classic French techniques, such as ice cream and wine sauce.

Learn how to plan a meal, and what can be prepared in advance. In total you will learn about 6-8 different techniques.

After about 2 hours of cooking - fortified with a glass of wine or 2 - it’s time to enjoy a delicious meal, paired with red and white wines and generous servings of cheese. Sitting in the beautiful setting, you will be joined by a native Frenchman whose complete mastery of the English language will help him share stories about French food and culture.

Lunch typically finishes at around 15:00 - but nobody will be rushing you out the door!

name: Paradis Latin
shortDescription:
Il y a beaucoup de nouveautés au Paradis Latin. Venez y découvrir la nouvelle revue mais aussi le nouvel esprit de ce cabaret moderne qui reste dans la tradition toujours réinventée du cabaret parisien. 

Le Paradis Latin présente sa nouvelle revue, « L’Oiseau Paradis ». Mise en scène par Kamel Ouali, elle se placera sous le signe de la sensualité, de la poésie, de l’émotion et de l’humour.

Kamel Ouali, chorégraphe et metteur en scène créatif et passionné, relève le challenge lancé par le Paradis Latin pour cette nouvelle revue.

Le spectacle commencera dès l’arrivée des clients, dans le hall du Cabaret. Comédiens, danseurs, artistes plongeront les convives dans une ambiance surréaliste et saisissante !
“Les artistes et la brigade entraîneront l’audience dans un monde féérique tout au long de la soirée. Une interaction permanente avec le public fera de chaque spectacle un moment unique.”

Créatures, danseuses, effets spéciaux et nouvelles technologies se mélangeront au milieu d’une quinzaine de décors exceptionnels signés Alain Lagarde, créateur reconnu de décors d’opéras, comédies musicales et pièces de théâtres. S’y ajoutent plus de 500 costumes créés pour l’occasion par La maison de Couture Parisienne « On aura tout vu », qui a réalisé les costumes scéniques des plus grandes stars comme Beyoncé, Katy Perry, ainsi que de nombreux ballets pour l’opéra.

Après leur collaboration aux Folies Bergères (spectacle « French Cancan »), Marie-Laure Philippon rejoindra Kamel Ouali pour remonter un nouveau French Cancan au Paradis Latin, qui sera à la fois authentique, moderne et surprenant.

Déroulé de la soirée :
19h30 : Accueil et Pré-show : dès l’arrivée, vous serez reçu par des comédiens, danseurs, artistes qui vous immergeront dans une atmosphère surréaliste et surprenante.
20h00 : Un dîner de qualité et élaboré par Guy Savoy sera servi. Les artistes entraîneront l’audience dans un monde féérique et dans une ambiance très parisienne. Une chanteuse à la voix exceptionnelle évoluera dans la salle mythique du Paradis Latin.
21h30 : Début du spectacle. La nouvelle revue du Paradis Latin intitulée « L’Oiseau Paradis », se placera sous le signe de la sensualité, de la poésie, de l’émotion, de l’humour et des nouvelles technologies.
23h00 : Grand final

Depuis 1er janvier 2020, Guy Savoy élabore la nouvelle carte du Paradis Latin. 
Il imagine pour le dîner spectacle 4 cartes par an avec une proposition de deux menus signature gastronomiques à chaque saison.
Chaque soir, cette nouvelle carte s’articule autour d’un menu Gustave Eiffel et d’un menu prestige.
Au fil des saisons, les menus se succèderont autours de conceptions uniques, subtiles et gourmandes.


Les Offres

Soirée Saint Valentin
Menu :
Le duo de saumon « Paradis Latin »
***
La tourte de « volaille - foie gras », sauce périgourdine
***
Le coeur de litchi et framboise
***
Eau minérale
Champagne* à discrétion
½ Bouteille de Vin* 
* Selection du Paradis Latin

 

Soirée Prestige (en emplacement privilégié)
Entrées :
Foie gras mi-cuit au sel de Guérande, gelée de thé fumé, orange amère
ou Avocat et ceviche de daurade-passion en habit de bambou
ou Cœur de saumon « PARADIS LATIN » rafraîchi « tarama-caviar » 
Plats :
Pavé de cabillaud et patate douce comme une brandade
ou Canette de Challans « pochée-rôtie », figues, sauce cassis
ou Paradis Wellington « servi-saignant »
Desserts :
« Tenue Blanche » citron et verveine
ou Grognardise « fraise-vanille »
Forfait boissons à 20€ : 1/2 Bouteille d'Eau Minérale
1/2 Bouteille de Vin *
1/4 de Bouteille de Champagne*


Soirée Gustave Eiffel
Entrées :
Pressé de volaille, foie gras et céleri
ou Cassolette d’escargot et champignons de Paris 
ou Velouté de carotte « citronnelle-gingembre », tartare de gambas au citron vert 
Plats :
Saumon à l’asiatique en aigre-doux 
ou Suprême de pintade « rôti-farci », tian de légumes d’Automne
ou Multicolore de légumes, œuf parfait et parmesan
Desserts :
Robe « framboise-passion »
ou Chocolat « Cancan »
Forfait boissons à 20€ : 1/2 Bouteille d'Eau Minérale 
1/2 Bouteille de Vin *

1/2 bouteille de champagne par personne + spectacle.

Présence non garantie à chaque représentation :
Les artistes du Paradis Latin jouent plusieurs fois par semaine sur une durée de plusieurs mois (9 mois minimum).
Des changements d’interprète(s) peuvent en résulter afin de préserver les capacités des artistes.
La modification de la distribution ne donne droit à aucune compensation et aucune réclamation ne sera prise en compte.
description:
Il y a beaucoup de nouveautés au Paradis Latin. Venez y découvrir la nouvelle revue mais aussi le nouvel esprit de ce cabaret moderne qui reste dans la tradition toujours réinventée du cabaret parisien. 

Le Paradis Latin présente sa nouvelle revue, « L’Oiseau Paradis ». Mise en scène par Kamel Ouali, elle se placera sous le signe de la sensualité, de la poésie, de l’émotion et de l’humour.

Kamel Ouali, chorégraphe et metteur en scène créatif et passionné, relève le challenge lancé par le Paradis Latin pour cette nouvelle revue.

Le spectacle commencera dès l’arrivée des clients, dans le hall du Cabaret. Comédiens, danseurs, artistes plongeront les convives dans une ambiance surréaliste et saisissante !
“Les artistes et la brigade entraîneront l’audience dans un monde féérique tout au long de la soirée. Une interaction permanente avec le public fera de chaque spectacle un moment unique.”

Créatures, danseuses, effets spéciaux et nouvelles technologies se mélangeront au milieu d’une quinzaine de décors exceptionnels signés Alain Lagarde, créateur reconnu de décors d’opéras, comédies musicales et pièces de théâtres. S’y ajoutent plus de 500 costumes créés pour l’occasion par La maison de Couture Parisienne « On aura tout vu », qui a réalisé les costumes scéniques des plus grandes stars comme Beyoncé, Katy Perry, ainsi que de nombreux ballets pour l’opéra.

Après leur collaboration aux Folies Bergères (spectacle « French Cancan »), Marie-Laure Philippon rejoindra Kamel Ouali pour remonter un nouveau French Cancan au Paradis Latin, qui sera à la fois authentique, moderne et surprenant.

name: Paris: Family-Friendly River Seine Guided Cruise
shortDescription: Enjoy a guided cruise designed especially for families. Children and adults alike will discover all the secrets of Paris during this one-hour cruise.
description:
Board your family-friendly cruise at the foot of the Eiffel Tower. During the one-hour sightseeing cruise, learn all the secrets of Paris thanks to your guide on board.

Listen to anecdotes about Paris and its inhabitants. Hear all about the architecture, history, monuments and bridges of the city. Secrets will be revealed, so be ready to be surprised. 

A bar on board will be serving french crêpes, snacks, and drinks. Sit back and relax as you take in the sights of one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

name: Paris: Women of Paris Audio Tour in Saint-Germain-des-Prés
shortDescription: Discover the lives of the remarkable women in Paris with a guided audio tour on your phone. Explore the heart of the Saint-Germain-des-Prés district and pass by the Notre Dame Cathedral and the Seine.
description:
Discover at your own pace, in the heart of the Saint Germain des Prés district, the incredible history of remarkable women in Paris.
Your only guide? Your smartphone! The voice of Virginie Girod, historian and columnist specializing in women's history, will guide you throughout the tour, which you can start whenever you want, alone or with others. The stories will automatically trigger as you walk from the Rewind app. Prepare to be amazed!

Let's meet at Pont Saint-Michel in the heart of Paris for this tour lasting approximately 1 hour. From there you'll have a breathtaking view of Notre-Dame de Paris Cathedral. You will discover the history of our first woman of the course, a certain Josephine de Beauharnais... Learn how she almost cancelled Napoleon's coronation, no less! While listening to the story, enjoy a magnificent panorama on the Seine.

Then cross the Pont de Saint-Michel to reach the rue de la Huchette where the story of Madame Claude, the queen of high-end call-girls in the 1960s, awaits you. Keep walking the "Caveau de la Huchette" where the mythical jazz and rock singer Nancy Holloway used to stay! Did you know that the Caveau de la Huchette appeared in the movie La La Land? Continue your journey in the heart of the Saint-Germain-des-Prés district to learn about other famous women in Paris.

A little further on you will come across the Sorbonne, the oldest university in France! Continue your way until you cross the Pantheon to discover the history of a fascinating woman: Simone Veil.

A short stop at a terrace or a shop, a small craving? Resume the visit when you want, right where you paused. Impossible to get lost. The guide provides clear audio directions and a map indicates clear directions to follow in real time. And if you take a wrong turn, the integrated geo-localization feature will get you back on track in no time! Customize your itinerary as you wish, relax and enjoy a fun and entertaining tour about the Eiffel Tower, at your own pace.

Then, join the Seine to discover on the way the two restaurants of the Eiffel Tower: the "58 Tour Eiffel" by Thierry Marx and the "Jules Vernes" by Frédéric Anton. Also learn new facts about the Tower before finally reaching the Pont de Iéna on the banks of the Seine ...

Then join the magnificent Luxembourg garden where you will discover the adventures of Simone de Beauvoir and her soul mate... Jean-Paul Sartre. The stories of many other famous women will await you during the rest of the walk which will end in front of the timeless Café de Flore. So, let's go?

name: Paris: City Exploration Game in Saint Germain
shortDescription: Try a new take on a city tour and follow the trail of the runaway fox by solving interactive clues, breaking codes, and revealing hidden messages. Explore Paris in a fun and unique way.
description:
Embark on a self-guided city exploration game to follow the trail of a runaway fox. Get to know Paris in a completely unique way, by running around and finding clues with your team. Explore the beautiful neighborhood of Saint Germain, see the sights, and tickle your brain. 
Start the game at the meeting point and solve the first riddle to get to the next location. Feel free to work in teams of 2 to 6 people to break the codes and guide you through the city streets. There is no application, you just need your hands, trail documents, and a keen eye. 
Encounter permanent installations that the fox has hidden around the city. Combining creativity with technology, the game is creative and original. Clues will require both intelligence and teamwork to solve, so work together and get to the end. 
Go at your own pace, and feel free to stop and start as you reach special locations you might like to visit. Fully appreciate the sights and unexplored corners of the city discovered along the way. 
Enjoy this outdoor activity with friends, families, or groups of all kinds in which the city becomes your playing field. If during the game you find yourself in difficulty, text the helpline to get you back on track.

name: Paris: Book a Local Friend
shortDescription: Book a local Parisian for a personalized tour. Ditch the travel guides, decide where to go, what to see and what to do together with your private, personal, like-minded guide. With a friend who knows what you like, the city will unveil its best to you.
description:
Paris, beautiful Paris. There is a reason why this romantic city remains one of the top vacay spots. Make the most of your time in France with a host in a customised experience of the city.

You'll be paired with guides that are passionate about the place they call home and who choose to spend their free time sharing it with like-minded travelers matched to them.

Explore iconic boulevards, historic landmarks, and chic boutiques as you get acquainted with the very essence that defines Paris. Choose which of the city’s top attractions you most want to see like the Eiffel Tower, the Arc de Triomphe and The Louvre, as well as stopping by a few lesser known hot spots and places of interest along the way.

Enjoy discovering amazing spots in Paris that are lesser known to the crowd but beloved by the locals. The day revolves around your wishes, so enjoy your private tour and let your local guide show you the Paris you'll love and never forget!

name: Best of Paris Bike Tour
shortDescription: Begin your visit to Paris and see Notre-Dame, the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower and loads more on this small-group bike tour.
description:
Cruise through Paris from Notre-Dame to the Eiffel Tower on a bike and see the highlights of this great city in a fun way. 
Cycle around the glass pyramids in the Louvre’s courtyard, learn about the Impressionists in the Orsay Museum, and get right into the middle of the Place de la Concorde for an amazing view of the Champs Elysées and the Arc de Triomphe.

On this half-day small-group bike tour you’ll ride along the banks of the Seine River as you breeze by other visitors and locals.

Make stops at the most picturesque spots where your guide will tell you about Paris and share little-known fun and historical facts.
Learn some secrets that will help you later as you explore Paris on your own – such as where to find the shortcut into the Louvre that saves you 2 hours of time waiting in line!

Enjoy a snack break at the Rue Cler outdoor market, where you’ll have a half hour to explore the stalls and try local treats.

name: Paris: Full-Day Cooking Class, Market Tour and Lunch
shortDescription: Learn classic French cooking techniques at a 6-hour cooking class in the Latin Quarter of Paris, visiting a local open air market to forage for fresh produce to turn into a memorable meal cooked by you! Enjoy a glass of wine, or two, along the way.
description:
Discover some of the secrets to French cuisine at a small group cooking class in Paris. Held in the Latin Quarter, the class is typically limited to between 3 and 7 people to keep things intimate and personal.

You wlll be welcomed at 09:00 with croissant, coffee and tea. After getting to know each other, head to a nearby open air market to find the freshest ingredients for your class, and experience some of the local color of the Latin Quarter.

Back at the school by 10:30, it’s time to build your menu depending on what ingredients were available. This will include an appetizer, main course, and a dessert focused on classic French techniques, such as ice cream and wine sauce. Learn how to plan a meal, and what can be prepared in advance.

After about 2 hours of cooking - fortified with a glass of wine or 2 - it’s time to enjoy a delicious meal, paired with red and white wines and generous servings of cheese. Sitting in the beautiful setting, you will be joined by a native Frenchman whose complete mastery of the English language will help him share stories about French food and culture.

Lunch typically finishes at around 15:00 - but nobody will be rushing you out the door!

name: Paris: Wedding Vows Renewal Personal Photo Shoot
shortDescription: Renew your wedding vows on a 2-hour Paris tour, and recommit to your beloved in the capital of love. The private session includes a personal reading of a preferred text or poem, and a video shoot against the backdrop of one of the city’s great monuments.
description:
Say, "Yes" to your beloved once more at a unique Paris experience, and renew your wedding vows in the most romantic city in the world.

The 2-hour experience includes a private 1.5-hour photo session with a professional videographer , and can be done at a place of your choice in the city center. One of the most popular options is against the backdrop of the Eiffel Tower, where your celebrant will greet you and prepare a reading of your own speech. If you are stuck for ideas, they have a selection of love poetry you can choose from.

At the end of the ceremony, your personal videogrpaher will accompany through the streets of Paris, and immortalize the moment by creating a great souvenir video in some of the most photogenic spots in the city.

The price allows you to bring up to 8 witnesses if you want to share the moment with friends and family.

name: Paris Obscur
shortDescription:
Découvrez le Paris ténébreux au fil de cette visite guidée en plein coeur de Paris.

Une visite guidée au cœur d'un Paris mystérieux, sombre et encore méconnu, loin de l'image de la ville Lumière...

Votre guide conférencier Cultival vous contera les légendes qui entourent la célèbre Cathédrale de Notre Dame et vous détaillera une ténébreuse affaire qui fit couler tant de sang au Moyen Age. Votre parcours continu devant la Tour Saint-Jacques dans les méandres de l’alchimie avec Nicolas Flamel, un savant chercheur expérimentant la transformation du plomb en or. Puis, à proximité de la place sainte-opportune, vous découvrirez effrayés, l’étroite et sombre rue Courtalon, où jadis, au temps du roi soleil, une ténébreuse affaire a eu lieu. Un peu plus loin, au cœur de la rue de la ferronnerie, vous apprendrez comment le "vert galant" perdit la vie...

Votre visite guidée insolite se terminera à la tour astrologique et astronomique de Catherine de Médicis, alias la Reine Noire. La légende raconte qu'encore aujourd'hui, durant les nuits orageuses, le fantôme du mage de la reine revient hanter la Tour...

A savoir :
- Le mail de confirmation doit impérativement être imprimé.
- Rendez-vous sur le Pont Neuf, au pied de la statue équestre d’Henri IV 15, Place du Pont Neuf, 75001 PARIS
- Déconseillé au moins de 12 ans. Tarif enfant valable de 12 à 18 ans

name: Diner Lyrique Bel Canto A Paris
shortDescription:
Un Diner lyrique au Bel Canto, c'est marier l'Opéra et un menu fin pour avoir l'assurance d'une soirée enchanteresse.

Dans les restaurants Bel Canto, l’Opéra s’invite à votre table. Un quatuor de jeunes chanteurs lyriques accompagné au piano, se mêle au ballet des serveurs.

De tables en tables, servant un verre ou tendant une assiette, les chanteurs interprètent toutes les quinze minutes environ, en solo, duo ou quatuor, des extraits de Don Giovanni, Tosca, La Flûte Enchantée, La Bohème… La surprise, la gaieté, la proximité des chanteurs créent une véritable émotion.

A Paris, les notes résonnent entre Notre-Dame et l’Hôtel de Ville, le long de la Seine. Dans un décor d’opéra, parsemé de costumes créés par les Ateliers de l’Opéra National de Paris, les grands airs prennent vie tous les jours, chantés par les étoiles de demain, à votre service pour un soir.

MENU LYRIQUE
Mises en bouche
Duo de mises en bouche du chef
Entrées
Foie gras de canard aux 5 épices, pain de mie maison et chutney façon vieux garçon.
Filet de maquereau mariné sur choux et jus de betterave.
Véritable mozzarella de bufflone au balsamique blanc, artichauts marinés.
Plats
Pavé de lieu jaune garniture façon Niçoise.
Barcarolle de poissons du marché au sésame sauce vierge et folie de quinoa.
Suprême de volaille au lait de coco, saté et semoule fine.
Epaule d’agneau de lait caramélisée aux épices, petits légumes du moment.
Trio de quinoas, petits légumes, copeaux de parmesan.
Assortiment de fromages affinés Selection of matured cheeses
Ou
Desserts
Tarte au chocolat fin revisitée.
Baba au rhum vanillé façon « Castafiore ».
La religieuse « Dulce de leche ».
Assortiment de sorbets fait maison.

Les mets servis peuvent être adaptés et modifiés selon les restrictions alimentaires ou les allergies des convives.

A savoir
1 chant toutes les 15 minutes de 20h00 à 23h30 (ouverture du restaurant à 19h30)
10€ de supplément pour Fromages et Dessert
Les menus sont proposés hors boissons

Le restaurant Bel Canto est également ouvert à Neuilly : Cliquez ici

name: Queen Symphonic - A Rock And Orchestra Experience
shortDescription:
Retrouvez les plus grands succès de Queen en concert symphonique, dans le show incontournable Queen Symphonic - A rock and orchestra experience au Grand Rex !

Avis à tous les fans de QUEEN ! Rendez-vous le 12 janvier 2022 à Paris pour revivre la légende sur scène. Après une tournée triomphale en 2018, retrouvez les plus grands succès de QUEEN lors d’un concert symphonique exceptionnel dans la salle mythique du Grand Rex !

Sur scène : les 4 chanteurs et le rock band du musical londonien « We Will Rock You » accompagnés par un orchestre symphonique. Du premier single « Seven Seas Of Rhye » à « The Show Must Go On » écrit par Freddie Mercury quelques jours avant sa mort, venez revivre en live les plus grands succès de ce monument du rock britannique, entièrement réarrangés pour orchestre symphonique.

L’occasion unique de redécouvrir sur scène « Somebody To Love », « We Will Rock You » ou encore « Don’t Stop Me Now » comme vous ne les avez jamais entendues !

Soutenu par le guitariste de QUEEN, Brian May, le spectacle a déjà voyagé dans le monde entier aux côtés des plus grands orchestres, de Londres aux Etats-Unis en passant par Sydney. Prochaine étape : Paris !
description:
Retrouvez les plus grands succès de Queen en concert symphonique, dans le show incontournable Queen Symphonic - A rock and orchestra experience au Grand Rex !

Avis à tous les fans de QUEEN ! Rendez-vous le 12 janvier 2022 à Paris pour revivre la légende sur scène. Après une tournée triomphale en 2018, retrouvez les plus grands succès de QUEEN lors d’un concert symphonique exceptionnel dans la salle mythique du Grand Rex !

Sur scène : les 4 chanteurs et le rock band du musical londonien « We Will Rock You » accompagnés par un orchestre symphonique. Du premier single « Seven Seas Of Rhye » à « The Show Must Go On » écrit par Freddie Mercury quelques jours avant sa mort, venez revivre en live les plus grands succès de ce monument du rock britannique, entièrement réarrangés pour orchestre symphonique.

L’occasion unique de redécouvrir sur scène « Somebody To Love », « We Will Rock You » ou encore « Don’t Stop Me Now » comme vous ne les avez jamais entendues !

Soutenu par le guitariste de QUEEN, Brian May, le spectacle a déjà voyagé dans le monde entier aux côtés des plus grands orchestres, de Londres aux Etats-Unis en passant par Sydney. Prochaine étape : Paris !

name: Atelier Composez Votre Parfum Avec Un Nez
shortDescription:
Découvrez les secrets de la composition d'un accord olfactif et composez votre propre parfum avec un nez professionnel !

Tout débute par la connaissance de vos senteurs préférées et celles que vous détestez, puis après avoir fait un peu connaissance, vous allez découvrir les notes de fond, de cœur et tête pour construire votre parfum. Vous serez accompagné pour le conseil et l'équilibre olfactif.

Vous choisirez ensuite vos fragrances préférées parmi les 180 notes exclusives de l'orgue à parfum. Toutes les notes viennent de Grasse et de la maison Galimard, plus ancien parfumeur de France, établi en 1747. A l’issue de l’atelier, vous repartirez avec un flacon de 30ml contenant votre création.

A savoir :
- A partir de 16 ans
- A l'issue de votre commande, vous recevrez l'adresse du lien où activer votre Pass. 
- La date de réservation est à titre indicatif. Les dates et horaires seront à sélectionner à votre convenance lors de votre réservation finale sur le site du partenaire.
description:
Découvrez les secrets de la composition d'un accord olfactif et composez votre propre parfum avec un nez professionnel !

Tout débute par la connaissance de vos senteurs préférées et celles que vous détestez, puis après avoir fait un peu connaissance, vous allez découvrir les notes de fond, de cœur et tête pour construire votre parfum. Vous serez accompagné pour le conseil et l'équilibre olfactif.

Vous choisirez ensuite vos fragrances préférées parmi les 180 notes exclusives de l'orgue à parfum. Toutes les notes viennent de Grasse et de la maison Galimard, plus ancien parfumeur de France, établi en 1747. A l’issue de l’atelier, vous repartirez avec un flacon de 30ml contenant votre création.

A savoir :
