- A l'issue de votre commande, vous recevrez l'adresse du lien où activer votre Pass. 
- La date de réservation est à titre indicatif. Les dates et horaires seront à sélectionner à votre convenance lors de votre réservation finale sur le site du partenaire.

name: Paris: Père Lachaise Cemetery Private Tour
shortDescription: Explore the legendary Père Lachaise Cemetery on a private tour. Join a knowledgable guide on an unforgettable journey that is fully customizable to your tastes and time.
description:
Situated on the top of an enchanted hill called Mont Louis, the Père Lachaise Cemetery is world-renowned for its funerary art and as the final resting place for many great cultural icons. The cemetery is a surprising open-air museum of 70,000 graves, 44 hectares and 5,300 trees. 

An experienced and licensed guide who knows this labyrinth like the insides of their pockets will be there just for you. The itinerary can be easily customized and adapted on the spot according to your tastes, interests, and time. Your guide will provide a narrative of energy and passion, balancing humor with historical accuracy.

Avoid the noisy big groups and experience this unique spot in a more intimate way as your guide reveals to you the secrets and legends of past and present. This tour can be just for you alone, for your partner, for your family, or for your group of friends - and all special requests will be fulfilled.

Many celebrities are buried here, both local and international - this includes Jim Morrison, Oscar Wilde, Isadora Duncan, Gertrude Stein, Maria Callas, Marcel Proust, Chopin, Molière, Delacroix, Piaf, Marceau, and so many more. Your guide will take you off the beaten path to visit the graves of some of the world's best, and to discover this unusual landscaped beauty.

The tour is approximately 2 hours, but the rest is up to you!

name: From Paris: Monet Impressionism Tour to Giverny by Minibus
shortDescription: Experience the beauty of Claude Monet's home and garden on this half-day tour. Discover the lily pond and its famous Japanese bridge and round off the experience with a stroll around Giverny.
description:
Enjoy this half-day trip to Claude Monet’s home and gardens. Choose between a public tour or a private tour in your preferred language and explore the home and its beautiful surroundings.

With your guide, discover the lily pond and its famous Japanese bridge, Monet’s main sources of inspiration at the end of his life. Then visit the flower garden, the house, and the former studio of the great painter.

The house of the great master is a unique place where you can see how he lived and worked, from his studio to the kitchens. Discover the beautiful works of Monet which depicted Normandy.
After exploring the home, discover the charming village of Giverny. Take some time to stroll through its small streets, before heading back to Paris.

name: Paris: Marais District Smartphone Audio-Guided Tour
shortDescription: Discover the vibrant and trendy streets of the Marais district, the Jewish neighborhood, and the heart of Paris' LGBT community with an audio-guide tour on your smartphone.
description:
Start the audio-guided tour at Place des Vosges. As you stroll through the charming district of Le Marais, automatically triggered audio commentary from the app provides more information and insight into one of Paris's trendiest neighborhoods.

See the former home of renowned writer Victor Hugo near the start of the tour. Discover a selection of attractions in the area including the Carnavalet Museum and Maison Européenne de la Photographie. Learn more about the Jewish heritage of the area and a thriving LGBT community.

The audio guide provides clear audio directions and a map indicates directions to follow in real-time. If you wish to stop at one of the trendy cafes for a drink or a bite to eat, simply pause the app and resume the tour when you are ready. The audio tour finally leads you to the Hotel de Ville, Paris's city hall near Ile de la Cité, and the Seine River.

name: Medieval Paris Private Walking Tour
shortDescription: Travel back to the early days of Paris on a private 2-hour walking tour of its medieval monuments. Learn the history of the city in the Middle Ages at sites such as the Notre-Dame Cathedral, and one of Europe’s oldest and most famous universities.
description:
Explore life in Paris 800 years ago on a 2-hour tour of the most important Medieval sites in the city, including the Hotel de Cluny, Notre-Dame Cathedral, and Fountain of the Innocents. Your guide will tell you about the culture, art, and architecture of the Middle Ages while walking along Medieval streets to discover façades that retain their Medieval symbols.

Along the way, visit the imposing Notre-Dame de Paris, the most important monument to Medieval Paris. Wander the Latin Quarter to see where the Medieval lives on today. Pass the Hotel de Cluny, a former mansion of Cluny abbots that is now the Museum of the Middle Ages.

Go to the Sorbonne to see one of Europe's oldest universities, and marvel at the Flamboyant Gothic Saint-Jacques Tower, all that remains of the 16th-century Church of Saint-Jacques-de-la-Boucherie.

Learn the mercanitile history of Les Halles, and see the oldest intact fountain in Paris at the Fontaine des Innocents. You will even learn the surprising connections the ultra-modern Centre Pompidou has with the Middle Ages!

name: Versailles Bike Tour with Palace & Queen Farm Entrance
shortDescription: Skip the lines of the Palace of Versailles and grounds on an 8-hour bike tour, with transfers from Paris. Go to a local farmers market to purchase fresh French produce for a picnic lunch on the lake, see Marie-Antoinette’s private farm, and much more.
description:
Explore the 2,000-acre grounds of the Palace of Versailles on a full-day bike tour from Paris with a entry timed ticket, and discover the unrivaled opulence of the Sun King’s royal residence.

Following your transfer from Paris, start the day at the farmer's market in the town of Versailles. Select the produce you want for a picnic lunch later in the day, choosing from the mounds of cheeses, fresh fruits, charcuterie, and more.

Then, it’s time to cycle the landscaped grounds of the Palace, cruising effortlessly from one picturesque spot to another on lightweight aluminum bikes. 
Your guide will take you to the outhouse chateaux of the Petit and Grand Trianon, and show you Marie-Antoinette’s private village and farm. Pedal through sumptuous landscapes, ending with a look inside the Chateau of Versailles itself.

Here, you will be given plenty of time to focus on what interests you most, explore at your leisure. Feel free to take a rapid tour in 30 minutes, or loiter for 3 hours to marvel at the Hall of Mirrors, Marie-Antoinette's bedroom, the King’s Royal chambers, and more.

Learn about the life, legends, and scandals of the decadent Sun King (Louis XIV) and Marie Antoinette, and the resulting French Revolution that brought about the beheading of the French Royalty.

name: Orangerie Museum Guided Tour with Monet's Water Lilies
shortDescription: Skip the long lines to the Orangerie Museum and take a guided tour through the 19th and 20th-century history of French art. Marvel at masterpieces by Monet, Matisse and many other artists.
description:
Stroll through the beautiful Tuileries Gardens to reach the former Orangerie where the royal family kept their oranges in the winter. Skip the long lines to enter the Orangerie Museum and see some of Monet's beautiful paintings of water lilies, now on permanent display.

Follow an expert art historian guide around the expansive collection of 19th century and early 20th-century paintings. Get a better appreciation of the techniques of the French Impressionists and their disciples. Study paintings of fruit and flowers by Cezanne, learn about the exotic style Matisse used for his seductive portraits and trace the different stages of Picasso through his interpretations of nude models.

Learn the secrets behind works by artists including Modigliani, Renoir and Utrillo.

name: Paris: Hop-On Hop-Off Bus Tour & Seine River Cruise
shortDescription: Explore Paris at your own pace on this hop-on hop-off sightseeing bus. Listen to entertaining commentary as you marvel at the Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame, Sacre Coeur, Louvre Museum, and Champs-Élysées.
description:
This hop-on hop-off bus tour of Paris takes you on an exploration of the city's top attractions. Discover the city at your own pace with stops near the Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Arc de Triomphe, and much more. This city tour takes you to more than 50 points of interest around Paris.
Experience the beautiful avenues, the stunning architecture, and picturesque views at the top of an open-air bus. Hop on and hop off at your leisure to create your own customized journey around the city. 
The tour includes informative and entertaining commentary that guides you through the city. To see the city from a different perspective, your hop-on hop-off city tour will be combined with a sightseeing cruise on the Seine River.
The cruise takes you past the many stunning monuments and museums, while sailing under several beautiful bridges, showcasing the best landmarks in Paris. 
The individual audio commentary shares the hidden stories of Paris, along with the historical and cultural significance of the attractions, helping you decide which to visit once you’re back on land.

name: Montmartre: Private Treasure Hunt for Families and Kids
shortDescription: Explore the Bohemian atmosphere of Montmartre with a private kid-friendly guide. Your kids will have tons of fun with an amusing treasure hunt and engaging activity booklets. Plus, get the best views of Paris on a cable-car ride.
description:
Montmartre is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Paris. Its artistic atmosphere and views of Paris are unbeatable, but visiting it with kids can sometimes be tricky. This fun walking tour will allow the whole family to appreciate this charming part of town and its fascinating history, all while keeping your kids entertained.    

Meet your guide outside the Anvers metro station—they'll be ready with activity booklets for your kids full of questions and riddles. Head to the top of the hill in a cable-car, where the views from the esplanade will stun your whole family.  

Through riddles and fun games about the many artists who once lived in this area, your children will hear all about the remarkable lives of these famous painters and about their works of art. Your guide will tell you all about the quarter’s notorious windmills, vineyards, and cabarets, as your kids relive some crucial moments in Montmartre’s history.  

Finally, make your way to the public gardens, where your kids will solve riddles, shake hands with a former local resident, cure another person’s headache, and receive a lesson in French Romance.

name: Paris: 2-Hour Street Art Tour
shortDescription: Discover Paris in a unique light as you uncover the city's rich urban art scene. Admire the sight of the city's open air gallery as you traverse the Belleville neighborhood on a 2-hour guided walk.
description:
Welcome to the visual delights of a fantastic tourist-friendly, off-the-beaten-track area called Belleville. Explore a different and vibrant side of Paris that only a few know of. This is not the Paris of yesterday. No, it's the Paris of today!

Belleville, with its charming small streets, is where the iconic French singer Edith Piaf grew up and where many other artists have lived. Belleville became the center of Paris's urban art movement, which is what you'll be exploring on this tour. Your guide is passionate about urban art and will be sharing with you works by both French and internationally-known street artists, from a giant wall fresco by Jérome Ménager to the mosaic tile creations of the artist Space Invader.

The tour is relaxed and change never ends as works of art appear one day and disappear the next under the colors of another piece. You may even come across artists working on a new mural during the 2-hour walk!

name: Paris: South Pigalle Smartphone Audio-Guide Walking Tour
shortDescription: Use a self-guided audio tour to explore the quartier of Pigalle, home to Paris's liveliest cabaret clubs and nightlife scene.
description:
Start the audio-guided tour at St. George Square in the "New Athens" district, just south of Pigalle. Learn about the neighborhood of Pigalle which evolved into a bustling red-light district in the 18th century. With automatically triggered audio commentary from the app, hear about the courtesans and libertine personalities of Paris's liveliest area.

Learn more about the history of sex work in Paris, which historically has been centered primarily around the Pigalle district. Discover more about the famous cabaret shows and nightlife hotspots of the area. Hear about notable residents of Pigalle, including renowned artists such as Henri Toulouse-Lautrec, Edgar Degas, and Pablo Picasso.

The audio guide provides clear audio directions and a map indicates directions to follow in real-time. If you wish to stop at any point for a drink or a bite to eat, simply pause the app and resume the tour when you are ready. The audio tour finally leads you to the iconic Moulin Rouge, located right in the heart of Pigalle.

name: Paris: Left Bank Highlights Private Sidecar Tour
shortDescription: Discover the secrets of the left bank of Paris and explore areas such as Montparnasse and the Latin Quarter. Enjoy a unique tour by riding aboard a motorcycle's sidecar alongside your private guide.
description:
Unearth some of the best-kept secrets of Paris' left bank on a guided tour with a local expert. Travel across the vibrant districts on this side of the Seine and feel the thrill of riding aboard a sidecar through the busy city streets. Admire the breathtaking cityscape as you zoom by.
Meet your guide right by the waterfront and hop into their sidecar for a thrilling adventure. Explore the fascinating history of immigration in the Montparnasse neighborhood before zipping off to the Pantheon to learn all about Paris' first real power broker.
Gaze at the archaeological site of Arènes de Lutèce and learn what called the Romans to the city, inciting them to build this ancient amphitheater. Dive into the charming Latin Quarter to take in its warm atmosphere and hear some stories about its history.

name: Paris Flea Market Insider's Tour
shortDescription: Search for treasures and bargains at the Paris Antiques Market, with the help of an insider guide. Rummage through clothing, jewelry, watches, and more at the world's largest flea market.
description:
From pirates' pearls to haute couture dresses, the world's largest flea market awaits you on this private tour with an insider guide. With more than 2,500 stalls, the Paris Flea Market of Saint-Ouen is laden with hidden treasure – but knowing how to navigate it can be a little daunting for a novice.

For a period of 90 minutes, and up to 2 hours, your personal guide will show you how to recognize the best artifacts and find unique, good-quality treasure at the best price. Your guide will show you how it all works and where to hunt for the items that beg you to be bought.

You will learn to identify quality versus garbage and how to negotiate, Parisian-style! You will also get a little lesson in flea market culture and be able to chats with local shop owners. Find everything from antique weapons to Paris memorabilia on this introductory tour that gives you a much better sense of the city-within-a-city, preparing you to raid the market for that perfect piece!

name: From London: Paris Self-Guided Day Trip with Eurostar Ticket
shortDescription: Enjoy an independent trip to Paris from London by Eurostar. Travel around the city at leisure and visit the many iconic sites and monuments.
description:
Spend a day exploring Paris at your own pace on this day excursion from London. Travel round-trip on the Eurostar with reserved seating from St. Pancras Station.

See the top sights of the city, including the Eiffel Tower, Sacre Coeur, Notre Dame, the Arc de Triomphe and the Louvre Museum. Visit museums, shops and spend some leisurely time at a cafe or restaurant.

In addition to your round-trip train tickets you’ll receive a Paris map and an information pack to get things underway.

name: Paris: Versailles Palace & Gardens Ticket and Audioguide
shortDescription: Skip the long ticket lines to the Palace and Gardens of Versailles, and discover them at your own pace with an audio-guided tour. Enjoy a choice of departure points for your bus transfer from central Paris.
description:
Explore the Palace of Versailles with this ticket and audioguide. Enjoy a comfortable roundtrip journey from Paris to the palace, visit the glittering Hall of Mirrors, and relax in the Palace Gardens. 
Meet your driver at one of 2 departure points in Paris and head to Versailles on a comfortable bus. Upon arrival at the UNESCO World Heritage-listed monument, a trilingual host will first escort you to the château. 
You then will discover more about the site from the informative audio guide available in 11 languages. Delve deep into the heart of court life and learn how the Palace of Versailles grew from a hunting lodge for Louis XIII before his son Louis XIV transformed and expanded it, moving the court and government of France to Versailles in 1682.

Explore the dazzling Hall of Mirrors and the opulent State Apartments. Follow in the footsteps of Louis XIV ("The Sun King"), and stroll among gardens designed by André Le Notre at your own pace.

From May to October, your ticket includes the legendary Musical Fountains & Gardens Shows. Watch as the water features light up in a dazzling spectacle to complete your day in Versailles before returning to Paris by bus.

name: Paris: Professional Photoshoot at the Eiffel Tower
shortDescription: Book an exclusive photoshoot with a photographer in front of the Eiffel Tower in Paris. Have a professional photographer capture high-quality digital photos of your visit to this iconic sight.
description:
Turn your visit to Paris into a memory that will last a lifetime with a photoshoot session in front the Eiffel Tower. Let your professional photographer who knows all the best angles take snapshots of you outside this stunning landmark. 
Choose between an basic option of 15-20 photos, a premium of 30-40 photos, or go all out with a VIP photoshoot with 60-80 photos at 3 nearby locations. All options include professionally edited, high-resolution digital photos. 
Meet your photographer at the Carousel of the Eiffel Tower. Bring your smile and follow the instructions of your professional photographer to get some great shots. Enjoy the thrill of taking a private photo shoot at this iconic landmark.

Get your picture taken alone or with the special people in your life. Be sent a personal link to your pictures within 24 hours. View and download the high-resolution images on your own device.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower's Madame Brasserie Gala Dinner
shortDescription: Enjoy a dinner on the first floor of the Eiffel Tower with this booking for Madame Brasserie. Savor mouth-watering delights prepared by the Parisian chef Thierry Marx in an iconic setting.
description:
Enjoy a unique moment at the top of Paris with this culinary experience at Madame Brasserie on the first floor of the Eiffel Tower. Choose from a Gustave menu with 3 courses or a Grande Dame menu with 4. Pick from options with drinks like champagne, wine, and coffee. 
Select seating with a Paris view, an Eiffel Tower view, or a seat in the heart of the Madame Brasserie restaurant. Have the option to choose from an early or late dinner option. Take the lift up to the first floor of the Eiffel Tower. Be served healthy and gourmet cuisine in a friendly atmosphere. 
Experience world-class service in a restaurant with stunning views of Paris. Discover the dishes of the committed artisan, Thierry Marx, who shares his human and environmental values with this establishment by proposing a menu prepared with local and seasonal products. 
Scan the provided QR code at reception to enjoy a digital Mystery Game about Madame Brasserie and the Eiffel Tower.

name: Paris: Skip-the-Line Arc de Triomphe Rooftop Tickets
shortDescription: Come and visit the Arc de Triomphe at Place de l'Étoile. Skip the lines to reach the top of the Champs-Élysées and feast your eyes on breathtaking panoramas of the world-renowned City of Love.
description:
The Arc de Triomphe is a Neoclassical take on the ancient Roman triumphal arch style. Fifty meters tall, the view from the platform atop the arch is well worth the hike. See the dozen Parisian avenues radiating out from the arch into the City of Light. Paris is one of the most fascinating places in the world and you will find yourself right at its center.

Inspired by the great arches of ancient Rome, Napoleon commissioned the Arc de Triomphe shortly after his victory at Austerlitz. Unfortunately, he never lived to see its completion.

At the base of the arch, the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier pays tribute to the 1.3 million French soldiers who died in World War I. Behold the eternal flame that is rekindled at 6.30 PM each evening. In addition, there is a must-see exhibition that explains the symbolic importance of this monument.

The view from the top of the arch is worth climbing the 284 stairs. From your privileged position, survey all of Paris. Unlike the obligatory Eiffel Tower trip, getting into the Arc de Triomphe is an effort not all tourists undertake. Plus, with skip-the-line tickets, you'll hardly have to break stride on your way in.

name: Paris: 3-Course Dinner Cabaret Show at Paradis Latin Theater
shortDescription: Watch a unique cabaret show choreographed by Kamel Ouali. Experience a modern, poetic and sensual show combining emotion and humor while savoring quality French gastronomy signed by Guy Savoy 3*
description:
Chose between 2 dinner-show menus "Prestige" or "Gustave Eiffel" and a special Gala dinner Valentine's Day menu:
Autumn/Winter Menu 2022/2023 – Signed by Guy Savoy, 3*

name: Paris: Seine River Cruise & Montparnasse Tower Entry Tickets
shortDescription: Admire the French capital from the top of the Montparnasse Tower, which rivals the Eiffel Tower in height. Relax on a boat ride on the Seine River and take in the city's most iconic sights.
description:
Grab tickets to the Montparnasse Tower and Seine River Cruise for a night to remember. Enjoy the terrace atop the tower that rivals the Eiffel Tower in height. Grab the one-hour cruise along the Seine River and take in the emblematic monuments, with onboard commentary. 
Ride up to the top of the Montparnasse Tower, 210 meters high and with stunning panoramic views of Paris. Take sight of the Eiffel Tower from a new perspective and other spectacular monuments. The Montparnasse Tower remains the tallest skyscraper in Europe for the last 20 years. Before or after, meet at the Port de la Bourdonnais, located at the foot of the Eiffel Tower. Embark on a majestic cruise along the Seine river. Contemplate up close many important monuments of Paris such as the Louvre, Orsay Museums, Notre Dame Cathedral, and many unique bridges.

Once you book your tickets, use them anytime within the month after purchase.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower, Hop-on Hop-Off Bus, Seine River Cruise
shortDescription: Experience the famous landmarks of Paris on a one or two-day hop-on hop-off bus pass.
description:
Discover Paris from atop the Eiffel Tower and feel the pleasure of seeing this splendid city from a new vantage point. Choose a one or two-day bus pass on an open-top hop-on hop-off sightseeing bus tour for panoramic views of Paris.
Meet your guide at the meeting point in the morning and receive vouchers for the hop-on hop-off bus, the Seine River cruise, and entrance tickets to the Eiffel Tower to see Paris from the second floor or summit, depending on the option you choose.
Climb aboard our hop-on hop-off bus and discover Paris at your leisure. Stop at iconic monuments such as the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre Museum. Learn about the history of Paris with the help of our live guide, speaking through an audio guide available in eight languages. 
See the city’s famous landmarks from Napoleon’s Arc de Triomphe at the end of the Champs-Elysées, to the magnificent Opéra Garnier. A full loop takes about 2.5 hours (without getting off), or you can hop off at any of these 10 stops:
• Eiffel Tower, Quai Branly (facing Pont d’Iéna)• Champ de Mars, Avenue Joseph Bouvard• Opéra Garnier, 15 Rue Scribe• Louvre-Pyramide, Big Bus Information Center, 11 Avenue de l’Opéra• Louvre-Pont des Arts (near Pont des Arts)• Notre-Dame, Quai de Montebello (opposite Notre-Dame)• Musée d'Orsay (opposite the Orsay Museum)• Champs-Élysées, 156 Avenue des Champs-Élysées• Grand Palais, Avenue Winston Churchill• Trocadéro, Avenue Paul Doumer
Relax while taking in the views of Paris with a 1-hour boat cruise on the Seine River, valid for up to one month. Admire the UNESCO-listed buildings lining the riverbanks, including the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, Notre-Dame de Paris, and the Conciergerie. 
Pass by charming houseboats and floating restaurants along the way. A guide will be explaining the beauties of Paris to you while you relax and see the most recognized sites in Paris.

name: Paris: 1-hour Guided Segway Tour
shortDescription: Discover 12 Parisian landmarks on 1-hour guided Segway tour. Get to know the city in a short amount of time, as you cruise on a Segway.
description: See all the major sights of Paris in a single hour. Get a feel for the city as you cruise down the streets on a Segway. Meet your guide near a few blocks away from the Champ de Mars. Receive a 10-minute safety briefing from your certified Segway instructor. Spend a few minutes getting used to your Segway before hitting the streets.  Cruise by the Eiffel Tower, Champ de Mars, Lavirotte Building, the Cultural Center and the new Russian Orthodox Church, as well as other famous Paris landmarks. Stop to take photos, both on your Segway and off.

name: Paris: Direct Access Eiffel Tower Summit with Audioguide
shortDescription: Avoid long queues with direct access and head to the very top of the Eiffel Tower. Learn all about this incredible tower from the audioguide. See amazing views of Paris from the 2nd and 1st floors before heading to the summit.
description:
This is the best way to explore the most iconic monument, the Eiffel Tower. Simply book your time slot and meet your host at Place de Sydney. Enjoy a skip-the-line ticket to access the 1st and 2nd floors and admire the view of the whole city. Listen as your audioguide relates many stories regarding the Iron Lady.

From the second floor, see many iconic monuments such as Trocadero and Ecole, as well as the River Seine below with its many magnificent bridges. Experience the transparent walkway 187 feet above the ground, a complete breath-taking drop, and see Paris sprawl beneath your feet.

Then, if you select the option, take the elevator to the top level (located at 377 feet from the ground floor). Admire 360° panoramic views of Paris's most amazing landmarks: the Sacré-Cœur on the top of Montmartre, the Invalides, Montparnasse Tower, the Arc de Triomphe, and many more. 
From the Summit, 905 feet up, you will spot other important sites, such as the Louvre and Orsay Museum and La Grande Arche de la Défense. What a memorable experience!

name: Paris: Seine River Cruise with 3-Course Dinner & Live Music
shortDescription: Experience the magical atmosphere of the City of Light during a dinner cruise along the Seine River. Enjoy a gourmet 3-course meal prepared by a legendary Paris restaurant while relaxing to live jazz.
description:
Admire the banks of the Seine River during an intimate evening dinner cruise featuring prime window seating of iconic Paris landmarks such as the Eiffel Tower and Louvre. Savor a delicious 3-course meal with drinks and live musical entertainment.
Choose from a shorter cruise starting earlier in the evening or a later, longer cruise. Kick off the evening with a glass of champagne as your aperitif.
For the earlier cruise, enjoy a starter of creamy burrata, leek, and asparagus, followed by one of four main course options and moulleux (molten chocolate cake) with vanilla ice cream for dessert.
For the later cruise, appetizer choices include creamy burrata, lobster ravioli in Thai broth, risotto with black truffle chips, or a vegan option. Choose sea bass, beef filet, poultry, or a seasonal vegetable casserole for your entrée. Satisfy your sweet tooth with one of four desserts.
Enjoy beverage service to complement your meal including a glass of wine, water, and coffee or tea. Take in romantic views of the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, the Louvre, and many other famous monuments along the way.

name: Paris: Private Customized Tour with a Local Guide
shortDescription: Explore the city with a local guide who will help you discover the city like a real Parisian. Enjoy a tailor-made experience with complete flexibility to customize any part of your walking tour.
description:
With this customizable tour, transform the way you travel and pick the sights you want to see. Explore the city with a friendly local who is passionate about his or her city and eager to share all the tips and tricks that will help you make the most of your trip.

Meet where you're staying to get familiar with the neighborhood, find out about the best places to eat and buy groceries, discover the easiest ways to get around, and learn about the top things to see and do. 
By the end of the tour, you'll feel more comfortable navigating the city and confident that you have all the information needed to make the most of your stay.

name: Paris: Behind the Scenes Bakery Tour with Breakfast
shortDescription: Enjoy a guided tour of a French bakery in Paris and learn how to bake the perfect baguette. Have breakfast with croissants and a pain au chocolat, and uncover kitchen secrets from a top French baker.
description:
Get a behind-the-scenes look at a French bakery in Paris on a guided culinary tour. Spend a morning exploring the bakery, see the workshop, and discover the various steps that go into baking the perfect French baguette.
Begin your morning with breakfast at the bakery. Savor delicious croissants and a crisp pain au chocolat. Head into the kitchen and learn the secrets from the bakers themselves. See the different stations and the variety of products.
Finish your tour with your own freshly-made baguette.

name: Paris: Private Walking Tour in German
shortDescription: Experience a private tour of Paris in German. See the iconic artists' quarter of Montmartre, the world-famous Louvre Museum and the Seine with fantastic views of the city.
description:
Start your 4-hour private tour in German at Moulin Rouge, the famous cabaret, and make your way through the artists' quarter of Montmartre in the north of Paris. Hear interesting facts about the history of the area and about the artists who lived and worked in Montmartre at the end of the 19th and beginning of the 20th century.

Visit the most famous sights such as the Sacré-Cœur Basilica and the Place du Tertre and learn interesting insider information about the famous Paris artists' square. In addition to the tourist hot spots, discover the lesser known side of Montmartre, which offers beautiful places away from the crowds.

Continue to the oldest boulevards in the city, to enjoy the views. On the way see the luxury department store Galeries Lafayette. Pass the Palais Garnier and learn more about the history of the Phantom of the Opera. Make your way to Place Vendôme and the Tuileries Garden, passing the world-famous Louvre Museum. Finish your tour with a leisurely walk along the Seine and see one of Paris' most famous pedestrian bridges.

name: Paris: Mysteries and Legends Smartphone Audio-Guided Tour
shortDescription: Hear about the mysteries and legends of Paris on this tour from the Louvre to Notre-Dame Cathedral with a professional guide in your pocket. Discover emblematic sites such as the Louvre, the Pont-Neuf, and the Conciergerie with a macabre twist.
description:
Uncover the mysteries and legends of Paris on this audio-guided walking tour. With your smartphone in your pocket, follow your professional and passionate guide’s commentary as you explore the historical landmarks of the city.

Begin the tour in front of the Arc du Carrousel, right by the Louvre Museum. Discover how the Louvre and the Tuileries Garden got their name as well as all their disturbing ghost stories.

Get to know Belphégor, the indiscreet ghost of the Louvre, and find out why the Pyramid of the Louvre has been the subject of so many conspiracy stories, including in Dan Brown's Da Vinci Code.

Why did an Italian worker steal the Mona Lisa at the beginning of the 20th century? And what is the longest work of art in Paris? These questions and more will be answered as you go.

Cross the Cour Carrée and the Pont des Arts to admire one of the most beautiful views of Paris. Then, on Ile de la Cité, discover the secret history of the Order of the Templars, the former state prison, and the antechamber of the guillotine.

Take the tour at your own pace and make stops along the way as you desire. Simply pause the app then kick off again where you left off. Clear audio directions, a map, and an integrated geo-localization feature ensure you can focus on enjoying your tour without the fear of getting lost.

name: Reims Champagne Full-Day Tour from Paris
shortDescription: Experience the beauty of Champagne on a full-day tour of Reims and the wine cellars of the Champagne region. Discover where French Kings were crowned, on a guided tour of the magnificent Gothic Cathedral of Reims.
description:
Taste the famous sparkling wines of the Champagne region and visit the sacred town of Reims, capital of Champagne-Ardenne, on this 11-hour tour from Paris.

The Champagne region is famous throughout the world for its sparkling wine, and during the tour you will visit 2 legendary Champagne houses to tour the cellars. Begin with a morning orientation tour of Reims, a major city during Roman times, and at the heart of the French monarchy from the Middle Ages until the French Revolution.

Get a guided tour of the Gothic Cathedral, a dedicated UNESCO World Heritage Site and the site of the coronations of almost all French kings. Next, visit the superb cellar of Mumm Champagne (or similar), famous for its Cordon Rouge Champagne. Sample some of the goods as you learn about the delicate Champagne making process.

After lunch, tour the picturesque landscape of the Champagne-Ardennes vineyards between Reims and Épernay, one of the most famous communes in the production of Champagne. Visit the wine cellars of Nicolas Feuillatte (or similar). You will, of course, get to sample some of their superb wines.

name: Paris: Amphibious Minibus from Versailles Boat and Road Tour
shortDescription: Explore Paris by water and land on a hybrid minibus tour from Versailles. Drive across the Saint Cloud Parc, then sail from Sèvres to Paris Pont des Arts while learning about the city from your guide.
description:
During our 1 hour 30 minutes Tour, our clients will see:
Palace of Versailles, Place d'Armes, 78000, Versailles France,
non-stop passage Le pont Mirabeau, Pont Mirabeau, 75015, Paris France,
passage without stop Pont de Grenelle, Paris France,
passage without stop Palais de Tokyo, 13 Avenue du President Wilson, 75116 Paris France,
non-stop passage Tour Eiffel / Invalides, Tour Eiffel / Invalides, Paris, Île-de-France, non-stop passage Grand Palais, 3 Avenue Du Général Eisenhower Avenue Winston Churchill, 75008 Paris France,
passage without stop Place de la Concorde, 75008 Paris France,
passage without stop Orsay Museum, 1 Rue De La Légion d'Honneur, 75007 Paris France,
passage without stop Louvre Museum, 99 rue de Rivoli, 75001 Paris France,
passage without stop Pont des Arts, River Seine Between Institut de France And Palais du Louvre, Paris France,
We will drop you off @ the Passerelle des Arts in Paris.
The Seine River is called the Paris'beautest Avenue, you will easily realize why!

name: From Paris: Versailles Palace Skip-the-Line Half-Day Trip
shortDescription: Witness the beauty and elegance of the famous Palace of Versailles, discover why it is such an important symbol of absolute monarchy, and take a relaxing stroll through the majestic French-style gardens on a half-day tour of this impressive site.
description:
Discover the beauty and glory of Versailles, a world famous location, on a half-day tour from Paris with an experienced guide.

Travel back in time and go on a fascinating journey to discover the world famous palace, a symbol of absolute monarchy and its impressive and turbulent history.

Walk straight in without waiting in line and learn about and explore old French grandeur. Follow your experienced guide through the majestic rooms, the State Apartments, the Hall of Mirrors and the Queen’s private apartments.

After the tour, enjoy a relaxing stroll through the astonishing French-style gardens at your own leisure.

name: Paris: Evening Bike and Boat Tour
shortDescription: Explore Paris on a 4-hour bike tour, and see the city under the magic of its evening illuminations. Take a boat cruise along the Seine river.
description:
Discover Paris like a local on a 4-hour bike tour that also includes a boat cruise along the Seine river.

Climb aboard a comfortable city bike and follow your guide on a tour of some of the most spectacular monuments of Paris as they are lit up for the night. You will cycle from the Notre-Dame to the Eiffel Tower.

Along the way, pass the Pyramids at The Louvre, learn the secrets of the parisians monuments. Stop on the Champs Elysées for a view of the Arc Of Triomphe, and discover the golden gates and glass ceiling of the Grand and Petit Palais. Cylce cross the Pont Alexandre III and enjoy the river banks.

Then, enjoy a cruise along the Seine river on boat with commentary from your guide.

name: Paris: Vallée Village Outlet Shopping Day
shortDescription: Grab a designer bargain at the Vallée Village Outlet Mall and spend the day shopping for quality fashion and homeware items in a relaxed environment. Skip the stress of public transport and get direct access with air-conditioned transportation.
description:
Spend an enjoyable day shopping your way through multiple outlet stores at the Vallée Village Outlet Mall just 35 minutes from central Paris. Find great discounts on designer garments and items for the home, with everything from dresses to jackets, shoes to jewelry, sportswear to men’s shirts.

The village, unique in France, groups together a hundred or so prestigious fashion and home decorating brands, offering their previous collections at reduced prices 7 days a week, all year long.

Choose from Armani, Bally, Calvin Klein Jeans, Diane Von Furstenberg, Diesel, Gérard Darel, Guess, Jimmy Choo, Joseph, Lancel, Paul Smith, Salvatore Ferragamo, Sandro, ST Dupont, Ventilo, Zadig & Voltaire, and many more. French and international brands are present in the open-air village, where each house is a boutique.

You will get round-trip transportation to and from central Paris, traveling in comfortable, air-conditioned coaches and minibuses, and plenty of time to enjoy the extra facilities such as a range of food outlets and a kids playground.

name: Conciergerie
shortDescription:
Visitez la résidence royale la plus célèbre de l'Ile de la Cité. Ancien Palais et de Justice et prisons, ces lieux vous racontent les épisodes sombres de l'histoire de France.


Un splendide palais gothique. Du Palais de la Cité médiévale subsistent la salle des Gardes et l'immense salle des Gens d'armes érigées sous Philippe le Bel ainsi que les cuisines édifiées sous Jean le Bon. 
 
De la résidence royale au Palais de justice. Les rois de France délaissent le palais à la fin du XIVe siècle pour s'installer au Louvre et à Vincennes. L’activité judiciaire s’y développe, et des prisons sont aménagées.
 
Prison révolutionnaire. La Conciergerie devient un des hauts lieux de détention pendant la Révolution française avec l’installation du tribunal révolutionnaire. Sa prisonnière la plus célèbre est Marie-Antoinette. Une chapelle commémorative est aménagée à l’époque de la Restauration à l’emplacement de sa cellule.

Poursuivez la visite en achetant vos billets pour la Sainte-Chapelle et laissez-vous éblouir par les 1113 vitraux de ce joyau du gothique rayonnant.

A savoir :
Toute l’année : de 9h30 à 18h
Fermeture à 16h les 24 et 31 décembre ; Fermeture les 1er mai et 25 décembre 
Dernier accès 30 min avant la fermeture.

- Entrée gratuite pour les moins de 18 ans et les 18 à 25 ans ressortissants et/ou résidents de l’U.E
Autres gratuités et tarifs réduits, voir avec la Conciergerie.
- Gratuit le 1er dimanche du mois (du 1er novembre au 31 mars) et lors des Journées du Patrimoine.

Afin d'accéder à la Conciergerie, vous devez impérativement présenter le code-barres présent sur ce billet électronique Ticketac (billet imprimé ou sur votre mobile).
Votre billet est valable 6 mois à partir la date d'achat pour un seul passage au contrôle..

- En temps normal, le Billet open est valable à n'importe quel moment de la journée choisie pour un seul passage au contrôle. En cette période agitée, bien que vous soyez en possession de billets non datés, et afin de gérer le flux de visiteurs dans le monument, nous vous remercions de vous inscrire en ligne sur le site internet du monument afin de choisir une date de visite via le lien indiqué sur le mail de confirmation envoyé à l'issue de votre commande.

name: Paris: Musée d'Orsay 1-Day Ticket with Reserved Access
shortDescription: Get reserved access to the Musée d'Orsay in Paris and enjoy more time inside to see the artistic masterpieces of one of the world’s greatest museums. Admire works by Impressionists and Post-Impressionists, including Renoir and Van Gogh.
description:
Explore one of the world’s best art museums at your own pace with a reserved access day admission ticket to the Musée d'Orsay. Avoid lengthy lines and the hassle of ticket counters.

You’ll simply show your voucher directly at the dedicated entrance for visitors with pre-bought tickets. After a security check, you’ll be able to walk straight inside.

The Musée d'Orsay is located in the former Gare d'Orsay train station and is home to one of France's largest national collections of art. The major section of the museum is dedicated to Impressionist and Post-Impressionist paintings, but you also find some sculptures, photographs, and furniture.

This is considered one of the best galleries in Paris and contains masterpieces such as Dance at le Moulin de la Galette by Renoir, Apples and Oranges by Cézanne, Van Gogh's self-portraits and many other unique pieces you’ll have the opportunity to admire.

name: Paris: Skip-the-Line Ticket to Sainte Chapelle
shortDescription: Take a self-guided tour of Sainte Chapelle in Paris with skip-the-line tickets and a visitor booklet. Marvel at the more than 1,000 stained glass windows in this jewel of the Gothic period.
description:
Discover the remarkable Gothic style and stunning stained glass work of the Sainte Chapelle Cathedral in Paris with this skip-the-line ticket. Admire this jewel the French Gothic aesthetic at your own pace with a self-guided tour booklet.

Spend an hour admiring the spectacular stained-glass windows that contribute to making Sainte Chapelle so famous. Arranged across 15 windows, each 15-meters high, the stained glass panes depict 1,113 scenes from the Old and New Testaments. 
Learn more about these glass depictions using your tour booklet. Discover facts about sacred relics and items such as the Crown of Thorns or the Image of Edessa that were once held here. Gaze up at the star-painted ceiling.

name: Paris: 1-Hour Illuminations River Cruise
shortDescription: Admire the beautiful monuments of Paris illuminated for the evening on an enjoyable 1-hour on the River Seine.
description:
Take a night cruise on the River Seine and enjoy spectacular views of Paris illuminated against the night sky. Enjoy informative audio commentary on your smartphone as you cruise on this boat trip past the city's most famous buildings.
Embark on this round trip boat excursion to see Paris by night. Listen to the on board audio-guide commentary on your smartphone (available in 14 languages) to learn more about the Eiffel Tower, Louvre Museum, and other attractions.

Glide gently through the Paris of today and yesterday as you enjoy panoramic views from the classic trimaran boat, with terrace and exterior passageways. Marvel at the illuminated sights such as the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, and Musée d’Orsay. 
See the spooky gargoyles of Notre Dame, and pass the imposing façade of the Louvre Museum, Grand Palais, and many more sites.

name: Paris: Wine and Cheese Lunch
shortDescription: Taste 5 different wines from 5 different regions, including Champagne and Bordeaux, paired with delicious cheeses, during this Parisian lunch.
description:
Enjoy a leisurely lunch that provides a great opportunity to taste and learn about French products. Starting at noon in a beautiful tasting room close to the Louvre, try 5 different wines from 5 different regions of France. 
From Champagne and Bordeaux, Sancerre and Rhone, sit back and enjoy this tasty “Tour de France” of wine and cheese.
Most of the presentation will be focused on wine. But enjoy food suggestions and pairings, and listen as your sommelier explains why each cheese works with individual wines. Indulge in 2 of the best delicacies from France, learn how to read a French wine label and how to pair wine with food.
Along with wine and cheese, try some charcuterie of smoked ham from the south-west of France and some Corsican saucisson to bring even more joy and color to the table.
The wine bar is located in a ‘hotel particulier,” previously owned by Mme de Pompadour in the 17th-Century. Voltaire, Rousseau, and George Sand used to come to these famous receptions organized by the lady of the house. In the beautiful old vaulted cellars, the most famous French wines were stored to serve to guests.

name: Sainte Chapelle : Billet Coupe File
shortDescription:
Sur l'île de la Cité à Paris, visitez la Sainte-Chapelle, joyau du gothique rayonnant édifié par Saint Louis au cœur du Palais de la Cité.

La Sainte Chapelle a été contruite afin d'abriter les plus précieuses reliques de la chrétienté dont la Couronne d'épines du Christ. Découvrez ses vitraux uniques qui nimbent l'air de couleurs et de lumière, symboles de la Jérusalem Céleste.

Deux sanctuaires superposés (1242-1248) :
Les 15 verrières de la chapelle haute, dont les deux tiers sont d’origine, racontent en 1 113 scènes l’Ancien Testament et la Passion du Christ. La chapelle basse est ornée d’une Annonciation, la plus ancienne peinture murale de Paris. 

Au centre du Paris monumental :
Les reliques de la Sainte-Chapelle sont aujourd’hui conservées au Trésor de la cathédrale Notre-Dame de Paris, toute proche. En bord de Seine, la visite peut se poursuivre à la Conciergerie, le plus ancien témoignage du premier palais des rois de France.

Prolongez votre découverte de cet ensemble en achetant vos billets pour la visite de la Conciergerie

A savoir :
Horaires d'ouverture :
Du Ier avril au 30 septembre : de 9h à 19h
Du Ier octobre au 31 mars : de 9h à 17h
Dernier accès 30 mn avant la fermeture
Fermeture à 16h les 24 et 31 décembre.

- Gratuit pour les jeunes de moins de 18 ans
- Gratuit pour les jeunes de moins de 26 ans, ressortissants de l’U.E. ou résidents réguliers sur le territoire de l'U.E.
Pour les autres gratuités et tarifs réduits, voir avec la Sainte Chapelle directement.
- Gratuit le 1er dimanche du mois (du 1er novembre au 31 mars) et lors des Journées du Patrimoine.

- L’accès au monument se fait par la place Louis Lépine (Marché aux Fleurs). 

Afin d'accéder à la Sainte Chapelle, vous devez impérativement présenter le code-barres présent sur ce billet électronique Ticketac (billet imprimé ou sur votre mobile).
Votre billet est valable 6 mois à partir la date d'achat pour un seul passage au contrôle.

- En temps normal, le Billet open est valable à n'importe quel moment de la journée choisie pour un seul passage au contrôle. En cette période agitée, bien que vous soyez en possession de billets non datés, et afin de gérer le flux de visiteurs dans le monument, nous vous remercions de vous inscrire en ligne sur le site internet du monument dont l'adresse vous sera communiquée sur le e-billet.

name: Balade Au Coeur Du Marais
shortDescription:
Découvrez tous les secrets du Marais grâce à cette visite guidée : Place des Vosges, Musée Carnavalet et hôtels particuliers vont ponctuer votre parcours

En partant de l’Eglise Saint-Paul Saint-Louis plus ancien héritage de l’art jésuite de la capitale, vous vous dirigerez vers la place des Vosges, point central du quartier à la Renaissance, apaisant par ses fontaines et la fraîcheur de ses arcades. Puis vous emprunterez la rue des Francs-bourgeois, autrefois occupée par les tisserands, et comptant plusieurs hôtels majestueux, où vous pourrez admirer le Musée Carnavalet, dédié à l’histoire de Paris, de l’Antiquité à nos jours. Vous passerez par la Tour Philippe Auguste, construite au XIIIème siècle et finirez votre circuit par l’Hôtel de Rohan et ses belles écuries, puis le palais doyen de Paris, celui de Soubise.

Si ce quartier impressionne par son architecture, c’est parce qu’il est parsemé de nombreux hôtels particuliers parce qu’Henri IV en avait fait le lieu de vie des aristocrates mais, dès la Révolution, ce sont les artisans qui s’en emparent, notamment les horlogers. Il doit son nom aux anciens marécages asséchés sur lesquels il est construit, et est l’un des rares secteurs parisiens à ne pas porter la marque haussmannienne. Désormais, c’est un quartier très à la mode où vivent plusieurs communautés dans une belle harmonie.

A savoir :
- Le mail de confirmation doit impérativement être imprimé.
- Rendez-vous :
sortie du métro Saint-Paul, 10 minutes avant le début de la visite.
