Vous passerez par la Tour Philippe Auguste, construite au XIIIème siècle et finirez votre circuit par l’Hôtel de Rohan et ses belles écuries, puis le palais doyen de Paris, celui de Soubise.

Si ce quartier impressionne par son architecture, c’est parce qu’il est parsemé de nombreux hôtels particuliers parce qu’Henri IV en avait fait le lieu de vie des aristocrates mais, dès la Révolution, ce sont les artisans qui s’en emparent, notamment les horlogers. Il doit son nom aux anciens marécages asséchés sur lesquels il est construit, et est l’un des rares secteurs parisiens à ne pas porter la marque haussmannienne. Désormais, c’est un quartier très à la mode où vivent plusieurs communautés dans une belle harmonie.

A savoir :
- Le mail de confirmation doit impérativement être imprimé.
- Rendez-vous :
sortie du métro Saint-Paul, 10 minutes avant le début de la visite.

name: Heroes Bowie Berlin 1976-80
shortDescription: THE ULTIMATE DAVID BOWIE TRIBUTE 3 chanteuses / 8 musiciens / 3 choristes 26 chansons phares Le spectacle dont rêvent les fans de Bowie et les mélomanes à travers le monde. Comme si David Bowie revenait aujourd’hui sur scène avec une création spectaculaire autour de l’un des moments les plus créatifs et avant-gardistes de sa carrière : la période berlinoise. Écran géant LED tout en transparence, motion design, cinéma expérimental et lumières nous transportent dans un monde où tout est permis, où les limites de l’imagination sont transgressées. Un voyage de nuit à bord d’un train en mouvement vers des paradis artificiels.
description: THE ULTIMATE DAVID BOWIE TRIBUTE 3 chanteuses / 8 musiciens / 3 choristes 26 chansons phares Le spectacle dont rêvent les fans de Bowie et les mélomanes à travers le monde. Comme si David Bowie revenait aujourd’hui sur scène avec une création spectaculaire autour de l’un des moments les plus créatifs et avant-gardistes de sa carrière : la période berlinoise. Écran géant LED tout en transparence, motion design, cinéma expérimental et lumières nous transportent dans un monde où tout est permis, où les limites de l’imagination sont transgressées. Un voyage de nuit à bord d’un train en mouvement vers des paradis artificiels.

name: Paris: Guided City Tour by Electric Bike
shortDescription: Explore Paris while riding a comfortable electric bike on this tour. Hear historical anecdotes about Paris and let your guide take your picture at sights like the Louvre Palace and the Eiffel Tower.
description:
Discover Paris highlights like a local on an e-bike tour. Peddle through the charming streets with the help of a motor. Have the use of a raincoat, so you can enjoy the city in any weather. Take a family-friendly route that is mostly on bike paths and sidewalks. 
Meet your guide and get fitted with your helmet and bike. Test drive your bike to ensure that you are comfortable handling an electric bike. Set off on an adventure as you ride to the iconic Louvre Palace. 
Wave to the Mona Lisa as you pass the Louvre Muséum and the Carrousel shopping center. Enjoy the greenery in the Tuileries Gardens and watch the ships pass by the docks. Admire the oldest bridge in the city at Pont Neuf. 
Travel to Cité Island to view the stunning Cité Palace. View the Gothic architecture of Saint Chapelle and the rose window of the Notre dame Cathédral. Venture to the Institute of France and see the love locks on the Arts Bridge. 
Go by the Orsay Muséum which was once a train station before passing the Orsay Docks. Get up close to the Eiffel Tower and marvel at the view of it from across the Trocadero Gardens. 
Feel the immensity of the Chaillot Palace as you see both wings. Get a taste of modern art as you pass by Tokyo Palace. Be tickled by the contrast between the Great and small palace. 
Experience the connection between the US and France at the Liberty Flame in Lady Diana square. Ride by the arched Alexandre III bridge and appreciate the use of space in the Vendôme and Concorde square. Finish your tour where you began.

name: Private Wine and Cheese Tasting in Paris
shortDescription: Taste delicious French wines and cheese at the Paris apartment of an expert oenologist. Get tips on how to pair certain cheeses, such as comté and goat cheese, with different kinds of wine to help develop your olfactory senses.
description:
Enjoy moments of pure pleasure on this 2-hour wine and cheese tasting adventure at the Paris apartment of an expert oenologist, who will help unlock the secrets of French wine tasting.

Set in an intimate and cozy atmosphere, learn to savor wine by alternately using the sense of sight, smell and taste. Learn how to associate certain types of cheese with different kinds of wine, in order to develop your olfactory senses more.

You will find out everything you’ve always wanted to know about oenology, including the different grape varieties, the different technical terms, and the process of wine making.

Learn about the different types of cheese, from the floral rind cheese, such as camembert and brie, to natural rind cheese, such as chevrotin and crottin de Chavignol, or hard rind cheese, including emmental, comté, and beaufort. Learn techniques to store and savor a cheese and how to pair it with your wine.

Your guide will happily answer any questions you might have to satisfy your curiosity further, so that you can take home some great new knowledge about French wine and cheese to impress your friends.

name: Paris: Outdoor Treasure Hunt Experience
shortDescription: Try and follow the trail of the runaway fox. Solve clues, break codes, and find hidden messages to explore the streets of Paris. Make the city your playing field.
description:
In teams of 2 to 6 people, try and follow the trail of the runaway fox. Solve clues, break codes, and find hidden messages that will guide you through the city streets. No app is required, just your hands, your printed documents, and a sharp eye. Once you have booked your start time, bring your tickets and the documents you will receive via email to the starting point.

During the activity, you will encounter permanent installations that the fox has hidden around the city. They combine creativity with technology, producing fun and original challenges. Clues will require both intelligence and teamwork to be solved, similar to an escape room. However you are free to complete the trail at your own pace, so you can fully appreciate the sights and unexplored corners of the city along the way.

Enjoy this outdoor activity with friends, your family, or groups of all kinds. It takes approximately 2 hours of walking to complete a trail. If during the game you find yourself in difficulty, text or call the helpline to get back on track.

name: Paris: Conciergerie Skip-the-Line Ticket with Histopad
shortDescription: Discover the Conciergerie, a medieval royal palace that became Marie Antoinette’s prison and a revolutionary tribunal. Enjoy skip-the-line access and choose the option including a histopad, to explore this site with an augmented reality tool.
description:
Get a glimpse into the turbulent history of the French Republic, with priority access to the Conciergerie. Originally built as a royal palace in the 14th century, the building became a prison when the royal family moved residence. During the French Revolution the prison was known as "the antechamber to the guillotine."
 
Explore the cells of criminals and the tombs of heroes of the French Revolution. Discover the chapel that was once the prison cell where Marie Antoinette was held. See the largest remaining medieval hall in Europe, the Salle des Gens d’Armes.

Choose to be accompanied by an histopad, and go back in time using this augmented reality tool. Explore the medieval rooms, as well as the spaces that have now disappeared.

name: Paris: Orsay Museum Entry & Audio Guide & River Seine Cruise
shortDescription: Combine your visit to Musee d'Orsay with a River Seine cruise. Discover the museum's masterpieces at your own pace with the use of a digital audio guide, then enjoy a peaceful sail along the Seine.
description:
Create a perfect day in Paris with a skip-the-line entry ticket to the Orsay Museum, topped off with a serene cruise down the River Seine. Choose your ideal time for both activities, and enjoy an added audio guide to learn even more about the world-famous Musee d’Orsay.
No trip to Paris would be complete without a visit to the Musee d’Orsay, home to world-famous masterpieces including Van Gogh’s self-portrait and 'Starry Night over the Rhone'. Skip the long lines once you arrive, then access your digital audio guide on your phone.
Explore the museum at your own pace and listen to the audio guide’s fascinating commentary about the artworks and the artists. Discover the intriguing history of the museum itself, which was once a former train station over a century ago.
At the end of an epic visit to the Musee d’Orsay, take advantage of your time in Paris with a ride along the scenic River Seine. Enjoy a 1-hour tour along the river, and admire the City of Light’s iconic landmarks including Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower.

name: Paris: 1-Hour Seine River Wine Cruise with 3 Tastings
shortDescription: Enjoy the sights of Paris on a romantic 1-hour wine cruise along the River Seine. As you sail past the city’s attractions, an expert sommelier will serve 3 different wines and provide fascinating facts about its production.
description:
Cruise down the River Seine with your loved one, and toast the city’s many monuments with a selection of different wines. This is a Seine River cruise with distinction. For 1 hour you will drift past the city’s attractions in the company of an expert sommelier from the comfort of a private salon.

Look out for the Ile de la Cité, the Louvre, Notre Dame, the imposing presence of the Eiffel Tower, the bohemian Rive Gauche, and much, much more. During the cruise you will taste 3 different wines, usually one Brut, one Demi-sec, and one Rosé.

Although your wine guide is mostly there to serve you wines, he will be happy to answer any questions you may have, either about the winemaking process, or about the “City of Lovers.” It is one of the most romantic things you can do in Paris, offering an hour of fun and memories that will last a lifetime.

name: Paris: Private Transfer from Airport (CDG) to Disneyland
shortDescription: Enjoy a private transfer between Paris Airport and Disneyland. Book your transfer to take the stress out your airport commute and create more time for your trip to relax and enjoy the views.
description:
Take the stress out of airport commutes by pre-booking your own private airport transfer to or from Paris Airport. Rest back knowing you will be dropped off anywhere between city center and airport conveniently, safely and in comfort.

Whether you are traveling in a bigger group or with extra luggage, tailor your private transfer to your needs by indicating what you need when you book. To ensure a relaxed transfer experience, you will receive a text message shortly before your scheduled pickup with your booking reference, our customer service number, and your driver's name and contact details.

When you book your private transfer, remember to include your flight details. Your driver will track your flight so that no matter whether your flight arrives early, late or on-time, your driver will be there to greet you on arrival. Your driver will pick you up from the arrivals hall or agreed meeting point in the airport and help you to the vehicle with your luggage.

Feel secure knowing that our customer service line runs 24/7 to support you in whatever you need. Sit back, relax and enjoy the views.

Please be aware that in order to ensure a smooth travel, you will need to provide us your flight number as well as your drop off destination and pick up time

name: Paris: 2.5-Hour Private City Highlights Kickstart Tour
shortDescription: Discover the history and culture of Paris on this private tour. See the city's famous attractions like the Eiffel Tower and Louvre Museum. Walk in the Tuileries Garden and stumble upon hidden gems as your local guide takes you through the city.
description:
Get to know Paris on this private 2.5-hour introductory tour and visit the city's main highlights. Follow your local guide as they take you to popular attractions and hidden gems.

Meet your guide and walk through the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens. Lose yourself in the narrow streets of the Latin Quarter and St. Germain. See where Parisian intellectuals socialize, explore passages and corners, and listen to your guide as they tell you the history of the area.

Head to the Louvre Museum and see it from the outside. Walkthrough the elegant Tuileries Gardens to Place de la Concorde, and learn about its cruel past. Arrive at Les Invalides and hear about its connection to Napoleon. Continue on to Champ de Mars, one of the city's largest green spaces, and finally, admire the symbol of Paris, the famous Eiffel Tower. Your tour concludes at the Eiffel Tower.

name: Afternoon in the Petit Trianon & Estate of Marie Antoinette
shortDescription: Visit the hidden jewel of Versailles, the private estate of Marie Antoinette. See her beautiful private mansion, gardens and Normandy village, all hidden away a short walk from the palace.
description:
During this three-hour tour you’ll visit the Petit Trianon, an exquisite private palace set in a luxuriant garden where Marie Antoinette spent much of her time. Over 4 million people annually visit the Palace of Versailles, but for nearly 90% of the visitors the experience is limited to the State Apartments and the distant perspective of the gardens. With your expert and entertaining guide, you have the rare opportunity to really make the period and the personalities come to life by continuing your visit into more exclusive areas. Upon leaving the main palace behind, explore the surprising atmospheres and art hidden in the garden’s many groves. 

With a diamond-encrusted key, Louis XVI offered his wife Marie Antoinette an escape from the ritualized public life she found so suffocating. This key unlocked the small Petit Trianon palace, sheltered from gossip and criticism, where she could feel free. Follow in her footsteps, through her English gardens and into the place she called home. The furniture and decoration authentically represents the queen’s own taste and favored craftsmen. Y

Just down the path from the richly adorned palace, Marie Antoinette commissioned a replica rustic village, evoking Normandy with its thatched cottages and dairy herd. Here she appreciated the informal atmosphere and healthy air, and indulged in pastoral amusements. No visit to Versailles is complete without a visit to the domain of Marie Antoinette. For your comfort, and to reduce the walking distance on the tour, take the Petit Train to and from the domain of Marie Antoinette.

name: Paris Bike Tour: 3 Hours Along the River Seine
shortDescription: Discover the highlights of Paris on a 3-hour bike tour along the River Seine. Admire the stunning Notre-Dame Cathedral and the famous Eiffel Tower. See the Chaillot Palace, the magnificent Louvre, and the beautiful Tuileries Garden.
description:
Discover the highlights of Paris on a bike tour along the River Seine. The banks of the Seine have been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1991 and will enchant you as well. You begin the tour on the right bank of the Seine overlooking the Conciergerie and the Ile Saint-Louis. After crossing the Pont Notre-Dame, you discover Paris and its bridges over the centuries.

Experience the stunning Notre-Dame Cathedral and the famous Eiffel Tower. See the beautiful Chaillot Palace and ride across the largest royal square in Paris to discover the Tuileries Garden and the magnificent Louvre with its unique collection of art.

Thanks to your experienced tour guide, you will enjoy the best views along the Seine and discover a large variety of prestigious monuments.

name: Paris : The Hidden Gems of Paris in Virtual Reality
shortDescription: Discover Paris and its monuments as if you were actually there. Be amazed by a 360° immersive virtual reality experience that explores the fascinating history of the most famous monuments in Paris.
description:
Get teleported on a virtual journey through inaccessible places of Paris' monuments in a 360-degree immersion experience. Thanks to a combination of virtual and augmented reality technologies, discover fascinating stories and perspectives about these emblematic places of the capital of light.

Discover the machinery of the Eiffel Tower installed in the 19th century in its basements, access the glass roof of the Grand Palais, climb up to the top of the arrow of the Sainte Chapelle, descend into the hidden corridors of the Pantheon to discover the secrets of the Great Men, sail on the canal that flows under Bastille Square, and finish your journey on the roofs of Montmartre at sunset time.

Enjoy this fabulous virtual journey of emotions, surprises, and wonder!

name: Paris: Grèvin Wax Museum and Seine River Cruise Tickets
shortDescription: Walk among your favorite celebrities, politicians, and singers with an entry ticket to France's most popular wax museum, Grèvin Wax Museum, then admire Paris' landmarks from the water on a Seine River cruise.
description:
Book your entry ticket to the Grèvin Wax Museum in Paris and travel through time with celebrities and historical figures alike. Then, embark on a Seine River cruise and admire Parisian highlights, including the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame Cathedral. 
At the Grèvin Wax Museum located in the heart of Paris, see more than 200 personalities including stars of television, film, music, and more. Pose and take pictures with your favorite celebrities from the past and present.

Afterward, make your way to the Bateaux Parisiens Pier for a cruise along the Seine River. Admire landmarks such as the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, the Louvre Museum, the Orsay Museum, and Notre-Dame de Paris. Listen to the audio guide for facts about the monuments and environment.

name: The Louvre: Small Group Tour with Skip-the-Line Access
shortDescription: Make the most of your time at the Louvre as an informative guide whisks you to the museum's famous artworks, including the Mona Lisa and Venus de Milo, on a personalized tour.
description:
Make the most of your time in Paris and beat the crowds with skip-the-line access to the Louvre; the world's biggest museum.

On your 3-hour personalized tour, your guide will ensure your day at the Louvre is informative and efficient as you are led through a museum that would normally take weeks to cover. 
The Louvre is so big that Louis XIV used to ride his horse up and down the Louvre's corridors! Learn about the history of the museum and, of course, the world-famous art on its walls including Da Vinci's Mona Lisa and Canova's Psyche and Cupid.

Travel through time and look at art and artifacts dating from 450 B.C. right through to the 19th century. 
Begin with the medieval foundations of the former royal residence, admire one the world’s most celebrated sculptures, the Winged Victory of Samothrace, and see the royal crowns of Napoleon and King Louis XV.

name: Paris: Aquaboulevard Water Park Entrance Ticket
shortDescription: Spend the day at Europe’s biggest urban water park in the heart of Paris with this entry ticket to Aquaboulevard. Enjoy waterfalls, water slides, jacuzzis, sandy beaches, and more.
description:
Book your entry ticket to Aquaboulevard in Paris, a water park dedicated to fun and water games right in the heart of the city. Explore the park’s 7,000 square meters of activities, featuring waves, waterfalls, geysers, water cannons, and much more.
Slide down giant water slides, swim with Jonas the blue whale, and splash under the water mushrooms. Unwind in one of the jacuzzis or stretch out on a sandy beach. Easily find something for everyone to do at the park. 
Enjoy a fun yet safe trip knowing that supervision, safety, and hygiene are a top priority. Water attractions are fully staffed with certified lifeguards operating on a rotating shift, and water is checked 15 times a day and constantly filtered and recycled.

name: Paris Family Private Tour and Seine River Cruise
shortDescription: Want to discover the must-sees of Paris? Enjoy an easy-going itinerary past the highlights and hidden gems to discover Paris with a local. To keep your kids 100% involved there are also special games and quizzes. End with a cruise on the river Seine.
description:
Already picturing yourself at the majestic Eiffel Tower, the amazing Louvre, or the beautiful Palais Garnier? Visit these stunning highlights and many more during this informative and fun tour. While you wander past the beautiful landmarks you’ll discover hidden gems along the way too.

To make your kids feel extra special your guide has some fun-filled games. There’s also a special visit to Le Palais Royal gardens where your kids can feed the birds and you can take beautiful photos.

Start your journey of must-sees at the most famous museum in world: Musée du Louvre. Learn all about its history and get contemporary facts on how to plan your personal visit from your local guide. After a short photo break, it’s time to move on towards even more great monuments such as Palais Royal, the famous Paris Opéra, and, of course the Eiffel Tower. The local guides are all great storytellers; each one with a different background ranging from history to journalism. They can’t wait to share some unique insights and personal anecdotes with you and your family.

At the end of the tour, you will embark on a cruise on the river Seine and enjoy wonderful sights of the most prestigious monuments. The seine river cruise ticket can be used anytime: you may for example embark the day after the tour, if you wish.

name: Musée d’Orsay: Guided Impressionist Tour & Gourmet Lunch
shortDescription: Take a guided tour through the famous Orsay Museum - home to the world’s most complete collection of Impressionist art from Manet, Monet, Renoir, Van Gogh and more. End your tour with a delicious lunch at a spectacular restaurant.
description:
Start your Impressionist adventure by meeting your fully accredited, expert guide right in front of the museum. Forget the hassle of waiting in line, you and/or your group can bypass the ticket queues and enter the building to start your tour.

Take a guided tour through each and every one of the publicly available rooms in the Orsay Museum. Whilst inside, marvel at the wonders of the Impressionistic era and get a chance to see world renowned paintings by Van Gogh, Monet and many others. Your expert guide will use his/her knowledge to enhance your appreciation of this particular artistic movement. 

Take a stop in the gallery restaurant and enjoy a delicious lunch with wine in the Orsay station’s original Belle Epoque restaurant, opened in 1900. Savoring the traditional French cuisine under the sparkling chandeliers will be a most fitting finale to your memorable tour. After lunch, your entrance ticket allows you to return to the galleries on your own if you wish, to further explore the collection or perhaps take in a special exhibition.

name: Paris: Self-Guided Outdoor Escape Game and Tour
shortDescription: Unlock the highlights in the city center of Paris with a smartphone game. Interact with the the city sights and solve riddles at locations like the Eiffel Tower to unlock your next destination.
description:
Combine a sightseeing city tour with the fun of a trivia game with this smartphone app tour in Paris. Play the game by yourself, or compete to get the best score with a group of up to 5 others. Find attractions quickly with the easy-to-use navigation function. 
Enjoy the challenge of solving riddles and puzzles at attractions like the Eiffel Tower. Try to solve a puzzle at this stunning wrought-iron lattice tower that was named after the engineer Gustave Eiffel. Solve riddles that range in difficulty to discover your next destination. 
Uncover facts about each location as you play. Explore the city at your own pace and uncover hidden gems. Have the freedom to stop the game and resume playing whenever you want. 
Start your tour at Eiffel Tower, the symbol of Paris! Visit the Pont de l'Alma ,where Queen Diana met a tragic death and walk through the Pont Alexandre III , built to honor the name of Tsar Alexander III. Take photos of Petit Palais and Grand Palais. Then, the iconic shopping street of the Champs Elysees and its gardens await for you. Continue to the famous from the French play ''The Hunchback of Notre Dame'' the Place de La Concorde continues your beautiful journey in Paris. Admire the statues and sculptures of Tuileries Garden and the great pyramid of Louvre museum (visit the museum if you want). The Church of Saint-Germain-l'Auxerrois, built in the 7th century but unknown to many, will enchant you, while Pont Neuf, the oldest stone bridge in Paris, beautifully closes your eighth destination. A stop at the Conciergerie will pique your interest to see the prison of the notorious Queen Marie-Antoinette and the well known Saint Chapelle, while the icing on the cake for this unique tour will be Notre-Dame, about which so much has been written, so many legends have been told and you will be in awe of its ruined (for a while) beauty.

name: Discover Paris with a Local at Christmas
shortDescription: Discover Paris at the most magical time of year and explore the Christmas markets and streets of Le Marais with a local host. Learn about holiday traditions and find unique gifts and decorations for your own Christmas tree.
description:
See the festive lights and decorations of Paris at Christmas with a local host and experience the seasonal cheer of the "City of Lights" from an insider's perspective.

You'll be paired with guides that are passionate about the place they call home and who choose to spend their free time sharing it with like-minded travelers matched to them. Benefit from an itinerary that can be adjusted according to your interests following contact with your host after booking.

Stroll the cobbled streets of Le Marais and browse the Christmas markets. Find special gifts and indulge in gourmet treats such as warming chocolat chaud (hot chocolate) and mulled wine. Learn about holiday traditions like the "13 Desserts of Christmas" and visit sweet shops and pâtisseries to taste seasonal fare, such as gingerbread and Yule time logs.

name: Secret Paris Guided Tour: The Hidden Heart of Paris
shortDescription: Discover the hidden heart of Paris on a 100-minute guided tour of the city’s secret stories. Step away from the usual tourist tales, and dive down narrow lanes around the Notre-Dame, follow in the footsteps of a legendary magician, and much more.
description:
Go on a journey into the heart of Paris at its most mysterious, and explore the dark side of a city better known for its illuminations. 

Your guide will explain to you the mysteries that surround this imposing Notre-Dame Cathedral. Pass along a narrow street where a scary story of medieval blood and ink will be revealed. Then, near the Place Sainte-Opportune, you will discover the narrow and dark rue Courtalon, where once, in the time of Louis XIV, a dark affair took place. Facing Saint-Jacques Tower, discover how reality beats fiction, and in the heart of Rue de la Ferronnerie, learn how “Le Vert Gallant” died.

Your guide will tell you about the astrological and astronomical tower of the Black Queen, where the magician at the service of Catherine de Medici practiced black magic inside this tower.

name: Paris: 1-Hour Sightseeing Cruise with Bistro Dinner
shortDescription: Spend a delightful evening in Paris that combines a cruise along the Seine in a glass-covered boat with dinner and wine on the quay at the Bistro Parisien. Take in panoramic views of the city’s monuments from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame Cathedral.
description:
Le Bistro Parisien welcomes you for dinner between 18:00 and 21:30. Come and visit this contemporary, see-through bistro offering unique views of the Eiffel Tower and the River Seine. The chef uses seasonal products to prepare tasty and authentic cuisine for your enjoyment.

Adult Menu:
Starter + Main course + dessert + drinks (glass of wine or soft drink)

A vegetarian option is available

Children's menu (under 12 years old):
Main course + dessert + drink (Squash 25cl)

Pennette pasta with ham and Emmental cheese
or
Chicken supreme with crispy potatoes

Pot of ice cream
or
Chocolate cream

Before or after dinner, the 1-hour sightseeing trip on the Seine in an entirely glass-covered boat takes you through the finest parts of Paris. Enjoy the commentary and music as you discover Paris and learn about its history.

On your sightseeing cruise, you’ll have views of the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, the Parliament, Musée d’Orsay, Institut de France, Notre Dame Cathedral, City Hall, the Conciergerie, the Louvre, the Obelisk, the Grand Palais and more.

name: Paris: River Seine Cruise with Optional Drinks and Snacks
shortDescription: Enjoy a guided river cruise past the French capital's most spectacular landmarks. Escape the busy streets and learn about the city from your local guide as you sail down the Seine, past Paris's iconic sights such as The Louvre and Eiffel Tower.
description:
Hop on board for a refreshingly new perspective of central Paris. Take a relaxing river cruise of Paris and enjoy unbeatable views of the city's most memorable landmarks.

Starting at the Eiffel Tower, cruise on a comfortable boat down the river for a taste of elegant Parisian life. Glide past The Grand Palais, the Louvre, Musée d'Orsay, and Notre Dame Cathedral. Your guide will entertain you throughout the leisurely cruise with anecdotes and intriguing historical facts. 

The Paris cruise goes as far as the Institute of the Arabic World at the Ile Saint-Louis before returning you to the Eiffel Tower, and it's the most relaxing way to sightsee in Paris and is the only way to explore the city free of traffic noise and congestion.
The tour ends where it began.

name: Paris: Guided Segway Tour
shortDescription: Join a Segway tour and see Paris in all its beauty! You’ll glide by the Eiffel Tower and many other iconic attractions in a small group with an experienced guide. Spend 45, 90 or 180 minutes of effortless sightseeing on your own personal transporter.
description:
See some of the top sights in Paris on a small group Segway tour with a knowledgeable guide. Your personal transporter ensures easy navigation through the city, making it possible to cover much more ground than you could on foot and access places you couldn’t on a sightseeing bus.

On the tour you’ll have plenty of opportunities to take photos on stops organized by your guide that optimize the time available.

The itinerary takes in the Eiffel Tower, the Field of Mars, the National Residence of the Invalids, the Pont Alexandre III, and the Museum of Civilization.

Along the way your guide will provide interesting commentary about the sites you pass before heading on to the next sight of interest.

name: Paris: Comedy Show - How to Become a Parisian
shortDescription: Learn how to think and act like a Parisian at the 1-hour show in English “How to Become a Parisian” at the Theatre des Nouveautes, Paris. Laugh along with others from across the globe as you explore cultural differences, the Parisian way of life and more.
description:
Take your seats for a show with a difference, and discover what it’s really like to be a Parisian.

The English language comedy explores the cultural differences between the people of Paris and the rest of the world. Discover why they got their reputation for being rude through spot-on impressions and everyday scenarios. Get to know the difference between born-and-bred Parisians and the rest of the world.

The show has been enjoyed by more than 800,000 locals and visitors alike. Join them as you learn some typical Parisian language and facial expressions that will help you pass for a local. Find out what the protocol is for traveling on public transport, the etiquette when browsing the shops, and how best to navigate the nightlife scene.

Then, walk out knowing how to fake it as a real Parisian, and how to act in every situation you’ll encounter during your stay.

name: Skip-the-Line: Paris Catacombs Guided Tour with VIP Access
shortDescription: Discover the haunting underground labyrinth of the Paris Catacombs. Enjoy skip-the-line access to the site, where your guide will tell you about the history of the Catacombs.
description:
Paris is commonly known for its beauty and romance. However, far beneath the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre is an entirely different, intimidating world. 
In the Catacombs of Paris there is an inscription above a doorway that reads: Beware of the Realm of Death. This is a suitable warning to prepare you for a memorable, once-in-a-lifetime experience.
Access to the Catacombs is extremely limited as only 200 people are allowed to enter the site at a time. 
Consequently, lines can be very long and waits can be up to 2 hours. Privileged, skip-the-line access lets you save time and energy to make the most out of this personalized visit.
Nearly 300 kilometers of tunnels and narrow paths stretch below the streets of Paris. Originally, the Catacombs were limestone quarries, hollowed out for the construction of the most famous bridges and buildings in the city.
Beginning in the 18th century, the Catacombs served as the final resting place for more than 6 million people, and skeletons, bones, and skulls of exhumed bodies neatly line the walls and arches.
Join this exclusive small-group, skip-the-line tour and see Paris in a different light than ever before.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Direct Summit Access & Cruise by Night
shortDescription: Be amazed by the illuminated views of Paris at night on a 1-hour river cruise. Make the most of your time in Paris with a direct access ticket to the Eiffel Tower.
description:
See a different side of Paris from the water on this night cruise. Admire the city and see iconic sights such as the Notre Dame de Paris and the Eiffel Tower. Visit the Eiffel Tower with direct access and miss the vast queues.
Meet your host and board a panoramic river boat for a 1-hour cruise from the base of the Eiffel Tower. Benefit from a service that runs every 30 or 60 minutes, depending on the time of year. You can also opt to use your ticket anytime within three months of purchase.

Save time and take a self-guided visit to the Eiffel Tower at night with a direct access entry ticket. Watch over the panoramic views of iconic monuments, such as the Notre Dame de Paris and the Egyptian obelisk on Place de la Concorde.

name: From Paris: Giverny Day Trip with Audio Guide or Live Guide
shortDescription: Go on a half-day excursion to beautiful Giverny and explore Claude Monet's former home and breathtaking gardens. Admire his flowerbeds, plants, and weeping willows.
description:
Enjoy a half-day trip to the former home of Claude Monet, one of the most famous painters of French Impressionism. Located in the tiny hamlet of Giverny on the banks of the River Seine, 50 miles west of Paris, the house and gardens were bequeathed to the Académie des Beaux-Arts by his son in 1966. 
They were opened as a public museum in 1980 following large-scale restoration work. Depending on the option you choose, your tour will either be guided, audio-guided or at your own leisure. 

Depart Paris and travel by comfortable air-conditioned coach. As there is no direct public transport to Giverny, this is the ideal way to get there. 
You will drive via the western districts of Paris and take the Normandy motorway as far as Bonnières. After crossing the River Seine at Vernon, continue to Giverny through the wooded plateaus of Eure.

Giverny attracted several Impressionist painters in the 19th-Century, most following the lead of the movement’s founder, Claude Monet, who lived there for 43 years. Visit the Master’s house, where the spectacular colors and enchanting garden were designed like a work of art. 
Be dazzled by the flowerbeds and plants and get a sense of the artist’s feelings and inspirations as you stand in front of the famous water lilies and weeping willows in the delightful water garden.

name: Paris: 1.5-Hour Private Segway Tour
shortDescription: Join this private Segway tour to see the significant sights of Paris in only 1.5 hours. The route takes you to the Eiffel Tower, Field of Mars, The National Residence of the Invalids, The Pont Alexandre III and more.
description:
Explore some of the top sights in Paris on a private Segway tour with a knowledgeable guide. Your personal Segway ensures easy navigation through the city, making it possible to cover more ground than usual on foot with access to places you couldn't experience with a sightseeing bus.

On the 1.5-hour tour, you'll have plenty of opportunities to take photographs during stops organized by your guide that utilize the available time. The itinerary includes the Eiffel Tower, the National Residence of the Invalids, the Pont Alexandre III, the Museum of Civilization and the Field of Mars. Along the way, your guide will provide interesting commentary about sites as you pass them before heading to the next point of interest.

name: Paris: Street Art Segway Tour of the 13th District
shortDescription: Discover the vibrant Parisian street art scene in this 8km segway tour. See art by some of the most influential street artists of the 21st century.
description:
Get to know Paris from a new perspective in this Segway street art tour of the 13th district. Begin your tour with a safety briefing, in which your certified Segway instructor will introduce you to using a Segway. 

Then, hop on your segway and begin your tour of the 13th district of Paris. You will see some of the best street art on offer, including Microccebus Lemur by Bordalo II, 'Peace Tower' by Tristan Eaton and Dr. House by Invader. You will also see amazing murals by Okuda, Inti, C215, and Obey, who gained international fame for his Barack Obama 'Hope' poster.

Bring your camera to capture photos of the fantastic art, or ask your guide to take a photo of you with the art.

name: Paris: Private Tour with Personal Guide, Driver, and Vehicle
shortDescription: Explore the most emblematic sights of Paris on a private tour with your own local licensed guide, driver, and private vehicle. Choose where you visit, from the Champs-Élysées to the Moulin Rouge.
description:
Make the best of your visit to the city of light and enjoy a Paris private tour with us. Discover one of the most beautiful cities of Europe with a local expert. The tour is tailor made and adaptable to your own personal interests. Your driver and guide will be at your entire disposal during the total duration of the tour. You will be able to visit places such as:

- Cathedrale Notre-Dame de Paris
- Arc de Triomphe
- Champs-Elysees
- Place de la Concorde
- Trocadero
- Moulin Rouge

And many more!

name: Paris: The Tuileries Gardens Quest
shortDescription: Bring your exploration of the stunning Tuileries Gardens to life as you take part in a fun puzzle-solving adventure.
description:
Discover the iconic Tuileries Gardens in a unique way as you try to solve puzzles with friends and family in picturesque surroundings.

Begin your adventure under the triumphal arch facing the Louvre Pyramid, and explore the open-air museum that is the Tuileries.

Follow instructions on your smartphone to help a Russian billionaire complete their landscape architect's file in the game, and earn memories to treasure.

name: Musée d’Orsay: "Meet the Impressionists" Highlights Tour
shortDescription: Skip the ticket lines and step into the stunning interior of the museum. Immerse yourself in a world of incredible art by Van Gogh, Monet, Gauguin, and other artists.
description:
Begin your tour in front of the art museum, where you’ll meet your guide and a small group of no more than 15 people. Skip the lines for tickets and enter the jaw-dropping Main Hall with its towering beaux-arts ceiling vaults. Learn how it went from being a train station to having the preeminent collection of Impressionist paintings.

Dive into the collection and view famous works like Van Gogh’s Self Portrait and Starry Night Over the Rhone, Manet’s Olympia and Luncheon on the Grass, Monet’s Houses of Parliament, Gauguin’s Tahitian Women on the Beach, and many more. The collection is a who’s who of the biggest names in late 19th-century European art, so whether you are a seasoned art lover or just someone who wants to improve your knowledge, your experience will be unique and unforgettable.

Tap into the knowledge of your expert guide and avoid missing out on any masterpieces. Navigate the Musée d’Orsay's collection of world-class paintings and sculptures and understand what makes each so special.

name: Paris: Like a Local Private Tour
shortDescription: Thought the Parisian way of life was just for those living there? Think again. Now is your chance to discover what that typical “la vie en rose” is all about with your private, local guide.
description:
Having a warm croissant in the cold morning, spending some time in a beautiful park or hanging out at Canal St. Martin are just a few things from the life of a Parisian. During this 2.5-hour private tour, you’ll dive into the unique lifestyle of Paris and discover the true face of the city. Get ready to explore the city away from the tourist crowds and enjoy Paris like a true local.

Step into the shoes of your private, local guide and be amazed by the beautiful passages, amazing art galleries, petite boutiques and much more. Together, with your local host, you’ll make your way from the cultural Latin Quarter towards the hip and buzzing districts of Oberkampf and St. Martin. It’s a great way to take in both the bohemian-chic and urban vibes of the city.

Stop by places all locals love such as Sorbonne University, Jardin du Luxembourg and Canal St. Martin. Along the route, you can also visit a cool concept store or the best organic bakery in town. Make sure to keep your eyes wide open while you wander around; you might spot some great street fashion or creative local artist working on a masterpiece. Your private, local guide can’t wait to share their own unique personal anecdotes with you and give you a glimpse into their daily lives.

name: Explore Batignolles: Bohemian and Artsy Paris Tour
shortDescription: Discover the heart of the 17th borough. This bohemian local neighborhood is loved by Parisians for being peaceful and for being home to a diverse community of artists, trendy young locals, and grandparents who have lived in the area for generations.
description:
Join a like-minded local to explore the charming Batignolles neighborhood in the heart of the 17th arrondissement, a peaceful quarter that’s less touristy than the neighboring Montmartre. 

You'll be paired with guides that are passionate about the place they call home and who choose to spend their free time sharing it with like-minded travelers matched to them.

Browse chic boutiques as well as local open-air markets, pop into fromageries and boulangeries like the locals and stroll along the charming streets while browsing their stylish boutiques and épiceries.

Wander through the streets and soak up the classic Parisian style, stopping to enjoy a coffee or crepe at a local café, immersing yourself in the café culture that the neighborhood is known for. Walk along the Rue Sauffroy, which is the center of the neighborhood’s African community, and browse shops selling products from across the continent.

Get recommendations from your local host for other neighborhoods to explore to get another glimpse of the real Paris as the locals see it.

name: Free Tour Macabre Events, Legends and Mysteries of Paris (Available in Spanish)
description:
In this tour we will not talk about architecture, art or fashion, we will focus on those macabre events that have marked the history of France , we will learn about some legends that have fed the folklore of the city and the mysteries that they contain.
We will talk about the best cakes and pies in the city during the fourteenth century, we will know the legendary beginning of the gargoyles. We will talk about the atrocities they carried out in prisons, public executions * and much more.
Our tour begins at 5:00 p.m. and for 2 hours we will tour the island, ending in what was the cemetery of the Holy Innocents.

*Some topics discussed on this tour may be sensitive for children under 12 years of age.

name: Paris Latin Quarter - Free Walking Tour (Available in )
description:
Paris Latin Quarter Walking Tour / Guided  tour  of  the  Latin  Quarter

Next to the Ile de la Cité and the majestic Cathedral of Notre-Dame de Paris is one of the most historic and iconic districts of Paris, the Latin Quarter. Often referred to as the student district because of the many prestigious Parisian universities found here, this little piece of Paris has so much to offer travelers looking for an authentic, historic, and bohemian experience. Walk on these magic narrow streets to discover the hidden secrets of this charming Parisian district.

In the historic heart of Paris, the Latin Quarter has been home to many generations of students for several centuries. Its name also comes from the many prestigious high schools and universities that are found in this district. Located on the left bank of the Seine, between Notre-Dame de Paris and the Luxembourg Gardens, the Latin Quarter is one of the most visited districts in the city. It’s renowned as much for its cafes as for its history and monuments, from the Pantheon to the Church of Saint-Sulpice.

Paris Middle Age Latin Quarter.

But since the Middle Ages, the Latin Quarter has built its reputation primarily on the schools that are located there. The Sorbonne, Assas, the Ecole Normale Supérieure on Rue d’Ulm, and the high schools Louis le Grand or Henri IV are all examples of the prestigious establishments found in the Latin Quarter.

Latin Traces in the Neighborhood.

This student tradition dates back to the 13th century when many colleges were founded in the neighborhood. This was the case, for example, of the college created by Robert de Sorbon in 1257, which would later go on to become the University of the Sorbonne. The name of the district also comes from medieval times. Latin was the only language used for teaching in all of these schools and universities.
Join one of the Best Paris Walking tours.

You will discover, behind sumptuous palaces and unique places , the turbulent French history, from the Middle Ages, its wars and its bonfires, to the present day. You will find illustrious characters such as Joan of Arc, the Hunchback of Notre-Dame, Louis XIV, Napoleon and many more...

name: Free Walking Tour: Gems of the Marais (Available in )
description:
The Marais is one of the oldest and most picturesque neighborhoods in Paris. 

It flourished during the 17th Century when aristocrats built sumptuous townhouses close to the royal residences of St Pol and the Tournelles. It declined after the events of the French revolution and remained largely untouched by the transformations of the 19th Century. Since the 1960’s, it has regained public interest and is now an important cultural hub. 

We will start at City Hall. Our walk will take us to Saint-Gervais and Saint-Paul Saint-Louis churches, Hotel de Sens, Place des Vosges, Rue des Rosiers, the national archives, and Carnavalet museum. We will look at the social and historical significance of these landmarks. 

We will also visit the Anne-Frank Garden, a hidden park on rue des Rosiers, and a few of the small, often hidden gardens around the Marais. 

Book a tour with me, and I'll show you around some of the most iconic and picturesque neighborhoods in central Paris.

name: Paris 2.5-Hour Unique Macaron Cooking Class
shortDescription: Meet Chef Noémie at her charming cooking school in Paris and learn how to make the macaron – the iconic Parisian delicacy. You’ll learn from an expert, who will guide you through 2 different macaron flavors. Take home your creations and the recipes.
description:
Chef Noémie graduated from the famous Lenôtre Culinary Institute, one of the finest pâtisserie schools in the world, so you’ll definitely be in the right hands to learn the art of making the iconic macaron.

During the 2.5-hour activity, you’ll discover the secrets involved in preparing one of the most famous French delicacies. 
You’ll be guided step by step to create, from scratch, 2 different flavors of macarons, with classical fillings such as chocolate, lemon, salted butter caramel, coffee, pistachio, or walnuts.

Whatever your level of cooking experience, your chef is a professional who will adapt the class accordingly.

When you’ve finished the class you’ll enjoy a cup of tea or coffee and have a chance to share your impressions with the chef and ask her questions about how to create these successfully at home.

Leave with the result of your hard work to show family and friends how you mastered the art of creating French macarons.

description:
Enter the very heart of Paris on this walking tour of the city center.

What better way to fulfill your Paris dream than getting the best views of the city whilst your tour guide reveals how the landmarks you see set the stage for the city’s 2000-year history and its major characters – like Napoléon Bonaparte and Louis XIV (the Sun King!)

On this quintessential Parisian tour, not only will you leave as an expert on the French Revolution and the 19th-century reconstruction of Paris, but you will also gain insider knowledge of French culture and customs. name: Historic Paris Free Tour (Available in English, Spanish)
description:
Ah, Paris, the capital of elegance, chic, love, art and science. Its architecture and ambiance are truly iconic, and its people famous for their achievements and... sense of pride.

The city rose from its humble beginnings as a marshland settlement, became a Roman colony, seat of the early Frankish monarchs to finally set trends as the biggest medieval city in Europe. Home to many revolts and societal changes, it evolved as the capital of the free thinkers and... the most famous revolution changing the political landscape of the western civilization forever. With its final overdo in the 19th century, its elegant boulevards became a go-to model for many other cities. Today, Paris retains many of its fortes, adding a spice of modernity.

All this can get a little overwhelming, so why not have a helping hand while diving in? Walkative will grant you that and much more, with our local guides taking you on a fascinating journey through Paris most important monuments and histories, including:

  • ︎Hotel de Ville(Paris City Hall)

description:
Step back in time and discover the rich history of Paris' Latin Quarter, one of the oldest neighborhoods in the city. Join us on a 2-hour free walking tour and become an expert on the centuries of history that have shaped this iconic area.

We will begin the tour at Cardinal Lemoine metro station. From there, you'll experience the charm and wonder of the Latin Quarter as you explore its many historical sites, including:

name: Paris: Opera Garnier and Seine River Cruise Tickets
shortDescription: Make the most of a combination tour to explore 2 of Paris' leading attractions. Explore the biggest opera structure in Paris, before traveling on a boat for a sightseeing cruise down the Seine.
description:
With this combo tour, benefit from entry to 2 of the most famous cultural attractions of Paris. The Palais Garnier, or Opéra Garnier, is a 1,979-seat opera house. When the new opera house, the Opéra Bastille, opened at the Place de la Bastille, the Palais Garnier began operating primarily for ballet. The theater has been a historic monument of France since 1923.

Following that, meet beside the Eiffel Tower to board a Parisian boat for a cruise on the Seine River. Unwind while contemplating the history of Paris, and admire its many monuments such as the Louvre Museum, the Orsay Museum, the Notre Dame Cathedral, and the many bridges with their unique architecture.

The audio guide on board the boat is available in 13 languages, and you can also listen to it from an application on your smartphone. Upon purchase, you can use your ticket at any time, valid until the date indicated on the ticket.

name: Skip-the-Line Versailles Palace Tour by Train from Paris
shortDescription: Enjoy a 3-hour guided tour of the Château of Versailles and its gardens. Marvel at the glimmering Hall of Mirrors and the lavish state apartments.
description:
Visit the Château de Versailles, the royal residence of Louis XIV. See the Hall of Mirrors and the lavish state apartments, where the royals received the elite. Your English-speaking guide will make life at Versailles come alive.

Meet the guide in central Paris and travel to Versailles by train. At the Château, skip the lines and begin a 3-hour journey through time in the Château and its gardens. Hear how the royal family recaptured France’s preeminence in fashion and art. Hear about the lavish lifestyle of Marie Antoinette.

Tour the magnificent gardens with your guide, and enjoy either the beautiful Musical Gardens or the Fountain Show (depending on the day of the week). After your tour, your guide will be happy to provide you with return train tickets and instructions for the easy journey back to Paris on the train.

name: Paris: Versailles Skip-the-Line Guided Tour & Gardens
shortDescription: Experience the opulence of the Palace and Gardens of Versailles on a half-day excursion from Paris. Marvel at the spectacular interior of the palace and the manicured gardens surrounding it. See the Fountain Show or Musical Gardens.
description:
Hidden away from the modern world, this majestic European castle on the outskirts of Paris is a perfectly preserved example of the reckless extravagance of the French monarchy. Experience life at its most luxurious, in a setting of lush rolling lawns that stretch as far as the eye can see.

Meet your guide at a central location in Paris and board a private, air-conditioned tour bus to Versailles. Skip the lines at the entrance with your pre-booked admission to Versailles, where your guide will lead you through the gardens and palace.

Marvel at the sheer size of the Palace of Versailles, one of the largest and most spectacular castles in the world, boasting 700 rooms. See the incredible array of fine art and the intricate designs of the 1,250 fireplaces. 
Work your way through the palace’s highlights, including the king’s and queen’s apartments, the chapel, the Coronation Room, the Hall of Mirrors, and the Salon of Abundance. Head out into the sunlight and visit the manicured gardens, covering an area of 1,800 acres. 
The Musical Gardens show runs every Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday (except Wednesday, July 14) from July 1 to August 31, while the Musical Fountains can be experienced every Saturday and Sunday from May 22 to October 31.

name: From Paris: Versailles Palace and Gardens Guided Expereince
shortDescription: Journey through the history of France at the Palace of Versailles. Discover the palace and its gardens on a tour from Paris. Have free time to enjoy the grounds at your own pace.
description:
Discover the Palace of Versailles and its stunning gardens on a day trip from Paris. Immerse yourself in the history and culture of this place as you come across beautiful sights, like the Hall of Mirrors and the Abduction of Persephone statue. 
Depart from Paris in the morning with your guide and purchase a train ticket to Versailles. Learn about the city that was the capital of France during the 17th, 18th, and 19th centuries as you ride. Arrive at one of the greatest symbols of French royalty: Versailles.
Take in the views of this palace, which stands out for its buildings and rooms, as well as its astonishing gardens that cover 1,800 hectares. Save time with skip-the-line access to the popular gardens. Hear the stories of King Sun and the scandals that led to the French Revolution.

Dip into the legend and curiosities as you explore the chamber of the King, with its beautiful fountains and the sculpture of The Abduction of Persephone. Plunge into the mystery of the diamond necklace. After the guided portion of the tour, enjoy the grounds on your own and see the inside of the palace.

name: Free tour, night from Notre-Dame to the City Hall. (Available in Spanish)
description:
The ancient streets of Paris hide unthinkable urban legends. You won't believe what we have to tell you. Paris is an open book full of mysteries.


The truth is that tourists sometimes eat in places without imagining who was cooking there or take photos where someone has thrown a curse, they even enter places and churches like Notre Dame through the wrong door.

I want to tell you the stories behind those places. Let you immerse yourself in the intimacies of medieval and contemporary Paris. We will enjoy and have a great time during the tour and also, we will learn secrets, and we will gossip a lot about this city so much that it will make you want to repeat.

  1. Our tour begins in an iconic place of Christianity and architecture, Our Lady of Paris (Notre-Dame) . You will know the secrets of its gargoyles, did you know that one of the theories of the 2019 fire is related to a legend of them? Oh and of course! I will introduce you to the most famous Gargoyle of this thousand-year-old Cathedral.
  2. We will continue the tour to the oldest restaurant in the center of Paris, on the Ile de la Cité. Legend has it that this restaurant became famous for preparing the most coveted meatloaf in the city and which also has its hidden ingredients. Even King Henry II of France loved him. In front of this beautiful place I reveal its history to you.
  3. We will continue towards a tiny street, one of the narrowest in the city. There Napoleon Bonaparte I suffered a tragedy that marked his life forever. The legend tells us why the French emperor posed with his right hand in front.
  4. Then we will go to the Bridge of Change. From that intersection we will see the first prison in the city, full of terrible prisoners, each one worse than the other, including a doctor who went to do an experiment. What was it about? There on one of the balconies of the bridge, I tell you its story.
  5. From that bridge you will see an illuminated Gothic tower, which sometimes does not give a good impression, but must be visited. The tower of "Santiago de los Carniceros" . This tower was built thanks to the charity of the most illustrious alchemist in France, so much so that he is a character in the famous Harry Potter.
  6. And we end in front of the City Hall , which does not escape the dark stories of Paris. There we will take a souvenir photo of this intense and magical night. Oh! And if you then want to immerse yourself in the Parisian night world, I have a list of the best places to dance, drink and have a great time. And of course, those who want a good restaurant recommendation, I also have 100% recommended places for them.

The Latin Quarter in Paris is named after the famous Sorbonne University , for how commonly it was to hear students and teachers speak Latin during medieval times.

With our guide you will learn about the student revolts of May 68 and the key role that the university played during the "French May". The presence of the university promoted the cultural development of the area, with some of the best-known cinemas, theaters, bookstores and concert halls in the capital, such as the Odéon Theater or the cafés of Saint-Germain-des-Près , where Intellectuals from the Left Bank and other personalities of the 20th century met .

On our Latin Quarter Free Tour of Paris we will also find churches as old as Saint-Séverin , famous for its spiked tower and its medieval bells, or Saint Sulpice , the largest in Paris after Notre Dame; and other places of great historical interest, such as the Cluny Museum, the Pantheon , the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens or the controversial Saint-Michel Fountain .

name: Latin Quarter free walking tour (Available in English)
description:
Embrace the bohemian spirit of Paris as you join us on an unforgettable journey through the city's historic and enchanting Latin Quarter. This captivating tour will transport you back in time, as you explore the winding cobblestone streets, beautiful gardens, and hidden gems that have inspired generations of artists, writers, and philosophers. Don't miss the opportunity to discover the heart of intellectual and artistic Paris on this unique and engaging walking tour.

Our passionate local guides will lead you through the picturesque streets of the Latin Quarter, revealing the stories and secrets that have shaped this iconic neighbourhood. Founded in the Middle Ages, the Latin Quarter was once the centre of learning and culture in Paris, as students from around the world flocked to the prestigious University of Paris, now known as the Sorbonne. As you wander through the maze of narrow streets, you'll uncover the origins of the neighbourhood's name, which stems from the Latin language spoken by these mediaeval scholars.

The tour begins at the charming Shakespeare & Company bookstore, a haven for literature lovers and aspiring writers. As we explore the vibrant streets, lined with quaint cafes, bistros, and bookshops, you'll understand why the Latin Quarter has attracted famous figures such as Ernest Hemingway, James Joyce, and Simone de Beauvoir.

No visit to the Latin Quarter is complete without admiring the stunning Panthéon, a neoclassical monument housing the remains of France's most revered icons, including Voltaire, Rousseau, and Marie Curie. We'll also venture into the serene Luxembourg Gardens, a lush oasis in the heart of Paris, where you can take a leisurely stroll or enjoy a picnic surrounded by meticulously manicured lawns and exquisite sculptures.
The Latin Quarter is famous for its bustling nightlife. From lively jazz clubs and traditional cabarets to intimate wine bars and historic pubs, there's no shortage of options for those looking to immerse themselves in the neighborhood's energetic atmosphere. Our guides will be happy to provide recommendations for the perfect spot to enjoy a well-deserved glass of wine or delectable French cuisine after your tour.

Join us on the Latin Quarter Paris walking tour, and be inspired by the captivating tales of this bohemian neighbourhood, its rich history, and its enduring artistic spirit. This unforgettable experience will leave you enamoured with the Latin Quarter and eager to uncover more of its hidden treasures.
Book your spot on this captivating tour and let the magic of the Latin Quarter sweep you away!

name: True crimes and legends of Paris' history - Free Walking Tour (Available in English)
description:
Paris has a dark side with multiple stunning stories to share which is rarely highlighted during guided tours although this interesting topic gives a different point of view on the capital and a good way to philosophy about human kindness...

The meeting point is the equestrian statue of Henry IV, the Huguenot king who ended the wars of religion before his tragic death.

The amazing ghost story related to the former Tuileries palace will be revealed to you. This ghost was seen by some of the most famous monarchs and emperors of France... and maybe by you too soon!

Follow your guide to the nearby parish church of the Louvre, which is related to a horrible massacre perpetrated in 1572. Hear what happened there and how come such a slaughter was possible.

Discover Les Halles quarter, where the cemetery of the Saints-Innocents was established until its closure for sanitary reasons, which lead to the creation of the famous catacombs. Listen to the stunning tradition of the anchoresses, ladies voluntarily immured in a cell of stone inside cemeteries...
 
The last stop will take place at Hôtel de Ville, former place of public executions, where the culprit who killed king Henry IV suffered the most horrible death penalty ever...

Will you dare to join this tour? We bet you will!

  • Musée du Louvre
  • Jardin des Tuileries (end of the tour)



DURATION OF YOUR FREE TOUR
Approximate duration 2 hours and a half.

ADDITIONAL USEFUL INFORMATION
The tour is recommended for everyone, children and adults. 
I suggest that you should bring water, sunscreen, and a snack. You should also wear comfortable shoes :). 
ENJOY!

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Heart of Paris Free Walking Tour (Available in Spanish)
description:
This free walking tour is your initiation to the city of lights. As it will introduce you its most essential landmarks. This deep dive into the Heart of Paris will kickstart your vacation. Putting you in sync with what there is to do, and showing you the main things that there is to see.

On this 2h 45 min tour, we will cover Paris’ most iconic landmarks, plus many other hidden gems:

1)Hotel de Ville
2) Notre Dame
3) Palais de Justice, Saint-Chappelle, & Conciergerie
4)Pont Neuf (oldest bridge in Paris)
5) Lovelock Bridge (Pont des Arts)
6) French Academy
7) Louvre Museum
8) Pyramid
9) Arc du Carroussel
10) Jardin des Tuileries
11) Eiffel Tower (full explanation from a distance)

This animated and dynamic tour is perfect for all audiences. From solo travelers, to families with children, as well as couples on their honeymoon!

We will finish right around lunchtime. If you wish to eat, our finishing point is a restaurant that offers our clients a preferential menu (appetizer, main course, dessert, and drinks—including wine), from a very wide variety of choices that you can choose from. The food is good, the staff is nice, and the location is central and very convenient.

If you just need the use the bathroom, you are welcome to do so. I also stay there afterwords to answer questions and give personalized recommendations. And I can also give you the wifi code if you’d like to hang out there to plan the rest of your day.

Can’t wait to having you on our tour!

⚠️ Note: We are unable to accept reservations of groups larger than 6 adults  without prior notice. This includes multiple bookings under a different name. This format is NOT a private tour. If you'd like to join us as a group, there is a group fee that should be prepaid before the tour starts. Or you can also arrange a private tour with the guide on an available date.⚠️

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: The majestic Notre-Dame Cathedral and surroundings - Free tour (Available in English, Spanish)
description:
Few cathedrals in the world evoke as much fascination as Notre-Dame Cathedral and its surroundings .

Immerse yourself in history and witness the many events and monuments that you will discover on this tour that starts at the first stone bridge to be built in Paris: Pont Neuf , until you reach the emblematic Latin Quarter.

 This experience will allow you to know:

  • Île de la Cite
  • Henry IV
  • Pont Neuf
  • Place Dauphin
  • Marche aux fleurs
  • Conciergerie
  • Saint Chapelle
  • Palace of Justice
  • Notre Dame Cathedral
  • shakespeare
  • Latin Quarter


Are you going to miss it?

 This is a FREE TOUR and proposes a minimum contribution of €10 per person, as the expenses that each of our guides must cover to carry out the tour.

We value PUNCTUALITY , since we have other tours at different times and points in the city, a reason that leads us to have to move from one place to another in short periods of time.

For reservations of more than 4 adults, a minimum contribution of €8 per person will be requested, to guarantee the costs and logistics required by large groups.

The tour requires a minimum of 4 attendees to start the tour.







Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: An Adventure History of Paris through its prominent people, architecture, revolutions, and art (Available in Russian)
description:
*RU - ниже

  • Why Paris is a city considered to be the “City of Love” and “City of Lights”?
  • How to quickly determine the architectural style and what these styles can tell?
  • What is a hidden place which Parisians call the capital of Paris?
  • Who is the man who saved Paris 200 years ago? 
  • Is it an accident that the Louvre is full of Leonardo Da Vinci paintings?
  • What event was taken as inspiration for Red Wedding from Game of Thrones? 
  • What are the light and dark sides of Napoleon and why is only one street in Paris named after him?
  • Who was this mistress of the king, who ruled the country for 20 years, patronized art, and was a French mother of Rococo style?

All these secrets and many others we will be cover during our adventure!

In 2 hours we are going to visit:

  1. Église Saint-Julien-le-Pauvre, Square René Viviani, and the oldest tree in Paris.
  2. Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Paris as a home for the main French events in the last 10 centuries.
  3. Hidden streets of Cite's island and the house of Héloïse and Abélard.
  4. Amazing Hôtel de Ville and a bloody history of Place de Greve (explanation from a distance).
  5. The Christian gem - Saint-Chappelle, Medieval castle - Conciergerie, and history of Terror.
  6. Romantic Place Dauphine, the statue of the beloved king, and Pont Neuf. 
  7. Breath-taking history about Square du Vert-Galant and Templars while getting rest for our legs on benches 😉
  8. Saint-Germain-l'Auxerrois and Red wedding from GoT.
  9. The hurt of the Musée du Louvre (Cour Carrée) and what its architecture can tell us.
  10. Pyramide du Louvre and Code da Vinci.
  11. Arc du Carrousel,  ghost Palace de Tuliries, and its garden.
  12. Eiffel Tower (full explanation from a distance).
  13. Rue de Rivoli, Napoleon's triumph, and Imperial Paris.
  14. Magnificent capital of Paris, favorite café of Colette and Angelina Jolie.


If you come with children, I have a bunch of Disney-like stories about Paris)


The win-win case for punctuality;)
Arrive 10 minutes earlier, If you want to hear the crash course - Paris 101:

  • The difference among brasseries, bistros, restaurants, cafes, and etiquette features in Paris
  • The 3 main rules in how to combine wines and cheeses.
  • The most popular scams on the streets
  • How wisely spend money in Paris)


 
[RU]

  • Почему Париж считается “Городом любви” и “Городом огней”?
  • Как быстро определить архитектурный стиль и о чем эти стили могут нам рассказать?
  • Что это за скрытое место, которое парижане называют столицей Парижа?
  • Кто тот человек, который спас Париж 200 лет назад?
  • Случайно ли, что в Лувре полно картин Леонардо да Винчи?
  • Какое событие послужило источником вдохновения для Красной свадьбы из "Игры престолов"?
  • Каковы светлые и темные стороны легенды о Наполеоне и почему только одна улица в Париже названа в его честь?
  • Кто была любовницей короля, которая правила страной 20 лет, покровительствовала искусству и была французской матерью стиля рококо?

Все эти и многие другие секреты мы раскроем во время нашего приключения-экскурсии!


                          За 2 часа мы собираемся посетить:

  1. Собор Сен-Жюльен-ле-Повр, площадь Рене Вивиани и самое старое дерево в Париже.
  2. Собор Парижской Богоматери, как место проведения главных французских событий за последние 10 столетий.
  3. Скрытые улочки острова Сите и дом Элоизы и Абеляра.
  4. Удивительный Отель де Виль и кровавая история Гревской площади.
  5. Христианская жемчужина - Сен-Шапель, средневековый замок - Консьержери и история Террора.
  6. Романтическая площадь Дофина, статуя любимого короля и Новый мост.
  7. Захватывающая дух история о площади Верт-Галан, пока наши ноги отдыхают на скамейках 😉
  8. Сен-Жермен-л'Оксерруа и Кровавая свадьба из Игры Престолов.
  9. История музея Лувра и о чем может рассказать нам его архитектура.
  10. Пирамида Лувра и Код да Винчи.
  11. Арка Карузель, призрачный королевский дворей и его сад.
  12. Эйфелева башня (полное объяснение на расстоянии).
  13. Улица Риволи, триумф Наполеона и Имперский Париж.
  14. Великолепная столица Парижа, драма юности Наполеона и любимое кафе Анджелины Джоли.


Если вы будите с маленькими детьми, я специально подготовил "диснеевские" историй о Париже и их принцах и принцессах)


Специально для тех, кто придёт на 10 минут раньше, я расскажу о главных хитростях города или Париж 101:

  • Разница между бразерье, бистро, ресторанами, кафе и особенностями этикета в Париже.
  • 3 главных правила в том, как сочетать вина и сыры.
  • Самые популярные мошенничества на улицах
  • Как разумно тратить деньги в Париже)

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Essential Free Tour of Paris in SPANISH (Available in Spanish)
description:
The Free Tour starts at the Hôtel de Ville square and ends at the Louvre, at the foot of the Tuileries Garden. It lasts 2h30.

Don't run out of your place, they sell out easily! Make your reservation!

The tour will take you through the heart of Paris from its origins, crossing the île de la Cité, the place chosen by Julius Caesar to found the Roman city of Lutecia. Old walled city built on an island where the first palace of the French kings and the imposing Notre Dame cathedral will be concentrated.

Before the Louvre and Versailles, the monarchs resided in a palace that would ironically end up becoming the prison where Marie Antoinette would spend her last days. It also has one of the jewels of radiant French Gothic art, the Sainte Chapelle. We will see the exterior of other iconic monuments such as the Conciergerie, the Palace of Justice and the Pont Neuf.

WHAT WILL YOU VISIT?

  • Ile de la Cite
  • notre dame
  • Palace of Justice
  • Conciergerie
  • Pont Neuf
  • Pont des Arts
  • Louvre Museum
  • Carousel Arch
  • square yard
  • Louvre Pyramid... and much more.


This tour does not allow groups larger than 6 people! Regardless of whether they are different reservations.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Versailles: Skip-the-Line Entrance and Lunch at Ore
shortDescription: Try contemporary French cuisine at Ore - Ducasse au château de Versailles, including starter, main dish, dessert, one glass of wine, water and one espresso per person in a beautiful and historic setting.
description:
In the recently renovated Pavillon Dufour, ore offers the great French classics, light bites and delicate pastries. Located at the first floor of Pavillon Dufour, the restaurant plan is divided into two main dining rooms, one bar and three salons.

One can admire the Palace through the windows overlooking the cour Royale and the cour d’Honneur. In the salons, the subtle position of the mirrors allows the guests to look upon the Palace, even if their back is turned to the windows.

Ore - Ducasse au château de Versailles offers contemporary French cuisine and artfully combining great classics and new dishes. Service is relaxed, professional and efficient.

After lunch, be guided to the skip-the-line access for the palace and enjoy the rest of your day in Versailles.

name: Paris: Historical Crimes Walking Tour in French
shortDescription: Explore the sordid business affairs and other sinister crimes that have left their mark on the streets of Paris on a unique and fascinating walking tour. Visit the site of some of the city's great crime scenes and much more.
description:
Journey through a darker side of the history of Paris on a walking tour of some of the city's great crime scenes. Follow a route that traces shady business dealings, sites of execution and much more.

Discover how Paris was once a maze of side streets where it was easy to get lost, providing refuge for thieves and other miscreants. Learn, for example, about the emblematic Pont Neuf where, in the 17th century, the crooks, thieves and beggars came from the Cours des Miracles to steal the bourgeois before returning to the neighborhoods around the Halles and Beaubourg.

Learn about the great gallows and gibbets of Montfaucon, and listen to surprising facts and fascinating anecdotes on the approximately 2km walk. Discover Paris from a completely different perspective.

name: Paris: Army Museum Ticket and Seine River Cruise Combo
shortDescription: Browse through the vast exhibits of France's war history at the Army Museum, then take a boat trip down the Seine with this 2-in-1 activity. Widen your knowledge and enjoy panoramic views of the city.
description:
Tour the Invalides War Museum, the magnificent War Museum, including the tomb of Napoleon Bonaparte.

Learn about the French Revolution, the first and second world wars, and many important battles in French history.

See combat vehicles, soldier clothing and various war documents used in ancient wars.

Admire the structure of the museum, which is important in terms of war history.

When your museum tour is finished, head to Port de la Bourdonnais for a relaxing Seine River Cruise.

Enjoy a 1-hour river cruise on the Seine.

name: Paris: The Rodin Museum and Seine River Cruise
shortDescription: Visit the Rodin Museum, a French and European icon, and witness the represents of artistic time. Then, take a dreamy cruise along the Seine River.
description:
Discover the Rodin Museum, dedicated to the exploration of a very interesting historical period that marked the creative explosion of modern art. Wander the grounds of the sculpture garden before admiring the wonderful sights of Paris on a Seine River cruise.

At the museum, explore French Sculptor Rodin’s lesser-known (yet equally impressive) works in great detail. You'll also see a collection of more than 200 paintings that he has accumulated over his lifetime.

After appreciating all the arts inside, head out to the sculpture garden. Stretching over three hectares, the grounds are divided into a rose garden and a large ornamental garden. There is also a terrace and a relaxation area for a moment of quiet contemplation.

When your amazing Rodin Museum visit is over, let yourself be mesmerized by the enchantment of Paris City. Cruise on the Seine River, the most important waterway in France, and pass the foot of the Eiffel Tower.

name: Paris 4-Hour Bike Tour: Off the Beaten Path
shortDescription: Explore the charming neighborhoods of Paris on a 4-hour bike tour, and get insider info about the lesser-known sights of the Marais, Latin Quarter, and more. Stop for a savory crepe or cup of coffee in a typical café, and experience the city like a local.
description:
Explore the historic neighborhoods of Central Paris from the saddle of a comfortable, lightweight aluminium bike on a half-day small group tour of the Jewish Marais, Latin Quarter, and more.

Ideal for those who want to see and experience Paris from a different perspective, your knowledgable guide will take you to where the locals go, revealing hidden courtyards, ancient ruins, and other surprises off the usual tourist path.

Groups are limited to no more than 12 people for a more immersive and intimate experience, and the route is suitable for all ages and fitness levels. 
Discover an old city wall and a Roman arena, pedal down the Rue Mouffetard in one of the city’s oldest and liveliest areas, and experience the intellectual exuberance of St. Germain.

name: Paris: French Fashion History Walking Tour
shortDescription: Learn about the connection between the world of fashion and social movements. Tour the topmost luxury brand stores and find out their history on a 1.5-hour walk.
description:
