Stroll the streets of the luxury district of rue Saint-Honoré, famous for its designer shops. Find out about the first ateliers to open up here. Learn the history of Louis Vuitton and travel, the revolution of Coco Chanel, and the liberation of women by famous fashion designers.

During the walk, enjoy the Place Vendôme, where the likes of Chanel and Hemingway spent a lot of time. Visit La Madeleine with its amazing church, Greek design, and surrounding small streets that are one of the top places in Paris for shopping.

Walk down the fashion streets and see the first Hermès shop. Find out the amazing history of the development of this brand from saddler to an iconic bag creator.

Take a deep dive into Coco Chanel and how her lovers changed her life and saved her. Learn about the superstitious Christian Dior who followed his destiny and created his brand after a few failures. Finally, find out about the iconic Yves Saint Laurent, the founding figure for modernity in fashion.

Discover the changes the fashion industry went through during the 19th and 20th centuries. Enter a few shops to get a better understanding of the luxury brands and their legacy.

name: Versailles-Giverny Day Tour with Lunch at Moulin de Fourges
shortDescription: Versailles undoubtedly makes lasting impressions on visitors, but so will the lily ponds in Giverny that inspired Claude Monet to new artistic heights. See them both in one day, with a gourmet lunch at the renowned Moulin de Fourges.
description:
A day of unforgettable impressions awaits you outside Paris at legendary Versailles and the home of Claude Monet.

Select the private option, and you'll be whisked straight from your lobby or doorstep in downtown Paris to Giverny, the village where Monet produced some of the world's most beautiful landscape paintings. See the gardens the so-called Father of Impressionism magically recreated on canvas, with their trademark water lilies and Japanese bridge.

A complimentary 3-course lunch at the renowned Moulin de Fourges restaurant will provide the perfect opportunity to rest and savor what you saw along with fine gourmet food.

The second part of the day takes you to Versailles, where reality might exceed your idea of how kings and queens once lived. Spend an hour wandering about the Grand Apartments of the king and queen, and the famous Hall of Mirrors. Outside discover the famous palace gardens, the marble Grand Trianon palace retreat and Marie Antoinette's Hamlet.

name: Le Marais: Pastry and Chocolate Food Tour
shortDescription: Discover the hidden nooks of the charming neighbourhood of Le Marais. Perfect for those who enjoy wonderful food, explore the small streets and stumble upon quaint cafes and shops offering an array of delicious treats.
description:
Located in the heart of Paris, the famous neighbourhood, Le Marais, is a beautiful area renowned for its grand architecture and fine food.

You are invited to explore the hidden gems of this district with a food-connoisseur and experienced chef trained by Pierre Gagnaire. Stumble upon a pastry shop, chocolate shop, a Franco-Russian tea store and even a store solely dedicated to absinthe! Indulge yourself in the best ice cream you will find in Paris and delicious treats from the bakery. Finally visit the shop stacked with 1001 spices from across the world.

Your senses are truly awakened on this unique tour. Your taste buds will indeed be stimulated with scrumptious delicacies, and aromas of chocolate, coffee and spices will fill your nose. Hear fascinating stories behind this district and take in the charming atmosphere and beautiful sights of the quaint roadside cafes, the Jewish Quarter and the stunning mansions.

name: Paris: Ile de la Cite Walking Tour with Notre Dame
shortDescription: Discover the charming Ile de la Cité, the Sainte Chapelle and Conciergerie. Marvel at the prowess of the 13th century builders; Notre Dame survived the devastating fire of April 15, 2019 and a new page of her history is being written today as we visit.
description:
Join your guide for a fascinating walking tour of the charming and historical Ile de la Cite. Start your tour on the Left Bank in the Latin Quarter and pass by the famed bookstore, Shakespeare & Company, a gathering place for the literary legends of the 'Lost Generation'.
 
Then, see the imposing gothic structure of Notre Dame Cathedral. Built in the 13th century, this magnificent edifice has recently survived a devastating fire, yet she is still standing proudly as the symbol of the city. Learn of her incredible construction and watch history unfold before you, as she readies herself to stand tall for another eight centuries.
 
Next, enjoy a short stroll through the charming flower market to Sainte Chapelle. Built in the 13th century by King Saint Louis, 80% of the walls are covered by remarkable colored glass windows. Your last visit is to the Conciergerie, built as a medieval palace, but most famous as the prison and last home of Queen Marie Antoinette during the French Revolution.

name: From Paris: Versailles Full-Day Guided Tour with Lunch
shortDescription: Immerse yourself in the grandeur of Versailles on this guided tour from Paris. See the quarters Louis XIV and Marie Antoinette's hamlet. Enjoy lunch on the estate in a setting meant only for royalty.
description:
Uncover the splendor of Versailles full-day guided tour from Paris. Save time on your vacation with skip-the-line access. Admire highlights like the Grand Trianon palace and the elegant state apartments. Savor a delicious lunch in the park.
Starting from anywhere in central Paris, you will be picked up and driven in an air-conditioned minibus to Versailles, where your guide takes you right inside with no waiting.
Tour the elegant State Apartments of the Sun King, including separate "grand apartments" for the king and queen, and the 73-meter-long Hall of Mirrors. Go for a stroll in the impressive gardens before having lunch in the park near the Grand Canal.
After lunch, your guide will show you the Grand Trianon, a smaller marble palace the king used for less formal occasions. Then discover the Queen's Hamlet, a Norman-style thatched cottage build for Marie Antoinette.
On Sundays the tour includes the "Grand Eaux" water and music show.

name: Versailles: Skip-the-Line Tour of Palace with Gardens Access
shortDescription: Enjoy an exclusive guided tour of Versailles Palace and visit its beautiful royal gardens. Skip the long lines and enter through a separate entrance alongside an expert guide.
description:
Discover the opulence, beauty, and history of Versailles Palace on an interactive guided tour. Access the palace through a separate entrance to begin your tour and then you head off to the famous gardens with a guide or on your own.

During the 90-minute tour of the main palace, see the State Apartments, the King's Bedroom, and the emblematic Hall of Mirrors. Learn about the main figures of the French monarchy, from King Louis XIV to Marie Antoinette.

Hear about the fascinating historical events that took place in many of the palace’s rooms, before stepping out to explore the vast gardens complex with your guide or on your own.

Marvel at the gardens' grandeur, its bronze statues, and ornamental basins accompanied by rows of large trees. If visiting with a guide, gain fascinating insights about the garden on a 45-minute tour.

name: Paris: Guided Eiffel Tower Tour with Elevator Access
shortDescription: Witness incredible panoramic views of Paris from the Eiffel Tower. Explore the tower with a guide and learn the history behind this iconic French landmark as you ascend to the 276-meter-high summit.
description:
Experience breathtaking views of the world-famous city of Paris from the summit of the Eiffel Tower. Ride the elevator to the higher levels and spot iconic Parisian landmarks as you learn the history behind the tower and all of its little secrets from your expert guide.
Allow your English-speaking guide to present you with the magnificent panorama offered by the 360° view of Paris from the 2nd floor of the Eiffel Tower. Enjoy an interactive history lesson from a truly privileged location while gazing at sites such as Notre Dame and the Seine River.

Depending on your chosen option, you may also have access to the top of the tower. Rising to a height of approximately 276 meters, this third floor offers the most exclusive views of the city.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Second Floor Access with Summit Option
shortDescription: Explore the Eiffel Tower with a direct access ticket to the second level or to the summit by elevator. Enjoy a presentation from your guide before admiring the incredible views of the French capital from above.
description:
Bypass the ticket booth lines at the Eiffel Tower with a direct access ticket to the second level and, if option selected, the summit. Learn about the tower from your guide and explore the interior at your own pace. 
Meet the guide and enjoy a historic presentation on the Eiffel Tower before being guided through security and inside the elevator as far as the second floor. Explore the second floor and, if you have selected the option to, ascend to the summit. 
Take in the spectacular views of the French capital and spot key monuments from above.

name: Paris: Crazy Horse Cabaret Show
shortDescription: Let yourself be seduced by the subtle light effects of a show that's bewitched audiences since 1951. Discover the glamor and impertinence that are the very DNA of Crazy Horse Paris in the immersive format of "Totally Crazy."
description:
Watch the most sensual dancers in the world performing legendary acts with stunning visual effects. Immerse yourself in the creative and sophisticated world of Crazy Horse Paris with the new show Totally Crazy and discover great performances and creations in this world-renowned Parisian venue.

Enjoy emblematic cabarets and iconic acts that have revolutionized the venue. Experience 65 years of dazzling creations and craziness packed into 90 enchanting minutes and let the charm of Crazy Horse Paris drive you totally crazy.
Hippy Bang Bang, Kika Revolver or Etta d’Amour, the dancers are given a stage name ahead of their first performance on the boards of the cabaret. Hips swaying, your heart will beat in rhythm to their dance steps, while their XXL eyelashes will keep you at bay.

Crazy Horse Paris is ready to welcome you every day at 12 Avenue George V in the 8th arrondissement of Paris, two steps away from the Eiffel Tower, the Champs Elysées and the designer shops of Avenue Montaigne. Discover a legendary venue and a unique and stunning show, a favorite among international artists and celebrities. Like them, go crazy about Le Crazy.

Every Sunday at 7 PM dive into the Crazy Horse Paris Legend and immerse yourself in an exclusive and intimate unique experience. Are you tempted to discover Crazy Horse Paris on a truly unique journey? Then visit the cabaret in VIP mode and have a “Crazy Experience” — one that you won’t soon forget... Secrets, anecdotes, behind the scenes... the legendary Crazy Girls reveal the underside of their cabaret and tell you its history during a special tour full of surprises.

Enjoy 1 hour of total immersion, even backstage, where the doors of the former office of Alain Bernardin, the founder of Crazy Horse, open to you. This cozy boudoir, whose ceiling is mysteriously reflected in a mirror table, is both captivating and intriguing. The “Crazy Experience” is a unique moment welcoming you for 1 hour full of delight (which ends with Champagne and petits fours), before you take your seats in the theater to attend the show in VIP mode.

name: Paris: Haunted Père Lachaise Cemetery Guided Tour
shortDescription: Experience the macabre as you explore the haunted Père Lachaise Cemetery with your guide. Discover the graves of celebrities and hear fascinating stories about the cemetery's ghosts as you explore.
description:
Discover Père-Lachaise Cemetery, Paris's largest and most popular cemetery and the home of fantastic paranormal phenomena. Hear stories about the celebrities buried here, learn about the cemetery's long history, and uncover fascinating tales of ghosts that roam the grounds. 
Walk amongst the graves with your guide and spot the resting places of famous celebrities like Frédéric Chopin, Edith Piaf, Marcel Proust, Oscar Wilde, and Jim Morrison. Learn about the lives of the celebrities and the numerous Parisians laid to rest in Père-Lachaise Cemetery.
With over one million people interned in the cemetery, it should be no surprise that it is one of the most haunted places in Paris. Learn about the long history of the cemetery, the strange cults associated with it, and delve into the hauntings reported over the years. 
As you explore, your guide will tell you stories about spiritualist founder Allan Kardec, the fantasms found by the tomb of Jim Morisson, the ghost of Marcel Proust who wanders the cemetery looking for his lover, and many lesser-known phenomena that loom within Père-Lachaise Cemetery.

name: Paris: The Louvre Museum and Seine River Cruise
shortDescription: Visit the world-famous Louvre Museum. Complete your journey with 1-hour River Sightseeing Cruise Tour.
description:
Visit the masterpieces of the Louvre Museum, one of the most popular tourist destinations in the world. Then, go on a cruise along the magnificent Seine River and admire the famous monuments in the city.
Being the world's largest museum, the Louvre packs 35,000 artworks into a 73,000 square meter exhibition space in three wings. Each wing possesses more than 70 rooms and displays extensive paintings and objects of art. 
See the iconic Mona Lisa, marvel at thousands of amazing paintings, and walk among perfect sculptures. Book the option with an audio guide included and enhance your experience and understanding of the works on display.

After the visit of the Louvre Museum, take a 1-hour Seine River cruise tour. See more of Paris' iconic monuments such as the Institut de France, Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Conciergerie, Musee de Orsay, Hotel de Ville and more. 
Onboard you have access to an audio guide of your chosen language for free on the spot which will help you learn more about the vast history attached to each monument.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower's Madame Brasserie Lunch
shortDescription: Enjoy a unique lunch experience above the Paris rooftops in the heart of France’s most famous landmark, the Eiffel Tower. Sample French cuisine by Parisian chef Thierry Marx.
description:
Get a taste of the high life in the famous Madame Brasserie restaurant on the first floor of the Eiffel Tower. Savor a delicious lunch prepared by artisan chef Thierry Marx and enjoy stunning views over the city and inside the iconic tower itself. 
Ascend skywards in the lift to the first floor of the Eiffel Tower and step into the contemporary yet cozy atmosphere of the Madame Brasserie restaurant. Indulge in a three-course lunch, consisting of a starter, main course, and dessert, made from locally sourced and seasonal products.
Choose whether to accompany the delectable bites with drinks including champagne and wine. For some added fun, scan the QR code at the reception to enjoy a digital mystery game or to access exclusive content about Madame Brasserie and the Eiffel Tower.

name: Paris: Pere Lachaise Cemetery Guided Tour
shortDescription: Explore the tombs and funerary art of the legendary Pere Lachaise Cemetery in Paris on a 2-hour guided tour, and see the graves of Jim Morrison, Oscar Wilde, Chopin and many other artists, writers and musicians in 44 hectares of landscaped beauty.
description:
Discover an enchanted hill in the center of Paris on a guided tour of the labyrinthine Pere Lachaise Cemetery, world-renowned for its funerary art and as the final resting place for many great men and women from the world of art, music, literarure and history.

The most surprising open-air museum in Paris, Pere Lachaise is home to 70,000 graves and 5,300 trees in 44 hectares of landscaped beauty. Your guide will lead you down the cemetery’s cobbled paths to see picturesque tombstones.

The necro-romantic safari is certified by the Paris Visitors Bureau, and takes you on a trip through history, where the great celebrities of the past come alive. See the tombs of Oscar Wilde, Edith Piaf, and Jim Morrison. Discover the final resting place of Molière and Chopin.

Pay your respects at the graves of Isadora Duncan and Gertrude Stein, and marvel at the tomb of Héloise and Abélard. Your guide will provide a narrative of energy and passion, balancing humor with historical accuracy to share secrets and anecdotes about the legends of the past and present.

name: Paris: Aquarium de Paris Entrance Ticket
shortDescription: Explore the marine life of the world with an entrance ticket to the Aquarium de Paris in the Trocadéro Gardens. Enjoy access to all exhibitions and workshops, see more than 10,000 fish, watch dancing pirates and National Geographic films, and more.
description:
Head to the Trocadéro Gardens in the heart of Paris to enjoy an access to the Aquarium de Paris. Boasting more than 10,000 fish from around the globe, the 3,500-square meter venue offers an exciting introduction to the world’s oceans and rivers.

See fearsome sharks and sweet sea urchins. Look out for shy clown fish, and marvel at the sting rays. The marine life hails from areas as diverse as the Reunion Islands of the Indian Ocean to the estuaries and basins of the River Seine. There’s even a touch pool that allows you to stroke and feed the fish.

Aquarium de Paris also boasts 2 cinemas that show fascinating National Geographic documentaries, as well as fish related cartoons for the kids. The young ones will also love the ever-changing program of pirate shows and water dances.

Spend a magical day with your family or friends, learning more about the life under the water, and enjoy free access to the daily program of interactive workshops (no reservations required).

name: Paris: Bus Toqué Tour with 5-Course Dinner and Champagne
shortDescription: Explore Paris at night and marvel at city landmarks on this 2-hour bus tour. On board, enjoy a 5-course meal prepared with seasonal ingredients and admire the starry sky above you through the glass ceiling.
description:
Experience Paris by night on a city bus tour like no other. Dine on the upper deck with a delicious 5-course meal and soak in the magical nighttime views of the French capital.

Hop aboard the double-decker and take your seat at the table upstairs. Once you've settled in, experience the "City of Light" at night and see famous Parisian monuments along the way. Admire the views from beside you at a height of 4 meters.

As you cruise through the glittering Parisian streets, the chef will prepare a delicious 5-course dinner with highlights like the beef fondant with broccoli mousseline and summer vegetables. Enjoy dinner while sightseeing in one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

As you pass city landmarks, enjoy commentary from the guide tablet on your table. Finish your tour at the Champs-Elysées and admire the famous street at night.

name: Fontainebleau & Vaux-le-Vicomte Châteaux Day Tour from Paris
shortDescription: Visit the magnificent châteaux of Vaux-le-Vicomte and Fontainebleau on a full-day day trip from Paris. Marvel at the opulent interior of Vaux-le-Vicomte, and UNESCO-listed Fontainebleau, dating to the 12th century. Explore the stunning gardens as well.
description:
This full-day trip from Paris takes you to the Vaux-le-Vicomte and Fontainebleau châteaux for guided tours of the castles and a chance to explore their gardens.

Set off from Paris at 09:15 on the hour-long drive to Vaux-le-Vicomte, the château that inspired King Louis XIV to build his Versailles Palace. A masterpiece of mid-17th century classical architecture, the château and its grounds were created by 3 talented artists working for Nicolas Fouquet, a rich, high-ranking French official and Louis XIV's Superintendent of Finance.

The 3 artists were the painter and decorator Charles Le Brun, the architect Louis Le Vau, and the landscape gardener André Le Nôtre.

With an audio guide you’ll explore Nicolas Fouquet's private apartments, the state rooms, and the château's great kitchens and vaulted cellars. Enjoy a stroll through the stunning French-style formal gardens on the estate’s 86-acre grounds, featuring sculpted bushes, lakes, and multicolored flower beds. If you like you can eat lunch on the lawn or in the Vaux-le-Vicomte restaurant.

You’ll leave Vaux-le-Vicomte at 13:30 for the second part of the tour, heading to the heart of the forest of Fontainebleau.

Fontainebleau is the only royal château to have been continuously inhabited for 7 centuries. Dating back to the 12th century, it was one of the residences of French rulers from Francis I to Napoleon III.

During your audio-guided visit, you’ll explore the richly furnished château, admiring its unique collections and key pieces such as the throne of Napoleon I and the famous horseshoe-shaped staircase. You’ll also see the spacious private apartments. After the tour, you’ll have time to explore the vast grounds surrounding the château, as well as its 3 lovely gardens.

Departure from Fontainebleau is scheduled for 17:00, with arrival back in central Paris at around 18:15.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Dinner Cruise with a Moulin Rouge Show
shortDescription: Enjoy breathtaking views of the capital from the Eiffel Tower, then cruise along the Seine River. Have dinner on a dinner cruise. Finish with a revue show at the iconic Moulin Rouge.
description:
See Paris by night and get an entry ticket to the city’s most famous monument, the Eiffel Tower. Go to the first floor and marvel at the stunning views. Then, enjoy a cruise on the Seine River, a delicious 3-course meal, a glass of champagne or a bottle, and a Moulin Rouge show. 
Start your night by meeting your guide and fellow travelers at the meeting point to begin your activity. Walk to the Eiffel tower and go to the first view to marvel at the stunning views of Paris at night.
Next, see the magic and romance of the capital through a glass-enclosed boat while gliding along the River Seine. You also have the option to choose between two different three-course dinners on the water. Pass some of the capital’s romantic bridges and palaces; all lit up at night. Admire the architectural masterpiece of Notre Dame Cathedral, La Conciergerie, and the world-famous Louvre.
Top off this magical tour with a revue show at the atmospheric Moulin Rouge. You will feel like you have traveled back to Paris of yesteryear as you raise a glass of sparkling Champagne and toast the French Cancan, superbly danced by the Moulin Rouge showgirls.

Dinner Cruise
Starter (choose 1)
• Smoked salmon on blinis, artichoke tapenade, young spinach shoots
• Assortment: Provencal tart with fresh tomatoes, peppers, and pine nuts; Scallop flavored with lime leaf; diced potatoes with seaweed preserve; cucumber and artichoke tartare, diced smoked salmon and lumpfish roe, pan-seared aubergines, shrimps with lemongrass, yellow pepper coulis
• Three-greens gazpacho, crushed fresh tomatoes with Espelette pepper

Main course (choose 1)
• Braised chicken leg, Mediterranean flavored vegetables, celery chips with parmesan
• Haddock loin with shellfish juice, roast artichokes, and carrots
• Piece of beef, new potatoes, caramelized peppers and onions, green pepper sauce (+7€)
• Medley of seasonal vegetables, crunchy celery with tarragon vinegar

Cheese
• Plate of Cheeses (+6€)

Dessert (choose 1)
• Raspberry and lychee éclair, chocolate-coated rose petals, exotic coulis
• Cream pastry with apricot medallion, intense chocolate ingot, mixed fresh seasonal fruit
• Chocolate dome, a ring of strawberries and raspberries, apricot coulis

Children's menu
• Shredded turkey breast, cherry tomato, and mozzarella balls
• Choice of main dish from the menu
• Chocolate sweet with raspberry-soaked almond biscuit

Drink
• 1 glass of wine or soft drink

Luxury Dinner Cruise

Starter
• Foie gras royale, grilled shitake mushrooms, light cream infused with mushrooms, figs in wine, and kumquat

Main Course
• Pearly hake, potatoes with white wine, braised bok choy cabbage, shellfish and shrimp cream

Dessert
• Chocolate and hazelnut, a combination of soft and crisp

Vegetarian option
Starter
• Pressed quinoa and tofu terrine, light cream of watercress soup, and pickled red onions

Main Course
• Buckwheat with silky tofu, plain confit of seasonal vegetables, and red wine bouillon

Drinks
• Pays d’Oc Chardonnay Viognier PGI*, PDO Minervois Terroir (One bottle (75cl) between four people)
• Mineral water
• Coffee

name: Paris: Guided Tour of the Must-Sees of the Louvre Museum
shortDescription: Marvel at world-famous artworks in the largest museum on this guided tour of the Louvre. Enjoy skip-the-line access and navigate easily to masterpieces through its vast collections.
description:
Make the most of your time in Paris with a whirlwind tour of the must-see works of art in the Louvre. Gaze upon works like the mysterious Mona Lisa, the exquisite Venus de Milo, and the spectacular Winged Victory. 
Meet your guide at the Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel and walk over to the museum together. Breeze past the long lines to this popular attraction and spend more time looking at the masterpieces. 
Travel back in time and explore the Italian Renaissance, ancient Egypt, Greece and Rome, and French paintings of the 19th century. Uncover how the Louvre was a royal palace as you walk through the sumptuous corridors as Kings, Queens and Emperors once did.
Cover all the must-see masterpieces in the Louvre and get to some additional fascinating art pieces along the way. Hear the stories behind the art and artists, as you find out what makes iconic works so special. 
Feel free to remain inside the museum to explore at your own pace after your tour. Your guide will be happy to provide you with directions and recommendations.

name: Paris: Romantic Limousine Tour
shortDescription: Enjoy a romantic limousine tour around Paris and amaze your sweetheart with a personalized message of love displayed inside the limousine, right outside the Eiffel Tower.
description:
Take a romantic tour around the streets of Paris in your own private luxury limousine before surprising your sweetheart with a love message inside the limousine. 

The tour will begin at a time of your choice, when you'll be picked up by a stretch limousine in front of a restaurant or in front of your hotel.

You will then begin a V.I.P. ride through the most beautiful districts of Paris - Opéra, Vendôme, Champs-Elysées, Concorde, Louvre, Notre-Dame and Eiffel Tower. While charmed by the sumptuous sights of Paris, you can relax with some glasses of champagne.

Then the car will slow down and you will see a heart made out of lights displayed on an ultra-bright screen inside the limousine. To make this experience even more romantic, this message will coincide with the exact moment that the Eiffel Tour is sparkling with its illuminations.  The limousine will then drop you off, a couple of minutes later, at the destination of your choice.

The luxury limousine comes complete with a classy interior, tinted windows, mini-bar, bottle of champagne, LCD screen, laser disk player, surround speakers, and star ceiling...

name: Paris: Private Night e-Bike Tour with Boat Ride
shortDescription: Discover Paris by night on a private e-Bike tour. Complete your experience with a boat ride on the Seine River to take in the city lights at night.
description: Soak up the sights of Paris by night with this guided e-bike tour. Uncover some of the city's hidden gems as you peddle thorugh the streets in the safety of a reflective jacket. Marvel at the romance of city while it is illuminated for the night on a Seine River boat ride.  Meet your guide at the activity provider's shop and get set up with a well-maintained bike, helmet, and reflective jacket. Stay hydrated along the way with the included bottle of water. Make your way through the streets with ease with the assistance of the bike's electric motor. Hit the streets like a local and watch as your guide reveals some of the city's secrets. Board a boat and glide down the Seine river through the heart of the city. Admire the lights as they reflect on the water. Return to your meeting point at the end of your tour.

name: Parisian Deluxe Wine Tasting Experience
shortDescription: Indulge in a wine tasting on your visit to Paris during an informative master wine class. You’ll taste six different wines, coming from six different regions of France. A diverse range of wines has been selected to ensure a unique tasting experience.
description:
Treat yourself to an outstanding wine tasting experience. This wine tasting tour is designed for people who love fine wine. You don't need to be an expert to sign up for this class; the only thing that matters is a love of wine.

The tasting begins at 17:30 in the most beautiful tasting room. Enjoy the flavors of six different wines, originating from six varied regions in France. A variety of fabulous wines has been carefully selected for you including: older vintages, grands crus, premiers crus, grands crus classes and many more. These wines that come from some of the most renowned wineries in France – including high quality châteaus and small volume boutique wineries.

With a unique and refreshing approach, your sommelier will take you through a variety of themes to build up and refine your wine knowledge. You will learn about the main wine regions of France, understand what it takes to make a grandiose wine, and be guided through the specialties of French terroirs. Your guide will also explain the hierarchy of French wines and advise you of names you should be looking for when you select your own bottle. The content of the class will be tailored to meet your desires and the sommelier will ensure you learn about exactly what you are interested in.

The Wine Class is both informative and fun. In just two hours, you will learn a lot of interesting facts about French wine, and taste some of France’s finest drops.

name: Paris: Hop-On Hop-Off Bus Tour with Self-Guided Walking Tour
shortDescription: Explore Paris at your own pace on a hop-on hop-off sightseeing bus tour. Hop off at the stops of your choice to discover the city's landmarks with an easy-to-use self-guided walking tour from an app.
description:
Enjoy fantastic views and experience the charming atmosphere of Paris aboard a double-decker sightseeing bus. Hop off the bus at your favorite landmark to explore it on foot with an included self-guided walking tour from your smartphone, before jumping back on the bus to continue your route.
Best of all, opt for a 24-hour hop-on hop-off ticket and choose to add a Seine River cruise or book the 48-hour option, which includes a ticket for the cruise.

Drive by iconic attractions like the Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame Cathedral, and the Basilica of the Sacred Heard. Take in the sights at the lavish Champs-Elysées and admire the historical Grand Palais, Palais Garnier, and Louvre Museum from the comfort of your seat.

Discover over 15 landmarks in depth thanks to the fully narrated audio tour along the route. Join the tour from any of the stops on the route or from the starting point at the Eiffel Tower.

Hop off at the stop of your choice to explore the city on foot with a detailed audio- and self-guided tour. Choose one out of the 10 tours on the app, including the charming village of Montmartre, the sumptuous Palais Royal and the covered passages of Paris, the Eiffel Tower district, and more.

name: Lifestyle Tour of Saint-Germain-des-Prés
shortDescription: Discover the very best of the Latin Quarter of Paris! Saint-Germain-des-Prés is one the most visited and appreciated areas of Paris. Learn about the history and discover various boutiques for the best experience of the area.
description:
Saint-Germain-des-Prés, a small area within the Latin Quarter and Left bank, combines a tradition of Bookshops, art galleries, gourmet shops and home decoration. An atmosphere that is very much sought-after, it is relaxed and selective, synonymous with a comfortable lifestyle.

Your guide will tell you about the historical landmarks of the area, and will let you discover a selection of distinctive shops with original and quality items. You will visit a hotel with a unique ambiance, and see some of the best restaurants and cafés addresses in that area, there are so many of them! Become inspired by experiencing the very best that the neighbourhood has to offer.

Two tastings will be included to complete your experience!

name: Invalides War Museum the World Wars Guided Tour
shortDescription: Your engaging guide will lead you through the wars, sharing the most significant stories to help you understand France’s place in it and the effects these wars had on the French people.
description:
Take a tour of the Invalides War Museum with an expert guide. Begin by exploring the 19th century roots that lead to one of the bloodiest wars ever, learning about characters like Bismarck during the Franco-Prussian War. From there, your guide will piece together the chain of events, including the assassination of Franz Ferdinand, that set off World War I.

Come face to face with the equipment, uniforms, weapons, and other artifacts that were used during the war’s many battles. Relive the famous Battle of the Marne while seeing one of the iconic taxis that played a crucial role. Watch original footage detailing the atrocities before finally understanding how the Treaty of Versailles ended things. You’ll even see the train car where the armistice was signed, ending the war. Afterwards, learn how the threat of Adolf Hitler came to be a reality, launching World War II. Discuss significant events like the Ligne Maginot, Dunkerque, and the Occupation of Paris while meandering among artefacts collected from the battlefields.

Your guide will discuss famous men like Pétain and De Gaulle who helped guide France through this horrendous war. You will discover stories behind the battles of Normandy and the Liberation of Paris, which lead ultimately the preservation of the city that you can still enjoy today.

name: Small Group Guided Louvre Highlights Tour
shortDescription: Join a small group and an expert guide, and navigate the world’s largest art collection in a comfortable and memorable way, seeing all the highlights and much more.
description:
A visit to the Louvre is a must-do in Paris, as the museum contains many of civilization's most famous artistic masterpieces.
Many visitors feel intimidated by the site's vastness and the collection's magnitude; join this tour to skip the lines and get straight to the highlights. Your guide will ensure your visit to the Louvre is among the most memorable moments of your trip to Paris.

The Louvre’s awkward layout is because it was not built to function as a museum; the sprawling structure has nearly 10 miles of galleries. Navigate the halls, conveying the most important works and pointing out numerous lesser-known beauties you might have passed without noticing. 
You might appreciate the French Crown Jewels, Egyptian antiquities many thousands of years old, sculptural wonders by Michelangelo, and large-format canvases such as Liberty Leading the People and the Coronation of Napoleon. 
Admire the richly furnished and decorated salons preserved from the Second Empire, the last time the Louvre was home to a sovereign.

And, of course, you won’t leave without spending some time in the presence of the most famous painting in the world, Da Vinci’s Mona Lisa. 
Your guide will provide explanations and anecdotes about this enigmatic image. You’ll leave with a better sense of why she’s such a wonder to behold. After your guided service, you can remain in the museum until closing time if you wish.

name: Paris: Private Food Tour in Montmartre
shortDescription: Delight in a private 3-hour food tour in Montmartre with a local foodie guide. Visit some of the best artisans in the area. Sample a range of products, from wines and cheese to cream puffs and chocolate, united under the same umbrella: quality.
description:
The hilltop village of Montmartre has so much to offer. From its unique vineyards to its colorful bistros and picturesque little houses, the most bohemian area of Paris will amaze you at every street corner. On this private 3-hour food tour, discover the best foodie spots in this fantastic area with a passionate local guide.

With a flexible departure time, begin your walking tour in the Montmartre area. Savory and sweet specialties will delight you along the way, from the Moulin Rouge to the Sacré Coeur. During your tour, discover small artisans working with traditional methods, and get quickly introduced to French delicacies.

Stop by 8-10 of some of Montmartre's most fantastic shops to sample the quality produce. Try wines, cheeses, cured meat, the French baguette, cream puffs, and other tasty and traditional French treats. You will also have the opportunity to taste chocolate and Macarons from renowned chocolatiers.

name: Rodin Museum Guided Tour
shortDescription: Your expert guide will share the stories and secrets behind the most iconic works in the Rodin Museum. Learn about this French artist and the role he played in the 20th century art world. Explore the museum and garden.
description:
Explore the Rodin Museum with an expert art historian guide in a small group. The rooms are studded with sculptures and selections of more than 200 paintings that Rodin had accumulated over his life.

Explore his various studies of the human form, including numerous hands and the life-sized The Walking Man. Learn about his contemporaries, whom he depicted in clay, like the French writer Balzac. Discover the details of his masterpiece, The Gates of Hell, including the most recognizable of Rodin’s work, The Thinker.

After exploring the inside of the museum, you can stroll the beautifully manicured gardens where more sculptures are on display. Through this epic collection of his works, learn all about this renowned artist who became, even if unwittingly, a father of modern sculpture.

name: Mont Saint-Michel & Chateaux Country 3-Day Tour from Paris
shortDescription: Explore the history of France on a 3-day excursion to Normandy and the Loire Valley. Travel back in time, with tours of Mont Saint-Michel, Château de Langeais, the city of Rouen, D-Day Landing Beaches, and more.
description:
Drive through the beautiful French countryside to discover Middle Age and Gothic-inspired architecture, and learn the intriguing history of Normandy and France from an expert guide.

Cross to the tidal island of Mont Saint-Michel, and soak up the refinement of prestigious Loire Valley castles, such as the vast royal Château de Chambord.

Day 1 (Friday):
Traveling by luxury air-conditioned coach, depart Paris via the western districts and take the Normandy motorway as far as Mont Saint-Michel. Arriving at approximately midday, stop for lunch at the 4-star Relais Saint Michel, offering fantastic views across to the island.

After lunch, ascend to the Abbey on the summit of the mount for a guided visit of its Gothic and Romanesque interior. Enjoy some time at leisure exploring the narrow, hilly streets before your departure for Angers, cradle of the Plantagenet dynasty, where you will enjoy dinner and an overnight stay at the Hotel Mercure Lac de Maine (or similar accommodation).

Day 2 (Saturday):
After a hearty breakfast, drive to Langeais, passing Cunault and Saumur en route. Driving by vineyards, enjoy views of romantic castles on the horizon. Arrive at Château de Langeais to explore one of the best-known examples of late medieval architecture.

Continue with a guided visit of Clos-Lucé, Leonardo da Vinci's last dwelling place. Stroll through the stunnning gardens of Villandry, and visit the old historic district of Tours on the lower reaches of the Loire.

An evening meal will be served at your overnight stop in Tours at the Hotel Mercure.

Day 3 (Sunday):
Take a guide tour of the Château de Chenonceau, built on the site of an old mill across the River Cher. Continue to the decorative Château de Cheverny, used by Tintin creator, Hergé as the inspiration for his fictional Château de Moulinsart.

After lunch at the Hotel Saint-Hubert, go to the Château de Chambord to explore the largest and most imposing castle in the Loire Valley. Admire the distinctive French Renaissance architecture, which blends impressively with traditional medieval forms.

name: Paris: Guided Tour from Notre-Dame to Champs-Élysées
shortDescription: Get your bearings with a walking tour and explore the iconic landmarks and quaint, secret corners of Paris. Learn its rich history and evolution while you marvel at the Notre Dame, stand before the Louvre and stroll through the stunning Tuileries Garden.
description:
For locals and visitors alike, life doesn’t get much more romantic or picturesque than when you’re strolling the cobbled streets and grand boulevards of Paris.

On this private walking tour, pass by storied monuments as well as the charming snapshots of quaint, everyday life that make the French capital a beloved destination.

Marvel at the towering gothic façade of Notre Dame Cathedral, stand before the impressive Louvre museum and its famous glass pyramid, and stroll through the beautifully designed Tuileries Gardens.

Before the day is over, pay a visit to the elegant Place de la Concorde and impressive Champs Elysées, and discover quaint, little-known corners as your knowledgeable guides show you the secrets behind the tourist facade.

name: Paris: Premium Shopping Experience in Le Marais
shortDescription: Indulge in some retail therapy with a shopping experience at Le BHV Marais department store. Get a limited edition tote bag and enjoy a tall drink and pastry at Marlette on the 3rd floor.
description:
Discover Le BHV Marais, the Parisian’s favorite department store. Go to the welcome desk on arrival to collect a pouch containing all your "good deals" vouchers. Then, set off independently and shop at leisure.

Do you know this emblematic store? Le BHV Marais has a history dating back 160 years and is a part of the famous Galeries Lafayette group. An entry point into the cultural Marais district, the store is a major player on the international shopping scene, hosting a whole range of fashion, culture, design and gastronomy brands and services. Browse more than 2,000 brands.

Save money at one of the most popular department stores in Paris as you enjoy some retail therapy at Le BHV Marais. 

Browse more than 2,000 brands and take advantage of your 15% discount card to find bargains on a selection of items. When you need a break and some refreshments, head to the 3rd floor Marlette café and exchange your voucher for a tall drink and pastry for a mini price tag.

Enjoy some quality time shopping at Le BHV Marais and benefit from services such as tax refund line jumps and a refund cash machine.

If you purchase this package, Le BHV Marais offers you a special surprise: 15% off on a selection of brands.

name: Paris: Gourmet Food Tour in South Montmartre
shortDescription: Discover the romantic neighborhood of Paris through its food. Explore the secret addresses of the 9th arrondissement and taste real French food. Benefit from a local guide and a small-group experience for no more than 6 people.
description:
Depart at 3:15 PM for your walking food tour. Learn the story of Moulin Rouge and how it got that name. Pass the cabarets and theaters and listen as your guide tells you their stories. Make a stop at a secret coffee shop with an amazing courtyard and house from the 19th century. Have your first pastry tasting here.


Your next stop will be at a master cheese ripener, where you will taste some cheese. Learn from the local craftsman that you will meet. Continue the tour and discover a romantic neighborhood where the most famous artists, painters, and musicians lived. Walk through the most famous street of the 19th century where the most famous actresses and actors were living.

Next, discover a surprising restaurant where you will sample a local dish and beverage. This neighborhood is very charming with a particularly cute square. Head to the famous street of Rue des Martyrs, which is a very old Merchant street from the 18th century. Here, try amazing sweet and savory products and hear the stories of the shop owners. Finish your food tour in a delicatessen-restaurant where you will have a food and wine pairing experience.

name: Les Invalides: Napoleon's Tomb & Army Museum Priority Entry
shortDescription: Take a deep dive into the History of France through one of the largest collections of military history and art. Don’t miss the tomb of Napoleon I under the majestic golden Dôme des Invalides.
description:
Discover the Hotel National des Invalides, now home of the musee de l'Armee. Walk through the collections of the museum, at your own pace, and immerse into over 500, 000 pieces from the Middle Ages to present day. Witness the temporary exhibition of Special Forces L'exposition, dedicated to the French special forces. 
Step into the heart of Paris and integrate into the History of France at the Hotel National des Invalides. Created by Louis, XIV to house veterans and wounded soldiers, the hotel national is now also the home of the musee de l'Armee. 
Admire the world-renowned gilded Dome, which has been, since 1861, the resting place of Napoleon. Explore the collections and wander through the armor and weapons of the kings of France. Gaze around at swords, cannons, uniforms, paintings, photographs, and personal belongings of France's major figures. 
Look beyond the artifacts, and participate in an interactive digital experiences with devices that allow visitors to get a better understanding of some of the battles that forged the country's history. Make sure to examining the Special Forces l'exposition temporary exhibit, that celebrates the 30th anniversary of the creation of the Special Ops Command.

name: Paris: Champagne at the Moulin Rouge & Seine River Cruise
shortDescription: Experience the magic of Paris at night on a combined cruise of the Seine River and a revue show at the legendary Moulin Rouge. See the city’s attractions from the comfort of your river vessel, then toast the famous cancan with complimentary Champagne.
description:
Discover the lights of Paris on a night cruise on the Seine river and feast your eyes on a stunning can-can show with entry to the iconic Moulin Rouge. Relax with a half bottle of champagne while taking in the show. 
Experience the unparcelled romance of the capital through a glass-enclosed Bateaux Parisian boat. Climb on board at a centrally-located meeting point and glide gently along the river admiring the city’s monuments at they are lit up at night.
Pass some of the historic bridges that make Paris so enchanting and admire architectural masterpieces of like the Notre-Dame Cathedral and the Louve Museum. Float by the lush greenery of the Tuileries Gardens.

End of your river cruise and hop aboard a spacious coach for the drive to the Moulin Rouge at the foot of Montmartre. Step into the spiritual birthplace of the modern form of the can-can. 
Let the “Féerie” revue show take your breath away as you witness a coordinated performance by a troupe of 100 artists, including 60 Doris Girls, and 1,000 costumes of feathers and glitter.

Enjoy magnificent stage settings of rich colors and unique drawings created by Italian artists. Raise a glass of sparkling Champagne to the exceptional acts which are all set to original music from 80 musicians and 60 chorus singers.

name: Paris: Skip-the-line in Louvre Museum Guidance to Mona Lisa
shortDescription: Skip the line to the Louvre and save valuable time in Paris. Head straight to Leonardo da Vinci's famous painting of the Mona Lisa, and then, explore the Louvre museum at your own pace.
description:
For a long time, before becoming a museum in 1793, the Louvre was one of the main residences of the kings of France. Located in the heart of Paris, it covers an area of 73,000 square meters and houses the largest collection of art works in the world, from civilizations over 7,000 years old to the 19th century. The collections of the museum are divided into 8 departments: Egyptian Antiquities, Greek, Etruscan and Roman Antiquities, Oriental Antiquities, Islamic Art, Paintings, Sculptures, Artworks and Graphics.

Upon arrival, admire this masterpiece painted by Leonardo da Vinci in 1506 and one of the most famous portraits of women in the world, the host will let you enjoy the museum at your own pace.

name: Paris: Stade de France Behind the Scenes Tour
shortDescription: Step into France’s largest football stadium, host to the finals of the FIFA World Cup in 1998 and the UEFA Euro Cup in 2016. Go behind the scenes and learn about the architecture, walk in private areas and finish your visit at the museum.
description:
Tour France's largest stadium on this unique 90-minute tour. Sit in a spectator's seat and take in the incredible panorama. As a privileged visitor, you’ll get to see the private boxes and locker room and walk through the same tunnel that players use to access the pitch.

Your expert guide will tell you about the stadium’s history, its unique architecture and the stars who have appeared on its manicured pitch.

Apart from sporting events, the stadium also hosts international shows. The Rolling Stones were the first group to perform at the Stade de France. International stars such as Madonna and ACDC also chose this venue for their concerts, witnessed by 80,000 spectators each time.

End your visit at the museum, where you’ll find heaps of items that are testament to the stadium’s legendary history. On display are archives, models, autographed guitars, jerseys and much more.

On this unique tour you’ll be able to follow the footsteps of football legends Zidane and Ronaldo, who played the 1998 FIFA World Cup final. This is also the site where Cristiano Ronaldo lifted his first major Trophy for Portugal!

name: From Paris: Versailles Guided Tour with Skip-the-Line Entry
shortDescription: Enjoy a professionally guided tour of the Palace of Versailles, and skip the long lines to enter. View the Royal Apartments, Hall of Mirrors, Queen's Private Apartment, and more, with free time to explore the gardens before your return to Paris.
description:
Join an expert interpreter-guide on a half-day tour of the exquisite Palace of Versailles, and get priority, skip-the-line entrance. You will be led through the history of the Palace, one of the most important monuments in the world.

Meet your guide in front of the Pullman Hotel in Paris. Board your luxurious air-conditioned coach, sit back, and relax on the short ride to Versailles. 
Once home to Louis XIV, also known as the Sun King, you will relive the glory days of Parisian royalty. Gaze in awe as you are guided through the most beautiful rooms of the palace, including the State Apartments, the Hall of Mirrors and the Queen's and King´s Private Apartment.

After experiencing the grandeur of the interior, enjoy free time to explore the beauty of the Palace of Versailles’ gardens, filled with statues, busts, and marble vases that date back to 1661, when teams of sculptors were led by King Louis XIV's official painter, Charles Le Brun.

name: Paris: Panthéon Admission Ticket and Self-Guided Tour
shortDescription: Explore the Panthéon, the temple dedicated to the memory of the men and women who have marked French history since the time of the French Revolution. Spend a fascinating hour on a self-guided tour and take in views of the city from the upper floors.
description:
A masterpiece created by Soufflot (1713-1780) and a former church, the Panthéon became the burial place for famous French personalities from the French Revolution. Spend an hour visiting this important monument on a skip-the-line self-guided tour.
A major exhibition at the Panthéon pays tribute to Jacques-Germain Soufflot, one of the greatest French architects. It presents his career and his monumental achievements, the most famous being the royal Church of Sainte-Geneviève, the current Panthéon.

The architect achieved Louis XV's desire to glorify the monarchy in church form dedicated to Saint Geneviève. The edifice was deconsecrated during the French Revolution in 1791 and renamed the Panthéon. During the turbulent 19th century, it shifted between a religious and patriotic monument.
Since Victor Hugo's death in 1885, the Panthéon has been the resting place for French writers, scientists, generals, clergymen, and politicians. The crypt houses the tombs of 70+ illustrious figures including Voltaire, Jean-Jacques Rousseau, Emile Zola, Alexandre Dumas, Pierre, and Marie Currie.
From the recently restored upper floors, you can enjoy superb views across the city (from April to October).

name: Paris: Romantic Cruise with 3-course Dinner on Seine River
shortDescription: Discover the most beautiful city in the world on the "Capitaine Fracasse" boat. Enjoy a relaxing river cruise with panoramic views of Paris, perfect for a romantic night.
description:
Admire the French capital from the water on a sightseeing dinner cruise. Dine on the river Seine with a 3-course meal and see iconic Parisian monuments, including the Eiffel Tower, Pont de l’Alma, Musée d’Orsay, and the Louvre museum. 
Depart from the Île aux Cygnes, and cruise along the Seine. Pass important landmarks and take in the views from the water. Go as far as Bercy before heading back to the starting point.

Freshly-cooked on board:
StarterHalf-cooked foie gras, apple, and grape chutney. Haddock tartar with lemon confit espuma. Brazilian bread with Mimolette, herring eggs.
Main CourseGrenadin of veal, Darphin apple, smoked Sucrine, cream of corn, carrot with puffed Amaranth or Back of cod grilled with sauce Vierge, burnt leek, cream of peas, and cauliflower pickles. 

DessertsBaba with whipped cream or Chocolate Hazelnut Finger or Inverted Lemon Tart.

name: Louvre Museum: Guided Tour with Optional Ticket
shortDescription: See masterpieces of art on a carefully planned tour of the Louvre Museum in Paris, and see the best of the collection in 2 hours. Skip the ticket line and enjoy Priority Access. Head to gems such as the Mona Lisa as well as some lesser-known sites.
description:
Discover one of the world’s great art collections on a guided tour of the Louvre Museum, and marvel at relics from Ancient Egypt to the art of the Italian Renaissance. The entire collection would take months to see in full, but you will follow a carefully planned route to discover the highlights.

Gaze at da Vinci’s enigmatic Mona Lisa and see Anthony Canova’s emotional Psyche Revived by Cupid’s Kiss. Hear the true story depicted in Gericault’s Raft of Medusa. Go to Napoleon’s former apartments to admire the most beautiful décor of the palace, as well as a collection of crown jewels.

The masterpieces continue with the Venus de Milo, the sculpture that inspired so many artists. Head to the basement of the Louvre Palace to see the foundations of the castle that once stood on the site.

Choose between 2 options: get your ticket and guided tour with one of the skip-the-ticket-line guided tours in several languages. Alternatively, if you already have a ticket or museum pass, choose the guided tour for ticket or museum pass holders.

name: Paris: Hop-On Hop-Off Sightseeing Cruise 1-Day/2-Day Pass
shortDescription: Discover Paris at your own pace from the River Seine with a 24-hour or 48-hour pass to a riverboat shuttle service. Board and alight where you want, as often as you want, and see the city's iconic sights.
description:
Explore the sights of Paris at your own pace with a 24-hour or 48-hour pass to the Batobus shuttle service along the River Seine, and jump on and off at 9 strategic stops to see sights such as the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Louvre, and more. Cruise through the heart of Paris, admiring landmark monuments along the river bank from the comfort of a glassed-in boat. Then, stop to explore further at leisure.

• Tour Eiffel - Port de la Bourdonnais. Jump off at the foot of the great Parisian landmark, and ascend for panoramic city views from the viewing platforms. The stop is also convenient for the Cité de l’Architecture museum, where exhibits include casts of French architecture from the 12th to 18th centuries.

• Musée d'Orsay - Quai de Solférino. Located a 2-minute walk from the Musée d'Orsay, this stop is perfect for those who want to explore the world of Impressionists artists, such as Monet, Degas, Renoir, Cézanne, and Van Gogh.

• St-Germain-des-Prés - Quai Malaquais. Hop off near the Institut de France, home of Paris artists and intellectuals, and discover historic sights, such as the famous Les Deux Magots and Café de Flore.

• Notre-Dame - Quai de Montebello. Admire the architectural harmony and Gothic gargoyles of the most iconic cathedral in Paris, and explore the carefree student atmosphere of the Latin Quarter.

• Jardin des Plantes - Cité de la Mode et du Design. Wander among nature in the main botanical garden of Paris, and explore the museums in the garden grounds, including the Grande Galerie de l'Évolution and Paleontology Museum. The Cité de la mode et du design (also known as "les Docks") was built in 1907 as industrial warehousing for the Ports de Paris. It is a city within the city dedicated to creativity: design, fashion, innovation, and events. The Cité has permanent residents which include restaurants, nightclubs, a museum, and shops.

• Hotel de Ville - Pont d'Arcole. Stop here to visit the historic City Hall of Paris, go to the Pompidou Centre, and wander the bohemian streets of the Marais district.

• Louvre - Pont Royal and Pont du Carrousel. Discover a Paris quarter where history and the history of art come together, and see centuries of art, from Egyptian antiquities to Renaissance masterpieces.

• Place de la Concorde. Stroll down one of the most elegant streets in Paris, home to five-star hotels and chic boutiques, and see the Grand Palais, Petit Palais, and tree-lined Avenue Montaigne.

• Invalides - Pont Alexandre III.

name: Paris: 1.5-Hour Guided Walking Tour of Montparnasse
shortDescription: Get an intimate look into 20th-century Paris with a guided walk through the influential Parisian neighborhood of Montparnasse. Explore the streets, once occupied by Nazis, and see the most important theaters and bars of the 1920s.
description:
Discover Montparnasse, a lesser-known Parisian neighborhood brimming with history and culture. Explore the area with a professional guide on this 1.5-hour guided walking tour.

Start your walking adventure at Boulevard du Montparnasse, where the cream of the Cafe Society wined and dined at legendary eateries. Next, walk down the romantic Rue Delambre.

Learn about the life of Josephine Baker, the beloved entertainer who helped the French Resistance. Visit historical sites like The Sphinx: a brothel requisitioned by the Nazis during the Second World War, and the Monocle: a famous women-only cabaret.

Continue to Montparnasse Cemetery and pay tribute to famous figures like Simone de Beauvoir and Jean-Paul Sartre. Finally, enter Rue de la Gaite, the "Little Theater District," of Paris and finish your tour at the impressive Montparnasse Tower.

name: Paris: Sainte-Chapelle Skip-The-Line Ticket and River Cruise
shortDescription: Go on a self-guided tour with skip-the-line tickets and be spellbound by the beauty of Sainte-Chapelle. Find out this Gothic gem’s great history.
description:
Spend less time in queues and more time admiring the finest collection of stained glass in Sainte-Chapelle. Get a booklet for a self-guided tour and see the windows that make Sainte-Chapelle the gem of French Gothic monuments.

Go on a self-guided tour and marvel at the beauty of the Sainte-Chapelle, a Gothic-style royal chapel within the medieval Palais de la Cité. Marvel at the 1,113 stained glass windows in the monument and find out its great history.

Decorated with a unique collection of 15 glass panels and a rose window, this jewel of shining Gothic architecture lies at the heart of the royal residence. Step inside for a closer look at this rich decoration.

Besides exceptional stained glass windows, Sainte-Chapelle houses Christian artifacts of the Passion of Christ including the Crown of Thorns, a piece of the True Cross, and the holy face of Edessa. Learn how the possession of these sacred relics made the French monarchs head of western Christianity.

name: Paris: Private 1.5-Hour Sightseeing Segway Tour
shortDescription: Discover Paris in a different way on a private 1.5-hour Segway tour. Ride along effortlessly in a matter of minutes on a form of transport that is fun and easy to learn.
description:
Explore the most iconic landmarks in Paris in a fun way aboard a Segway. Whiz around the city for 1.5 hours, learn about the city's history with your Segway guide, and delight in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere on a personalized tour.

After making your way to the meeting point, begin your Paris discovery at the amazing Dôme des Invalides, a collection of buildings containing military museums and monuments.

Next, set off through the center of Paris to see the main places and monuments, such as the Grand Palais. Hear stories about them from your guide, as well as observations about the Paris of nowadays, with its gastronomic culture, modern life, and nice addresses.

Cross the city's most extravagant bridge, Pont Alexandre III, built for the Paris Exposition in 1900. Admire its elegance, then make your way to one of the most celebrated avenues in the world, the Champs Elysées. 
See the Arc de Triomphe, which Napoleon commissioned in 1806 to commemorate his victories.

name: Paris: Fly Over Paris and the World in Virtual Reality
shortDescription: Put on your jetpack (flight simulator) and see Paris from a bird’s-eye view. Embark on the first immersive flight experience over Paris. As a bonus, fly over 7 dream destinations around the world.
description:
Embark on the first immersive flight experience of Paris, in which visitors fly over Paris and its monuments in virtual reality, complete with real flight sensations. 
Head to the departure lounge for your flight instructions then, in the takeoff room, don your jetpack, put on your virtual-reality headset, and take flight over the rooftops of Paris. Enjoy a 35-minute experience (including 20 minutes in virtual reality), filmed with real-life images.

Fly past the Eiffel Tower, soar over the Seine, and discover the Champs-Elysées, the Arc de Triomphe and other iconic monuments. Experience the realistic feeling of actually flying through the air with the virtual-reality headsets and your jetpack (flight simulator). 
After this amazing flight over Paris, fly over seven dream destinations, taking in 360-degree views of the Great Wall of China, Victoria Falls in Zimbabwe, Angel Falls in Venezuela, Lake Baikal in Russian, and others.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Visit with Summit, Louvre, and Cruise
shortDescription: Enjoy a visit to the Eiffel Tower, with a guided tour up to the 2nd floor, then explore the summit alone. Embark on a 1-hour Seine River Cruise with your ticket to see the sights of Paris. Complete your journey with a visit to the Louvre Museum.
description:
Enjoy the adventure of triple sightseeing in Paris. Meet your guide at the departure point to pick up your Eiffel Tower ticket. Go up the famous tower with the guide. Hear great stories from your guide until you reach the second floor. After your guided tour, ascend all the way up to the summit and marvel at the fascinating view of the city.

Head out for your river cruise ride for 1 hour on the city's romantic Seine. See the best parts of the City of Light from the tranquil water, and enjoy great tidbits from your audioguide.

Visit the world-famous Louvre Museum. With your entrance ticket, head into this maze of art and culture in the center of the city. See whether Mona Lisa is smiling, marvel at amazing paintings, and walk among sculptures.

name: Notre-Dame Exterior, Île de la Cité, St. Severin Church Tour
shortDescription: Enjoy a guided walking tour in Île de la Cité and a tour inside the Saint-Severin Church in Paris' Latin Quarter. See Notre Dame Cathedral from the outside and learn about how it will be rebuilt.
description:
The monumental Notre-Dame Cathedral is one of the most remarkable Gothic cathedrals in France and Europe and is one of the capital’s major monuments. As a symbol of a city and even a country, its history is made of stones and men. On April 15, 2019 the main spire and roof of the building collapsed in a huge fire.

By joining this tour you will learn more about the rebuilding of Notre-Dame and the next steps for its reconstruction. You will see the revival of Gothic Architecture and enjoy a walking tour in the Île de la Cité, the mythical place where everything began. Next you will enjoy a guided tour at the Saint-Severin Church in the Latin quarter, a great example of flamboyant Gothic Architecture.

name: Paris Gourmet Tour
shortDescription: This delicious tour will take you in a journey through the French culinary arts which are famous around the world.
description:
During this gourmet tour you will walk through the medieval parts of the Latin Quarter, one of the most famous neighborhoods in the world.

The Latin Quarter was the intellectual area of Paris where the famous Sorbonne University is located. Walk through a market well-known for the high quality and large variety of food which can be found there.

Next, stop at an authentic French cheese shop. You will find out why Charles de Gaulle famously exclaimed “How would you like to govern a country with 246 different types of cheese?”

Here you will try different cheeses and discover their different tastes and textures that are perfectly complementary to the delicious wine.

You will also visit several bakeries and enjoy the amazing variety of French breads and pastries, from the baguette to the croissant.

Finish your tour in a regional specialties’ shop where you will have the opportunity to taste the most luxurious French delicacy—the foie gras.

Enjoy a walk rich in tastes and flavors, where you will be introduced to the French art of culinary delights.

name: Paris: Dark City Secrets Walking Tour
shortDescription: Experience Paris’ dark side throughout a spine-chilling evening walk. You'll discover the historical murders, crimes, and fantastic legends that have shaped the story of this city.
description:
Throughout your 2-hour guided tour you will discover the dark side of the center of Paris. Choose between a shared or private experience, which will begin at the former main site of the bloody and popular public executions, which were both adored and appreciated by Parisians. 
You will see how cruelly they used to punish convicted criminals, as well as the occasional unfortunate innocent person too.

Paris is a haunted city with plenty of ghosts and phantoms. One famous French poet became the ghost that today haunts a theater, another one was injured during a fire and has since never left the Opera House. 
You'll learn about the "evil queen" of France, and how another spirit haunted her all the way up until her final days.

Demons and devilish beings are everywhere in Paris, with the Notre Dame Cathedral containing plenty of them on its exterior. On this facade, there are so many creepy and mysterious signs and symbols, which require a thorough investigation to properly appreciate it.

You will learn how a gypsy cursed a house in the Latin Quarter, causing its owner to die. This was followed by more people mysteriously dying there. 
You'll hear the spine-chilling story about this most famous cursed Parisian place, before your chilling tour finishes at the meeting point with the story of a vampire.

name: Paris: Louvre Museum Highlights & Hidden Gems
shortDescription: Discover the range of artwork at the Louvre on this comprehensive guided tour. Go beyond the Mona Lisa to see works from the Apollo Gallery, the Grand Gallery, and the Mesopotamian collection.
description:
Get an in-depth look at the works on display in the Louvre to understand why it is one of the most-visited museums in the world. Your guide will take you on a route through the main collections, as well as pointing out the museum’s lesser-known gems. 
You’ll meet your guide by the nearby Arc de Triomphe before heading to the Louvre. Spot the museum’s original stone foundations to appreciate its roots as a fortress for a royal residence.
As you enter the museum itself, you’ll be greeted by the Venus De Milo, the Winged Victory of Samothrace, and the Mona Lisa. Your guide will tell you the stories behind the legendary pieces, ensuring you get a true understanding of these larger-than-life works.
Next, journey towards the Apollo Gallery which houses the French Crown Jewels, before perusing the Grand Gallery lined with lesser-known Leonardos and Raphaels. Highlights include The Raft of The Medusa and The Wedding Feast at Cana, the largest canvas in the Louvre at 32 feet. 
In addition to works from antiquity, the Renaissance, and French Romanticism, you’ll travel further afield with treasures from the Middle East and the Mesopotamian collection. See one of the oldest objects in the Louvre before being awed by the most extensive set of laws from an ancient kingdom.

name: Versailles: Skip-the-Line Guided Palace Tour w/ Gardens
shortDescription: Visit the elegant Palace of Versailles on a guided tour. Skip the long lines and enter through a separate entrance.
description:
Learn more about the Palace of Versailles on a guided tour of the inside and spend some free time in the gardens. Avoid the hassle of waiting in long lines with skip-the-line tickets.

Meet your guide at Versailles at the foot of the Equestrian Statue of the Sun King, Louis the 14th. Start your tour with a visit to the Royal Apartments. 
Walk through the interior of the palace and explore its many rooms. Learn fascinating information about its history from your guide.

Afterward, spend some free time in the gardens. Explore this 2,000-acre park filled with lovely fountains, statues, and landscaped gardens.

If visiting Versailles on a Tuesday or a Friday, see the Musical Gardens show. On Saturdays or Sundays, catch the Musical Fountains Show (from March to October).

name: Paris: Romantic Photoshoot at the Eiffel Tower & The Louvre
shortDescription: Book an exclusive VIP photoshoot with a photographer at the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre Museum. Have a professional photographer capture high-quality digital photos of your visit to this iconic sight.
description:
Turn your visit to Paris into a memory that will last a lifetime with a 2-hour photoshoot session in front of the Eiffel Tower and at the Louvre Museum. Let your professional photographer who knows all the best angles take snapshots of you outside this stunning landmark.
Receive professionally edited, high-resolution digital photos.
Meet your photographer at the Carousel of the Eiffel Tower. Bring your smile and follow the instructions of your professional photographer to get some great shots. Enjoy the thrill of taking a private photo shoot at this iconic landmark.
You will then take a private taxi to go to your next location: the Louvre Museum. Take the most beautiful photos of this memorable Paris sight, and enjoy the different backgrounds.

Get your picture taken alone or with the special people in your life. Is your photo shoot for a special occasion? Ask our photographer to arrange some props: flowers, balloons, banner! (excluding from the total price)
Be sent a personal link to your pictures within 24 hours. View and download the high-resolution images on your own device.

name: Paris: Walking Food Tour in Saint Germain des Prés
shortDescription: Taste the best food in Paris in the oldest neighborhood of the City of Lights. Make a Tour de France of French Food, visiting the best local master artisans in the charming and luxury neighborhood of Saint Germain des Prés and savour their products.
description:
Start your walking tour with a morning departure at 10:45 AM or afternoon at 4:00 PM, in front of the Church of Saint Germain des Prés, in the 6th arrondissement (near Saint Germain des Prés stop on Metro line 4).

Now, visit 3 different sweet shops, entering each one for a tasting as you listen to the success story of the local artisan, interact with the merchant if you wish. Discover a hidden courtyard where the story of restaurants began, where many famous French historical leaders passed through.

Then, embark on an oilve oil tasting much like a wine tasting, discovering the different tastes of olives. Your guide will lead you in the neighborhood introducing you some local restaurants before a new stop at one of the best pastry French chefs'. Learn how to recognize the best pastry chef and choose the right kind or pastry.

End your tour with three savoury addresses, where you will sit for a longer tasting with wine: a charcuterie tasting, a cheese tasting, and the best bread of Paris.

name: Paris: 2-Hour Private Musée d'Orsay Guided Tour
shortDescription: Explore the Musée d'Orsay on a 2-hour private guided tour and admire its diverse collections of western art. Learn about the masterpieces you see during the tour and discuss the works that interest you most with your expert guide.
description:
Follow your guide on a 2-hour private tour of the Musée d'Orsay and you’ll be taken to the heart of an exceptional museum that is home to masterpieces of western art from 1848 to 1914. In addition, your expert guide will provide commentary on the many works of art you see.

You’ll have the opportunity to admire numerous world-famous masterpieces of the Impressionist Movement, and as you walk along the Museum’s corridors you’ll take in major works of Neoclassicism, Realism, and Symbolism, as well.

You’ll also be able to share your opinions with your guide as you discuss works that interest you on this journey of discovery.

name: Paris: Street Art Open-Air Museum Bike Tour
shortDescription: Bike past giant frescoes, admire the work of famous street artists and stop to have a coffee at the world's largest startup incubator in this 3.5-hour tour through Paris' most modern neighborhood.
description:
Explore the world's largest Street Art Open-Air Museum by bike and photograph murals by Tristan Eaton, Invader, Faile, Btoy, D * Face, Shepard Fairey, Cryptik, Hush, Conor Harrington, INTI, and maybe even Banksy. 

Join your guide in central Paris and cycle to the city's most modern neighborhood, ZAC Paris 13. Here, some of the greatest architects let loose and created delirious buildings decorated by star graffiti artists from all over the world.

Admire 40-meter frescoes and a vibrant collision of styles and colors. After exploring, take a coffee break in the world's largest startup incubator, Station F. See Big Mama's flagship vessel of 10 themed restaurants and soak in the creative atmosphere.

name: Direct Access Eiffel Tower Ticket and 2nd Level Tour
shortDescription: Skip the ticket line to the Eiffel Tower and enjoy a 90-minute guided tour of this iconic Parisian landmark. Ascend directly to the 2nd level with an expert guide and admire fantastic views of the city.
description:
This direct access tour gets you priority admission to the Eiffel Tower, the iconic symbol of Paris. Save time on your trip to the City of Light - bypass the notoriously long ticket line at one of the most-visited monuments in the world!

Built for the 1889 World's Fair, Gustave Eiffel’s magnificent construction stands at 324 meters tall. On this 90-minute tour, your guide will bring you straight to the front of the line and up to the 2nd level of the Eiffel Tower.

Along the way, your guide will tell you about major events in the tower’s history, including early marketing stunts and its role in both World Wars.

name: Paris 2-Hour Perfume Walking Tour
shortDescription: Discover the history of world-famous French fragrance houses, including Chanel, Dior, Yves Saint Laurent, Guerlain, and Givenchy on a guided walk through Paris. Visit 3 iconic perfume shops and learn how the different fragrances are made.
description:
On this 2-hour guided walk you’ll be led through Paris by your nose as your knowledgeable guide takes you back through the history of French perfumes. Hear about a time when perfumes were restricted to religious ceremonies, and when the use of perfume was considered to be a privilege.

Your guide will explain how perfume is part of French history and traditions, as you visit perfume houses and discover how fragrances are made. Learn how to describe the ingredients of eau de cologne, and the characteristics of different families of perfumes.

Hear the fascinating stories of world-famous perfume houses such as Chanel, Dior, Yves Saint Laurent, Guerlain, and Givenchy, and learn some of the secrets behind their unforgettable perfumes.

name: Paris: Professional Photoshoot Outside the Louvre Museum
shortDescription: Book an exclusive photoshoot with a photographer outside the Louvre Museum in Paris. Have a professional photographer capture high-quality digital photos of your visit to this iconic sight.
description:
Turn your visit into a memory that will last a lifetime with a photoshoot session outside the Louvre Museum in Paris. Let your professional photographer who knows all the best angles take snapshots of you outside this stunning landmark. 
Meet your photographer for your candid photographs. Bring your smile and follow the instructions of your professional photographer to get some great shots. Enjoy the thrill of taking a private photo shoot in the heart of Paris.

Get your picture taken alone or with the special people in your life. Be sent a personal link to your pictures within 24 hours. View and download the high-resolution images on your own device.

name: Paris Highlights 2.5-Hour Segway Tour
shortDescription: See the sights of Paris from a different angle on a 2.5-hour Segway tour, and learn the history of the city as you glide down sidewalks and bike paths. Marvel at some of the most historic sites in Europe, such as Les Invalides, the Eiffel Tower, and more.
description:
Explore the grand boulevards of Paris on a fun and eco-friendly mode of transport. Climb aboard a self-balancing Segway and set off in a small group of no more than 10 people to see the top attractions of the “City of Lights.”

Following a short, 30-minute training session on the easy-to-drive vehicles, explore the cultural heritage of Paris from a different angle. Glide past historical monuments and down narrow lanes that are inaccessible to other modes of transport.

Your guide will reveal hidden treasures as you take a loop from Avenue de Suffren. Pass the Military school at Les Invalides and glide past the National Assembly.

Next, go down the tree-lined Champs Elysées from the Grand Palais to the Place de la Concorde, looking at the upscale shops and hotels along the way. Continue to the Grand et Petit Palais on the banks of the River Seine. Marvel at the historic Pont de l'Alma, before taking in the legendary Eiffel Tower.

name: Paris: Versailles Palace & Trianon Castles E-Bike Tour
