shortDescription: Enjoy an overview of Paris as you ride your electric bike toward Versailles Palace and Trianon Castles. Visit both sites at your own pace with skip-the-line tickets and learn about their rich history.
description:
Meet your guide and get set up with your e-bike. Start the tour by crossing the park of Saint-Cloud (1500 acres). Discover the fountains of the Grande Cascade designed by Hardouin-Mansart and Le Pautre.
Be amazed by the history of the former Royal Castle of Saint-Cloud. This castle was the residence of Philippe d'Orléans, the young brother of Louis XIV. It was also the residence of Napoleon. Pass through the statues of the Parterre des 24 jets. Take a selfie a great viewof Paris in the background.
Ride through the small village of Marnes-la-Coquette. Admire the beautiful architecture of this small town located at "the gates of Paris".
Then, explore the Fausses-Reposes as you ride along paths sheltered from the sun under the canopy of the trees. 
Arrive at the iconic Palace of Versailles, surrounded by stunning fountains and lush gardens. Avoid the queues with skip-the-line entry to the palace. Explore the Hall of Mirrors with an audio guide.
Afterward, meet your guide again to head to the Notre-Dame market. Purchase a variety of delicious local products according to your budget such as wine, cheese, baguettes, or saucisson. Your guide, a former restaurateur, will be happy to advise you. 
Enjoy your picnic lunch by the water on the banks of the Grand Canal. The Grand Canal is located on the grounds of the Palace of Versailles.
After lunch, visit the Trianon estate at your own pace. See the Gand Trianon castle which was of great importance to Louis XIV. Then, discover the Petit Trianon castle gifted to Marie-Antoinette by Louis XVI.
Stroll through the gardens, the Temple of Love, and the hamlet of Marie-Antoinette. Then hop back on your bike and peddle your way back through the forest. Finish the tour in the park of Saint-Cloud with beautiful views of Paris in the background.

name: Paris: Cruise the Seine River at Sunset
shortDescription: Explore Paris on a Seine river cruise. Sail through the heart of the city as the sun sets. Marvel at views of Notre-Dam and the Eiffel Tower from the river.
description:
Embark on a downtown Paris river cruise. Watch the sunset as you float down the Seine and take in sights like the Tuileries garden and the Louvre museum. Have the option to purchase wine and snacks at the bar. 
Hop aboard and admire the verdant Tuileries garden, the famed Louvre museum, and l'Ile de la Cité (Island of the City). Go past the Notre-Dame cathedral as it is bathed in the the evening light. 
See the bridges that go the natural island of l'Ile Saint Louis. Pass by the grand l'Hôtel de Ville and the iconic Eiffel Tower.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Guided Visit to Summit & Optional Cruise
shortDescription: Enjoy a guided visit to the iconic Eiffel Tower's 2nd floor and learn about the monument's history and head up to the summit on your own.
description:
Begin your 2-hour Eiffel Tower visit with commentary by your guide about the monument's history. Meet your guide at the meeting point by at the time given in the booking according to the booking season. Then head up to the 2nd floor for your guided visit. Take in views of all the famous monuments that can be seen from the Eiffel Tower, including the golden dome of the Hôtel des Invalides and Notre-Dame.

At the end of the second-floor tour, the guide will tell you about the other floors. Your ticket grants you access to the first floor and the summit as well. On the first floor you can walk on a glass floor and visit the small museum about the Eiffel Tower. Stay as long as you wish. If you choose the cruise option, you’ll enjoy a 1-hour sightseeing cruise on the Seine River.

name: Paris Montmartre: 2-Hour Walking Tour in German
shortDescription: Explore the artists' quarter Montmartre with a German guide. Learn more about its history and stroll through the picturesque alleys and streets. See Sacré Coeur, the Place de Tertre and the Moulin Rouge.
description:
Discover Montmartre in the north of Paris, the small village just outside the city. At the beginning of the 20th century, it was known as an artists' quarter and still today it mesmerizes visitors with the charm of the cobbled streets and the picturesque alleys.

Follow the traces of Piccaso, Renoir and Toulouse-Lautrec, who worked in Montmartre and left their mark on the district. Marvel at the most beautiful sights such as Sacré Coeur, the artists' square Place de Tertre and the famous red mill of Moulin Rouge.

Listen to the stories of times long gone and discover fascinating, largely unknown spots. Learn about the French everyday life from your German guide.

name: Paris: Cheesemaking Workshop
shortDescription: Learn how to make cheese with passionate and personable experts at the only cheese school in Paris. Learn more about French cheese and wine culture with a memorable tasting at Paroles de Fromagers.
description:
Meet at the Paroles de Fromagers cheese shop, where you will be greeted by your cheese master and the rest of your group. First, visit the cheese-aging cellar located at the school. See and smell a wide variety of typical French cheeses that are slowly maturing into their final textures and flavors.

Then, make your way to the cheese-making room. Learn how to create "tomme fraiche" cheese and an amazing artisanal butter. This cheese has a slightly milky acidic taste and is used for melting on a variety of traditional dishes. 

Upon completion of the workshop, taste your creations accompanied by some wonderful local wine, for an authentic French culinary experience.

name: Paris: 1 or 2-Hour Major Monuments Tour by Tuk Tuk
shortDescription: Enjoy a sightseeing tour of the major monuments in Paris in a pedicab, as your experienced guide tells you about the city from a personal perspective. See the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, Notre-Dâme, the Latin Quarter, and other sites of interest to you.
description:
There’s so much to see in Paris, but you’ll find you can take in the major monuments in just 1 or 2 hours by pedicab with a driver that knows the city well.

You’ll ride by the iconic sites of the City of Light, and listen to the commentary of your knowledgeable local guide along the way.

It’s up to you to decide which monuments you want to see and hear about. The route could include the Eiffel Tower, the grand Champs-Elysées, the Cathedral of Notre-Dâme, and the world-famous Latin Quarter. See the Louvre, the Orsay museum, and the Opera. It’s your choice!

In the winter, you don't have to worry about being cold, as you’ll be provided a princess blanket to keep you warm. There’s also a clear plastic tarp available for inclement weather, to keep you dry without obstructing your view!

name: Versailles Palace Private Family Tour Designed for Kids
shortDescription: Travel back in time with your whole family to explore the palace of the French kings with your private tour guide. Absorb the beauty of the rooms, the Hall of Mirrors, and the Queen's and King's apartments on this tour dedicated to family visitors.
description:
This fun, private two-hour tour not only introduces you to the wonders of this iconic palace of the French kings, but it also includes an energetic family recipe.

Participants will have to use their deduction and creative skills to answer questions about the castle treasures and items, including the breathtaking Hall of Mirrors, so your little detectives stay captivated, while you learn about the most famous castle of the French monarchy.

This is both a fun and educational way to discover this unique palace west of Paris. This is a tour your children will remember for a long time. The tour guide will focus their energy on them during the tour, without forgetting the parents to make it fun for the whole family.

name: Paris: Romantic Sunset Cruise + Montmartre Self-Guided Tour
shortDescription:
Offer to your loved one the best of Paris with two activities: a romantic night cruise along the Seine with music on board and
a unique audio-guided walking tour of Montmartre, the most charming district of the City of Lights.
description:
Explore Paris, one of the most magical cities in the world. Take a moonlit night cruise along the River Seine, see Paris in all its glory, and then enjoy a self audio-guided walking tour of Montmartre, the most charming district of the City of Lights. Choose the order of the activities, and take as much time as is needed to complete them.


Marvel at the monuments and docks that serve as scenery for this fantastic evening on a Musical Night Cruise. Admire the most emblematic monuments of Paris while listening to electro-lounge music and pass by the Louvre Museum, the Orsay Museum, the Cathedral of Notre Dame, the Grand Palais, the Eiffel Tower, and many others.

Immerse with your loved one in the bohemian Montmartre neighborhood on a unique audio walking tour available for smartphones. Enjoy insightful commentary triggered by location, right where the action happened. Begin the tour at Place des Abbesses and follow the audio description through historic streets and squares.

Visit famous movies locations and learn the fascinating stories of artists who called this place their home. Explore at any pace with this flexible experience, pausing the tour whenever necessary. End up at the stunning Sacre-Coeur Basilica, for magnificent panoramas over Paris.

name: Paris: Classic Sites Tour by Vintage Citroen 2CV
shortDescription: See the classic sites of Paris on a 2-hour driving tour, traveling by vintage Citroen 2CV with retractable roof. Cruise down the Avenue des Champs Elysées to the triumphal Arc de Triomphe, marvel at the Pyramide du Louvre and Opéra Garnier, and more.
description:
Climb aboard a vintage Citroen 2CV to experience Paris from the seat of one of the most iconic - and fun – vehicles ever to have been produced in France. The 2-hour “classic” tour is designed to see the most beautiful landmarks of the city, from the Eiffel Tower to the grand edifices of the Louvre and Musée d'Orsay.

Your private driver/guide can pick you up from any location in the center of Paris. If the sun is out, roll back the roof and feel the breeze in your hair as you drive down the Avenue des Champs Elysées to the Arc de Triomphe.

Cruise past the Trocadéro, and gaze up at the wrought iron monument of the Tour Eiffel. Continue past the Champs de Mars and grand façade of the Ecole Militaire. Go past the museums and monuments of Les Invalides, and see the Petit et Grand Palais by the Pont Alexandre III.

Admire the obelisk in Place de la Concorde, and the ornate decorations of the Opéra Garnier. Marvel at the glass pyramid outside the Louvre, and the gargoyles of Notre-Dame de Paris on Ile de la Cité. See the historic Quai des Grands Augustins on the Left Bank of the Seine, and the spectacular Musée d'Orsay on the right bank of the river.

name: Paris: A Très Délicieux Food Tour in Charming Le Marais
shortDescription: Discover the culinary traditions and gourmet delicacies that are an important and delicious part of Parisian life. Wander through the charming Le Marais district with a local and immerse yourself in the city’s food culture.
description:
Join a like-minded local to enjoy eating your way around the tastiest fromageries, boulangeries, patisseries, and charcuteries in the historical and charming Le Marais district.

You'll be paired with guides that are passionate about the place they call home and who choose to spend their free time sharing it with like-minded travelers matched to them.

Discover just how good food is at the heart of French culture. Sample classic delicacies like macarons, regional cheeses and cured meats as you visit different food shops and market stalls and stop  for an authentic crepe or galette at a creperie while also learning about French food culture.

Enjoy a glass of regional wine or a coffee at a classically Parisian pavement café, then wander around a market where the locals buy fresh and delicious produce.

name: Paris: Underground Bars and Speakeasy Guided Tour
shortDescription: Travel back in time through the history of Paris as you visit two mysterious speakeasies. Walk through hidden passageways and into cozy bars to enjoy delicious drinks on this unique pub crawl.
description:
Discover a different side of Paris in the company of a professional guide. Make your way through secret passageways and step into hidden underground bars with a rich history. Learn all there is to know about these unique locations as you sip on the drink of your choice.
Meet your guide and take a short walk to your first speakeasy, where you'll enjoy a delicious cocktail. Hear stories about the site's past from your guide, before moving on to your next location. Visit your second bar for the night and enjoy the chance to purchase more drinks at your own expense.
Experience good music and a great atmosphere with your new group of friends. Take advantage of a wide array of drinks, including cocktails, beer, and soft drinks, to make the most of your night out.

name: Paris: Electric Bike Tour
shortDescription: Discover Paris on a guided e-bike tour. Listen to your guide's commentary with fun facts about the city as you bike to see some of the Paris' highlights.
description:
Paris , this amazing city ...
Discover the most beautiful city of the world through our tours espacially designed to make you find out about Paris and its little secrets.
You will be riding the last generation E-bike to make you feel comfortable and ride with ease.
Discover the legendary districts that will make you fall in love with this city.
The highlight tour isThe most complete tour ever ...
With this tour , you will discover all the essentials , all in one tour .
We espacially designed this tour to give you the best of Paris.

name: Paris: Dinner with Customized Wine Selection
shortDescription: Treat yourself to a special night of delicious French food and wine, in one of Paris' number one wine bars. Enjoy a memorable meal while joining local foodies in the place Le Figaro called "One of Paris' best kept secrets".
description:
After being greeted and seated, a friendly sommelier will come chat with you to learn more about your food and wine habits and preferences. Based on this chat, the sommelier will make a wine selection for you, aimed at creating enchanting pairings.

The cuisine served is always fresh and seasonal. The style is French with a modern twist and great care and attention is given to suppliers.

The decor is chic and elegant but very laid back: leather, wood, smooth music... A beautiful wine bar with more than 50 wines by the glass is the centerpiece of the establishment, which has been distinguished by many awards. The crowd is a mix of locals and internationals willing to experience great food and wine in a friendly, elegant and relaxing environment.

name: Paris: Romantic Montmartre Exploration Game
shortDescription: Discover Paris’ most romantic locations by solving clues and unlocking love stories on your smartphone. Play the engaging exploration game, reenacting the story of 2 people who fell in love, got disconnected, and are now trying to find each other.
description:
Follow the clues in the app and discover Amelie’s cafe, the Wall of Love, the Sacré-Cœur Basilica, and many other favorite Montmartre landmarks. Read fascinating stories about the different destinations you are lead to and discover events that took place there as well as the people who used to live or work there.

Along the way, solve clues to unlock the love story of a couple trying to reconnect in the city where they once fell in love, but then became estranged. Leave your map at home — the app offers precise directions through the city. Play at your own pace. Feel free to pause and explore your surroundings whenever you wish. 

After you book the game, you’ll get a code via email with instructions on how to play. Head to the Place Blanche metro station and use the access code to unlock the quest in the app. End the tour on the beautiful steps of the Sacré-Cœur Basilica.

For larger groups, one person can purchase access for the entire group by selecting the number of people in the group. All group members will be able to play the city game on their smartphone. Alternatively, each person can purchase their own voucher.

You can play as a group and solve the clues together as you walk, or you can split into smaller groups/teams and compete against the others. Each person can also play on their own, separate from the group, and meet the group at the end.

name: Paris: Private Pontoon Boat Seine River Cruise with Guide
shortDescription: Enjoy a private cruise through Paris and admire the city’s iconic sights with your family and friends. See the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, Notre-Dame de Paris, and many more.
description:
Cruise along the Seine river and see Paris from a different perspective. Appreciate the warm and friendly atmosphere as you see the iconic sights of France's capital. Connect your music via Bluetooth and feel free to bring your own drinks and snacks to enjoy onboard.
Set sail in Paris and enjoy a comfortable outing perfect for any circumstance. Watch as the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, Notre Dame, and more pass you by. Enjoy the commentaries and anecdotes of a passionate skipper while listening to any music you like. 
Experience a timeless moment, perfect for a pre-dinner outing, a romantic date, or the entire family. Marvel at the magic of Paris over a drink and a snack, any time of year, day or night.

name: Monet's Garden Bike Tour from Paris
shortDescription: Go on a beautiful bike excursion from Paris, and tour Claude Monet's breathtaking gardens in Normandy. See his unique house, visit the quaint villages of Vernon and Giverny, and then ride along the banks of the River Seine at your leisure.
description:
Begin this full-day Monet bike tour with a scenic coach journey through the spectacular wheat and sunflower fields of Normandy. Speed by the lazy Seine River, and stop off at the village of Vernon. Here, you will visit the charming farmers' market to buy picnic supplies. Then, hop-on your bike and pedal across the river to a beautiful park along the banks of the Seine.

After lunch, enjoy a relaxing 3-mile (5-kilometer) ride down bike paths to the village of Giverny. Cruise past Giverny Church and its cemetery, which contains graves of local citizens dating back to the 17th Century, as well as British soldiers from World War 2, and even Monet himself buried within his family's vault.

Pass Hotel Baudy, where Impressionist painters Manet and Renoir used to paint. You will then arrive at the highlight of the day, Monet's Garden. Spend about 90 minutes exploring the gardens and house, including the famous water lily pond where some of his most famous works originated.

Additionally, you can explore the village of Giverny, which boasts the American Museum of Art, located across the street from Monet's Gardens, as well as numerous cafés and small streets begging to be discovered.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Direct Access with Summit Access
shortDescription: Visit the Eiffel Tower with a direct access ticket. Enjoy access to the 1st and 2nd floors and the Summit by elevator. Marvel at spectacular views of Paris.
description:
Enjoy direct access to the Eiffel Tower and admire the breathtaking views from the top of the iconic structure. Spend as much time as you like at the tower and explore the different levels at your own leisure. 

See Paris from above and from a completely new perspective. Marvel at the ancient façade of the Louvre and the financial district of La Defense. Admire the colorful Pompidou Museum and the vast white expanse of Sacré-Coeur Basilica.

Stop at the Champagne Bar on the top floor for a glass of bubbly. On your way down, take in the many interesting activities on the first floor. Test your courage by walking on the glass floor!

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Summit Tour & Optional River Cruise
shortDescription: Enjoy the views from the top floor of the Eiffel Tower on a guided tour. Choose the optional Seine river cruise to discover the other highlights of Paris.
description:
Admire the views of Paris from the top floor of the Eiffel Tower on a guided tour. Add an optional Seine river cruise to enjoy the sight of famous landmarks from another perspective.
Start first at the Eiffel Tower in the morning where you will meet your tour guide Take the elevator to the top of the tower and learn about the tower and the city of Paris.

See some of the most famous monuments in Paris as La Défense, Trocadéro, Arc de Triomphe, Pont Alexandre 3, Les Invalides, Montmartre, and the Louvre.
Choose to add an afternoon river cruise on the Seine and admire the sights from a different perspective.

name: Eiffel Tower Summit, Walking Tour & Seine Champagne Cruise
shortDescription: Enjoy panoramic views of Paris from the Eiffel Tower. Experience the “City of Lights” on a River Seine cruise with a glass of champagne. See historic bridges and churches, including Notre Dame.
description:
Start your Paris experience with a short but informative walking tour of Trocadéro and the Champ de Mars with an English-speaking guide. Then, explore the Eiffel Tower on your own and take in the panoramic views over Paris.

Enjoy some of the most romantic views of the “City of Lovers” on a Seine champagne cruise with this flexible 2-part excursion. Sip a complimentary glass of champagne as a professional English-speaking guide onboard the cruise points out the famous sights along the way. Then, take advantage of the reserved entrance to the Eiffel Tower and ascend to the 2nd floor for a self-guided visit, where you will be rewarded with a breathtaking panorama of Paris.
At the conclusion of your visit to the 2nd floor or continue to the Summit (depending on the option selected) where you’ll have complete freedom to stay as long as you like.

You are free to linger at the Eiffel Tower to take in the views and catch your cruise anytime after your Tower visit. The enchanting itinerary takes in some of the city’s most famous monuments, such as the Louvre, Notre Dame, and Conciergerie. After the bird’s-eye views from the top of the Eiffel Tower, the close-up views from the river are a perfect complement.

name: Paris: Hands-On Small Group Cooking Class
shortDescription: Join Chef Noémie, a graduate of the famous Lenotre Culinary Institute, for a unique cooking class experience at her charming cooking school in the heart of Paris. Learn the secrets of authentic and delicious French cooking from a true Parisian.
description:
Learn the art of French cooking with a young and talented chef. Take a 3.5-hour hands-on cooking class and develop a new appreciation for fresh and local market products. Discover a new side of French culture through your chef and teacher Noémie, a true Parisian, and share a pleasant and relaxed time as you prepare and enjoy a delicious 3-course meal.

Whether you're a serious cook or a novice, everyone is welcome to share their love of gourmet food in a friendly and intimate environment. Whatever your level, chef Noémie will adapt the class accordingly.

Cooking classes are scheduled from 10:30 to 14:00, offering the perfect amount of time to prepare and appreciate a traditional French meal including a starter, a main course, and a dessert. The lunch is served with mineral water, a glass of French wine, and coffee or tea.

name: From Paris: Chateau de Fontainebleau & Vaux-Le-Vicomte Tour
shortDescription: Discover two of the most beautiful and historically interesting Chateaux in the Paris region on this small group day trip. You’ll visit the lovely Chateau and gardens of Vaux-le-Vicomte and also Chateau de Fontainebleau with more than 1500 rooms inside!
description:
Discover two of the most beautiful and historically interesting castles in the Paris region on this small group day trip. You’ll visit the lovely Chateau and gardens of Vaux-le-Vicomte, where the “jardin à la francaise” was born and then explore the regal splendor of Chateau de Fontainebleau where more than seven centuries of kings and emperors lived and created history. 

Chateau de Vaux-le-Vicomte, with its deluxe 17th century decor and outstanding French Gardens is enchanting. It is so beautiful that it directly inspired the Sun King to build the Palace of Versailles, in order to rival it. You’ll learn about the captivating history of the estate and its past owners, wander through the perfectly ordered French Gardens and enjoy free time to explore the inside of the Chateau.

Chateau de Fontainebleau is unparalleled in its extravagant architecture and links to important events in French History. With more than 1,500 rooms inside, it is a sumptuous palace and according to Napoleon Bonaparte "The true home of kings, the house of ages". It was home to three dynasties of Kings, a Pope and two French Emperors and as such is truly unique among the castles in Europe. You’ll explore its majestic halls, extravagantly gilded rooms, beautifully decorated Chapel and learn its fascinating history.

name: Paris: Musée Yves Saint Laurent Private Tour
shortDescription: As a special honor, come and immerse yourself in the world of the famous couturier, Yves Saint Laurent, outside the usual public opening hours. See the museum's salons, designs, and even YSL's own studio.
description:
Come and discover the Musée Yves Saint Laurent Paris before it opens to the public on a guided tour.

On the historic site of the former fashion house, the Musée Yves Saint Laurent Paris opened its doors in October 2017 and presented the work of the creative genius himself, as well as the process of creating a high-fashion collection. 
Yves Saint Laurent’s studio also forms part of the museum’s exhibition, preserved inside the fashion designer’s elegant private mansion located in the 16th arrondissement.

From October 15th, 2022 to May 15th, 2023, discover the Gold by Yves Saint Laurent exhibition.

name: Paris: Entrance Ticket to the Chocolate Museum
shortDescription: Explore 4,000 years of chocolate on a self-guided tour of the Chocolate Museum Paris and sample some chocolate along the way. Learn how the Aztecs introduced mankind to cacao beans, and how they are turned into chocolate loveliness.
description:
See more than 1,000 chocolate-related artifacts at the Chocolate Museum Paris (Le Musee Gourmand du Chocolat), and indulge your passion for all things related to the cacao bean. The self-guided tour includes live demonstrations and - more importantly - tastings. Children’s activities are provided to keep the little ones happy, including a treasure hunt.

Explore the museum’s exhibits and demonstrations which take up 2,789 square feet (850 square meters) and recount the 4,000-year history of the cocoa bean in all its forms, starting with the Olmecs, Mayas, and Aztecs. Learn about the important role cocoa played in ancient cultures, including how cocoa was used in mystical rituals.

Move on to the 1500s, when the Aztec emperor Montezuma introduced cocoa to Europe. Christopher Columbus was the first European to taste the tchocoatl drink, but he didn't like it and thus paid little attention to chocolate. Luckily, he wasn't the last European to give it a try.

Witness the transformation of the chocolate trade as the chocolate-making process became more streamlined during the modern era. Watch virtual demonstrations to discover the secret behind the shiny outer coat that makes chocolate treats so appealing, and taste some of the chocolate products made on-site.

Enjoy the milky smoothness of Costa Rican chocolate, the superb melt-in-your-mouth fruitiness of Peruvian chocolate, the sweet aromas of cocoa beans from Vanuatu, and more. Don’t feel too guilty about indulging; you’ll learn that chocolate has many health benefits. Then, browse the museum shop for books, souvenirs, and chocolate-related products.

name: Paris: Private Tour with Locals – Highlights & Hidden Gems
shortDescription: Get a complete overview of Paris on a 3.5-hour private guided tour. See the best the city has to offer with a perfect combination of highlights, hidden gems, a local snack and storytelling.
description:
See Paris at its best from the eyes of a local in just 3.5 hours. Check out prime landmarks like Musée du Louvre, Palais Royal, Place de la Concorde and hear unique insights that only a local would know.
Uncover hidden gems and city secrets along the way that will show you an authentic side of the city with the help of a knowledgeable local guide.
Fully experience the local flare with an included local treat to make your city tour a complete experience.

name: Paris: Private Food Tour in St. Germain
shortDescription: Enjoy a 3-hour private food tour with some of the best artisanal delicacies you can find in Saint Germain des Prés. On this private adventure, you will explore this amazing area of Paris and try several tastings.
description:
Considered to be the soul of the City of Light, Saint-Germain des Prés is known as one of the best chocolatier areas in the world. It has a stunning mix of history, charming little streets, unique art shops, emblematic cafes and restaurants, and of course, is a hot spot for foodies from all over the world. With a flexible time departure, you will begin your private tour in this fantastic area and get introduced to French specialties thanks to your passionate, local guide. 

From the oldest Abbey in Paris to the wonders of the Luxembourg Garden, you’ll be amazed by the diversity of the french foods located there and how passionate the local artisan are about their work. During the tour, you’ll have not only the opportunity to taste the food most Parisians are craving, but you’ll also be enjoying the charming streets, art galleries, colorful cafes, restaurants, and fashion shops.

You will visit by 8 to 10 of Paris' most fantastic shops. While discovering the area you will try wines, cheeses, cured meat, the french baguette, jams, and other great delicacies. This tour will be also the opportunity to taste chocolate and Macarons from renowned chocolatiers. 

If you have any special requests, do not hesitate to ask. The local partner will be happy to try to cater to them.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame Night Tour by E-Bike
shortDescription: Explore Paris at night while riding an electric bike on this tour. Hear historical anecdotes about Paris and let your guide take your picture at sights like the Louvre Palace and the Eiffel Tower.
description: Discover the highlights of Paris by night on an electric bike tour. Peddle through the charming streets easily with the help of a motor. Enjoy the city in any weather, like a local. Take a family-friendly route that is mostly on bike paths and sidewalks. Meet your guide and get fitted with your helmet and bike. Test drive your bike to ensure that you are comfortable handling an electric bike. Set off on an adventure as you ride to the iconic Louvre Palace. Wave to the Mona Lisa as you pass the Louvre Muséum and the Carrousel shopping center. Enjoy the greenery in the Tuileries Gardens and watch the ships pass by the docks. Admire the oldest bridge in the city at Pont Neuf. Travel to Cité Island to view the stunning Cité Palace. View the Gothic architecture of Saint Chapelle and the rose window of the Notre dame Cathédral. Venture to the Institute of France and see the love locks on the Arts Bridge. Go by the Orsay Muséum which was once a train station before passing the Orsay Docks. Get up close to the Eiffel Tower and marvel at the view of it from across the Trocadero Gardens. Feel the immensity of the Chaillot Palace as you see both wings. Get a taste of modern art as you pass by Tokyo Palace. Be tickled by the contrast between the Great and small palace. Experience the connection between the US and France at the Liberty Flame in Lady Diana square. Ride by the arched Alexandre III bridge and appreciate the use of space in the Vendôme and Concorde square. Finish your tour where you began.

name: Paris: Mini Walking Tour and Musée d'Orsay Entry Ticket
shortDescription: Enjoy a 45-minute mini walking tour along the famous Seine River with a guide. Make your way to the Musée d'Orsay and explore the spectacular works of art housed within the museum at your own pace.
description:
Get to know Paris from the river that gave rise to it, the glorious Seine. Discover the history, highlights, architecture, and much more alongside your guide. With your ticket, explore stunning works of art in the Musée d'Orsay on your own.

Begin your tour at the Henri IV statue in the middle of the Pont Neuf, the first Parisian bridge built with stone. As you survey Île de la Cité around you, learn a secret about the island.
Then walk across the bridge and continue along the southern bank of the Seine until you reach the Pont des Arts. Take time to enjoy the incredible views from this 19th century bridge. 
Continue to Pont du Carrousel and Pont Royal, listening to the stories of the Rive Gauche and the Rive Droite and you’ll come to understand an important part of Paris’s identity. From here you’ll see a familiar Parisian icon on the northern bank, the Louvre.

As the 45-minute mini walking tour comes to a close, step into the Musée d'Orsay. Before you enter to explore on your own, your guide will share how this building came to be and what you can look forward to inside. Your guide will give you your priority entry ticket and tips about the most interesting paintings inside. 
Once inside Musée d'Orsay you won't want to miss Monet’s Nymphéas bleus or Renoir’s Bal au Moulin de Galette. Be enchanted by the amazing paintings, sculptures, decorative arts, photographs, and amazing interiors. Don't forget to visit the museum's terrace for more stunning views.

name: Paris Picasso Museum 2-Hour Private Small-Group Tour
shortDescription: Enjoy a 2-hour private guided tour of Paris's Picasso Museum in a small group. Delve into the life and work of one of the world's most prolific artists, and feast your eyes on some of his principal works – housed in a splendid 17th-century mansion.
description:
Learn about the life and work of Pablo Picasso on a 2-hour private guided tour of the stunning Picasso Museum in Paris. Located within the ornate 17th-century Hôtel Salé, the museum’s collections cover the entire career of one of the world's most prolific and versatile artists.

Your expert guide will take you through the various stages of Picasso's career, as you see examples of his incredible technical skill and mastery in a variety of artistic disciplines.

Explore Picasso's formal experimentation and ideological engagement and as well as the complex relationship he had with other notable artists of his time, such as Matisse, Dali, and Rousseau.

Marvel at Picasso's Bull's Head, a statue that is a testament to his Less is More approach to art. Admire one of his earliest paintings, The Barefoot Girl, as well as Still Life with Oranges, an important work by Matisse, Picasso's greatest influence and rival.

name: Paris: History of Crime Smartphone Audio Guide Walking Tour
shortDescription: Uncover the hidden history of Paris as you learn about its most notorious events and criminals. Use the audio-guide on your smartphone to explore at your own pace.
description:
Start the tour outside the beautiful Church of Saint-Germain l'Auxerrois. Learn how the bell of this church marked the beginning of the St. Bartholomew's Day massacre in 1572. Stroll down nearby Rue Saint Honoré, which was once used as a location for the public execution of criminals.

Hear about the many notorious crime figures in Paris' long history. Learn more about the notorious "Gang des Tractions" of the early 20th century. Hear the story of one of their leaders, Pierre Loutrel, who was France's first "public enemy number 1."

The audio guide provides clear audio directions and a map indicates directions to follow in real-time. If you wish to take a break, simply pause the app and resume the tour when you are ready. The audio tour finishes at the Hotel de Ville, the City Hall of Paris, which also hosted public executions in years past.

name: Paris 3–Hour Bike Tour in Spanish
shortDescription: Take a relaxing ride around the beautiful city of Paris with your expert, Spanish–speaking guide. Along the way, visit the most famous sites while receiving a great orientation to the city.
description:
Running since 1999, this tour is a fabulous way to visit Paris. Join a relaxing and fun pedal through this beautiful city.

Whether you're a Paris rookie or traveled veteran, the goal is to not overwhelm you with mind-bending dates and boring stories. Instead, visit the famous sites, enjoy a great orientation, all the educational information, heaps of unique and fascinating stories, fantastic photo opportunities, a comfortable bike and superb personal service from your guide.

Essentially, prepare to love Paris and have a great time doing it!

name: Montmartre Vice and Violence Sidecar Motorcycle Tour
shortDescription: Discover the dark, unbelievable, and true stories that shaped the soul of today's Montmartre. Tour its atmospheric streets in a motorcycle sidecar as your guide shares hauntingly hilarious anecdotes.
description:
Throughout this tour, you will indulge in the outrageous, macabre, and still humorous anecdotes which are lesser known to most.

This tour begins on the Pont de Bir-Hakeim. You will wind our way through Paris up to the hill of Montmartre.

On our way to the summit, you will about the scandalous and violent history of Montmartre's eventual absorption into the city of Paris.

name: Paris Private Full-Day Tour from Le Havre - Shore Ex.
shortDescription: Explore Paris from Le Havre and discover the highlights of Paris on a full-day private tour.
description:
Discover the most important places of Paris with this full-day private tour from Le Havre. Visit the Louvre Museum and enter Notre Dame. Walk on the Champs Elysées, see the Eiffel Tower, the Sainte Chapelle, and many other major landmarks.

Begin your journey in comfortable transportation. Walk on the Champs Elysées, to see the Eiffel Tower (if booked early enough, get to the top floor), the Sainte Chapelle, and many other major sites of Paris.

Visit the Louvre museum, where you will see the Mona Lisa, the Winged Victory, among other major works of art.

Explore the Capital of France with a friendly local guide who is full of knowledge. Not only will you learn a lot about Paris, but you'll get some real insight from a real Parisian about Paris and France.

Say "Au revoir" to Paris as you head back to the pier in Le Havre.

name: Day Trip from Paris to Ypres Salient, Flanders
shortDescription: Learn the history of events at Ypres Salient, one of World War I's bloodiest stretches of the Western Front. From Passchendaele, to the Menin Gate memorial, and more, discover a recent past that we all should have learnt from in “the war to end all wars.”
description:
Pay your respects to the 185,000 Commonwealth soldiers who sacrificed their lives at the Ypres Salient, one of World War I's hardest fought-over stretches of the Western Front.

Through its memorials, cemeteries, and battlefield remnants, Ypres represents one of the most dramatic periods of 20th-century history, a terrain stained by devastating modern brutality. Discover the horrors of war, and its very real heroes and villains, through the area's humbling landmarks: John McCrae's Essex Farm site; Langemark, the German cemetery; Vancouver Corner, the Canadian memorial; Tyne Cot cemetery, Passchendaele; Polygon Wood, the Australian memorial; Saint George's Chapel; and the Menin Gate Memorial.

Join a day of remembrance for the many who died at Ypres between 1914 and 1918, in what was once “the war to end all wars.”

name: Paris: Photo Walk in Montmartre
shortDescription: Learn easily and quickly how to take great photos on an unforgettable group walk. Discover or rediscover Paris with new photography friends while you learn. Get off the beaten track and explore the city in a unique way.
description:
A 3 hour tour with a local guide-photographer: an original activity that combines the discovery of Paris and photography tips from a professional. Discover Paris through its essential and unavoidable places as well as its hidden local secrets.
Discover an unknown Montmartre, off the beaten track: side streets, peaceful and tree-lined villas, alleys, ephemeral street art works. A playful and cultural tour to (re)discover one of the most visited Parisian neighborhood.
Alone, with friends or family, for all levels and all types of cameras (including smartphone). Also opened for persons without cameras.
The walks are limited to 10 participants (with camera), to allow you individual moments of exchange with the guide-photographer.
Throughout the walk, the guide-photographer will tell you anecdotes about the places you visit and advise you on how to use your camera.
The walks take place in the following way:
- Meeting of the participants (meeting point specified)
- Theoretical briefing and information on the explored area
- Photo walk, alternating mini-exercises, free photos and anecdotes about the places visited. The photographer passes from participant to participant to answer your questions and explains technical notions (aperture, depth of field, exposure, focus, composition, framing...)
- Debriefing (in a café): moment of sharing and exchange around your images and those of the other participants (consumption at the expense of the participant)

Practical information :
Meeting point : the meeting point is at the level of a metro exit "Abbesses" line 12.
Who is it for? All levels and all ages. Also open to accompanying persons without camera

name: Neoclassical Paris 2-Hour Private Walking Tour
shortDescription: This walking tour of neoclassical Paris takes you through an area that changed dramatically in the years prior to the French Revolution. Explore the aristocratic Paris of the Second Empire at the Palais Royal, the Tuileries, and other important sites.
description:
The great reconstruction of Paris in neoclassic style was an important part of the city’s history, transforming the face of Paris during the Second Empire.

On this private 2-hour guided tour you’ll learn more about the spirit of this city and how it evolved from a medieval town to a metropolis that became one of the most important capitals in Europe and a world leader in questions of style, elegance, and sophistication.

Your guide will show you aristocratic Paris, and tell you about the city’s transformation during an important period in its history. Hear about the connections between Paris and Rome and Italian culture, including the impact on Parisian architecture.

The sites you’ll visit include the Palais Brongniart, Palais Royal, Place des Victoires, Cour Carré, the Louvre, the Tuileries Garden, Place Vendôme, Place de la Concorde, and the Madeleine Church.

name: Paris: Guided tour “Love stories of Paris”
shortDescription: Experience the romantic allure of Paris with a loved one. Check out Pont-Marie, aka "bridge of lovers", and more. A professional local guide with unveil the magic of Paris to you in the form of inspirational, historical love stories.
description:
An exclusive tour during which you will visit the most romantic places in the city and answer the eternal questions: Why is Pont-Marie known as the "bridge of lovers"? What are the best places to have a date in the city? Where can you take lovely photos and feel spellbound in an enchanted atmosphere?
Be surprised at how many historical love stories are hidden in the streets, buildings, and parks of the city. From heartbreaking and tragic, to the hilarious or spicy ones. What is the meaning of the “Wall of love”? What is the love story of Yvonne and Charles De Gaulle? Find out on this tour, especially recommended around Valentine's Day.

name: Paris: Seine River Christmas Dinner Cruise
shortDescription: Enjoy a magical dinner cruise on the River Seine for Christmas. Soak up views of illuminated Paris and the Eiffel Tower over a gourmet 3-course meal accompanied by live piano music.
description:
Spend a festive evening in Paris aboard a floating restaurant boat. Sail on the Seine in a jazzy atmosphere with a pianist and singer. Savor a delicious 3-course meal while docked in the perfect location for admiring the Eiffel Tower.
Set sail from a dock near the Eiffel Tower and take in panoramic views of the City of Light from your window seat (if option selected). Enjoy your meal as you sail with music from an onboard singer and pianist in the background.
After dinner, the boat will dock in one of the most Instagrammable places in the city, right in front of the Eiffel Tower. You will have one hour to take in the views or grab a drink from the onboard bar. 
Menu:
Glass of Champagne and appetizers
Starter:
Foie gras from the harvest and apple chutney with spices
Fine tart of candied vegetables with coriander coulis and horseradish (vegetarian)

Main course:
Grenadin of veal, sweet potato mousseline, and morel fragrance
Small cassolette of seasonal vegetables and Italian polenta (vegetarian)

Dessert:
Saint Honoré-style pavalova
Drinks:
½ bottle of wine per person
½ bottle of water
Coffee

name: Paris: Wine Tasting with Professional Sommelier
shortDescription: Enjoy a lovely selection of French wine, presented to you by a friendly sommelier. You will taste, learn and have fun, all in a beautiful setting and in a very relaxed atmosphere.
description:
This is your chance to enjoy the most relaxed and enjoyable wine tasting experience in Paris. First off, this tasting happens on a day and at a time that is convenient for you. No stressful meeting time: you come when you're free and ready!

When you arrive, you'll be greeted and seated by a sommelier. After a quick chat to better understand what you typically like to drink and what you'd be interested in tasting (color, region), your sommelier will compose a wine selection just for you. Different tastes of participants can also be accommodated. This is not a class, but it's an experience where your sommelier will present the wines and answer any question you may have about them!

name: Paris: Guided Food Tour
shortDescription: Discover the culinary world of downtown Paris on a guided walking tour. Visit gourmet eateries and sample local Parisian dishes.
description:
Join your guide as you set out to explore the charming streets of Paris on a foodie walking tour. Visit a number of historic eateries, modern cafes, and trendy restaurants and sample some of this city's culinary delights, including cheese, pâté, pastries, and wine.

Mingle with the locals and experience a taste of Parisian life and learn about the history of Paris and its culinary culture.

name: Paris: Pure Chocolate Walking Tour
shortDescription: Taste luxury chocolates on a 2-hour walking tour of the Right Bank in Paris. Visit a selection of master chocolatiers and enjoy delicious samples of artisan chocolates in myriad flavors. Learn more about the cocoa bean and chocolate making in Paris.
description:
Indulge your passion for chocolate on this 2-hour walking tour of the Right Bank in Paris. Walking around the beautiful area dominated by the Place de la Concorde, Tuileries Gardens, and Madeleine Church, visit a selection of master chocolatiers who will be ready and waiting to share their sumptuous creations.

An enthusiastic foodie guide will enhance your understanding of the cocoa bean and take you down cobbled streets to get off the beaten path. Dip in and out of the glamorous fashion district, and stop at artisan chocolate stores to discover old-fashioned and designer chocolates.

Every tasting is included in the price of your tour, and you will meet chocolatiers who treat chocolate making as an art form. Each has his own creative style to give you a true taste explosion. Learn more about the history of chocolate making as you walk, and leave having tasted some of the best chocolates in the city.

name: Paris: Skip-the-Line Access to the Eiffel Tower's 2nd Floor
shortDescription: Skip the ticket lines at the Eiffel Tower with your direct access ticket and save precious time during your vacation in Paris. Your local host will provide useful information about the monument and then you can explore more on your own.
description:
Enjoy a bird’s eye view of Paris from the 2nd-floor observation deck of the Eiffel Tower. Skip the ticket lines and learn some fascinating information from your host before getting to explore on your own. 
Meet your host next to the Eiffel Tower for a brief introduction to the tower’s history. Next, bypass the notoriously long ticket lines to ascend to the 2nd floor, where your host will tell you more about the City of Light and you’ll enjoy privileged views of Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Arc de Triomphe, and Les Invalides.

Your host will then leave you to enjoy the Eiffel Tower at your own pace.

name: Paris: Anzac Day Day Tour to Villers Bretonneux
shortDescription: Travel to the small town of Villers-Bretonneux for the annual Anzac Day Dawn Service on a 12-hour tour from Paris. Explore the Somme battlefields, war memorials and cemeteries of World War I in the region of France that suffered so severely.
description:
Explore the Somme, where a dramatic period of history took place, on this full-day Anzac Day trip to the Somme Battlefields, and see the major memorials, cemeteries, and battle sites of World War I.

Departing Paris, transfer to the small town of Villers Bretonneux, where the Victoria School was built in 1923-1927 as a gift from the children of the state of Victoria in Australia to the children of Villers-Bretonneux as proof of their love and goodwill towards France.

Go to the Adelaide Cemetery to pay your respects to the fallen soldiers. See the deep Lochnagar Crater left behind at La Boiselle in 1916, providing a stark testimony of the ravages of war.

Visit the site of the Battle of Pozières, see the poignant Memorial to the Missing of the Somme at Thiepval. Visit Péronne to see the war memorial of Mont Saint-Quentin overlooking the Somme River, and much more.

name: Paris: Secret Montmartre Self-Guided Tour
shortDescription: From small hidden passages to the famous Sacre-Coeur Basilica, discover the fascinating area of Montmartre. Explore using your smartphone and listening to your guide.
description:
Immerse yourself in the bohemian Montmartre neighborhood on a flexible audio tour. Enjoy insightful commentary triggered by location, right where the action happened. Start at Place des Abbesses and follow the audio description through historic streets and squares.

Visit famous movie locations and learn the fascinating stories of artists who called this place home. Explore at your own pace with this flexible experience, pausing the tour whenever you like. End at the stunning Sacre-Coeur Basilica, for magnificent panoramas over Paris.

name: Paris: VIP Paris Hotel Transfer to and from Orly Airport
shortDescription: Relax and forget all the stresses of airport transfers with this eco-friendly, private transfer service. Get delivered from your Paris hotel to the Orly Airport, or vice versa, in comfortable luxury vehicles with plenty of leg room and air conditioning.
description:
Skip the stress and hassle of finding airport transfers on your visit to Paris and book a VIP private transfer service to bring you from your hotel in central Paris to the Orly International Airport, or vice versa.

Enjoy getting picked up at the Orly Airport, or in the lobby of your hotel and relax during a comfortable transfer in a luxury vehicle equipped with plenty of leg room, air conditioning and ample luggage storage. Sit back and enjoy the ride as you enter or exit the beautiful city of Paris and let your driver handle all the details and help you with your luggage.

The transfer services are available 7 days a week from 4:00 AM to 9:00 P.M. On December 24 and December 31 the services are only available until 6:00 PM.

name: Paris: Marais District Scavenger Hunt and Self-Guided Tour
shortDescription: Explore the fashionable Paris neighborhood of Les Marais on a smartphone-led scavenger hunt and self-guided walking tour. Solve puzzles and learn fascinating facts about the city along the way.
description:
Get to know the lower part of the Marais district in Paris at your own pace on this interactive scavenger hunt walking tour. You'll explore the city on foot and get points for solving different types of tasks:

Find sights:
You will use hints to find the best sights and hidden gems throughout the city. The map function in the app will help you get there.

Solve questions:
Once you’ve arrived at the place you’re looking for, you’ll be asked questions about the sight. Most of the time, the answers are hidden in signs, pictures, etc. A great and fun way to learn new things about the city.

Have fun:
During the adventure you can also expect exciting photo tasks that require a lot of creativity. If you master the snapshots, you will be rewarded with points.

Along the way, you’ll reach amazing places like the “Saint Jacques Tower”, “Bastille”, “Hôtel de Sens”, “Place des Vosges” and many more!

After you book the game, you’ll get a game code via email with instructions on how to play. Head to the “Place du Châtelet” and use the code to unlock the game in the app. The tour ends at the “Place de la Bastille”.

The experience is not limited in time. You can explore the city at your own pace and take breaks. Just download the Explorial-App, go to the starting point, and you’re ready to start with the game. The tour lasts on average about 1-2 hours.

name: Romantic Paris Vintage Citroën 2CV Tour
shortDescription: Experience the romantic side of Paris in style on a vintage Citroën 2CV tour. Drive through the city's enchanting streets and avenues, and visit some of the most impressive and romantic spots within the French capital.
description:
Experience the romantic side of Paris on an unforgettable tour, riding a vintage Citroën 2CV from the Eiffel Tower to Montmartre.

Enjoy the beauty of the lovers' city with someone special on a classic Citroën 2CV. Travel back in time through the city's historic streets and let yourself be taken on an unforgettable journey to some of the French capital's most impressive and romantic spots in the city:

• Montmartre
• Sacré Cœur
• Moulin Rouge
• Pigalle
• Opéra Garnier
• Place Vendôme
• Musée du Louvre
• Place de la Concorde
• Avenue des Champs-Élysées
• Trocadéro
• Arc de Triomphe
• Tour Eiffel

name: From Paris: Loire Valley Castles Full-Day Tour
shortDescription: Wander through the Loire Valley's gorgeous castles and gardens. Travel along the King's Road to visit the Chambord, Amboise & Chenonceau Chateaux with your friendly driver-guide. Enjoy a french wine tasting.
description:
Wander through the Loire Valley's gorgeous castles and gardens. Travel along the King's Road to visit the Chambord, Amboise & Chenonceau Chateaux with our friendly driver-guide. Dine at "Au Gateau Breton," a charming 200-year old inn, for lunch.

Discover the famous castles and gardens of the Renaissance with an all day tour of the beautiful Loire Valley. Let our friendly driver-guide pick you up from your Paris hotel.

Visit the cradle of the Renaissance, Chateau Amboise, one of the first truly royal residences of its kind. Follow in the footsteps of the great kings of France as you view a magnificent example of Gothic and Renaissance architecture.

Next, stop at Chateau de Chenonceau. Admire the wealth of beauty both inside and out, which makes Chenonceau the most popular chateau in France. Learn about its tumultuous history as the castle passed from Lady to Lady.

Then, you will have free time to enjoy lunch (not included), followed by a french wine tasting. After a full day wandering the castles and gardens of the Renaissance era, return to Paris aboard our deluxe minibus.

The last stop will be at the royal Chateau de Chambord, one of the most recognizable chateaux in the world. Legend has it that Leonardo da Vinci, living at the Clos Luce in Amboise, made several plans and models for its construction. 
While visiting Chambord, take pleasure in one of Europe's finest parks, covering over 13,000 acres, and is Europe's largest wooded park.

name: Highlights of Paris: Private 6-Hour Vintage 2CV Tour
shortDescription: Visit the monuments, museums, and gardens of Paris on a private tour. Cruise the city’s streets in a vintage Citroen 2CV, and experience the city’s unique atmosphere. Tour the museum at the Arc de Triomphe and enjoy a traditional French lunch.
description:
Your driver will pick you up at your hotel and begin the day with a visit to the famous Cathédrale Notre Dame. Afterwards you’ll head to the Ile de la Cité, located in the middle of the Seine. Discover the famous Saint Michel district, the Hotel de Ville, and enjoy views of the most beautiful bridges in Paris, such as the Pont Neuf and the Pont des Arts. Your driver will then take you to the Palais du Luxembourg, passing by iconic monuments such as the Pantheon.

Take a relaxing walk in the Luxembourg gardens, a haven of greenery and peace in the heart of Paris. Admire the famous 16th-century Palais du Luxembourg, its flower gardens, and sculptures. Next you’ll see the Louvre and its famous pyramid, the Royal Palace, the Church of St. Eustache, the Bourse of Paris, the National Assembly, and the Invalides.

Enjoy a traditional French picnic on the Champs de Mars park, in front of the Eiffel Tower. Bask in the lovely views of the city as you experience a traditional baguette, with camembert, charcuterie, and of course a bottle of red wine!

Your drive continues along the Seine to the famous Place de la Concorde, and then up the Champs-Elysées, considered by many to be the most beautiful avenue in the world. Your driver will stop at the top of the avenue, so you can climb the Arc de Triomphe, and take in the panoramic views from the top.

See the Concorde, Madeleine, Opera Garnier, and Place Vendôme before heading to Montmartre, one of the most charming and romantic districts of Paris. Before finishing the tour, you’ll be dropped off at the top of the Butte Montmartre. Visit the Basilique du Sacré Coeur or perhaps take a walk to the Place du Tertre, famous for its many artists before returning to your hotel or another location of your choice in Paris.

name: Christmas Lights Tour in Paris with Local Guide
shortDescription: Discover the beauty of Paris at Christmas during a guided walking tour. You will get to see the Louvre Museum, Notre Dame Cathedral, and more while learning about French Christmas traditions.
description:
Immerse yourself in the holiday spirit on this Christmas lights walking tour of Paris. Explore the beautiful streets of Paris and see the illuminated streets of the city, as well as landmarks like Notre Dame Cathedral, Louvre Museum, Tuileries Garden, and more with a local guide.
Your guide will share their traditions and stories around Christmas and the holidays in Paris. Marvel at the Galeries Lafayette, the Place Vendôme, Champs Elysees, and other city highlights.
Stroll through the city while you sip on a glass of mulled wine or hot chocolate to warm up at a local Christmas market. Soak in the views of the Eiffel tower and Seine while walking through the river bank.
Brighten your winter with a unique Christmas experience on a walk through this picturesque neighborhood of Paris.
Choose from 2 different itineraries depending on what you would like to see most.

name: Paris Illuminated Walking Tour in Spanish
shortDescription: Appreciate the beauty of Paris at dusk when its main monuments are illuminated, honoring the city's nickname "City of Lights." Complete your experience with a boat trip on the Seine.
description:
Paris is known as the "City of Lights" for being the first city to provide its streets and buildings with street lighting. However, it makes just as much sense to call it the City of Lights because of the way it looks when it's illuminated at dusk.

The tour begins at the Opera Garnier. See some of the main monuments and sites of Paris with beautiful illuminations of the city such as the Madeleine, an impressive church similar to Roman-style architecture; the Champs Elysees, one of the most important avenues in Paris; and the Elysee Palace, the seat of the presidency of the French Republic. 
Discover the monumental surroundings of the Grand Palace of Paris, the Petit Palais, the Pont Alexandre Ill, and the National Palace of the Invalides, which is where the remains of Napoleon are found. The tour ends at the beautiful Soul Bridge, which crosses the Seine River. Choose to include a boat trip on the Seine when booking to complete your experience.

name: From Paris: Versailles & Louvre Guided Tour
shortDescription: Enjoy a day exploring the stunning palace of Versailles, formerly home to King Louis XIV, and wandering the galleries of the Louvre Museum on this tour.
description:
Depart for the Palace of Versailles, located outside of Paris. Relax and enjoy the scenery on the ride.

Skip the often long entrance lines and follow your guide on a tour of the palace, including the Hall of Mirrors, the Royal Chapel, and the golden bedroom of the King. The former residence of Louis XIV and three other French kings is surrounded by a 2,000-acre (809-hectare) garden, which you will have time to explore at your leisure.

Return to Paris and, after some spare time for lunch (not included), begin the second part of your tour with a guided visit of the Louvre Museum.

You will again, skip the long lines and follow your guide on a 2-hour tour of the famous museum. See collection highlights and notable works at the Louvre include Venus de Milo, the Winged Victory of Samothrace and the Mona Lisa painted by Leonardo da Vinci at the beginning of the 16th century.
After the conclusion of your tour, you are free to explore the museum independently until closing time.

You will then have the opportunity to take the rest of the tour at your own pace, exploring other sections of this vast and impressive museum.

name: Disneyland Paris: Private Transfer from/for Orly
shortDescription: This is a private and no shared transfer service. Stay on board your car or minivan with comfortable seats, air conditioning and a wide trunk. You will benefit from 24-hour tourist assistance for your whole stay.
description:
Forget the stress to reach your hotel or airport by booking a private transfer between Orly airport and Disneyland Paris, the other way round. Transfer service is available everyday, from 4:00 AM until midnight (except for 24th and 31st December when it's available until 6:00 PM)

After arriving at the airport, enjoy a comfortable and relaxing transfer service from Orly Airport to your hotel or apartment at Disneyland Paris. Your driver will take care of you and will guide you to your destination in total comfort and safety.

If you need a transfer for your flight departing from Orly Airport after your stay in Disneyland Paris, book a transfer on board a comfortable car, which will guide you to the airport from your hotel. All you need to do is relax and enjoy the landscape on your way.

name: Paris: Edith Piaf's City Exploration Game
shortDescription: Embark on a city game about the life of o Paris’ most beloved singer, Edith Piaf. Discover stories in English about the Moulin Rouge, the Wall of Love, and Sacre Coeur.
description:
Discover Paris’ fascinating history and attractions through the eyes of Edith Piaf, the famous Parisian singer. Explore the French capital on a quest with your friends, significant other, or family.

Solve the clues to unlock secret stories about important places, from churches to sex shops, museums to bars. Navigate the city with clear directions without the need of a map, GPS, or guide.

After booking, receive your access code via email. Simply go to the starting point, open the app, and follow the instructions. Enjoy the flexibility of this self-guided tour, start whenever is convenient, and take as long as you like. The tour will take you about 1.5 hours to complete, but there’s no time limit.

Form a team and solve the clues together as you walk or split into smaller groups and compete. You can also play on your own and play the game at your own pace.

name: Paris Self-Guided Audio Tour
shortDescription: This historic audio guided tour of the cultural city of Paris is a wonderful walk where you'll be able to see the world famous Louvre Museum and relaxing Tuileries Palace and Gardens.
description:
Download a vibrant MP3 Self-Guided Audio Tour combined with a fully detailed map of the area of your tour!

The amazing and cultural city of France's capital is sure to captivate you! On this audio tour you will learn about the turbulent history of France's royal family and famous battles with neighboring countries, and see a few of the city's monumental landmarks such as the lovely square Place de La Concorde and the iconic Eiffel Tower. Walk down the cultured streets, see street vendors and get the chance to walk down the world famous Champ de Elysees. You will also see the Louvre Museum, the Arc de Triomphe, and the Tuileries Palace and Garden.

Please note this is a downloadable Self-Guided Audio Tour, therefore you will have no physical tour guide leading you through your travels.

name: Paris: 2-Hour Christmas Walking Tour
shortDescription: Join a small group on a guided walking tour exploring some of Paris’ most iconic markets and impressive landmarks during the Christmas season.
description:
Get an insider’s view of Paris' most vibrant Christmas spots on a small-group 2-hour walking tour around the charming, wintry city.

Begin your urban walking adventure by meeting your guide in front of the iconic Eiffel Tower. Take in views of the Champs de Mars, the Seine, and of course, the Eiffel Tower itself.

Marvel at the twinkling festive lights that add a certain magic to Paris in winter, and visit the most beautifully decorated places in the city. Along your way, learn fun anecdotes about Paris in wintertime from your expert, local guide.

Stop for a visit at a traditional Christmas Market and warm yourself up with a hot drink and snacks, and browse the sparkling stalls for seasonal goodies to bring home.

name: Paris Essentials: 2-Hour Minibus Tour
shortDescription: Experience the best sites of Paris in 2 hours with a friendly driver-guide aboard the deluxe minibus. See world-famous sites like the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre Museum, Notre Dame Cathedral and more, and get the perfect introduction to the City of Lights.
description:
On this Paris sightseeing tour, you'll cruise down the Avenue des Champs Elysees with spectacular views of the Triumph Arch to Concorde Square.

See the world famous Eiffel Tower and enjoy a 10-minute photo stop at the Trocadero Gardens before admiring the Opera Garnier.

Admire Vendome Square, the Orsay Museum, the Louvre Museum and Madeleine Church before returning to your hotel.

name: Paris: Musée d’Orsay Semi-Private Guided Tour
shortDescription: Discover the world’s largest collection of French Impressionist art at the beautiful Beaux Arts Musée d’Orsay in Paris. Enjoy a 2-hour guided tour of the museum’s highlights, and see masterpieces by Van Gogh, Cezanne, Degas, Monet, Manet, and more.
description:
Enter the stunning Beaux Arts building of the Musée d’Orsay in Paris and discover a treasure chest of French art.

Housed in a former railway station, the museum contains one of the world’s best collections of Impressionist and Post-Impressionist art. Enjoy a semi-private tour with expert commentary from a guide who will introduce you not only to the masterpieces but to the masters that created them.

Learn about a unique period of art history, and how it was harshly criticized in its time. See how painters, such as Monet, radically changed the way we view the world. Many of the museum’s most famous works are by Paris-based artists, and depict scenes throughout France, providing a pictorial history of the nation.

Marvel at Van Gogh’s “Starry Night over the Rhône,” and Renoir’s masterpiece “Dance at Le Moulin de la Galette,” a depiction of a typical Sunday afternoon in the Paris district of Montmarte. Discover highlights by Cezanne, Degas, Manet, and much more.

name: Paris: 1.5-Hour Eiffel Tower Beer Bike Tour
shortDescription: Set off on a unique sightseeing adventure through Paris. Get onboard a traveling bar with your friends, family, or colleagues. Take in some of the city's best views as you pedal and sip cold beers and tasty wines.
description:
Hop on Paris' beer bike bar. Discover the City of Light's most beautiful views onboard a moving bar, while sipping a cold beer or a glass of wine. Experience Paris in a totally new and original way, in the warm company of your friends, colleagues, or family. Pedal through the city at your own pace, as it's up to you to move the vehicle.

Pass by Place Victor Hugo and see the magical fountain. Enjoy a stop in Trocadero and then head to both the Arc de Triomphe and the famous Champs Elysées. Continue back to Avenue Foch. Crazy laughter and good moods are guaranteed on the beer bike, a moving bar for 10 people including 6 cranks and 4 spots for non-pedaling passengers. The onboard crew will steer while you enjoy yourself and the city.

name: Montmartre, Paris: The Locals' Favorite Arrondissement
shortDescription: Lose yourself in the 18th arrondissement, one of the most diverse and bohemian areas of Paris. Wander through the historic cobbled streets of Montmartre and explore its winding passages packed full of charm.
description:
In these charming and multicultural neighborhoods, you'll discover both Montmartre’s classic postcard aesthetic and the more off-the-beaten-path, artistic neighborhood of Clignancourt where most tourists don’t venture.

You'll be paired with guides that are passionate about the place they call home and who choose to spend their free time sharing it with like-minded travelers matched to them.

Follow your local host as they lead you through the labyrinth of streets to experience life in Paris like a local. From cheap to gourmet food, from high-end boutiques to unpretentious shops and flea markets, from sophisticated pastries shops to tiny cafes and everyday roadside markets, the 18th borough has it all.

Get to you know your local host, and they’ll be able to recommend spots they know you’ll love, so you can eat, drink, shop and party like a local during your trip.

name: Paris: Private La Défense Walking Tour
shortDescription: Explore La Défense, the economic district of Paris, on a private walking tour. Be surprised by its unexpected urban landscape of dynamic architecture and masterpieces of modern art.
description:
Head to a different part of Paris and make your way through La Défense on a private tour. Find out how the first business district of Europe developed and became a place of accessible artwork, towering skyscrapers, and modern monuments.
Meet your guide at the La Défense metro station and immediately be overcome by the Grande Arche and its grand, yet sleek, design. Design your tour of La Défense to suit your needs and interests with the guide before setting off.
On your tour, choose to stroll down the La Défense esplanade, a modern oasis of concrete and greenery, and head towards an area that feels like an open-air gallery. Be fascinated and amused by the "Red Spider," "Car on a lamp-post" or the "Finger of Cesar" installations.
Choose to modify your tour to focus more on architecture or history. Regardless of the focus of your tour, discover the essence of La Défense and its contrast to the classical notion of Paris.

name: Paris: Musée du Quai Branly Ticket & Seine River Cruise
shortDescription: Visit the Musée du Quai Branly - Jacques Chirac and discover the indigenous art from Africa, Asia, Oceania, and the Americas. Follow this with a trip on the river Seine and pass the city's highlights.
description:
Musée Du Quai Branly - Jacques Chirac

Take a welcome break from all the European art and visit The Musée du Quai Branly-Jacques Chirac its focus on non-European cultures.

Experience seeing all-important cultural artifacts and artwork from the civilizations of the Americas, Africa, Oceania, and Asia through a series of videos and tactile exhibitions.

Explore new worlds through the curving and mysterious design of the galleries. Be sure to visit some of the permanent collections, but leave time also to explore the wild and beautiful garden outside, especially the highly beautiful green wall, designed by Patrick Blanc.

Paris Seine River Cruise

With the Seine cruise ticket, you will enjoy a 1-hour sightseeing tour on the river. Discover Paris in a different way using the Seine River cruise ticket. Get any boat in the course of the working hours of the Bateaux Parisiens and enjoy the view while sailing on the Seine river. With this practical method, you will start your journey immediately.

Once onboard, you’ll enjoy a 1-hour cruise down the Seine River admiring the UNESCO-indexed riverbanks and Parisian landmarks consisting of the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, the Louvre Museum, the Orsay Museum, Notre-Dame de Paris, and a number of monumental bridges.

name: Marais Walking Tour: Lifestyle in Paris
shortDescription: Take a walk through the historic Marais neighborhood with your fun and knowledgeable guide. We'll visit the most historically important landmarks, stop by the chic shops, and enjoy a culinary delight with tastings along the way!
description:
Paris is the city of lovers, and Le Marais is a magnificent mix of historical mansions, cutting edge fashion boutiques, and lively restaurants. It makes an absolutely essential place to visit on your Paris adventure.

Long known as the aristocratic district of Paris, it hosts a stunning array of architectural buildings. It spreads across the 3rd and 4th arrondissements on the Rive Droite (Right Bank).

Our tour today will include a look at the unusual side of the neighborhood not usually experienced by tourists. We'll enter in some of the most prestigious gourmet addresses, and see the most important monuments along the way. These include: Place des Vosges - the oldest planned square in Paris; Hôtel de Sully, Carnavalet, and Hôtel Salé, each with their renowned designs. We'll also have a chance to find a remarkable group of shops along the way!

Make sure to ask your guide about restaurant recommendations in this culinary city. We'll also have an opportunity to stop for two gourmet tastings along the way, to complete your experience in the Marais.

name: Paris: Highlights Tour from Louvre Museum to Notre Dame
shortDescription: Enjoy a stunning walking tour in the heart of Paris and navigate the city with a local guide. See the most famous landmarks like the Eiffel Tower and the site of Notre Dame.
description:
Start your journey in front of Comédie Française and the gardens of the Palais Royal, a former royal palace, just opposite the Louvre. Learn about the building and its park with their history, architecture, and importance to the modern Parisian city culture.

Pass by the Louvre Museum and see some of the exhibition rooms from the outside. Follow your guide to the Pyramid of Louvre, easily the most popular place to be in Paris. Enjoy a detailed tour of the area with less emphasis on history and the art inside the museum but more on the local street life of Paris.

Once at the Pyramid, observe the Tuileries Garden connecting the Louvre to the Place de la Concorde. It is a place where Parisians celebrate and meet. Look how the setting served as a reference point for the modern development of Paris.

See the historical axis of the two Arc de Triomphe's of the town and Champs-Elysées. Learn how the monuments stand in harmony with their modern setting.

Then stay a while in the Square Court (Cour Carré) the place where The Louvre was born, a jewel of Renaissance architecture.

Follow the River Seine and go across the famous Pont des Arts, a pedestrian bridge listed as a national historic monument. See the art exhibitions, and immerse in the open-air studio for painters, artists, and photographers drawn to its unique point of view. Watch the Parisiens enjoying a summer picnic if you are there in the season.

Getting close to Notre Dame Cathedral, discover Île de la Cité and the surprising facts that this island will offer you. Your guide will bring you as close as the ongoing restoration permits to give you the best views possible. Talk about Notre Dame and discuss the impacts of the recent fire and the future of the building. 

Say goodbye to your guide at Notre Dame Cathedral with many references and recommendations for Paris so that you can discover more of the city at your leisure.

name: Paris: City Highlights Segway Tour
shortDescription: See some of the most notable landmarks of Paris by Segway tour. Hear historical anecdotes about the city and have your guide take your picture at famous locations such as the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower.
description:
Discover the highlights of Paris on a convenient Segway tour. Cover more ground with your own personal mode of transportation, and enjoy stops outside many of the city's most famous sights, with plenty of time for photos.
Arrive at the meeting point for a safety briefing and a test drive session to ensure you get comfortable driving your Segway. Once you are ready to go, set off to discover the streets of Paris with your guide. Hear interesting historical facts about the city from your expert guide as you explore.
First, stop outside the Vendome Place and Vendome Column. Then, head towards the Louvre, home to one of the world's most extensive art collections since 1793. 
Continue by the exterior of Orsay Museum before riding along the beautiful pedestrianized banks of the River Seine. Spot some of the most notable bridges in the city, including Pont Alexandre III. 
Next, stop for a photo opportunity by one of the most iconic landmarks in the world, and a national symbol of France, the Eiffel Tower. On the return leg of the tour, you will pass by the Trocadero Gardens, Chaillot Palace, and Place de la Concorde before arriving back at the meeting point.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Skip-the-Line Tickets and City Bus Tour
shortDescription: Enjoy the great sights of Paris with expert commentary and a Histopad. Then, skip the line and ascend directly to the 2nd floor of the Eiffel Tower for a panoramic view of the city. Access the summit on the 3rd floor if you select the upgrade option.
description:
Experience Paris from two unique viewpoints. First, enjoy a 1.5-hour sightseeing bus tour of the city. Then, take an elevator ride to the 2nd floor of the Eiffel Tower. Get the most out of your experience with interactive tour elements.
Start the tour by climbing aboard an air-conditioned bus to admire Opera Square and the Obelisk of Concorde Square. Cruise down the Champs-Élysées to see the Arc de Triomphe. See the Eiffel Tower over Trocadero Square. View Notre-Dame Cathedral, Invalides, and Pont Neuf.

Experience all this with a Histopad, a tablet with interactive functionalities. Thanks to its interactive functionalities, this new immersive city tour will allow you to better understand the history of Paris and its architecture over the centuries.
