Visit the most famous neighborhoods and monuments of the capital, from the Opera Garnier to the Eiffel Tower, through 3D reconstructions, 2D before and after slides, and 360° views of the interiors enriched with audio commentaries. 
During your tour, go on a treasure hunt to find mysterious objects in well-hidden rooms, and don't forget to immortalize your visit with the HistoSelfie.

Next, visit the most famous monument in Paris — the Eiffel Tower. Skip the line and journey to the second floor for a great view of the city. There is the possibility to access the summit if you select the option that includes the third floor. 
Your tour ends here, so stay as long as you like to enjoy amazing views of Paris.

name: Paris: Le Marais Walking Tour
shortDescription: Visit Le Marais, a neighborhood filled with trendy shops, medieval alleys, and unusual attractions. Feel Parisian by the end of this walking trip after seeing where locals spend their days.
description: Spend some time exploring the scenic views of Le Marais, Paris, as your guide tells you the history of the area on this walking tour. Admire the district which was once the Jewish Quarter, and visit the Stravinsky Fountain, the Centre Pompidou, the Street of Rosebushes, and more. Begin at the Stravinksy Fountain (currently under renovation until 2023), with abstract and outlandish sculptures that move and spray water. Marvel at the colorful display and capture photos of the whimsical fountain. Next, explore the Centre Pompidou, the street Sainte-Croix-de-la-Bretonnerie, and the Cloister of Billettes. Your guide will teach you the history and tell you about the LGBTQ+ community of the area. Spend some time learning about the Church of Our Lady of the White Friars, built-in 1258 by Saint Louis. Walk to the Impasse des Crossbowmen, the Street of Rosebushes, the Library of the City of Paris, The Place des Vosges, and more.  Your tour will end at Le Village Saint-Paul, a treasure trove of antiques, art galleries, and artisan boutiques. Leave your guide here to admire the area and stroll through the shops and attractions nearby.

name: Paris Bike Tour: Highlights and Secrets
shortDescription: Discover hidden gems on this exciting Paris bike tour. Using the latest generation of electrically-assisted bikes, ride at a leisurely pace or challenge yourself turning-off the boost mode. Let your guide share the secrets of the City of Lights.
description:
See not only the iconic monuments of Paris - Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Orsay - but expect to also be amazed by all the secrets the city has to offer on this tour. Let your local guide take you through a perfectly designed itinerary, including a mix of history, engrossing stories, and fun facts.

Use high-quality electrical bikes and change mode to adjust the power of the assistance. Follow your guide on the hidden, winding, or narrow streets in Paris that are often known only to the locals, encapsulating shining hidden treasures. The bike tour will also take you past unforgettable bridges, parks, and much more that you wouldn't think about.

Take time for great photos to make your travel memories last forever. By the end of the tour, you'll be filled with fascinating stories and lesser-known fun facts that have shaped Paris over the years.

name: Paris: Tootbus Kids Bus Tour
shortDescription: Jump aboard a 100% electric open-top bus and explore Paris on this amazing tour specially designed for families. Discover the best activity for seeing Paris with your children.
description:
Looking for a child-friendly experience parents and little ones can enjoy together? Hop on this Paris kids' tour and let the city take you by surprise!

Experience Paris as never before, on board a 100% electric bus. Ride past the Opera, Louvre Museum, Notre-Dame Cathedral, Sainte-Chapelle, Orsay Museum, Concorde, Champs-Elysées, Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, Grand Palais, and more.

During the tour, the guides will surprise the children with a mix of cultural and fun entertainment including amazing stories about museums, monuments, historical sites, popular tales, and animated films all powered by riddles and games. The cherry on top is the sweets the kids get at the end of the performance.

name: Paris: 1.5-Hour Vintage Car Night Tour
shortDescription: Visit Paris by night, away from the tourist crowds and traffic jams, on a 1.5-hour evening tour in a stunning vintage car with a friendly local guide.
description:
Join your local friendly guide for a nighttime tour of Paris aboard a vintage Peugeot 404 from 1963. A late evening visit will give you a great opportunity to admire the beauty of illuminated buildings and monuments in the quiet atmosphere of the city without traffic jams.

Explore some off-the-beaten-track sights of the city, such as the Butte-aux-Cailles, Gobelins, Arènes de Lutèce, Le Marais and the Albert Tower. Enjoy a stop at the Place des Vosges to taste delicious macaroons and take a walk to appreciate the architecture and unique atmosphere of this place, a historical Parisian landmark. Listen to your guide as he tells you the fascinating history of the places you visit, as well as numerous anecdotes about what it was like to drive a car in the sixties.

From the Albert Tower to the Hotel de Sens, passing the Grand Mosque of Paris or the Gare de Lyon, see fine monuments and sites away from classical tourist circuits.

name: Paris: Premium & Private, Highlights city tour on Sidecar
shortDescription: Discover the essence of France's capital on a vintage motorcycle adventure. Embark on an incredible journey past the unmissable sights in the city of Paris including monuments, landmarks, parks, and bohemian neighborhoods.
description:
Start at Place Vendôme and climb into a vintage motorcycle sidecar to begin your adventure. Admire the architecture and octagonal formation of this square including the original Vendôme Column erected by Napoleon I to commemorate the Battle of Austerlitz. Pass by the Élysée Palace, the official residence of the President of France then continue along the prestigious Avenue Montaigne lined with luxury stores and hotels.

Take a circuit around the Arc de Triomphe, one of the most famous monuments in Paris, standing at the western end of the Champs-Élysées at the center of Place Charles de Gaulle, formerly named Place de l'Étoile. The Arc de Triomphe honors those who fought and died for France in the French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars, with the names of all French victories and generals inscribed on its inner and outer surfaces. Beneath its vault lies the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier from World War I.

Next, continue along Les Jardins du Trocadero and admire the fountains in front of the most iconic monument in Paris, the Eiffel Tower. Make a photo stop here where your guide will explain the architecture and history of the building. After stretching your legs, climb back aboard and zoom off towards the Pont des Invalides, a complex of buildings in the 7th arrondissement of Paris, France, containing museums and monuments which all relate to the military history of France.

Venture onwards towards the Grand Palais, the largest historic site, exhibition hall, and museum complex located at the Champs-Élysées in the 8th arrondissement of Paris, France. And finally, pass by the Assemblee Nationale, the lower house of the bicameral Parliament of France under the 5th Republic. Learn about how 577 deputies are seated in this house.

name: Paris: Private Professional Photo Shoot
shortDescription: Get a unique souvenir of your time in Paris with a private photo shoot. A professional photographer will create personalized photos of you – choose from 2 package options. You will receive stunning high resolution images to share and print.
description:
Experience Paris like never before, and hire a professional photographer for an exclusive photo session against some of the city's best backdrops.

Your personal photographer will take on-location photographs against the city’s landmark buildings, cosy cafés, or winding streets. Capture authentic moments for a special occasion, or simply create a dynamic photo-documentary of your vacation.

Photo sessions are held in some of the most picturesque neighborhoods, or you can suggest your own location. Stand in front of the Eiffel Tower and beautiful gardens of the Champs de Mars to capture you with the city’s most famous icon. Take the session at dusk for even more magical moments.

Pose in front of the stunning glass pyramid outside the Louvre, or with the water features of the Tuilleries Gardens. Add a touch of glamour to your shoot in Place Vendome and outside the Ritz Hotel and its surrounding boutiques. Stand on the Pont des Arts, where lovers attach engraved padlocks before throwing the key into the Seine!

For classically Parisian pictures, the bohemian Montmartre and Pigalle districts offer lots of opportunities. Stroll among the artists selling their wares as your photographer captures it on camera. Quaint little cafés with terrace seating add to the atmosphere. Discover secret gardens and winding stairs with unexpected views, as well as the only vineyard in the city.

The last neighborhood popular for photo shoots is around the Opéra Garnier and nearby 19th-century arcades of stained glass and iron features. The area is architecturally stunning, with the Opéra itself providing a breathtaking explosion of gilt, carvings, and art.

Your photographer will contact you prior to your tour to discuss your precise options and requests, giving valuable suggestions to help capture memories that will last a lifetime.

name: Vintage Paris & St Ouen Flea Market Walking Tour
shortDescription: Get under the skin of vintage Paris on a guided walking tour to the hidden corners of the amazing Puces de St. Ouen flea market. Put your guidebook away and get expert vintage shopping tips from a local guide.
description:
Put your guidebook away and join an English speaking guide that knows vintage Paris inside out. They will lead you on a walking tour to many of the secret corners of the amazing Puces de St. Ouen, the most vibrant and immense flea market in Paris.

You eyes will pop wide open and your shopping heart will beat faster when you see what’s on offer. Different areas have different themes, from decorative furniture, antique textiles, paintings, ceramics, glassware, lighting, prints, maps, vintage clothing, jewelry, bags…The list just goes on and on.

When you’ve spotted that must-have item, your guide will help negotiate on price and any details if the items need to be packed and exported.You'll also learn the history of the market.

And to revive you after a hectic rummage around the hundreds of stalls, the visit includes a hot chocolate, coffee, or infusion at the famous cabaret café Chez Louisette, where an Edith Piaf style singer and accordian player recreate the atmosphere of retro Paris.

name: Paris: Bus Toqué Tour with 3-Course Dinner and Champagne
shortDescription: Join a unique tour of Paris aboard the Bus Toqué and enjoy a three-course dinner while you see the most important landmarks in the City of Lights.
description:
Head to the Eiffel Tower and hop onboard the Bus Toqué for an unforgettable evening. Take your seat at your table on the double-decker bus and admire spectacular views of Paris from an elevated position.

Each table is fitted with a tablet so you can listen to the audio commentary and watch the video guide as you savor a three-course meal based on local and seasonal products. End your experience on a high note with a signature dessert by pastry chef Mathieu Mandard as your bus makes its way back to the Eiffel Tower.

name: Half Day Versailles Palace & Gardens Tour From Versailles
shortDescription: Join this 3-hour guided visit to the Chateau of Versailles, the most prestigious and famous royal palace in Europe. Walk the glittering Hall of Mirrors in the footsteps of Kings and Queens, explore the lavish state apartments, and see magnificent gardens.
description:
Learn how the glory of the Sun King shone throughout the world on this tour. Your expert English-speaking guide will bring the extravagant lives of the royal family and the French court at Versailles to life. Small groups allow for a relaxed and intimate visit.

Your guide will take you on a journey in the footsteps of the Kings and Queens of France. During the reign of Louis XIV - the Sun King - Versailles was the place to be and to be seen. Nowadays visitors from all over the world still come to Versailles to marvel at the splendours of this incredible palace. The skip-the-line access allows you to bypass the long lines that form each day, and your friendly local guide will steer you expertly through the crowds, bringing the famous figures who once inhabited this palace back to life, and making sure you don’t miss a thing.

Learn how the Kings and Queens lived out their lavish lives in public, how they kept the gossiping courtiers under their thumb, and stole Italy’s thunder by making Versailles the artistic center of Europe. Discover a typical day in the life of Marie Antoinette; you’ll quickly understand why she hated the palace so much. Her opulent lifestyle here would ultimately lead to her tragic demise under the French Revolution; she left Versailles in 1789 never to return.

After visiting the royal apartments inside the palace, your guide will lead you through the spectacular gardens, once the setting of balls, parties and elaborate firework displays. On fountain show days you will discover the amazing waterworks, still running today as they did in the times of Kings and Queens. At the end of your tour your guide will be happy to give you advice on further places to visit or where to enjoy a great meal in this beautiful royal city.

name: Paris: Walking Tour with Louvre Ticket & Private Tour Option
shortDescription: Explore the sights near the Louvre Museum on a guided walking tour. Then, enjoy skip-the-line entry tickets to the museum to explore on your own or upgrade to a private tour of the Louvre.
description:
This experience combines the best of a guided tour at the price of a self-guided visit.

Meet your guide outside the Louvre Museum by the statue of Louis XIV, a man on a horse in front of the famous pyramid. From here, you begin your journey with your guide on a mini walking tour of the famous spots all around the world famous museum you are soon to enter. Find out why Louis XIV moved out of the Louvre so he could live in his new digs in the country aka Versailles. As you stand under the famous Arc de Carrousel, learn the historic significance of the nearby Tuileries Gardens, its former palaces and the royals who once lived in them.

Stroll along the gardens and view what is known as the Historic Axis of Paris, and you'll see the Luxor Obelisk at the Place Concorde. It's a beautiful Parisian square now, but it was once called Place de Revolution, the scene of beheadings for Marie Antoinette and thousands of other aristocrats. Look farther and you can even glimpse the most famous arch of them all: the Arc de Triomphe.

Continue with your guide towards the river Seine and see many famous sites, including the imposing Conciergerie, where Marie Antoinette was imprisoned before her execution.

You'll return through the back entrance of the Louvre, passing gorgeous gilded gates to the rear courtyard and continue through the dark archway into the main courtyard once again. Here, the Cour Napoleon opens wide before you and you'll once again see the statue of Louis XIV on horseback.

Your guide will make sure you have your timed entry ticket for the museum, and now you are ready to enter the Louvre for your self-guided visit with an appreciation for the historic context of the landmarks that surround it.

Your guided portion will last 45 minutes. Then, either explore the Louvre Museum on your own with your skip-the-line entry ticket or select the option to enjoy a private tour of the Louvre. Once you leave your guide and enter the museum, your self-guided visit could last anywhere from 1-4 hours. And the memories will last a lifetime.

name: French Lesson at Cafe de Flore and Paris Guided Tour
shortDescription: Come along on this fun, 1.5-hour French lesson with a local instructor. Have a cup of coffee while you brush up on your French skills, and then enjoy a guided visit through the charming neighborhood of Saint-Germain-des-Près.
description:
Everyone knows Paris is not easy to navigate as a non-Francophone, so enroll in a 1.5-hour French lesson over a coffee with a local Parisian language instructor, and improve your French during your stay in Paris.

If you are a beginner to the language, meet with your instructor any day at 09:00, and learn the basics of the language and how to express yourself and your needs. If you are slightly more advanced, meet at 11:00 and improve your language skills with helpful lessons and practice. The lesson is geared towards your level, your goals and your interests; discuss anything from art to sports to the state of French civilization.

The lesson takes place in the heart of Paris, in the typically Parisian atmosphere of Cafe de Flore, one of the city's most beautiful cafes and known for receiving many famous writers and artists over its 120 years in the business. Located near to the famous Saint-Germain-des-Près district, the neighborhood is worth exploring, and after your lesson, enjoy a guided visit through the district to appreciate its fascinating history and character.

name: Paris: Walking Tour of Artsy Batignolles
shortDescription: Discover the heart of the 17th Arrondissement and the village-like enclave of Batignolles. This bohemian neighbourhood is loved by Parisians because of its cafe culture, open-air markets and elegant gardens and parks.
description:
Join a like-minded local guide to explore the charming Batignolles neighbourhood in the heart of the 17th Arrondissement, a peaceful quarter that’s less touristy than neighboring Montmartre. Wander through the streets and soak up the area's classic Parisian style. Immerse yourself in the cafe culture for which this neighborhood is known.

With your guide, browse chic boutiques and local open-air markets; pop into fromageries and boulangeries, and sample local delicacies.

Stroll through charming streets and leafy parks before making your way along the Rue Sauffroy, which is the center of the neighborhood’s African community.

We will be in touch within 24 hours after your booking to find out more about your personality and interests, so that we can assign a like-minded local who can create a bespoke experience for you.

name: Paris: Highlights Self-Guided Scavenger Hunt and Audio Tour
shortDescription: Explore the highlights of Paris in a unique way on a smartphone scavenger hunt and city tour. Combine a city tour with the fun of a game by solving location-based riddles at 10 city attractions.
description:
What is the no1 thing to do in Paris? Of course walking it! Have the best walk of the city on your own pace!
Discover secrets of top attractions in Paris on a self-guided smartphone scavenger hunt and walking tour. Use logic, imagination, and observational skills to solve location-based riddles and uncover your next destination. This is a fun yet educational game that's suitable for all ages.
After downloading the app on your mobile device (instructions received after booking), start your tour at the jewel of Paris, the Eiffel Tower. Admire this majestic wrought-iron lattice tower from the outside as you unlock a game code using interactive clues. 
Use the code to reveal the details of your next destination and riddle, and continue the tour from there. Find your way around easily with the maps integration. Learn information and facts about each location as you explore the city. 
Play with up to five people and build your group's team spirit. You can also choose to compete against one another for some added adrenaline and fun. Whatever way you play, go at your own pace, stopping and going as you please.
Start your tour at Eiffel Tower, the symbol of Paris! Visit the Pont de l'Alma ,where Queen Diana met a tragic death and walk through the Pont Alexandre III , built to honor the name of Tsar Alexander III. Take photos of Petit Palais and Grand Palais. Continue to the famous from the French play ''The Hunchback of Notre Dame'' the Place de La Concorde continues your beautiful journey in Paris. Admire the statues and sculptures of Tuileries Garden and the great pyramid of Louvre museum (visit the museum if you want). The Church of Saint-Germain-l'Auxerrois, built in the 7th century but unknown to many, will enchant you, while Pont Neuf, the oldest stone bridge in Paris, beautifully closes your eighth destination. A stop at the Conciergerie will pique your interest to see the prison of the notorious Queen Marie-Antoinette , while the icing on the cake for this unique tour will be Notre-Dame, about which so much has been written, so many legends have been told and you will be in awe of its ruined (for a while) beauty.
Total walking distance: 6.5km
Average duration: 2.5 hours

name: Montmartre & Sacré Coeur: 2.5-Hour Walking Tour
shortDescription: Let yourself be swept away by the charm and atmosphere of picturesque Montmartre on this 2.5-hour walking tour through the quaint Parisian quarter.
description:
Discover the charming and picturesque quarter of Montmartre, the fascinating Parisian village perched on top of a hill, on this private 2.5-hour guided walking tour.

Wander its cobbled streets and walk in the footsteps of famous artists that once called the neighborhood home, including the former home of Vincent Van Gogh, Pablo Picasso's art studio, and the former haunts of Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec. 
Learn from your knowledgeable, English-speaking guide the thrilling history of Montmartre and the captivating tales of the Belle Époque and the area’s notorious cabarets, including the famous Moulin Rouge.

Step into the Sacré Coeur, the stunning white basilica perched on the hill in the heart of Montmartre, and enjoy a spectacular panoramic view over Paris as the sun goes down.

name: Paris Private Full Day Tour - Tickets to Louvre & Lunch
shortDescription: Dip into the history, culture, and gastronomy of Paris. Visit the Louvre and Notre-Dame and taste Parisian cuisine with a fantastic lunch.
description:
Discover everything about Paris in one day with a unique full day private tour. Admire its culture, gastronomy, and history. Let your local host take you to the most authentic places of the city, avoiding the crowds.

Feel like a local, as you walk through the most picturesque neighborhoods of Paris. Visit the famous Pantheon, located in the heart of the Latin Quarter, where the remains of famous characters from history rest.

Cross the romantic Seine River, colored with its artists and its bohemian atmosphere. Don't forget to have a coffee in the mythical round table bars facing the streets. Enjoy an authentic Parisian lunch, a perfect excuse to take a break from walking and to recharge your energy.

Journey through the history of the city and see the most important sights of Paris, including the square where Marie Antoinette was beheaded. Pass through the beautiful Tuileries Gardens and the magnificent Louvre Museum, where you will quickly enter, thanks to your skip-the-line tickets. Get all the insights you need to make the most of your time exploring the City of Light.

name: Paris: Notre Dame Quarter & St. Chapelle Kids & Family Tour
shortDescription: Join this specially designed family tour of one of the most charming and historical parts of Paris, the Ile de la Cité. Located on an island on the river Seine, the Ile de la Cité is home to some of the most beautiful and famous monuments in the city.
description:
Start your tour in front of the fairytale Hotel de Ville, home to the Mayor of Paris. Cross over to the Ile de la Cité, and enjoy a walk along the riverbanks and through the charming flower market. Then it’s time to skip the often long lines and enter the gem of the island, the Sainte Chapelle. This tiny chapel is home to some of the most dazzling stained glass in the world, much of it dating from the 13th Century. 

Your tour will take you past the Conciergerie - medieval palace, revolutionary prison and final home of Queen Marie-Antoinette before she was taken to the guillotine in 1793. Learn of troubles and turmoil during the French Revolution and the stories of some of the famous residents of this infamous prison. See the oldest public clock in Paris, as your stroll continues through one of the prettiest squares in Paris to the oldest bridge in the city.

Your final visit will be of the exterior of the spectacular 850-year-old gothic Cathedral of Notre Dame. Learn of the terrible fire in April 2019 that threatened to destroy this much-loved symbol of
Paris, but more importantly of the talents and techniques of her medieval architects and builders, whose mastery ensured that she survived this drama and is still standing tall. Discover her fascinating past, and of course learn about the most famous resident, Victor Hugo’s Hunchback of Notre Dame, and hear his colorful and thrilling story. See history unfold before you as she turns this new chapter and readies herself to face the future.

Specially designed materials for children will be provided to ensure that younger members of the family are able to participate every step of the way. Your guides are all fully licensed and specialised in leading tours for groups of all ages. Spend a memorable afternoon in Paris and enjoy a visit through the captivating heart of the city.

name: Paris: Hidden Marais Self-Guided Audio Tour
shortDescription: Immerse yourself in a world of legendary kings and queens, historical mansions, and charming medieval streets on a walking tour of the Marais district with your smartphone as your guide.
description:
Discover a quieter side of Paris' bustling Marais district on this audio-guided walking tour and explore the area's private mansions, charming gardens, and hidden passages. With informative commentaries at the touch of a button, wander through the streets with your smartphone as your guide.

Start your tour at the historical Cité Internationale des Arts, where you can admire works by over 300 artists at your own pace. Later, discover how Paris was first built in the Marais Sud before exploring the 12th-century city walls. Learn more about the historic neighborhood of Saint-Paul and discover some of its biggest scandals.

Feel free to pause the tour whenever you want for a bite to eat or rest, then hop straight back in where you left off. With clear audio directions and a visual map, it's impossible to get lost. Customize your itinerary to your own tastes and enjoy a fun and authentic walking tour of Le Marais at your own pace. Finish your at the Place des Vosges, former home of Victor Hugo.

name: Louvre Masterpieces & Royal Palace Private Extended Tour
shortDescription: Explore the world’s most famous museum during a private skip-the-line tour. Join your guide on a journey from one breathtaking gallery to the next as you travel through time. See works dating from nearly 450 BCE through to the 19th century.
description:
Begin with the medieval foundations of this ancient royal residence, and then gaze at the graceful Venus de Milo. Admire one of the Louvre’s most celebrated sculptures, Winged Victory of Samothrace. Continue on to the Apollo Gallery, which houses the ornate royal crowns of Napoleon and King Louis XV and be riveted by the valiant tales of these inimitable leaders.

This tour was specifically conceived and designed to bring together all of the museum’s most famous works. Stand in awe as you enter each new wing and gaze upon some of the world’s most monumental and recognizable masterpieces. Marvel at Canova’s Psyche and Cupid and Delacroix’s famous painting depicting the French struggle for freedom, Liberty Leading the People. Discover firsthand what makes Leonardo da Vinci’s Mona Lisa the most enigmatic portrait of all time. End your tour in the Napoleon Apartments, where the opulent interiors will transport you back to the 1800s.

This private tour helps you make the most of your time in the Louvre, leading you through the best of the collection and some hidden gems, all the while saving you time with Skip the Line Access.

name: Orsay Museum with Private Guide
shortDescription: Fan of impressionism or simply looking for a cultural and historical tour? Then the place to go is Musee d'Orsay. See the largest collection of French impressionism paintings with a private and knowledgeable licensed guide.
description:
On arrival, picture yourself in front of a former railway station, transformed into a museum and home to various treasures. But wait, you cannot simply pass through the doors of such an incredible place. First of all, you will have to brave the impressive creatures that stand guard over the entrance to the building, such as a rhinoceros, or an elephant measuring 3 metres in height.

Your guide will recount the thousand and one lives that make up the legend of this iconic museum, known throughout the world for its rich collection of impressionist paintings, and shed light on the history of its leading works by equally exceptional artists. Find yourself caught in that magical place between dream and reality, totally immersed in one of the most marvellous pages of the City of Light's history.

Tackling impressionism with a visit to the Musée d’Orsay is an incredibly enriching experience, from which everyone can draw enlightenment and reflection. The museum was born out of an association of a small number of artists in the second half of the 19th Century. Heavily criticised at first, it finally came to have a strong influence on the art of the period.

name: Versailles and Charles de Gaulle Airport: Private Transfer
shortDescription: Enjoy a private transfer between CDG Airport and Versailles. Book your transfer in either direction to take the stress out of airport commutes.
description:
Take the stress out of airport commutes by pre-booking your own private airport transfer between Versialles and Charles de Gaulle Airport. Choose from an air-conditioned Sedan or van for your journey, depending on your needs. 

Whether you are traveling in a bigger group or with extra luggage, tailor your private transfer to your needs by indicating what you need when you book. 

If being picked up from the airport, your driver tracks your flight to make sure they are there to greet you when you arrive. If being picked up in Versailles, your driver will meet you at your accommodation.

Feel secure knowing that our customer service line runs 24/7 to support you in whatever you need. The only thing you need to do is sit back, relax and enjoy the views.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Guided Tour by Elevator
shortDescription: Marvel at the beauty of Paris from the city's must-see monument on this guided tour of the Eiffel Tower. Learn about its history as a Parisian landmark from your guide as you ascend by elevator.
description:
Visit Paris' most iconic attraction with skip-the-line access and a tour guide. Take in the most impressive views of the city and learn about its construction and significance. You can stay on the second floor, or take the optional opportunity to go up to the summit.
After meeting with your tour guide, enjoy priority access to the second floor of the Eiffel Tower, with views over the so-called City of Light. As you ascend by elevator, your tour guide will delight you with stories and facts about this symbolic structure.
Learn about the building itself and about the civil engineer who created it, Gustave Eiffel. Your tour guide will also point out all of the notable Parisien landmarks, including the Louvre Museum, the Notre-Dame Cathedral, Montmartre, and the Sacré-Cœur.

Take the optional opportunity to ascend by elevator past the second floor to the summit of the tower, to admire views from the highest point in the whole city.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Guided Tour with 2nd Floor/Summit Access
shortDescription: Explore the Eiffel Tower with a guided tour and access to the 2nd floor of this iconic structure.
description:
Visit the most iconic symbol of the French capital and learn the fascinating history with your expert guide. Capture incredible photos of Paris from the top of the Eiffel Tower.

Meet your guide a few steps from the Eiffel Tower before starting your ascent to the 2nd floor. As you walk, your guide will tell you the history and anecdotes about the construction of this iconic structure.

Upon reaching the 2nd floor, enjoy breathtaking 360-degree panoramic views of the capital of France. Capture stunning photos or simply soak in the views of Paris.

name: Paris: Versailles Palace and Gardens Full Access Ticket
shortDescription: Enjoy a day at Versailles with this entry ticket. Visit the palace, Trianon, Marie Antoinette's Estate, and gardens and see the famous Musical Gardens or Fountain Show with an optional upgrade.
description:
Visit the Palace and Gardens of Versailles with a pre-booked 1-day full access pass. Explore the ornate State Apartments and breathtaking Hall of Mirrors inside the official residence of the French monarchy from 1682 to 1789. Learn more about Louis XIV and other French royals.

Get a sense of life in the French court as you take a walk through the glittering Hall of Mirrors. Stroll through the legendary gardens at your own pace, and admire fountains, sculptures, and beautifully manicured lawns.

Enjoy access to the Grand and Petit Trianon in their own grounds. See where the “Sun King” would entertain in private, and where he would go to escape the rigors of court life. Then, go to Marie Antoinette’s Estate, and discover where she would seek refuge in private.
Choose the fountain option to enjoy a spectacular fountain show or the iconic musical gardens to finish off your visit.

name: Paris: Dinner Show at the Moulin Rouge
shortDescription: Experience the fantastic atmosphere of the Moulin Rouge in Paris at a perfomance of the “Féerie” show, while enjoying a delicious dinner from a menu of traditional French food, with vegetarian and vegan options.
description:
Take your seats at one of the world’s most famous cabarets at a performance of the Moulin Rouge show “Féerie,” created by Doris Haug and Ruggero Angeletti, and choreographed by Bill Goodson.

Watch a troupe of 100 artistes, including 60 Doris Girls, parade in 1,000 flamboyant costumes of feathers, rhinestones, and sequins. Designed by Corrado Collabucci, and handmade in some of the most famous workshops in Paris, the costumes are complemented by the sumptuous set designs of Gaetano Castelli, and the return of the giant aquarium. Listen to music by Pierre Porte, brought to life by 80 musicians and 60 choral singers.

Upgrade to one of the dinner options and feast from a menu of traditional French gastronomy. It all takes place in a beautiful 850-seat Belle Epoque venue.
Menus, created by Chef Arnaud Demerville, are valid from September 21 until December 18.
Belle Epoque Menu
• Poached organic chicken egg, cream of chestnut, pumpkin and leek dressing, mushroom pickles, truffle gouda cheese, ground cazette hazelnutsor• Smoked salmon from fumaison, remoulade sauce, coco curry, sliced potatoesor• Homemade pâté in a pastry crust with foie gras, chicory tatin style and raw
• Low temperature cooked sea-bass, spinach with parmesan cheese, emulsion of hazelnut buttered potatoes, parsley sauceor• Pan-fried fillet of veal, roasted potatoes Swedish style, yellow wine sauce
• Walnut success cake, fig compote, homemade nut pralineor• Autumn leaf cake style, meringue wrapped in a chocolate mousse, pepper scented quince
Toulouse-Lautrec Menu
• Duo of Tangy Lentils with Old Balsamic Vinegar, Fresh Goat’s Cheese Panna Cotta, Marinated Beef Chips with Smoked Chilli or• Tataki style red tuna, horseradish, flying fish roe with wasabi, multicolored beetroot declination
• Cod fish slowly oven baked, sesame seed roasted with yuzu, risotto of pearl barley with squash, aged parmesan emulsionor• Breast of red label chicken griddle cooked, parsnip declination, truffle butter sauce, herb salad
• Almond tart with a Szechuan pepper poached pear, traditional whipped creamor • Gingerbread, light vanilla mousse, candied squash, and citrus

All the services (dinner show and show alone) include half a bottle of champagne per person. You can swap your half bottle for 2 soft drinks of your choice. Any additional beverages will be charged on the spot as an extra.
Vegan and child menus are available on request after booking. More details on your booking confirmation.

name: The Père Lachaise Cemetery: Guided 2-Hour Small-Group Tour
shortDescription: Enjoy a guided 2-hour tour through the celebrated Père Lachaise cemetery of Paris, and discover the famous graves of iconic figures such as Jim Morisson and Oscar Wilde, as well as the fascinating history and architectural design of the cemetery.
description:
The Père Lachaise cemetery was first opened in Paris in 1804. Today, it is the biggest cemetery in Paris, and houses the graves of a lot of famous artists, writers and politicians, including the likes of Chopin, Jim Morisson, Oscar Wilde, Edith Piaf, and Delacroix.

On this guided visit, make your way through the cemetery discover the different kinds of architecture and sculptures along the graves, supplemented with fascinating anecdotes and historical explanations from your guide, including an explanation as to the creation and the origins of the name of the Père Lachaise cemetery, as well as the discovery of some beautiful graves and legends, like that of the star-crossed Heloise and Abelard.

name: Parc Montsouris: Magical Adventure Exploration Game
shortDescription: Discover Parc Montsouris with an outdoor exploration game available on your smartphone. Solve puzzles and visit highlights in this iconic Parisian park, including La Carrière and Un premier frisson.
description:
The city game starts outside the RER B Cite Universitaire metro station. It will take you around one hour to complete and you can also explore at your own pace: pause the game and resume anytime from the location where you paused it. You will finish at The column.

As you solve challenges, the story unfolds and exact directions on your phone will guide you to the next location. So, are you up for an exciting city game?

After your booking you will receive an email with instructions on how to download and play the game on your phone. You can play on your own, in a large group or in several smaller groups that compete against each other and meet at the final stop of the game. We recommend that each user purchases a ticket for an optimal experience, although several people can share a phone.

name: Paris: Guided Segway Tour at Night
shortDescription: Explore the City of Light at night on this guided segway tour. Learn about the city as you effortlessly cruise by highlights including the Eiffel Tower, Champ de Mars, and the Lavirotte Building.
description:
You will discover Paris thanks to the astonishing nocturnal enhancement of the Parisian monuments! The tour starts at sunset, depending on the time of the year to enjoy the charm of the lights.
Near the Champ de Mars, a certified guide instructor you give you a safety briefing and time to feel comfortable on the Segway before riding on the streets.
Cruise by the Eiffel Tower, Champ de Mars, Lavirotte Building, the Cultural Center and the new Russian Orthodox Church, as well as other famous Paris landmarks.
We plan photo stops on the Segway and next to it.

name: Paris: Louvre Tour with Skip-the-Ticket-Line
shortDescription: Visit the largest art museum on earth and a historic Paris landmark packed with over 38,000 iconic works of art including Leonardo da Vinci’s Mona Lisa and sculptures like the Venus de Milo. Skip the ticket line with Priority Access.
description:
Meet your local art-loving guide and enjoy skip-the-ticket-line entrance to the Louvre. Once inside, begin your tour of the Louvre, admiring all of the best masterpieces and some of the more peculiar installations along the way. Your guide will have an encyclopedic knowledge of the Louvre and its artworks, so no need to refer to a guidebook.

See Leonardo da Vinci’s famous portrait of Lisa Gherardini, known as the Mona Lisa, one of history’s most iconic works of art. The Mona Lisa’s fame has led to endless debate regarding the facial expression of the subject - is she happy or sad? Learn about the history behind the acclaimed painting's story. See more of Da Vinci's work and works by Botticelli, Veronese, and Raphael as part of the Italian Renaissance collection. 

When you finish the tour, don’t hesitate to ask your guide for the best restaurant recommendations in Paris.

name: Paris: Premium Private Transfer from/to Orly
shortDescription: This is a private and no shared transfer service. Stay on board a car or minivan with comfortable seats, air conditioning and a wide trunk. Enjoy 24-hour tourist assistance for the whole stay.
description:
Forget the stress to reach your hotel or airport by booking a private transfer between Orly airport and Paris, or the other way round. Transfer service is available everyday, from 4:00 AM until midnight (except the 24th and 31st December when it's available until 6:00 PM).

When you arrive at the airport, enjoy a comfortable and relaxing transfer service from Orly Airport to your hotel or apartment at Paris. Your driver will take care of you and will guide you to your destination in total comfort and safety.

If you need a transfer for your flight departing from Orly Airport after your stay in Paris, book a transfer on board a comfortable car which will guide you to the airport from your hotel. All you need to do is relax and enjoy the landscape along the way.

name: Paris: Marais, Montmartre & Latin Quarter Walking Tour Pass
shortDescription: Explore the most romantic capital with this 3 guided walking tours in Paris to choose from. Explore the city at your own pace using a tour app as your guide.
description:
Paris has inspired artists, writers, and designers for centuries. But as much as the city is about culture, it is also about simply strolling along elegant avenues, indulging in croissants and coffee in cafe patios, and shopping in chic stores. On our guided Paris city tours, we show you the best of both Parisian worlds with tours through Le Marais, the Latin Quarter and artsy Montmartre.

If you don't have time to join our day tour and evening tour on the same day, don't worry! Your ticket is valid for 2 days from first use.

After exploring many of the city's landmarks with your guide, including the Rue des Rosiers, Église Saint-Gervais, Shakespeare & Company use the free Vox City app (included) to discover more of Paris and its fashion, art, and literary worlds.

Fashion, LGBT & Jewish Quarter walking tour includes:
Saint Gervais Church
Place des Voges
Rue des Rosiers
Hotel de Sens
Saint-Paul Saint-Louis church
Musee Carnavalet
Hotel de Beauvais

The Latin Quarter walking tour includes:
Hemingway House
Boulevard Saint German
Place Saint-Michel
Rue de la Huchette
Saint-Severin Church
Square Viviani
Saint Julien Le Pauvre Church

The Artists Quarter includes:
Basilica of the Sacré-Cœur
La Bateau Lavoir
I Love you Wall
Place des Abbesses
Saint-Pierre de Montmartre Church
La maison Rose
Le Passe Muraille

Our 8 self-guided route's main sights:
Eiffel Tower
Moulin Rouge
Arc de Triomphe
Champs-Elysées
Louvre Museum
Hotel des Invalides
Sainte-Chapelle
Notre Dame de Paris
Shakespeare and company Bookstore
Luxembourg Gardens ..and many more!

name: Paris: Jewish Quarter & Museum of the Art and History Tour
shortDescription: Discover Jewish heritage sites in the heart of Paris's Jewish Quarter including synagogues and memorials. Extended your tour with a visit to the Museum of the Art and History of Judaism.
description:
On this exclusive Jewish tour you will explore the Le Marais quarter, which after the French Revolution became a popular and active commercial area hosting one of Paris’ main Jewish communities. Trace the history of French Jews with an Expert Guide to gain an insight into their unique history, culture and traditions.

Your 2-hour Jewish tour begins at the Courtyard of the Hôtel de Ville, a historic administrative building. It's a great starting point to delve into the history of expulsions and emancipation of Jews over the centuries, from the First Crusade, through the French Wars of Religion, to the French Revolution. Head to Île de la Cité, home to the mighty Notre Dame Cathedral, and see the Deportation Martyrs Memorial, which commemorates people sent to Nazi concentration camps in WWII. Your Expert Guide will help you understand what had happened to the French-Jewish population during the Holocaust, and how the community raised itself from its ashes.

Explore the trendy Marais district, where you will find many Jewish shops, bookshops and kosher restaurants that cater to one of the world’s largest Jewish communities. See the landmark Agoudas Hakehilos Synagogue, built in the early 1900s by the wealthy group of Orthodox Jews who immigrated from Poland and Russia. Another point of interest will be the gorgeous Synagogue des Tournelles, located next to Place des Vosges, which is the oldest planned square in Paris.

Choose the 4-hour option to enhance your experience with a visit to the Museum of the Art and History of Judaism. We provide skip-the-line tickets to fast track your entry. Outside, you will find a statue of Alfred Dreyfus, a French-jewish officer who was convicted for treason in 1894. Inside the museum you will enjoy incredible permanent and temporary exhibitions on the history of Jews in Europe and North Africa. Among its treasures, you will find a collection of religious objects, archives, manuscripts, and works of art, including paintings by Marc Chagall and Amedeo Modigliani. It’s a great place to learn more about Jewish culture and traditions.

The 5,5-hour option includes a walking tour of the Old Jewish Quarter, a visit to the Museum of the Art and History of Judaism, and private transportation. We can organize private car transfers from your Paris accommodation to make it easier to join this tour. Enjoy a convenient pickup and drop-off service with a 5-Star Driver and a clean, air-conditioned vehicle.

name: Run The Lights
shortDescription: Paris reveals itself in all its splendor in the evening. In this experience, you jog along a 10 km (6 m) route passing by illuminated streets, bridges and monuments that make Paris deserve the title of 'City of Lights'.
description:
Nothing planned for the evening? Join this 10 km/6 m jog along the illuminated streets of Paris! Work out, sight-see and have a lot of fun by meeting new running mates from all over the world!

The starting point of the tour will be the place where all the distances in France are measured from: the Notre-Dame Cathedral, in the very heart of Paris. From there, your running guide will lead you on a round tour, at your own pace, along some shiny landmarks of Paris, such as: Paris City Hall, the Louvre Museum, Vendôme square, the Garnier Opera house, Hôtel des Invalides, the Eiffel tower, and much more!

Some quick pauses are planed for pictures and refreshments along the way. Your tour host will carry your belongings (small items only) inside his/her backpack and will have water and snacks ready for you whenever you feel like it. All you have to do is to put on some comfortable running gear and to lace up your trainers!

name: Paris: Centre Pompidou Skip-the-Line Guided Museum Tour
shortDescription: See exciting and modern and contemporary art on a 2.5 hour small-group guided tour (max. 8 guests). Learn about the architectural history of the museum’s striking exterior.
description:
Discover the many artistic masterpieces of the Musée National d’Art Moderne collection, housed in the Pompidou Centre. Learn about modern and contemporary art with an intimate small-group tour. Meet your guide outside of the building, and begin your tour by examining the museum's striking exterior. Designed by Renzo Piano, the building was conceived as an “inside-out” structure and vibrantly colored.

After hearing about the museum’s origin, begin your tour of its modern art collection, which contains nearly 3,200 works. Discuss Cubism in front of a Picasso painting. Chat about Fauvism while admiring a Matisse. See how the World Wars impacted the art world. Witness the chaos and dark humor of the Dada movement – a reaction to the gore of World War I. Admire works by the surrealists such as Salvador Dali.

Learn about Pop Art as you check out a few of Andy Warhol’s works. Explore movements such as Bauhaus and Abstract Expressionism. Marvel at works by beloved French artists as well as international artists such O’Keefe, Pollock, and Mondrian.

Visit the museum's contemporary art galleries and find out about recent artistic movements like Fluxus and Minimalism. Experience works such as Dubuffet’s winter garden installation. Hang out on the museum's roof and take in the Parisian Panorama. By the end of your tour, you’ll have a complete overview of the modern art world.

Choose the private tour option and enjoy an even more personalized experience.

name: Paris: Private Dark Chocolate Tasting
shortDescription: Treat yourself to a 2-hour introduction to the world of fine dark chocolate bars. You will learn not only about the history of chocolate, but also how to recognize, appreciate and enjoy a fine dark chocolate bar.
description:
Did you know that the chocolates made in France are amongst the finest in the world, if not the best? France is well known for its wines and cheese, but the chocolate is a half-hidden secret many miss when visiting Paris. Learn how to tell apart an excellent chocolate from the best while making your taste buds swoon.

On this 2-hour introduction to the world of fine chocolate, you will learn to recognize what makes a good chocolate bar and why you should only seriously consider dark chocolate if you consider yourself a true chocolate lover.

You will also learn about when chocolate was introduced to Europe as well as the other details from its interesting history. Through a carefully made selection of France's finest chocolate bars, you'll personally taste the differences in them as you learn to tell them apart and appreciate them in all their subtleties and nuances.

name: Paris: Charming Nooks and Crannies Bike Tour
shortDescription: Explore the charms of Paris. Follow your guide along the literary Saint Germain des Prés, past the antic Latin Quarter and through the medieval Marais.
description:
Start your 3-hour bike in front of the City Hall. On this small-group guided tour, enjoy a leisurely bike ride through Paris historical neighborhoods. Your local guide will show you nooks and crannies of the old Paris as well as explaining you the anecdotes behind the great history.
Starting on the city island, head toward St Louis Island, mostly unchanged since the 17th century. Crossing the Seine River, enter the medieval Marais, famous for its Jewish and gay neighborhoods. From middle-aged houses through trendy corners, reach the first-ever Kings Square and its magnificent buildings.
Continuing through the Bastille square, demystify its legendary prison and the famous Bastille Day. Escape from city traffic and stroll along the bike-friendly path that lines the Seine River and get ready for a nice drink stop along the water. Next, discover the left bank.
From the world's oldest company, which is 1154 years old, head towards the literary Saint Germain des Prés and meet Parisians’ preferred cafés and art galleries. See how the kings, queens, revolutionaries, and Napoléon mixed in a ballet that ended in blood in Odéon and Luxembourg.
After resting in the left bankers preferred garden, reach the Sorbonne University and the Latin Quarter with its antic roman empire ruins mixed with the most dangerous middle-aged back streets.
Joining this tour at the beginning of your vacation allows you to see a lot of the city and determine where you want to go back to.

name: From Paris: Normandy D-Day Landing Beaches Full-Day Tour
shortDescription: Visit the D-Day Landing Beaches of Normandy on a tour from Paris. Learn about events leading up to and during the Allied invasion of 6 June 1944. See memorial sites, such as Omaha Beach.
description:
Enjoy an unforgettable day trip from Paris, and visit the Normandy Landing Beaches, where the outcome of changed World War II and the future of Europe forever. Learn about the dramatic events of 6 June 1944, with round-trip minibus transfers from Paris.

Drive through the Normandy countryside to discover some of the most significant sites of the campaign. During the day, go to Omaha Beach, see the German Bunkers, visit Operation Overlord Museum, and travel to Pointe du Hoc.

Gaze in wonder at more than 10,000 white crosses that mark the fallen soldiers in the American Cemetery. Listen as your guide brings the battlefields to life, telling unique stories of the soldiers who fought and died to put an end to Hitler’s plans for Europe and the world.

name: Paris: Discover Paris by Night in a Vintage Car with a Local
shortDescription: Enjoy Paris like never before under its evening illuminations, and cruise the city streets in a vintage French convertible; a Citroen 2CV! Drive down the famous Champs Elysees and see the Eiffel Tower’s glittering lights.
description:
Experience the most beautiful buildings and astonishing sights of Paris at night, on a 1-hour tour by classic Citroen 2CV. An icon of the French motor industry, the idiosyncratic 2CV was built from 1948 until 1990, and sets hearts a-flutter with its instantly recognizable design.

Discover why Paris is known as the City of Lights, and hear how it became the first city in Europe to begin lighting its streets with gas lamps in 1828.

Your personal driver will collect you from your hotel, or any other central Paris location, and drive down the Champs Elysees, to the beautiful Arc de Triomphe. Gaze at the marvelous Eiffel Tower, even more impressive at night when it is completely lit-up in a rainbow of illuminations. Pass the Louvre, continue to Notre Dame Cathedral, Opera Garnier, Ile de la Cité, Petit et Grand Palais, and more.

name: Paris: Premium Private Transfer from/to Charles de Gaulle
shortDescription: Avoid the stress of travel with a private transfer from your accommodation in Paris to Charles de Gaulle Airport or the other way around. Enjoy a seamless transfer in an air-conditioned vehicle.
description:
Enjoy the convenience of a private transfer between Charles de Gaulle airport and your accommodation in Paris, or the other way around. Take the stress out of travel and avoid the busy public transport system.

When you arrive at the airport, meet your driver and board your private vehicle. Relax on board after your flight as you travel comfortably to your hotel or apartment in Paris.

If you need a transfer for your flight departing from Charles de Gaulle airport, be picked up from your accommodation in the city and enjoy a seamless transfer to the airport.

name: Paris: Explore Île de la Cité with a Local
shortDescription: Tourists flock to Notre Dame, located on Île de la Cité, but few take the time to discover the island’s many parks, shops and cafés. Dripping with history and charm, this island is a worthy destination for both natives and tourists alike.
description:
Discover Île de la Cité, the heart of Paris and home to the famous Notre-Dame as well as some secret spots that the locals love. You'll be paired with guides that are passionate about the place they call home and who choose to spend their free time sharing it with like-minded travelers matched to them.

Hop over the picturesque bridge and get lost in the winding streets of the Latin quarter where you can explore the locals' favorite hangouts and could perhaps taste some of the best crêpes the city has to offer.

Join a like-minded local host to explore the island, visit the most famous sights, and discover hidden local gems nearby so you can see the city through the eyes of the locals. Immerse yourself in a local neighborhood nearby, discover unique places that match your interests or visit the most famous districts to discover iconic boulevards, historic landmarks, and chic boutiques.

As well as visiting the places you most want to see, stop by local spots and places of interest along the way to get an authentic insight into local life in Paris. Your local host will also advise you on the best way to spend the following days of your trip, allowing you to discover other areas of the city that you will love and revealing other hidden gems that they know you’ll love.

name: Paris: Perfume Workshop
shortDescription: Join this unique perfume workshop in the beautiful city of Paris and learn to mix various scents and essential oils with the guidance of a perfume expert in order to create (and take home) a perfume that really expresses who you are.
description:
Learn the secrets of creating a perfume in the heart of the beautiful city of Paris.

Join this unique two-hour workshop for a chance to create a perfume that actually expresses who you are. With the help of a professional perfume expert, learn how to create a customized perfume that expresses your personality. Discover your own feelings with regard to different scents, and take a trip through a variety of over 150 olfactory emotions.

The perfume expert will study your olfactory profile, and test with you 15 different fragrance families that will remind you of various influences such as fruits, flowers, oriental scents and gourmet dishes in order to figure out the types that really attract you. The next step is choosing together the head, body and tail smells that you find attractive, and figuring out how to mix them in the right proportions.

The end result is your very own “eau de perfume” at 15 % alcohol content, that actually includes a choice and a mixture among 200 to 300 essential oils, and will become your own exclusive formula.

name: Paris: Notre Dame Virtual Reality Tour
shortDescription: Experience a groundbreaking virtual reality tour inside the Notre Dame, before and after the fire. Visit Notre-Dame as if you were really there.
description:
“Step inside” the Notre Dame of Paris with a virtual reality experience that will make you feel as you were really inside the famous cathedral before and after the fire.

Admire its vast central nave, gargoyles, bell towers, and the sacristy thanks to real life, 360° images filmed before the infamous 2019 fire. 

Discover the incredible history of Paris’ Cathedral and get an intimate glimpse backstage using a virtual reality headset.

Also, get to see the cathedral in its current reconstruction state and stand at the epicenter of the ruined cathedral, on the very spot where the flaming spire fell and crashed through the vault. 

Be transported through a unique experience gripping with emotion as you witness the fractured marble and floors strewn with rubble.

name: From Paris: Dinner Cruise on The Magical River Seine
shortDescription: Sit back and relax for the evening on this dinner cruise leaving from the Marina de Paris. Enjoy an assorted menu while passing the sights of the capital such as Notre-Dame Cathedral and the Eiffel Tower, learning about them with an audio guide.
description:
Sit back and enjoy a meal and cruise on the magical River Seine. You’ll board the cruise at the Marina de Paris, and travel along the river for around 1 hour 15 minutes.

The cruise takes in the sights of Notre-Dame Cathedral, Cité Island, and Saint- Louis Island. Then past the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre Museum, and lots more of Paris’s rich architecture, including the many bridges such as the Alexandre III Bridge.

Listen to commentary and music broadcast through individual handsets, which are available in 13 languages, including a children's version (in French only), and enjoy the assorted menu on offer.

name: Paris: Latin Quarter 2-Hour Private or Group Walking Tour
shortDescription: Enjoy a private walking tour through the Latin Quarter of Paris. Spend 2 hours with a knowledgeable local guide and see the top sights of the Left Bank such as Notre Dame as you hear about the history of the area and the artistic geniuses it inspired.
description:
Explore the Latin Quarter, the most popular part of the Left Bank district of Paris.

Enjoy a private 2-hour tour with a professional guide and discover the highlights of a fascinating area that has inspired countless artists and other creative geniuses, including Hemingway, Woody Allen, and Salvador Dali, to name just a few. 

The Latin Quarter is home to the Sorbonne University, the Pantheon, the world-famous Shakespeare and Co. bookstore, and the breathtaking Luxembourg Gardens.

This private tour will take you to the core of Paris history from medieval times to its present day's bohemian culture preserved in this charming student village.

name: Paris: Nighttime Segway Tour
shortDescription: Discover the best of Paris on a Segway night tour. Prepare to be dazzled by the City of Lights as you discover a different side of Paris.
description:
Explore Paris by Segway and see the top attractions on a guided sightseeing tour. See the city sparkle at night on this unique tour.
Start your journey near the National Residence of the Invalids, a historical complex dedicated to France's military history. From there, admire the beautiful Alexandre III Bridge, built for the Paris Exposition in 1900. 
Glide by several famous tourist points in Paris, including the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, the palace turned museum known as The Louvre, the massive Arc de Triomphe, and the Musee d’Orsay along the bank of the River Seine.
See some of the city's most classical buildings, the Grand Palais and Petit Palais, which currently serve as museums.

name: Paris: Secret Gardens Walking Tour
shortDescription: Explore the secret gardens of Paris on a 2-hour walking tour and get off the usual tourist path. Discover a magical green oasis, tucked away in semi-tamed wilderness, see grand historical gardens and go to secret squares in out-of-the-way neighborhoods.
description:
Get off the usual tourist path to explore some of the lesser known of Paris’s 400 gardens, parks, and woodland. Along with its leafy squares, they combine to make the city the greenest capital in the world.

Your guide will take you into magical gardens, hidden in scenic wilderness, and intoduce you to some of the grand French gardens of history. You will discover secret squares and parks in quiet corners of the city, and venture to out-of-the-way neighborhoods that celebrate nature’s beauty.

These intimate, often quirky, gardens are the ideal place to connect with local life. As you wander, discover spaces ideal for listening to a concert, church gardens, and gardens with vegetable patches. Find out-of-fashion rose bushes, chessboards, and even cemeteries and hospitals that leave you alone with the best views of Paris.

name: From Paris: Versailles Guided Tour with Skip-the-Line Ticket
shortDescription: See the best that Versailles has to offer without having to wait in line on this half-day guided tour from Paris. Discover the palace's spectacular art and architecture, then roam through the gardens.
description:
During this half-day tour you will see the best that Versailles has to offer without having to wait in line !

We will take you back to the Golden Age of France with an afternoon at the Palace of Versailles. The chateau and gardens count among the most prestigious monuments of the world’s artistic heritage, and are certainly the finest and most complete achievement of 17th century French art. Former residence of the ‘Sun King’ Louis XIV, this sumptuous royal palace was home to three of France’s most illustrious Kings for over 100 years. The guided tour of the palace includes the State Apartments of the King and Queen, Royal Chapel and Hall of Mirrors, a richly decorated gallery which boasts 357 mirrors, french bay windows and crystal chandeliers.

At the end of your visit there is free time to discover the famous gardens à la française ; a 2,000 acre park designed by André le Notre with its magnificent groves, statues, and fountains.

name: Paris at Christmas 3-Hour Bike Tour
shortDescription: Discover the beauty of Paris at Christmas. Take in the illuminated sights of the City of Lights as you pedal along on a real Dutch bike after dark.
description:
Visit Paris as the alluring lights glitter and the whole city gets into the festive spirit.

Enjoy a 3-hour ride on a comfortable city bike for a Christmas tour of the City of Lights. Pedal along some of the famous avenues and boulevards of Paris.

A local guide will lead a ride through Paris that takes in iconic sights and secret alleys known only to Parisians. See famous landmarks from a different angle as you hear insightful stories about life in Paris.

Begin near the Arc de Triomphe and cycle along paths to the Trocadéro, Eiffel Tower, Pont Alexandre III and Place Concorde. Pass through the Louvre, Notre Dame and many other places.

And of course, without forgetting, our immersion in one of the most beautiful Christmas markets in the capital.

name: Paris: 2.5-Hour Guided Vintage Car Tour and Wine Tasting
shortDescription: Join for a tour of Paris in a 1970 classic Mercedes 280 SE and discover the top landmarks and city highlights. Sample unique wine at a winery in Latin Corner.
description:
Explore Paris on a city highlight tour aboard a vintage Mercedes 280 SE from 1970. Visit the iconic Eiffel Tower and take incredible photos with the classic car.

This tour takes you to the many landmarks and sights Paris has to offer, including Hôtel de Ville, Hôtel de Sens, Tour Saint Jacques, Notre Dame de Paris, Institut de France, Place de la Concorde, Grand Palais, Pont Alexandre III, Invalides, and Saint Germain des Prés.

Explore some off-the-beaten-track sights and districts of the city like the Saint-Sulpice cathedral or Arènes de Lutèce with plenty of photo stops. Then, stop at a local winery in Latin Corner and discover a selection of unique wines.

name: Paris: Vintage Sidecar Premium & Private Half-Day Tour
shortDescription: Discover the essence of France's capital on a vintage motorcycle adventure. Embark on an incredible journey past the unmissable sights in the city of Paris including monuments, landmarks, parks, and bohemian neighborhoods.
description:
Soak up the atmosphere of the city as you zip through the streets of Paris. See all of the landmarks on your must-see list in 1 thrilling tour, including the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, and the Basilique du Sacre-Couer. Stop to take amazing photos of iconic monuments and enjoy phenomenal views. Each vintage motorcycle fits 2 guests: 1 on the motorcycle and 1 in the sidecar. Hear the stories and legends of the city from your knowledgeable driver/guide. Don’t be surprised if pedestrians wave and smile as you pass by. The vintage sidecar is a vehicle that attracts a lot of attention.

Begin your tour by being picked up by your driver/guide from your accommodations in Paris. See the Place Vendome, a famous square which features the Vendome Column as well as several luxury hotels. Stop in front of the Palais Garnier, the home of the Paris Opera. Admire the opulent architecture of its exterior. Roll up to the Moulin Rouge and see the windmill that stands atop the famous cabaret. 

Marvel at the splendid architecture of the Basilique du Sacre-Coeur de Montmartre, Paris’ second most visited monument. Pass through the Arc de Triomphe and be awestruck by this monument to the fallen soldiers of the French Revolution and the Napoleonic Wars.

Stop at the Eiffel Tower and learn about the iconic monument’s architecture and history from your guide. Take pictures and enjoy a walk around and admire the view. Ride down the side streets and make your way to Notre Dame. This medieval Catholic cathedral is widely considered to be one of the finest examples of French Gothic architecture. See 15 other must-see Paris landmarks, including the Palais Royal, Galerie Vivienne, and the Paris Pantheon.

name: Parc Astérix: Private Transfer to/from Orly Airport
shortDescription: Enjoy a relaxing car or minivan transfer from Paris Orly Airport to Parc Astérix, or the reverse route, with comfortable seats, air conditioning and a wide trunk. You will benefit from 24-hour tourist assistance for your whole stay.
description: Leave the stresses of airport transfers behind by booking a comfortable and relaxing private transfer between Paris Orly Airport and Parc Astérix. Transfer service is available every day, from 4:00 AM until midnight (except for the 24th and 31st of December, when it’s available until 6:00 PM).

name: World War I Battlefields & War Museum of Meaux Day Tour
shortDescription: Explore the battlefields and war memorials of Île-de-France on a 10-hour minibus tour to the Great War Museum of Meaux and the cemeteries of Aisne. Pay your respects to the fallen soldiers of the 1st Battle of Marne and the campaigns of the Bois Belleau.
description:
Travel back to the dark days of World War I, and visit the battlefields of Aisne and Marne on the Western Front. During the tour, you will learn about important campaigns, such as the 1st Battle of Marne, which changed the course of the war.

Following your transfer from Paris, start at the Aisne-Marne American Cemetery to pay tribute to the American troops who fought in the area. See the graves of 2,289 soldiers that lost their lives in the vicinity and Marne Valley in the summer of 1918. Go inside the Memorial Chapel to read the 1,060 names of the missing soldiers.

Continue to Bois Belleau, where the Marines deadliest battle took place in June 1918, cementing their reputation in modern history. A lot of soldiers lost their lives in their efforts to stop the Germans from reaching Paris, and while successful, the human cost was horrendous. Gather your thoughts as you walk through the woods, and see traces of trenches and shell holes, and the remains of ruined buildings.

Next, go to the Côte 204 Monument at Chateau-Thierry, erected as a mark of friendship between France and the United States, and to commemorate the achievements of the American forces of World War I. Enjoy views of the Champagne vineyards in the Marne Valley below.

After lunch (own expense), head to Meaux to learn more World War I history at the Museum of the Great War, inaugurated in November 2011 to commemorate the Armistice. Take time to discover more than 50 000 exhibits that provide a greater understanding of the conflict as it impacted the world.

name: Paris Bakery Tour
shortDescription: Tour the kitchen of a French bakery in Paris and learn about the production of typical French breads, such as the classic baguette, and authentic croissants. Taste different baked goods, and leave with some complimentary bread and croissants.
description:
Explore a French bakery in Paris and learn about the techniques for making classic French breads.

You will be part of a select group to step behind the counter of a typical French boulangerie. In the kitchen you will watch a demonstration by the master baker of how a perfect baguette is made, using techniques that have been passed down through generations.

Watch the mixing of the dough, the kneading and shaping, and finally the cooking in special baguette ovens. The baguette is at the heart of French daily life and comes in many forms. The baker has his own special signature baguette, and today all of its secrets will be revealed to you.

And when that heavenly freshly baked bread smell fills the air, and the baguette comes out of the oven all warm and golden, you will get to taste it, along with a free baguette and croissant goodie bag to go.

name: Paris: Sunset Cruise with Drink and City Walking Tour
shortDescription: Experience the best of Paris with an evening cruise along the Seine and music on board. After your cruise, hop off to explore the stunning capital on an amazing audio-guided walking tour with your smartphone as your guide.
description:
Get the best of the French capital with a 1-hour sightseeing cruise along the Seine. Admire city lights views of Paris before embarking on an audio tour of the city.

Set sail along the Seine for a relaxing city lights cruise with amazing views of city highlights. Enjoy the ambiance on board with your choice of drink and calming electro-lounge music. Capture stunning photos along the river from the famous bridges to the most iconic monuments in Paris.

Hop off to explore the city at your own pace with an audio-guided walking tour. Choose between 10 available tours in Paris such as Montmartre, Street Art, or the Eiffel Tower tour.

name: Paris: Evening Sightseeing Tour and Moulin Rouge Show
shortDescription: Enjoy the magic and romance of Paris at night with a combined city tour and evening at the legendary Moulin Rouge cabaret. See the city’s attractions glide by from the comfort of a luxury coach, then raise a glass of Champagne to the famous can-can.
description:
Embark on a night out in Paris and see the iconic sites before heading to a Moulin Rouge show. Enjoy a night out that you won't forget in a hurry.
Discover Paris by night on a combination luxury coach tour and performance of the legendary Moulin Rouge cabaret. Meet at the local partner's office near Tuileries Gardens, and set off to admire the city’s monuments illuminated at night.

An audio guide will provide a full commentary as you tour, passing city icons such as the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame Cathedral, and Louvre. Pass some of the historic bridges that make the River Seine so enchanting, especially when reflected in the evening illuminations.

Then, head to the Moulin Rouge to see the Féérie cabaret, where a troupe of 100 artists, including 60 of the show’s famous Doris Girls, will dazzle you. The cabaret was built in 1889 by Joseph Oller, and is the spiritual birthplace of the modern form of the can-can. Enjoy the show with a glass of champagne.

Wow to the show’s 1,000 costumes of feathers and glitter, all made in Parisian workrooms. Admire the magnificent stage set’s rich colors and unique drawings created by Italian artists. Then, hold your breath for the eagerly-awaited return of the giant aquarium, set to an original score played by 80 musicians and 60 chorus singers!

name: Paris: Half-Day Electric Bike Tour
shortDescription: Go electric and see more of Paris. From the legendary monuments to hidden back streets, the charms of Paris are waiting to be discovered during this 3-hour tour.
description:
Let the comfort and ease of an electric bike take you on an unforgettable Parisian adventure. Inside Marais, enjoy a game of Pétanque at the oldest Parisian monument. Experience student life in the Latin Quarter, sit back at the "Luco" and wander the typically Parisian side streets in the Mouffetard district.


While the always busy artist cafés of Saint-Germain-des-Prés are where you can find the action, if you need a break, the Nouvelles Berges de Seine offers the peace and quiet of the riverbank. The allure of this beautiful city is there for the taking. And lucky for you, this tour makes seeing it all possible.

name: Paris: Private or Shared Cruise on the Seine
shortDescription: See Paris from a different perspective on this private or shared guided boat trip on the Seine River. Fall in love with Paris as you see the sights and lights of the city from aboard a small boat.
description:
Admire the city of love and lights from the water on this Paris cruise. Embark down the Seine, one of the longest rivers in France, and take in Paris’ sights on the riverside, such as the iconic Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame.
Hop on board the boat and get comfortable before taking off from Port Javel Bas. Feel free to bring your own snacks and drinks on board to fully enjoy your trip. Pets are also welcome. 
First, you’ll cruise in front of the Statue of Liberty monument, followed by the Eiffel Tower, the Alexander III Bridge, the Orsay Museum, and the Louvre. 
The boat will pass under the historic Pont Neuf, Europe's oldest stone bridge and the first bridge in Paris. Just beyond it, you will have a unique view of Notre-Dame Cathedral and the Paris Plages, a famous artificial beach located along the Seine. 
After your scenic cruise around Paris, return to the Port of Javel Bas. Before saying goodbye to your captain, receive a souvenir photo to remember your experience.

name: From Paris: Normandy Landing Beaches D-Day Tour by Minibus
shortDescription: Take a full-day tour to the site where on June 6th 1944, the Allies landed in Normandy. Visit the American Cemetery in Colleville and the ruins of the artificial harbor at Arromanches.
description:
Explore some of the most important sights in Normandy – the remains of historic Allied landings that changed the course of the Second World War. The full-day tour from Paris will take you to the German battery of Longues sur Mer, part of the German's Atlantic Wall of defense.

You will also stop at the American Cemetery in Colleville, for an emotional visit, where 9,386 soldiers now rest. In 2007 a new Visitor Center was created to commemorate the operations of the D-Day Landings, and you will have time to learn more about these dramatic events.

Continue to Omaha Beach, where more bloody events took place, and spend some time contemplating those moments before you break for lunch. In the early afternoon, you will see the ruins of the Arromanches’ artificial harbor, built by the Allies in less than 15 days. 
Finally, continue along the coast past Gold Beach to Juno Beach, where you will get a guided tour of the remains of the Atlantic Wall, before your return to Paris.

name: Paris: Private Transfer from or to Beauvais Airport
shortDescription: Take the stress out of your journey with this car or minivan service with comfortable seats, air conditioning and a wide trunk.
description:
Forget the stress or getting to your hotel or airport by booking a private transfer between Beauvais Airport and Paris, or the other way round. The transfer service is available every day, from 4:00 AM until midnight (except the 24th and 31st December when it's available until 6:00 PM).

When you arrive at the airport, enjoy a comfortable and relaxing transfer service from Beauvais Airport to your hotel or apartment in Paris. Your driver will take care of you and will guide you to your destination in total comfort and safety.

If you need a transfer for your flight departing from Beauvais Airport after your stay in Paris, book a transfer with a comfortable car which will take you to the airport from your hotel. All you need to do is relax and enjoy the landscape along the way.

name: Teen Shopping Tour in the City of Paris
shortDescription: This Parisian shopping tour is specially designed for teenage girls looking to find the hottest trends and coolest items in the world's most stylish city. Attend sample sales with famous brands at discount rates, and stock up on a whole new wardrobe.
description:
Join this Paris shopping tour and spend some time shopping for fabulous bags, terrific shoes, and the most amazing selection of jewelry in the beautiful city of Paris.
