A complete itinerary awaits you, specially designed for children. Your guide will show you how Montmartre is a unique place, a place full of anecdotes, and more incredible than the other districts. Learn about the famous myth of the Passe-Muraille, see the Sacred-Heart, admire the work of painters and writers, discover a picturesque carrousel, and walk past the last windmills in Paris.

name: Visit of Epernay & Multiple Champagne Tastings in a Vineyard
shortDescription: Learn how Champagne is produced on a tasting tour from Paris. Visit a selection of wine estates, including well-known local wineries and one of the houses from the luxurious LVMH group.
description:
Start your tour in central Paris in a comfortable, air-conditioned minibus and head to the Champagne region. During the journey, listen to commentary from your guide covering the history of and interesting facts about the region. 
Stop in the small town of Épernay, where you will have a guided tour of Moët & Chandon, a prestigious French winery and Champagne house that produces Dom Pérignon or a similar domain from the same luxury LVMH group (depending on the availability).

After the tasting, feel free to stroll along the avenue de champagne towards the center of this small city and have a delicious lunch in a local restaurant and enjoy a 3-course lunch. 
Afterward, see the producer where more than 80 farmers work hard to make an amazing selection of sparkling wines designed for special occasions. 
Visit the museum to see different utensils used to make Champagne, and watch a short film about the vineyards.

Later you will visit another great vineyard and be greeted by its charming workers. 
Have a chance to taste their elegant and exclusive product and hear about the history of their champagne estate in a cozy and welcoming atmosphere before heading back to central Paris. 
Just in time to ask your guide where you can have a good dinner.

name: Paris: Covered Passages Audio-Guided Walking Tour
shortDescription: Visit the sumptuous gardens of Palais-Royal and stroll through the beautiful covered passages of Paris. With your smartphone in your pocket, follow your guide’s voice as they lead you through the streets with automatic directions and commentary.
description:
Stroll through centuries with an audio-guided tour of the Palais-Royal gardens and the city’s historic covered passages. Start and pause the tour whenever you like, to explore at your own pace. Begin at the gardens of Palais-Royal, to discover the story of this fashionable meeting place.

Continue to the covered passages of Galerie Vivienne, Passage des Panoramas, and Passages Jouffroy. Learn how these places battled to attract customers and pass iconic locations, including the oldest chocolate factory in Paris, a wax museum, and the former Paris Stock Exchange.

name: Paris: Guided tour of Marais in German
shortDescription: Discover the Jewish quarter of Marais in Paris. In this former swampland, you will see impressive city palaces from the 16th and 17th century, the oldest square in Paris and fascinating hidden places away from other tourists.
description:
Explore the Jewish Quarter in the 3rd and 4th Arrondissement of Paris and discover this unique area of Paris that was a former swampland on the outskirts of the city.

Before immersing yourself in the Jewish life of Marais, visit the impressive Paris City Hall and the extraordinary Centre Pompidou. On your way through Marais, learn more about the fascinating history of the quarter and why there are still a large number of well-preserved city palaces from the 16th and 17th centuries today. Visit the oldest city palace, as well as the oldest square in Paris, which is characterized by its extraordinary architecture and history.

At the end of the tour, see the last traces of medieval Paris.

name: Paris: Musée d'Orsay 2.5-Hour Guided Tour with Skip-the-Line
shortDescription: Get an expert introduction to one of the most celebrated museums in Paris on a 2.5-hour private tour of the Musée d'Orsay. Skip the long lines for an attentive and individualized tour of masterpieces by artists such as Monet, Van Gogh and more.
description:
Located in the beautiful Beaux Arts building formerly used as the Gare d'Orsay railway station, the Musée d'Orsay is one of the best loved and most popular attractions in Paris.

Designed as an introduction for first-time visitors, this 2.5-hour private tour will get you to the museum’s highlights, as well as some lesser known gems, with the minimum of fuss and stress. Skip the long lines to enjoy priority entrance, then head to remarkable works by the French Impressionists and more.

Learn about the featured artists of the museum’s collection of 19th-century French art. Explore the backgrounds and individual styles of artists such as Manet, Renoir, Cézanne and Gauguin. As well as viewing some selected highlights, learn the secrets surrounding the techniques used by the Impressionists and post-Impressionists and discover how a handful of art rebels paved the way for the Impressionist art movement.

Skip-the-line access means you will spend more time admiring the art and less time queuing and you are free to stay on and continue exploring at the end of your guided tour.

name: Paris: Private City Tour in Citroën 2CV
shortDescription: The best way to see Paris's most iconic sights, such as the Champs-Élysées, the Eiffel Tower, and the Louvre! Zip around Paris in an iconic Citroën 2CV. Your knowledgeable driver will provide facts and anecdotes. This will be the highlight of your trip!
description:
For the 45-minute tour option your chauffeur will drive you past the Arc de Triomphe, the Eiffel Tower, the Invalides, the Grand Palais and Petit Palais, La Madeleine, Place Vendôme, the Musée du Louvre and the Orsay Museum. This is the perfect highlights tour if you are pressed for time.

In addition to the sights included on the 45-minute tour, the 1.5-hour tour will take you past Notre-Dame de Paris, the Ile de la Cité, the Trocadéro, the Invalides , the Champs de Mars, the Opéra Garnier, Place Vendôme, Place de la Concorde, the Petit Palais, the Grand Palais, and the President of France's residence , or the Palais de l’Elysée. You will have seen all of Paris's most iconic monuments and sights!

The 3-hour tour Paris leaves no stone unturned! You will have the time to discover the amazing architecture and history of Paris in even more depth. You will take in additional sights, such as the Moulin Rouge, the Sacré Coeur, Place de la Bastille, and more.

If you already know Paris and wish to go off the beaten track, or if you are interested in a particular theme, your driver will be more than happy to do his best to tailor your tour to your requests.

name: Welcome to Paris Day Trip from London via Train
shortDescription: Embark on a day trip to Paris from London by high-speed train. Once in Paris your expert guide shows you around the best sights in town on a panoramic tour. In the afternoon you will take a 1-hour river cruise on Seine. The rest of day is free to explore.
description:
Meet your guide at St Pancras Station, then it's all aboard the high-speed train to Paris. Relax and watch the scenery fly by out your window on your short 2-hour-and-15-minute trip.

Arrive in Paris and set off with your guide to explore on a panoramic tour of the city that visits major sites including the Opera House, Champs-Elysees, and the Arc de Triomphe.

This is followed by a 1-hour river cruise on the Seine that boasts wonderful sights of famous landmarks such as Notre Dame cathedral.

Finish the guided part of your tour at the Eiffel Tower, then enjoy free time to visit your favorite sights on your own, or grab a delicious bite to eat at a local café. Your knowledgeable guide is more than happy to give you tips on what to see and do as you venture out solo.

In the early evening you re-join with the group, and head back to Gard du Nord for your return journey to London.

name: Paris: Cheese and Wine Tasting
shortDescription: Learn about cheese in an authentic and professional environment. In the 17th century cheese cellar in the heart of Paris, enjoy tasting and pairing exceptional cheeses with wonderful wines.
description:
Bite into the history of French cheese making on this unique workshop in Paris. Make your way to an integral cheese shop, where you’ll meet friendly cheese experts.

Learn about the traditional art of cheesemaking and the importance of the maturing process as you admire the cellar’s supply. Taste seven different varieties cut fresh from the block, such as Swiss Gruyère, Beaufort, delicate Camembert and Etivaz, a hard cheese originating in the Alps.

Alternate bites of fragrant fromage with sips of fantastic French wine paired for complementary flavors. Also nibble on fresh baguettes to complete your gourmet tasting experience. After 1.5 hours in the cellar, emerge back into the streets of Paris as a newly minted wine-and-cheese connoisseur.

name: Paris: Covered Passages Walking Tour
shortDescription: See Paris’ hidden streets and walkways on this guided walking tour. Learn facts and history and discover secret treasures as you explore the covered passages.
description:
Explore Paris’s covered passages: half-hidden covered streets filled with shopping and culinary treasures. Take a dazzling guided tour through 5 of Paris’ magical arcades, some of them dating back to the 1700s, and learn their secrets, history, and the best places to shop and dine.
Begin at the Galerie Vivienne, a neoclassical-style covered passage dating to 1823, now a national monument filled with luxury boutiques.
After the Galerie Vivienne, explore the Passage Choiseul, where over 600 feet of sunlit shops gather under the stunning glass roof. Be sure to look at the beautiful, ornately tiled floor.
Continue the tour at the Passage des Panoramas, Paris' first covered walkway, built more than 200 years ago. Admire its old-fashioned charm and ancient architecture. Your guide will point out the best artisanal shops and eateries as you stroll along the scenic passage.
Next, the Passage Jouffroy presents a narrow frame for shoppers to navigate, accented everywhere with glass and iron. It even houses a small wax museum that your guide will show you.
At each of these stops your guide will direct your attention to details you might otherwise miss, fascinating pieces of history, and the story behind how these many covered passages in Paris found their way to the capital of fashion.
The tour ends at the Passage Verdeau, where antique dealers and vintage curiosities crowd the walkway.

name: Paris Right Bank 2-Hour Private Walking Tour
shortDescription: Enjoy a 2-hour private walking tour of the Right Bank, the traditional seat of French authority and the most official district of Paris. Experience the differences between the city of medieval times and the transformed Paris of the neoclassical period.
description:
While the Left bank has always been associated with universities, the arts, youth culture, and free and forward thinking, the Right Bank was the seat of French power. Authority emanated from the royal court and had a significant impact on the character of its surroundings.

A 2-hour walk on the Right Bank is a very different experience compared to a visit to the Left Bank, which is home to the Latin Quarter and Saint-Germain.

As you take in the buildings of the Right Bank your guide will compare the way authority was shown in medieval times with the manner in which it was demonstrated in the neoclassical period.

You won’t only dwell on the official aspects of this area, however. You’ll also visit sites that have seen a change from their original purpose and acquired some interesting, unexpected functions and fame.

Principal sites visited on the tour include the Cour Carré, Saint-Germain-l'Auxerrois, Comédie-Française, Rue Saint-Honoré, Palais-Royal, Galerie Vivienne, Rue de Rivoli, Place Vendôme, and the Tuileries.

name: Paris: City Introduction in-App Guide & Audio
shortDescription: Discover the city by walking one of the most beautiful routes. Learn introductory information about each location and the city and choose where to focus on, after this tour.
description:
Walk through a beautiful route of the city, discover hidden gems and visit 10+ of the most important attractions and spots. Learn some introductory information about each place and interesting stories about the city in general. 
 Download the ‘World City Trail ‘app from the store and login. Read the instructions and head to the starting location. Unlock photos of the exterior and the interior of the location.
Listen or read some information regarding the attraction and continue walking to the next checkpoint. Note what you liked and did not like and create your bucket list for the next days! 
 Start your walk any time, without a schedule. Pause it for lunch, have a drink, visit an attraction of your choice, and continue later or even another day. With the maps feature, you will never get lost.
Start your tour at the Eiffel Tower, the symbol of Paris. f Paris. Visit the Pont de l'Alma, where Queen Diana met a tragic death, and walk through the Pont Alexandre III, built to honor the name of Tsar Alexander III.
You will then continue to the iconic shopping street of the Champs Elysees and its gardens. Next, see the Place de La Concorde, the statues and sculptures of Tuileries Garden, and the great pyramid of the Louvre museum.
Admire the 7th century Church of Saint-Germain-l'Auxerrois and Pont Neuf, the oldest stone bridge in Paris. A stop at the Conciergerie will pique your interest to see the prison of the notorious Queen Marie-Antoinette and the well-known Saint Chapelle.
The icing on the cake of this unique tour will be Notre Dame which will blow your mind with its ruined beauty. During the tour, choose to pause the app at any time to take a break or spend some more time seeing the sights.
Learn about stories and urban legends associated with the city or monuments of the city. Enjoy the tour with your friends and family and learn about the city as you wander around.

name: Paris: Explore with a Treasure Hunt on Non-Electric Scooters
shortDescription: Explore Paris and enjoy a mix of culture and fun with a treasure hunt. During this self-guided tour, ride along the Seine and enjoy its top monuments as you collect clues and try to get the treasure!
description:
This 2-hour self-guided tour combines a sightseeing tour of Paris with the fun of a treasure hunt on a non-electrical scooter. You will start at the Louvre where we will welcome you and introduce the plot of the hunt. Then, you will cross the Carrousel Bridge to reach the left bank of the Seine where you will start collecting clues in order to crack the code that opens the Cryptex. Inside, there is the key to open the treasure chest and get to the treasure! 
As you explore and search for clues, you will see many of Paris's famous landmarks including : The Louvre, Orsay Museum, the Invalides, Alexander III Bridge, the Eiffel Tower, and the famous Seine. To enjoy some quality time with a mix of culture and fun, our booklets have both a cultural and historical page and a riddle to solve in front of the iconic monuments of the city.
On arrival, after you have completed the game, we wait for you in front of the Eiffel Tower to solve the final riddle and get to the treasure.
And even if it is a self-guided scavenger hunt, we are always available for you in case you need help. There is no looser in our games, everybody wins, always !

name: Paris: Latin Quarter Selfie Walking Tour with Local Guide
shortDescription: Capture the best photos on a walking tour of Paris and see the Luxembourg Gardens, Notre Dame, and more. Hear stories about the sights all around you as your guide helps you find the best photo spots.
description:
Spend some time exploring the scenic views in the Latin Quarter of Paris, as your guide shows you the best spots for photos. Travel to iconic landmarks, including Notre Dame Cathedral, Luxembourg Gardens, and the Church of Saint Julian the Poor.
Begin your tour at the Luxembourg Gardens, with flowers, fountains, and a palace. Stop and capture photos in front of the tree-lined promenades and statues in the gardens. 
Next, walk to the Pantheon. Take pictures in front of the columns while your guide tells you about the National Heroes interred within.
Make stops at the Lutetia Arena, to pose like a gladiator, the Church of Saint Julien de Pauvre, the Shakespeare and Company bookstore, and Notre Dame Cathedral. 
The tour will end at the Rue de la Huchette, a street used during the filming of the movie La La Land. The perfect street to end with a fun video or a selfie.

name: Paris: Escape Tour - Self-Guided City Game
shortDescription: Explore Paris in a unique way with the Escape Tour. Wander through the city and search for new clues and tasks to find the secret exit of Paris. Will you find the secret exit within two hours?
description:
Paris is the city where many famous stories originated, including the Da Vinci Code. After the murder of Jack Sauniere, Roberto was identified as the prime suspect in the case. But was that right? Follow in the footsteps of Roberto and try to stay out of the hands of the Paris police. That in itself is a difficult task, but can you also prove your innocence? Experience it with the Escape Tour Paris!

Choose your starting time with your teammates, beginning at anytime day or night. Make your way across the city, checking off tasks to find all the clues you need to reach the secret passage. As you search for clues, marvel at the beautiful sights of the town. 
Walk past the , wander through the lovely streets and keep an eye out for the many historic buildings in the city center. 
Work quickly, and you and your team could set the record for the fastest tour. Good luck!

name: The Paris of the Movies: 2.5-Hour Walking Tour & Wine
shortDescription: Discover why Paris is one of the most filmed cities in the world on this 2.5-hour walking tour through the city. Visit the shooting locations of famous movies like "Amélie" and "Midnight in Paris," and cap the tour off with a glass of wine at a local bar.
description:
There are few cities in the world immortalized in film the that Paris has been over the years. From "Amélie," to "Moulin Rouge," to Woody Allen's recent "Midnight in Paris," the City of Love has never looked better.

Take a guided tour through the heart of the Montmartre district, a favorite among many directors and stars. Discover the bar in which "Amélie" was filmed with French actress Audrey Tautou, stroll by the famous Moulin Rouge, which served as inspiration for the film by the same name, and admire the white walls of the iconic Sacré-Coeur, featured in Woody Allen's "Midnight in Paris."

Your friendly local guide will fill your ears will the secrets from set, including the favorite haunts of the stars, while you stroll through the charming cobblestone streets of Paris and take in the vibrant neighborhood. End the tour with a drink at a local wine bar, often frequented by artists and film industry people.

name: Paris: Holiday Lights and Christmas Market Tour for Families
shortDescription: Soak up the holiday spirit with your family as your private, kid-friendly guide leads you through Paris's Christmas illuminations and end at the Tuileries Christmas market.
description:
Stroll through a glimmering holiday world with a kid-friendly guide as you soak up Paris' festive atmosphere. Start your tour at Galeries Lafayette where you can behold Paris’s largest indoor Christmas tree. Next, partake in a century-old tradition. Since before WWI, Parisians have rushed to famous department stores to admire the magical window display arrangements. This year, your family can join them. Be amazed by thematic displays and amusing automatons, displayed along the boulevard by two distinguished Parisian brands. 

As you stroll to Place de la Madeleine, pass streets and roads that have been transformed into holiday postcards. Marvel at the enchanting lights all around you and spot an old-style carousel, as well as Fauchon, a legendary Parisian caterer. Afterward, walk down Rue Royale and stop to warm up with a typical holiday drink of spiced hot cocoa or mulled wine. While you sip on your beverage, observe the enchanting illuminations of Place de la Concorde and the beginning of Champs-Elysées.

Finally, make your way inside the Tuileries Christmas Market to discover regional holiday specialties and attractions for the kids. Before you end your evening, be sure to direct your gaze to the Eiffel Tower at the top of the hour to witness the most brilliant Parisian light show of all.

name: Paris: Le Marais Self-Guided Audio Tour
shortDescription: Explore the buzzing neighborhood of Le Marais in Paris on a self-guided audio tour on your smartphone. Discover its elegant medieval streets, trendy cafes, and the heart of Paris’ LGBT community.
description:
Discover the Marais neighborhood and the iconic landmarks that surround it, with a self-guided audio tour.

Our tour showcases some of Paris most famous landmarks that are visible from the Marais neighborhood, from the Isle Saint Louise to the Hôtel de Ville and Notredam. Enjoy a relaxing walk on your own while you discover everything this unique area has to offer. With our self guided tour you will discover the fascinating history of these landmarks and much more.

Start the audio guided tour at the Isle Saint Louise. As you explore the vibrant details of the Marais, auto triggered audio commentary from the app provides interesting information and stories of the most important landmarks you’ll see, such us the Hotel de Ville, Le Village Saint-Paul, up to Sainte-Chapelle in Ile de la cite.

Visit the Saint-Paul-Saint-Louis Church, the first church in Paris to abandon the Gothic Style in Paris and the baroque masterpiece of Saint-Gervais church. Your tour will end in one of the most famous Cathedral in the world, Notre-Dame de Paris.

If along the tour you wish to pause the tour and stop in one of the stylish cafès for a drink, a macaron or piece of cake, you are free to do so. You can then resume your tour when you are ready.

name: Paris: Small-Group Cheese and Wine Tasting in Le Marais
shortDescription: Wander through Paris's Le Marais quarter and enjoy a tasting of delicious French cheeses and wines at a local market on this guided walking tour. Explore one of the most iconic neighborhoods in Paris and sample one of the country's most famous foods.
description:
Explore the famous Le Marais quarter, one of the most historic areas in Paris.

Enjoy a relaxed and informative walking tour through the vibrant Marais district; home to art galleries and new fashion designers as well as some of the city's most amazing architecture and gardens. Then stop at one of the most beautiful and intimate markets in all of Paris, Le Marché des Enfants Rouges, which bustles with food vendors and quaint little bistros.

Take the chance to taste some of the most famous and delicious varieties of French cheese in the whole of Paris! Of course, the tastings will be accompanied by glasses of France's best wines, making this a true cultural and culinary experience right in the historic center of Paris.

name: Paris: Travel Essentials Welcome Kit Rental
shortDescription: Get everything you need to feel at home in Paris with a travel essentials welcome kit. Recieve to your door the freedom of pocket WiFi, SIM card, power bank, metro cards, and a travel adapter.
description:
Find the perfect welcome box for your stay in Paris. Receive all the travel accessories you need to enjoy your visit worry-free. Rent the kit for your entire stay, or just a few days and enjoy the convenience of delivery right to your door. 
Access high degrees of freedom and connectivity with pocket WiFi, a local SIM card, a power bank, and travel adapter. Visit Paris like a true local with an included digital guide that provides an exclusive community that loves to share local tips and tricks about the city. 
Enjoy additions like unique pre-stamped postcards of Paris to send to family and friends. Select your delivery preferences, rental duration, and the Parisian guide you would like to receive.

name: Paris: City Walk and Louvre Museum Tour
shortDescription: Get an expert introduction to Paris and one of the world’s most popular museums on a combined 5.5-hour walking tour, with reserved entry included to the Louvre.
description:
Explore Paris on a private tour to ensure a highly personalized experience.

Meet your guide outside the Cité Metro Station for the start of a pleasant walking tour of the “City of Lights.” The tour covers the most famous landmarks along the River Seine, such as the Gothic splendor of the Notre-Dame Cathedral.

Your guide will describe the origins of Paris at the Île de la Cité, including its art and culture through the centuries. Admire bridges over the Seine, and discover secret spots known only to the locals.

Then, enter the Louvre, the ancient home of French monarchs and emperors. Once inside, your guide will take you to major artworks and hidden treasures. Learn about the museum’s architectural history and pre-museum life as a fortress and palace.

By the end, you will have a greater understanding of how the “City of Lights” and its treasures earned their worldwide reputation.

name: Paris: Latin Quarter Guided Walking Tour in German
shortDescription: Embark on a varied discovery tour of the Latin Quarter in Paris. Explore the interesting student district, see famous sights and hidden places, and learn about the history of the French capital.
description:
Together with your German-speaking tour guide, discover the lively Latin Quarter in the south of Paris on this private walking tour.
 
Also known as the student quarter of the French capital, the Latin Quarter is located mainly in the 5th arrondissement of Paris. This neighbourhood has everything your heart desires: see world-famous sights like the internationally-renowned Paris University of Sorbonne and the Pantheon, a domed neo-classic mausoleum. In contrast to these, you’ll also explore places off-the-beaten-track like smaller cafés and squares. Finally, discover a particularly impressive park, that stands in contrast to the popular avenues and boulevards of this district.
 
On this relaxed, German-language walk through the Latin Quarter, your guide will teach you all about the history of the district and its sights, as well as the everyday life of the city of Paris.

name: Paris: Le Marais District City Exploration Game
shortDescription:
Embark on a quest where you will explore Le Marais district in Paris.

Solve clues and unlock stories on your phone, as you discover The Wall of Philippe Auguste, Place des Vosges, and lesser-known places.
description:
Here's a sneak peek to the storyline: “You are Newton. You don’t know how you got here! You are a scientist in London, living a secret life as an alchemist: trying to perfect the science of turning base metal into gold. Last memory you have is of falling asleep under a tree in a garden, after a hard night’s work in your laboratory. Next thing you know, you are here in this mysterious place with a note.”

As you solve challenges, the story unfolds and exact directions on your phone will guide you to the next location. So, are you up for an exciting city game?

The city game starts at Hôtel De Ville. It will take you around 1 to 1,5 hours to complete and you can also explore at your own pace: pause the game and resume anytime from the location where you paused it. You will finish at Hôtel de Soubise.

After your booking you will receive an email with instructions on how to download and play the game on your phone. You can play on your own, in a large group or in several smaller groups that compete against each other and meet at the final stop of the game.

For larger groups, one person can purchase access for the entire group by selecting the number of people in the group. All group members will be able to download and play the city game on their phone. Alternatively, each person can make their own purchase.

name: Paris: Île de la Cité Walking Tour
shortDescription: Visit the historical center of Paris and learn about its humble beginnings. Visit the Sainte-Chapelle, the Conciergerie, Pont Neuf and the Latin Quarter. Explore île-de la Cité, in the heart of Paris home to some memorable sights.
description:
On this story-packed tour, you will unlock the secrets of Paris' historical origins and visit outside of the famed Notre Dame Cathedral.

Start the two-hour leisurely walk near Notre Dame. Learn about the myriad of sites the island has to offer, including Sainte-Chapelle, the Memorial of the Deported, the Conciergerie, Palais de Justice, and Pont Neuf.
Then, from peasants to emperors to hunchbacks, you will delve into the rich history of the exterior of Notre Dame de Paris and find out why over 13 million people come to see her every year.
As you stroll across the island to the leafy Place Dauphine, take in Sainte-Chapelle and the Conciergerie. Learn about the island's fascinating history and cross the Pont Neuf bridge.
Finally, take in the quaint Latin Quarter before your guide leaves you at the famous Shakespeare & Company bookshop.

name: Paris Walking Tour: The Art of Seduction in Montmartre
shortDescription: Learn the art of French seduction on a 2-hour walking tour of Montmartre in Paris, the city of love and romance. You'll be introduced to the most charming secret locations where romance blossomed. Discover the “I Love You Wall,” Studio 28, and more.
description:
Paris inspires thoughts of love and romance. It's the heart fluttering capital of the world - the city for lovers, where romance is stirred in the hardest of souls!

On this tour you will wander through the heart of Montmartre with a connoisseur of romance. They will show you how, with its bohemian atmosphere and fabled views, Montmartre is the perfect spot for declarations of love.

See where romance blossomed at sites such as the Galette Windmill, a former open-air restaurant with a dance floor where risqué liaisons were nourished in the 19th century. Go to the "I Love You Wall" to see how lovers from across the world celebrate their union, and visit Studio 28, which relives the days of those tear-jerking romantic films everyone loves.

Your guide will explain the French language of love and share advice and some tips on how to excel in the art of seduction, French style.

name: Notre Dame Tour with a Small Group
shortDescription: Join a tour of the most visited and best-known monument in Paris with a small group. Experience an in-depth and breathtaking tour of the most fascinating and astonishing place in the entire city of Paris.
description:
Out of all the tours, monuments or museums to be seen in Paris, this is the one that is not to be missed - furthermore, it is the one that should be the first on your list. The exploration of Paris starts from Notre Dame. This is the place where the city started out. It is the place where the temples of all of the societies occupying this part of the world were, and are, situated. It is the very center of Paris, and the symbolical center of France, Europe, and indeed the world.

Notre Dame is a marvel of Gothic architecture - one of the greatest accomplishments of not only western European culture, but of human civilisation in general. The guides are passionate about Gothic architecture and this monument in particular - it is the topic of ongoing research that only gets more and more exciting. It is the local supplier's goal to share that passion with you and introduce you to a world of knowledge hidden in these walls, windows, and even pavements.

Notre Dame is an eternal inspiration and an ongoing fascination. Take this visit and you will be surprised at just how much knowledge, wisdom, and genius went into creating this rare jewel of human endeavour, and how much of those rare qualities is communicated to the savant eye that knows where to look. The mission of this tour is to uncover this hidden knowledge and share it with you.

While the cathedral is under reconstruction (since the fire in April 2019), entrance to the cathedral is not possible. The tour stays on the outside of the building. The activity provider will resume entering the cathedral as soon as it becomes possible.

name: Paris: Private City Tuktuk Tours with Pickup
shortDescription: See the sights of Paris from a different perspective on a customizable Tuktuk tour with a local guide. Discover the highlights of the French capital and its iconic monuments aboard an eco-friendly vehicle.
description:
Climb aboard an eco-friendly tuk-tuk for a different sightseeing tour of Paris and explore the famous streets by electric vehicle. Choose from short tour option to get a good overview of the city, or upgrade to the half, petit and full-day tours for a more comprehensive experience.

Benefit from pick-up at your hotel and the option to customize your itinerary to suit your interests. Take up to 3 of your friends on a tour by Tuktuk for 1 to 4 people. See all the landmarks and tell the driver where you want to stop and for how long as you drive through the city.

name: Off-the-Beaten Track in Paris: 2-Hour Vintage 2CV Tour
shortDescription: Take a ride in a vintage Citroen 2CV convertible and see the famous sights of Paris and many of its unusual and interesting off-the-beaten-track neighborhoods. Visit Place des Vosges, Marais, Arènes de Lutèce, and more on this private 2-hour tour.
description:
Experience some of the hidden quarters of Paris and take in the city’s major highlights as you cruise the streets in a vintage Citroen 2CV convertible. See the grand avenues lined with well-known buildings and monuments, and also visit historical areas such as the Marais, with its village-like atmosphere. You’ll also see Place des Vosges, the oldest Royal place of Paris, on this unique 2-hour tour.

Take a drive to the Arènes de Lutèce, the site of the city’s most important ruins from the Gallo-Roman era in Paris. The stones at the site date back to 200 A.D.

What you’ll see:

• Place des Vosges
• Passage Sully
• Village Saint Paul
• Le Marais
• Port de l'Arsenal
• Bastille
• Grande Mosquée de Paris
• Butte aux cailles
• Cité Florale
• Arènes de Lutèce
• Institut du Monde Arabe
• Place Dauphine

name: Paris: Seine River Sightseeing Cruise with 3-Course Dinner
shortDescription: Board a boat for a memorable night on the Seine in Paris. Enjoy a typical French Dinner as you cruise along the River admiring monuments and bridges. Finish with a view of the illuminated Eiffel Tower.
description:
Discover the beauty of the Seine river with this Paris dinner cruise. Savor authentic Parisian cuisine as you sail past sights like the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, and the Louvre museum. 
Board your cruise by the Musée d'Orsay museum and sit down to a sophisticated gourmet meal as you soak up the beauty of the Paris evening from the water. Cruise past famous museums, striking monuments, quaint quarters, and magnificent bridges.
Sail past iconic highlights like the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, the Louvre, the National Assembly, and Pont Neuf. Enjoy a rich starter, choose your main course, and end with a typical dessert. After your sightseeing cruise, disembark at the departure point.

Starters
For 6:45 PM sailing: Seared salmon and leek compote with a grain crisp
For 9:15 PM sailing: Choice of:• Seared sea scallops with leek compote and shellfish jus • Lightly cooked foie gras, grape compote, and orange marmalade with pecan financier• vegetarian cream of red kuri squash, chestnuts, and roasted squash seeds

Main course For both departures, choice of:
• Suprême of young guinea hen with mashed potatoes, fricassee of local mushrooms, and vin jaune sauce • Fillet of sea bream with parsnip mousseline and honey-roasted carrots with thyme• Steak with shiitake mushrooms and a small cauliflower soufflé (+€9)• Vegetarian polenta with truffles and a seasonal vegetable medley

Desserts
L’instant by Paris seine (mini cheesecake/chocolate finger cake) or pear and chocolate crumble

Drinks
Coffee or tea at the end of your meal

Cheese and "a la carte" drinks are available to purchase onboard among a wide selection of cocktails, wines, beers, and soft drinks.

Children's menu
Starter: Salmon mille-feuille with leek compote
Main Course: Suprême of poultry, mashed potatoes
Dessert: Chocolate finger cake

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Skip-the-Ticket-Line Tour & Seine Cruise
shortDescription: Enjoy direct access tickets to the Eiffel Tower with a guide and be amazed at the views from the top of the tower. Board a sightseeing river cruise on the Seine any time after your tour.
description:
Skip the ticket line to the Eiffel Tower as you take a tour of the landmark and admire the city from the air. Then, head for the Seine and a boat cruise to take in the sights of Paris from the water.

Take a 2-hour guided tour of the tower, with skip-the-ticket-line access, to hear all about the origins and the secrets behind the construction of this architectural masterpiece. Choose from a 2nd level and summit or 2nd level-only ticket and learn from your guide about the fascinating history of this world-famous landmark.

Catch the elevator and ascend to the viewing platform on the second floor, and, if you choose the summit ticket, head all the way to the summit. From there, take in the amazing panoramic views of the French capital, including the Arc de Triomphe and Sacre Coeur.

Your ticket includes a 1-hour cruise on the river Seine, available any time after your visit to the Eiffel Tower. Admire the UNESCO-listed buildings lining the riverbanks, including the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, Notre-Dame de Paris, and the Conciergerie. Pass by floating houseboats and restaurants along the way.

name: Versailles: Skip-the-Line Day Tour & Transfer from Paris
shortDescription: Witness the beauty and grandeur of Versailles, learn about its intriguing history, enjoy a delicious lunch close to the Grand Canal, and see some of the most magnificent sights in Paris on a full-day tour starting at your hotel.
description:
Experience Versailles, and see some of the main sights in Paris on a fully guided day tour starting at your hotel.

Drive through Paris on your way to Versailles, and visit some of its most magnificent sights. Upon arrival at the Palace, take a guided tour within its majestic walls. Visit the State Apartments, see the Hall of Mirrors, the King and Queen’s Bedroom, and take a stroll through the beautiful gardens.

Take a break for lunch, and enjoy a delicious meal at La Petite Venise, close to the Grand Canal.

Then enjoy some time to explore, and discover the beauty of Versailles at your own pace.

name: Paris: Centre Pompidou Ticket and Seine River Cruise
shortDescription: Access the contemporary building of multiculturalism, the Pompidou Centre, located in the heart of Paris. Discover different forms of art and culture before boarding a cruise along the Seine River.
description:
Discover one of the architectural icons of Paris, the Pompidou Centre. Learn of the building's iconic history and admire contemporary works of art from all over the world. Be mesmerized afterward on a sightseeing cruise along the Seine River. Take in the Paris skyline and relax. 
Enter into the Pompidou Centre, designed by Renzo Piano and Richar Rogers at the beginning of their careers. Learn about how this building became one of the most important structures in Paris and in modern architecture. 
Admire the design of the building and the incredible pieces of contemporary art from the world's different cultures. Be inspired by the uniqueness of the building and its role in establishing a new type of cultural building. 
Board a sightseeing cruise afterward and allow yourself to be enchanted by the city of Paris. Float along the Seine River, the most important waterway in France. Watch the city's greatest attractions pass by, take photos, and enjoy after an exciting day.

name: Paris: Food and Wine Tasting Walking Tour in Le Marais
shortDescription: Dine like a local in Paris’ Le Marais neighborhood, and taste a mix of traditional and modern French cuisine.
description:
Begin your tour with one of the true classics: a flaky butter croissant made fresh from one of the city’s best-loved bakers. Here, you’ll also enjoy a taste of homemade sourdough bread and hear more about the family who runs this local favorite.

Naturally, macarons should be at the top of the menu for any visit to France. Your next stop will take you to a master chocolatier for some tasty treats to kick off the tour. As a Meilleur Ouvrier de France – a title awarded to only the best in their craft – you can be sure that these are some of the best quality chocolates in the neighborhood.

It's then time for a lesser-known but equally delicious snack at a local food market: chickpea pancakes. Afterward, you’ll be guided through Paris’ Jewish quarter on a short historical walk. 
As you explore a century-old shop bursting with regional delicacies, hear more about the Jewish history of Paris. Enjoy some unique pastries in a family-run bakery, then get insight into how the French shop for produce, all while tasting a delicious selection of cheeses and cured meats.

Originally opened as a protest against fast food, at the next restaurant you'll try some delicious French onion soup and learn more about the menu, which consists of locally sourced ingredients and dishes made from scratch.

Journey onwards for a pastry experience like no other. Mixing Syrian flavors with French patisserie techniques, visit a French-Syrian baker who crafts delicious pastry nests.

It wouldn’t be right to finish without a glass of wine. Your last stop will take you to a spot specializing in natural wines. Here, you’ll meet the owner and hear about this fascinating world.

name: Paris: Père Lachaise Cemetery Walking Tour
shortDescription: See the artistic tomb stones and burial sites of the famous on a 2-hour walking tour of Père Lachaise Paris. Explore one of the oldest cemeteries in the city, and find the graves of Edith Piaf, Oscar Wilde, Molière, Jim Morrison, Sartre and more.
description:
Wander the quiet walkways and park-like setting of Père Lachaise Cemetery, one of the oldest cemeteries in Paris and discover the last resting place of Edith Piaf, Oscar Wilde, Molière, Jim Morrison, Jean Paul Sartre, Chopin and many others.

Meet your guide at the entrance to the cemetery in the 20th arrondissement and learn about the artists, writers, politicians and other remarkable personalities that are buried within its beautiful stone walls.

Hear stories that encapsulate the history of Paris, the cemetery itself and even the popular culture, literary and political history of the 20th century. Learn about a gruesome Communist uprising in Paris and the hordes of Jim Morrison fans that make a pilgrimage to visit the tomb of The Doors front man.

name: Versailles Palace & Gardens Tour with Gourmet Lunch
shortDescription: Enjoy a visit to the spectacular Palace of Versailles. Walk the glittering Hall of Mirrors, see the State Apartments and stroll through the manicured gardens. End your morning with a delicious gourmet lunch at the splendid restaurant inside the chateau.
description:
Meet your guide in central Paris and enjoy a short, escorted train ride to Versailles. On arrival, start a journey in the footsteps of the kings and queens of France. During the reign of Louis XIV, the Sun King, Versailles was the place to be and to be seen. Nowadays visitors from all over the world still come to Versailles to marvel at the splendors of this incredible palace. Your skip-the-line access allows you to bypass the long lines that form each day, and your friendly local guide will steer you expertly through the crowds, bringing the famous figures who once inhabited this palace back to life, and making sure you don’t miss a thing.


After visiting the royal apartments inside the palace, your guide will lead you through the spectacular gardens, once the setting of balls, parties and elaborate firework displays. On fountain show days you will see the amazing waterworks, still running today as they did in the times of kings and queens.

After your tour, dine like a king at the sumptuous new restaurant Ore, recently opened in the spectacular 18th century salons at the Chateau of Versailles by renowned chef Alain Ducasse. Savor a delicious gourmet lunch and discover fine French cuisine. Alain Ducasse is world-famous for his inspired cooking, combining fresh, local ingredients to produce timeless and contemporary dishes. Admire the beautiful views of the chateau while you feast on some of the best French food. It’s the perfect way to end your tour.

name: Paris: Chef PJ's Montmartre Food Tour
shortDescription: Experience Montmartre's world-class food scene with PJ, a local chef and a famous food tour guide in Paris. Walk to different shops and cafes, and try French delicacies in a flavorful 4-course feast.
description:
Join Chef PJ while he visits his friends in his favorite shops. Learn about the history of French cuisine in the local boulangerie, fromagerie, and patisserie. See Montmartre's beautiful sites on the way to chef PJ's restaurant where you will be treated like a true VIP.
You will sit down for a seasonal 4-course feast paired with 4 French wines carefully selected from PJ’s cellar. On this unforgettable, chef-led food tour you will enjoy one of Paris’s best baguettes, something exotic like escargot or frog legs, something rich and filling like Beef Bourguignon, fine French cheeses, fruit, pastries, macarons, and Parisian chocolate.

name: From Paris: Epernay and Champagne Day Trip with Tastings
shortDescription: Take a day trip to Champagne and Epernay to visit 2 champagne houses with at least 6 tastings included. See houses of leading producers like Moët et Chandon, Mercier, Boizel and a family grower.
description:
Take a day trip from Paris to Champagne and Epernay. Visit 2 Champagne houses, a large one like Ayala or Moët and a family-run one, with at least 6 tastings included. Explore the vineyards and meet professional winemakers who will guide you through the tastings. 
From Paris, drive to the charming village of Hautvillers, the cradle of Champagne. Admire the sea of vines which engulf the hillside slopes, and stop at a traditional bakery in the village. Discover a piece of history at Hautvillers Abbey, the resting place of monk and cellar master Dom Pérignon.

Then, it's time to taste some bubbles at the AYALA Champagne House in Aÿ with its UNESCO-classified vineyard, Boizel, or Moët et Chandon headquarters and cellars in Epernay, depending on availability. Learn how to pay close attention to nuances in the Champagne flavor, aroma, and appearance.

Next, take a stroll on Champagne Avenue in Epernay which is lined with the prestigious houses of Moët et Chandon, Laurent Perrier, Boizel, Venoge, and Castellane. Head to a traditional restaurant with a large choice of menus (at your expense). During the spring and summer, you can order a picnic.

Visit a family of passionate champagne producers such as Champagne Bouquet in Châtillon-sur-Marne, Roger-Constant-Lemaire in Villers-sous-Châtillon, or Liébart-Regnier in Baslieux-sous-Châtillon. See how they continue the family tradition of producing top-shelf Champagne.
After another round of tasting, start your return journey to Paris.

name: Paris: 3-Hour Private Champs Élysées to Montmartre Tour
shortDescription: Book a local Parisian for a personalized tour. Ditch the travel guides and decide where to go, what to see and what to do together with your personal guide. With a friend who knows what you like, the city will unveil its best to you.
description:
After booking this tour, your host will contact you within 24 hours and ask you questions about your preferences and interests so they can match you with the right profile and assign a like-minded local Parisian who will be your guide.

You'll be paired with guides that are passionate about the place they call home and who choose to spend their free time sharing it with like-minded travelers matched to them.

Keeping in mind your personal answers, they will put together a fitting itinerary just for you. Please note that this will be outlined but flexible. They will arrange a meeting with your guide in the most convenient place for you. If, during the tour, you feel like changing direction or your guide believes that you'd enjoy a different experience, they will suggest and discuss with you changes to the itinerary.

Enjoy discovering a 3-hour private Champs Élysées to Montmartre tour in Paris you wouldn't find just with going by the tour books. The day revolves around your wishes, so enjoy your private tour and let your local guide show you the Paris you'll never forget!

name: Paris Bike Tour: Eiffel Tower, Place de la Concorde & More
shortDescription: Pedal through Paris on a bike tour that gives a perfect introduction to the sights and sounds of the City of Light. Stop at iconic Paris attractions and savor a café lunch.
description:
Paris is a city for lovers, and riding through its quaint streets, endless miles of café-lined boulevards, and gorgeous parks is the perfect way to get acquainted with the City of Lights. 
On this bike tour, cycle to the best bits of Paris for a fun, easy day of riding, accompanied by locals who know the city best.

Ride past the symbol of Paris – the Eiffel Tower – and continue past Napoleon's Tomb, where you can look upon on the resting place of the notorious ruler who designed every inch of the mausoleum. 
Pedal along the banks of the River Seine and make your way to the Louvre in a leisurely fashion.

See the famous avenue des Champs-Élysées from the Place de la Concorde and hear about the fascinating history of the square before taking a break at the Tuileries Garden. 

For both first-time visitors and experienced travelers, biking has to be the best way to see the City of Light.

name: Paris: Champs-Élysées Guided Tour and Arc de Triomphe Ticket
shortDescription: Walk along the Champs-Élysées with your guide and learn about the area as you take in the sights. Visit the Arc de Triomphe and climb to the top to take pictures of the stunning views of Paris.
description:
This 45-minute walking tour is a journey through the centuries, from the 1600s to the 1800s (when the Arc de Triomphe was built) and beyond to the glittering shops that today line the world’s most famous avenue.

On the way, you’ll pass near the Petit Palais’s monumental dome and the Grand Palais’s stunning glass ceiling. Soon, you’ll find yourself on the grand and glorious Champs-Élysées.

Your tour of the Champs-Élysées will be filled with the sights and sounds of the heart of Paris. Along the way, hear stories of the celebrities, dignitaries and parades that have filled this street, from glamorous 1950s movie stars to the November victory march after France was liberated from Nazi control.

If you love shopping (and love to splurge), your guide will also share tips on the top spots to pick up something special. The Champs Elysées is definitely the best place to feel like Lily Collins from “Emily in Paris!”

Finish your mini guided Champs-Élysées walking tour at the entrance of the beautiful Arc de Triomphe — you’ll be glad your guide showed you the secret way in!

Your self-guided visit to the Arc de Triomphe, a monument to France's war heroes and victories begun in 1806 (it took three centuries to build), will provide a unique view of Paris from above. See the Eiffel Tower and more as you enjoy the vibrant city scene and take photos you'll cherish forever.

name: Paris: 1-Way Transfer between Disneyland And CDG Airport
shortDescription: Take the stress out of your trip to Paris when you book your Disneyland and Charles de Gaulle Airport transfer service in advance.
description:
Whether your trip is just beginning or coming to an end, ensure a hassle-free holiday from start to finish when you book your airport transfer service in advance. Avoid long taxi lines, busy public transport, and language barrier confusions, then simply sit back and relax on your trip to or from your Disneyland accommodation and Charles de Gaulle Airport.

Upon arrival at the airport, collect your luggage and head through customs then find your friendly driver waiting in the arrivals hall. Travel in comfort and style as your driver takes care of your luggage and ensures a smooth ride to your hotel. During the drive you can admire the views of the city and begin to soak up the magic of your trip to Paris. For departures from Disneyland, enjoy pickup directly from your hotel and receive the same stellar service.

name: Private Treasure Hunt around Notre Dame for Families & Kids
shortDescription: Explore the medieval neighborhood surrounding Notre-Dame with a private, kid-friendly guide who will introduce you to the architecture, history, and heritage of the area, all while keeping the kids engaged.
description:
If you want to learn about Paris’s rich history and medieval heritage but are worried about keeping your kids engaged—this is the tour for you. Explore medieval Paris with a private, kid-friendly guide on a fun treasure hunt.  

Meet your guide outside the Cité metro station. They’ll be ready with activity booklets for your youngsters that will keep their interest throughout the tour. Acting as detectives, they’ll have to solve an investigation in the medieval neighborhood around Notre-Dame.  

Starting at the Notre-Dame in all her Gothic glory, you and your kids will discover architectural details that will take you back in time to the Middle Ages. Your next stop will be the Palais de Justice (the Courthouse), where you'll listen to your guide’s stories about knights and kings who once lived in this former palace. Then, a few blocks away, discover Sainte Chapelle, a true Gothic jewel with 15 stained glass windows.  

Hop across the River Seine to wander the natural island of Saint Louis. Spot gorgeous views, explore narrow streets, and get a feel for what a lively Parisian neighborhood is really like.  

After your tour, you can’t leave Saint Louis without stopping at Berthillon, the famous Parisian ice cream shop—your kids will be glad you did!

name: Paris: Audio Guided Walking Tour Around the Eiffel Tower
shortDescription: Discover the Eiffel Tower district at your own pace on a self-guided walking tour with an audio guide. Learn about the history of the area from professional guides and actors.
description:
Learn all about the Eiffel Tower and the history of the area on an hour-long self-guided tour with an audio guide. Listen and discover as an easy-to-use app on your smartphone regales you with entertaining commentary from a professional guide and actors.

Stories automatically trigger as you walk past important historical sites. You can begin this innovative self-guided tour whenever you want, alone or with friends.

Begin your tour at Place du Trocadéro in the heart of the Palais de Chaillot. From there take a short stroll in the gardens of the Trocadéro and learn why building the Eiffel Tower was considered to be such a great architectural feat.

Cross Jena bridge over the Seine, then continue on to the gardens of the Eiffel Tower. Stop along the way for snacks or coffee, never getting lost thanks to the clear audio directions and map.

If you do take a wrong turn, the integrated geo-localization feature will get you back on track in no time. Customize your itinerary as you wish, relax and enjoy a fun and entertaining tour of the Eiffel Tower at your own pace.

name: Crazy Horse Paris: New Year's Eve - "Totally Crazy!" Show
shortDescription: Come to enjoy New Year's Eve at the Crazy Horse Paris! Immerse yourself in the creative and sophisticated world of Crazy Horse Paris with its show "Totally Crazy!" Enjoy champagne, caviar, and macarons and ring in the new year in style.
description:
Experience the most sensual dancers in the world, legendary acts, and stunning visual effects. Immerse yourself in the creative and sophisticated world of Crazy Horse Paris by taking in the show, "Totally Crazy!" to celebrate the end of 2019!  

Discover the most iconic acts of the famous Parisian cabaret, tweaked with a dash of impertinence with must-see performances by legendary creators that have revolutionized the world-renown Parisian stage, including: Philippe Decouflé, Christian Louboutin, Ali Mahdavi, Dita Von Teese, and Chantal Thomass.  

Select the full package and enjoy half a bottle of Veuve Clicquot Champagne per person, 12 grams of Egg'xiting de Petrossian caviar, 5 Dalloyau canapés, and two Crazy by Ladurée macarons.

name: Paris: Tour de France Bike Ride
shortDescription: Take a spin like a pro on the last leg of the Tour de France. Get an early start before the race and cruise around the Arc de Triomphe.
description: Want to feel like a professional cycler? Take an amazing, albeit much slower, ride on the final stretch of the Tour de France. On the last day, rise early to take advantage of the Champs-Elysées with minimal traffic, ride through the famous Place de la Concorde and around the Arc de Triomphe, just like professionals. Stop for coffee and croissants at the Champs de Mars after the ride, and you'll still have the whole day ahead of you before the final finish.

name: French Wine Tasting Class with a Sommelier
shortDescription: Discover the best of French wines in a 2-hours session in English with a French Sommelier. Taste 6 wines of various regions, 1 Champagne, 2 whites and 3 reds
description:
Would you imagine leaving Paris without seeing the Eiffel Tower ? Of course not! Then, what would a trip to France and Paris be without discovering French wines?

Take advantage of this wine tasting session and gain a better appreciation for wines that you will find all over Paris, whether it is at a cafe, restaurant, or in your hotel. Do not miss a unique opportunity to discover the delicious French wines in the heart of the Latin Quarter, along the river bank. Opt for a unique way to discover the secrets of these wines in a tranquil atmosphere, during a 2-hour session with a wine expert. Reserve your session now and obtain your passport for French wines.

name: Paris: Virtual-Reality Escape Room Adventure
shortDescription: Enjoy one of the world’s best team-based virtual reality experiences, which is now available in Paris. The facility blends the escape-room concept with a full 3D cinematic experience to deliver a unique, immersive, and mind-blowing adventure.
description:
After booking online, you will receive an online confirmation which will provide you with your allocated time for your activity. Upon arrival, your "Gamemaster" will greet you and your group of fellow players to explain the basics of how to interact and progress throughout your virtual-reality adventure.

You will be able to choose from 3 different available scenarios, which are titled:

• Time Travel: Chapter 1 (beginners)
• Time Travel: Chapter 2 (intermediate)
• AreWeDead? (expert)

Following the adventure you will be offered soft drinks, coffee, or tea, and can also take a group picture together. The entire session will last approximately one hour, and does not require any knowledge, equipment, or special outfits.

name: Army Museum: Invalides and Napoleon's Tomb Guided Tour
shortDescription: Take a semi-private guided tour of the spectacular gold-domed Invalides, one of the most impressive buildings in Paris and home to the Army Museum, as well as the monumental tomb of Napoleon Bonaparte. Journey through history on this fascinating visit.
description:
Most tourists to Paris are impressed by the 26 pounds of gold leaf that make the Invalides stand out against the skyline, and take a photo of the dome. But few visitors realize the multiple facets of society on display within. Originally constructed under Louis XIV, the dome contains the tomb of Napoleon Bonaparte. The vast complex surrounding the cathedral is dedicated to preserving and exhibiting the many chapters of French military history, including the jousting of medieval knights, the Emperor’s European conquests, and the World Wars of the 20th century.

Your guided visit of the site lasts 2.5 hours, and features meaningful stories not only about the French but also about the many nations that have come to fight on French soil. Of particular interest are the exhibits about the D-Day Landings in Normandy and the Liberation of Paris in 1944. Your expert guide will take you on a historical journey. You’ll get into the military theme as you admire the decorated armor and cannon the XVIIth century. Hear of the exploits of General Bonaparte and learn how he became Emperor Napoleon. 

Next visit the church to discover tomb of the most famous military leader in European history. After taking the imperial crown for himself in 1804, Napoleon continued his program of European conquest right up to his ultimate defeat at the Battle of Waterloo. Napoleon died in exile in 1821, but his remains were returned to France in 1840 and entombed according to his wishes in the heart of his capital. Napoleon’s son, nicknamed the Eaglet, also died on foreign soil; his body was reinterred here by Hitler in 1940. Join this thrilling voyage through conflict, disaster, heroism and united victory.

name: Necropolis of Kings and Queens: Basilica of St. Denis Tour
shortDescription: Enjoy a semi-private guided tour of the world’s first Gothic cathedral and burial site of kings and queens of France. Marvel at over 1,500 years of grandeur.
description:
Hear about the Catholic legend of St. Denis, the first bishop of Paris, who was decapitated. Holding his head under his arm, he gave a sermon while walking to the site where the basilica was to be built some 900 years later.

Saint Louis selected this site for his family’s tombs, and the basilica now contains a collection of intricately sculpted sarcophagi.

Explore the official necropolis of the French Monarchy on this 2.5-hour guided tour. In all there are tombs of 43 kings and 32 queens, from the 7th-century King Dagobert through Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette. A guided visit of the site takes you through much of the history of Paris itself.

name: Paris: Museum of the Art and History of Judaism Entry Ticket
shortDescription: Discover Paris's Jewish history and heritage with a guided tour at the Museum of the Art and History of Judaism. Extended your tour and explore Jewish heritage sites and synagogues in Paris.
description:
Join this exclusive guided tour of the Museum of the Art and History of Judaism to immerse yourself in Jewish history, culture and heritage Discover Jewish artifacts and objects from Europe and North Africa and learn all about Judaism, its customs and traditions from a Jewish History Expert Guide!

The 2-hour option includes skip-the-line tickets to the Museum of the Art and History of Judaism, so you can enter as soon as you meet your Private Guide. The museum is located in the heart of the Marais district, which between the events of the French Revolution and the Second World War hosted one of Paris’ main Jewish communities. Inside, you will enjoy live commentary and excellent permanent and temporary exhibitions on the history of Jews in Europe and North Africa.

The Judaism collection includes religious objects, archives, manuscripts, and works of art. Among its treasures you’ll find The Cemetery Gate by Marc Chagall as well as paintings and sculptures by Jewish artists such as Amedeo Modigliani, Pascin, Chaim Soutine, Michel Kikoine, Jacques Lipschitz, and Chana Orloff. The unique exhibits will give you a new insight into Jewish culture and traditions.

The 3,5-hour option includes private transportation and skip-the-line tickets to the Museum of the Art and History of Judaism. Book private car transfers from your accommodation in advance to save time and effort. We will organize a 5-Stars Driver and a clean, air-conditioned vehicle for your pickup and drop–off at the address provided when booking. This option includes private transportation exclusively for your group of friends/family, so you don't have to worry about sharing with other tourists.

Choose the 4-hour option to enhance your visit to the Judaism museum with a walking tour of the Old Jewish Quarter in Paris. The museum is located in the heart of the Marais district, which during the years between the French Revolution and the Second World War hosted one of Paris’ main Jewish communities. During this tour, you will discover the story of the statue of Alfred Dreyfus, which commemorates a French-Jewish officer who was convicted of treason in 1894. You will also see 2 synagogues: Agoudas Hakehilos and the Tournelles, as well as many Jewish shops and kosher restaurants. The final stop will be at the Deportation Martyrs Memorial for the victims of the Holocaust.

Choose the 5,5-hour option to take advantage of private car transfers during your exclusive Jewish tour. Enjoy a convenient pickup from your Paris accommodation and transfer directly to the Judaism museum. At the end of the walking tour in the Old Jewish Quarter, your private driver will drive you back to the address provided when booking. This way you can enjoy a hassle-free experience and avoid overcrowded public transportation.

name: Paris: Hop-On Hop-Off Bus and River Cruise with Eiffel Tower
shortDescription: Discover Paris at your own pace with a 1 or 2-day hop-on-hop-off sightseeing bus pass. Head up to the Eiffel Tower's 2nd floor for a panoramic city view, cruise along the Seine River, and more.
description:
Explore Paris with a 24-hour or 48-hour hop-on-hop-off bus pass with ten stops. Travel to the second floor of the iconic Eiffel tower on a guided tour. Admire city sights like Notre-Dame from the water on a Seine River cruise. 
Start the tour by meeting your guide at the Eiffel Tower. You will be accompanied to the second floor by your guide to marvel at the spectacular views over Paris. You can also visit the summit if you booked the option. Discover Paris with a sense of freedom that group tours don’t provide.

Discover Paris on a 1 or 2-day pass on an open-top hop-on-hop-off sightseeing bus tour for panoramic views of sights throughout this sensational city. Hop off at strategic stops to visit iconic monuments such as the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre Museum. With the onboard audio guide, available in 8 languages, you’ll enjoy commentary about the city’s landmarks, from Napoleon’s Arc de Triomphe at the end of the Champs-Elysées, to the magnificent Opera Garnier.

Also included in this package is a 1-hour cruise on the Seine River, which you can take at any time during your stay. Admire the UNESCO-listed buildings lining the riverbanks, including the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, Notre-Dame de Paris, and the Conciergerie. Pass by charming houseboats and floating restaurants along the way. Back on land, you can continue sightseeing on the hop-on-hop-off bus tour. A full loop takes around 2.5 hours (without getting off), or you can hop off at any of these 10 stops:

• Eiffel Tower, Quai Branly (facing Pont d’Iéna)
• Champ de Mars, Avenue Joseph Bouvard
• Opéra Garnier, 15 Rue Scribe
• Louvre-Pyramide, Big Bus Information Center, 11 Avenue de l’Opéra
• Louvre-Pont des Arts (near Pont des Arts)
• Notre-Dame, Quai de Montebello (opposite Notre-Dame)
• Musée d'Orsay (opposite the Orsay Museum)
• Champs-Elysées, 156 Avenue des Champs-Elysées
• Grand Palais, Avenue Winston Churchill
• Trocadéro, Avenue Paul Doumer

name: Paris: 2-Hour Market Tour with Tastings
shortDescription: Visit the Marché d’Aligre in Paris with a local guide. Explore the indoor and outdoor food stalls and the treasures of the flea market. Meet vendors and taste chocolates, cheeses, and other products at one of the city’s most popular markets.
description:
Explore one of the most popular markets in Paris, and experience the daily life of a district that’s off the tourist track. Taste some of the freshest food products in the city during this 2-hour tour with a local guide.

Each of the shopkeepers you meet will spend some time with you sharing their passion and offering you samples of their products to taste.

The market’s location in the 12th arrondissement is not in a popular tourist area, but the Marché d’Aligre is one of the most popular markets for Parisians.

Experience 3 markets in one. There are indoor and outdoor food markets, as well as a flea market with all sorts of treasures on offer, from old gramophones to odd bits of crockery.

See the incredible seeds merchant that has been part of the market scene since 1895, the wide variety of cheese and chocolate shops, and more. Tastings are included!

name: Paris: Special Dates Dinner Cruise
shortDescription: Savor a delicious meal while watching night fall over Paris. Embark on a fabulous journey through the heart of the City of Light for an unforgettable Valentine's Day. Fall for the charm of the Seine River in a romantic, cosy atmosphere.
description:
Make this Valentine's Day one to remember with a dinner cruise on the famous River Seine. Enjoy a delicious French meal within a warm atmosphere as you pass by Paris' most beautiful monuments, including the Eiffel Tower. Soak up the sights and the company of your loved one as the sun sets on the City of Light. Enjoy a spectacular gastronomic experience from the onboard chef and crew.

• Sample menu for 6:45 PM Valentine's Day cruise:
Glass of sparkling wine with appetizers
Starter: foie gras and sour apple compote, small figs with cereals
Main course: veal slab, truffle juice, crispy polenta with parmesan cheese and hazelnut flakes
Dessert: coup de foudre au chocolat and vanilla ice cream
Drinks: Half-bottle of wine per person, either Saumur AOC white or Bergerac Château Lamouthe AOC red, and mineral water

• Sample menu for 9:30 PM Valentine's Day cruise:
Glass of Champagne with appetizers
Starter: foie gras and sour apple compote, small figs with cereals
Main course: veal slab, truffle juice, crispy polenta with parmesan cheese and hazelnut flakes
Cheese: plate of cheeses for 6€
Dessert: coup de foudre au chocolat and vanilla ice cream
Drinks: Half-bottle of Louis Constant Champagne per person and mineral water

name: Paris: Private Tour to Montmartre with Eiffel Tower & Lunch
shortDescription: Discover the culture and gastronomy of Paris on this private full-day tour. Visit Montmartre, Sacre Coeur, and have lunch, before admiring the most famous monument in the world: The Eiffel Tower.
description:
Discover the best of Paris in a full-day private tour, and admire its culture, gastronomy, and history. Let your local host take you to the most iconic places in the city, avoiding the crowds.
Visit the wonderful Montmartre district, the most bohemian neighborhood in Paris, where painters, cafes, and locals gather. Take the picturesque funicular railway and reach the top of the neighborhood.
Explore its colorful streets, its fascinating cemetery, the famous Basilica of Sacre Coeur, and even have a coffee in the most famous cafeteria in Paris, the scene of the movie 'Amelie’.
Walk through the beautiful Tuileries Gardens, to the Place de la Concorde, where Marie Antoinette was beheaded, among many other characters of Parisian history.
Discover the unmissable highlights of the city, such as the Grand Palais/Petit Palais, and Pont Alexandre III. Get the best views of Les Invalides, originally created by Napoleon as a royal residence for retired French soldiers and military.
Before the end of this fantastic day, your private host will guide you to get your tickets to visit the most famous monument in the world: the Eiffel Tower. Get all the ideas you need to make the most of your time exploring the city of lights!

name: From Paris: Versailles Palace And Garden Small Group Tour
shortDescription: Escape the city life of Paris and find royal adventure at the royal Palace of Versailles. This 3-hour tour includes train tickets from Paris to Versailles, a detailed tour of the palace and free time to explore the gardens.
description:
Explore the royal Palace of Versailles on a 3-hour tour from Paris. Trace the footsteps of royalty as you discover one of the most lavish palaces in the world.

You’ll meet your guide in Paris and travel to Versailles by train. Learn about the construction of one of the most famous palaces in the world from your knowledgeable guide. Explore the many apartments that make up the royal residences, and see the famous Hall of Mirrors.

After you’ve seen the beautiful palace with your guide, you will have time to walk through the lushous 2,000 acres of gardens. Your guide will provide you with your return train tickets and leave you to explore the gardens at your own pace. To create these manicured gardens, thousands of trees were imported from all over France. When you are ready, you will return to Paris by train.

name: Paris 90-Minute Street Art Tour
shortDescription: Take in some of the highlights of Paris's thriving street art scene on this guided walking tour of the most interesting neighborhoods in the city. Learn about the different techniques and the many artists that are transforming the French capital.
description:
On this 90-minute tour in 2 different arrondissements, your guide will show you highlights of Paris's street art scene, which has been rapidly expanding in recent years.

Discover pieces including ephemeral art, and learn about the different techniques employed by the artists, including stencils, graffiti and posters.

During this guided walk you’ll explore parts of the 19th and 20th arrondissements and visit the main street art sites in the French capital. Passing through Belleville, you’ll cross the rue Denoyez and admire its impressive space with graffiti-covered walls.

See another side of Paris on this fascinating glimpse into the city’s thriving urban art scene.

name: Paris: Perfume Discovery Workshop
shortDescription: Accompanied by an expert, discover the architecture and essence of a fragrance. You'll learn about the ingredients that make it up and how they complement each other, and will even have the chance to design your own scent.
description:
Throughout more than 170 years of history, five generations of perfumers have succeeded one another with the aim of creating a legacy of strong values. This has lead to the modern-day perfume scene which consists of luxury, authenticity, tradition, and modernity.

This is your chance to experience one of only three perfumers in France which are certified as a “living heritage company”, guaranteeing you a rare and ancestral know-how session. You will discover each step of the perfume creation process, including the origin of the flowers, methods of extraction, maceration, and nose laboratory.

Accompanied by an expert guide, discover the architecture of a fragrance, including the ingredients that make it up and how they match and complement one another.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Summit Floor Ticket & Seine River Cruise
shortDescription: Enjoy direct access tickets to the Eiffel Tower summit floor. Be amazed at the views from the top of the tower, and enjoy a boat tour on the Seine at any time during your stay in Paris.
description:
See Paris's most famous sights with this combined Eiffel Tower ticket and Seine river cruise experience. Benefit from assisted fast-track entrance, then explore Paris’ Iron Lady on your own up to the summit floor.
Your ticket includes a 1-hour cruise on the Seine river, available at any time during your stay. Admire the UNESCO-listed buildings lining the riverbanks, including the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, Notre-Dame de Paris, and the Conciergerie. Pass by floating houseboats and restaurants along the way.

name: Paris: UNESCO Headquarters Tour
shortDescription: Discover the headquarters of one of the most prestigious international organizations: UNESCO. Explore the agency's extensive art collection. Gain insights into the UN's history and present operations.
description:
Located in the 7th arrondissement of Paris, the UNESCO House has been home to the headquarters of this specialized agency of the United Nations (UN) since 1958. A treasure of modern architecture, it is the result of a collaboration among several emblematic figures of the twentieth century, including the architects Bernard Zehrfuss, Marcel Breuer, and Luigi Nervi.

This guided tour, which focuses on the actions and impact of the United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization, will allow you to discover its operations as well as its values. Accompanied by your guide, you will pass through the institution's iconic spaces, such as its impressive conference rooms, walkways, concrete corridors, the only Japanese garden in Paris, and its meditation space designed by the famous Japanese architect Tadao Ando.

This guided tour will also be an opportunity to discover the exceptional works of art housed in UNESCO House: from Miró to Picasso, from Giacometti to Calder, a unique and unexpected collection of more than 600 contemporary masterpieces unfolds along the way. Whether you are interested in UNESCO's missions, passionate about art and architecture, or simply want to know how this famous organization works, this guided tour in the heart of Paris will arouse your curiosity and inspire.

name: Orly Airport Shared Shuttle Transfer Service
shortDescription: Take the worry out of your arrival or departure from Orly Airport and save money with a shared shuttle transfer service to or from hotels in Paris city center by comfortable minibus.
description:
Save money and the worry of booking a taxi last minute with a shared shuttle transfer to or from Orly Airport. Get picked up from your accommodation in Paris city center and relax in comfort on the 1 to 1.5-hour drive.

Benefit from a meet and greet from your driver in the arrivals hall after landing, and relax in the knowledge that there will be no more than 3 stops en route to pick-up other passengers.

Avail of a service that operates 24 hours a day, 7 days a week and is ready whatever time your flight is scheduled. Avoid the stress of public transportation with heavy bags and get safely dropped off at your final destination.

name: From Paris: Versailles and Giverny Full-Day Trip
shortDescription: Discover two of the most iconic homes and gardens in French culture on this small group day trip from Paris. Explore King Louis the 14th Palace and outstanding French Gardens in Versailles, then roam the artistic gardens of Claude Monet.
description:
Get insight into some of the most famous figures in French history, their lives and how they liked to live. Giverny and Versailles are less than a 1 hour drive west of Paris, so combining them both into one day trip is easy and relaxed.

This tour starts with the calm and almost other worldly beauty of Claude Monet’s Home and Gardens in Giverny. Learn about the famous Impressionist artist and then enjoy free time to explore inside his vibrantly colored home, stroll along the charming paths of his flower garden, and admire the water garden with the little green bridge and lake full of his famous water lilies.

In the afternoon the guide will share the scandals surrounding the French Revolution and Marie-Antoinette during your visit to the Royal Domain of Versailles. You will enjoy Skip-the-line access into the Palace itself and have free time to explore inside with an audio-guide.
