Visit the Royal Apartments, the stunning Hall of Mirrors, and then wander through the famously organized French Gardens. When the Palace tour is finished, enjoy an easy transfer back into Paris, having accomplished the country side.

name: Paris: Private Speakeasy and Hidden Bar Tour
shortDescription: Answer riddles and spot hidden passages to access some of Paris' most unique bars. Explore local spots with a local guide while enjoying good drinks, good people, and a fun atmosphere.
description:
Discover a variety of Parisian bars and speakeasies on a guided tour.

Each bar has a different atmosphere and vibe. Some bars have hidden passageways, hidden doors you will pass through, secret shots, some require passwords for entry while others are only accessible by invitations.

name: Private tour of Paris by Night with Champagne
shortDescription: Discover the charms of Paris by night on a 1-hour tour in a classic convertible Citroen 2CV. Drive down the famous Champs Elysees, and see the Eiffel Tower’s glittering lights as you sip on complimentary Champagne.
description:
Experience Paris at night by taking a tour through the City of Lights in a vintage Citroen 2CV. An icon of the French motor industry, the idiosyncratic 2CV was built from 1948 until 1990, and sets hearts a-flutter with its instantly recognizable design. Paris is known as the City of Lights because it was the first city in Europe to begin lighting its streets with gas lamps in 1828.

Your personal driver will collect you from your hotel, or any other central Paris location, and drive down the Champs Elysees, to the beautiful Arc de Triomphe. Gaze at the marvelous Eiffel Tower, even more impressive at night when it is completely lit-up in a rainbow of illuminations. Pass the Louvre, continue to Notre Dame Cathedral, and the Opera Garnier.

Next, head for the bohemian district of Montmartre, known for its artistic and laid-back atmosphere. Here you will see the magnificent Basilica of the Sacre Coeur, featured in the hit movie Amelie. The tour includes a complimentary bottle of Champagne to make your visit of Paris even more memorable, and more quintessentially French!

name: From Paris: Day Trip to Giverny & Versailles
shortDescription: Enjoy an audio guided or guided all day tour to Giverny and Versailles from Paris including lunch. You will enjoy Giverny :Claude Monet's Former Home as well as the amazing Gardens and Versailles Royal Apartment and its gardens at your own pace.
description:
Take a fascinating excursion to 2 of the most impressive symbols of French culture, and discover the complex and rich history behind their walls.

Start your excursion from Paris to Giverny with an audio guide or a guide (depending on option selected), a quaint village in Normandy that attracted several impressionist painters throughout the 19th century. See the home of Claude Monet, and be inspired by the touch of color and charm that influenced his work.

Explore the colorful garden whose lilies, weeping willows, and flowerbeds are a vivid reminder of his masterful works. You will then enjoy a traditional lunch before visiting the stunning site of the Palace of Versailles. You will discover the masterful combination of classic and baroque architectural styles. Take a stroll through the beautiful gardens, walk by the hall of mirrors, and visit the Grands Appartements to get a sense of the grandeur that surrounded King Louis XIV. You will return back to Paris at around 6.00 pm.

name: Paris: Heart of Paris Private Boat Tour with Bottle of Wine
shortDescription: Cruise through the heart of Paris on board a unique boat. Sip on wine as you admire views of the Eiffel Tower, sail past the Ile de la Cité island, and glide under Pont Alexandre III bridge.
description:
Explore Paris from the Seine river on this 2020-model boat with a high-end sound system. Listen to music and enjoy a glass of wine as you drift through Paris. Watch the city's highlights like the Eiffel tower and Notre Dame pass by. 
Hop aboard your private boat at the Seine river meeting point and sit back and relax with some wine. Catch a glimpse of the Notre Dame cathedral as you pass the island of Ile de la Cité. Admire the old churches and hotels on the island of Ile Saint Louis.
Snap pictures of the Eiffel tower from unique angles. Feel the thrill of passing under to the Pont Alexandre III bridge. Get lost in the romance of the city as you navigate through stunning historical monuments on the river.

name: Paris: Openair Double Decker Bus Audio-Guided City Tour
shortDescription: See the best sites of Paris aboard a double-decker bus with panoramic windows. Listen to expert commentary as you admire the highlights of Paris.
description:
Discover the best sights of Paris on a panoramic 1.75-hour bus tour, with a knowledgeable guide. The tour takes you on a whirlwind drive around Paris, as you listen to expert commentary, available in French, English, Spanish, German, Italian, Portuguese, Dutch, Swedish, Korean, Russian, Greek, Japanese, Danish, and Mandarin Chinese.

Watch major attractions go by, from the comfort of an air-conditioned, enclosed double-decker bus. Admire Opera Square, and the Obelisk of Place de la Concorde. Cruise down the Champs Elysees, and see the Arc de Triomphe.  Discover the Paris of the Parisians and travel through time with your Histopad. Thanks to its interactive functionalities, this new immersive city tour will allow you to understand the history of Paris and its architecture over the centuries. Visit the most famous neighborhoods and monuments of the capital, from the Opera Garnier to the Eiffel Tower.

Then, view the Eiffel Tower as it soars over Trocadero Square. Discover Les Invalides, Pont Neuf, Bastille Square, and the Luxembourg Gardens. Experience the grandeur of Notre Dame Cathedral.

name: Paris: Private Transfer to/from Orly Airport
shortDescription: Book a private transfer service between Paris and Orly Airport. Hop aboard a car or minivan with comfortable seats, air conditioning, and a wide trunk. Enjoy 24-hour customer support and the best value for your money.
description:
Forget the stress of reaching your hotel or getting to the airport by booking a private transfer between Orly Airport and Paris, or vice versa. This transfer service promises the best bang for your buck and is available everyday from 4:00 AM until midnight (excluding December 24 and 31, when it's available until 6:00 PM).

Upon arrival at Orly Airport, meet your driver and enjoy a comfortable and relaxing transfer service to your hotel or apartment at Paris. Your driver will take care of you and will bring you to your destination in total comfort and safety.

If you need a transfer for your departing flight from Orly Airport following a stay in Paris, book this service to the airport from your hotel. All you need to do is relax and enjoy the scenery along the way.

name: Paris: Musée de Montmartre and Gardens Entry Ticket
shortDescription: Discover this charming museum in the iconic Montmartre district. Discover characteristic pieces of art and enjoy a great view from the Gardens.
description:
Immerse yourself in the history of Montmartre and its rich culture. Skip the ticket line and go directly to the museum which was once a meeting point and house for many artists. Discover the permanent collection and experience the montmate vibe.

With your audio guide, learn about the rich history of Montmartre from the 19th century and when it was annexed to the city of Paris. From this moment on, the city imposed itself on the countryside of Montmartre.

Artists started to move to Montmartre in 1870 and the cafes and cabarets multiplied in the 1880’s. Montmartre quickly became a place filled with effervescent bohemian spirit and creative energy.

The most celebrated cabaret, the Chat Noir, welcomed several performances of the Théâtre d’Ombres, shadow theatre, created in 1866 by Henri Rivière and Henry Somm.

Theatre, music, circus and dance all had a role in Montmartre. All of Paris came to listen to Aristide Bruant or Yvette Guilbert recite their texts or attend a performance by La Goulue, La Môme Fromage ou Grille d’Egouts, 3 dancers at the Moulin Rouge. Toulouse-Lautrec was one of the more assiduous artists in representing these performances.

This effervescent bohemian spirit was also present in the artists’ studios: 12 Cortot witnessed the passage of several, most of whom lovingly painted their residence. 

The museum also offers temporary exhibitions.

The duration of the audio tour is 90 minutes but you are welcome to stay and explore the museum at your own pace.

name: Versailles: Palace Trip by Motorcycle with Sidecar
shortDescription: Enjoy a ride out to Versailles in the sidecar of a motorcycle. Once there, discover the full grounds with your guide as you see the Palace to the Hamlet before pausing for lunch by the Grand Canal.
description:
You will be picked up in Paris and driven through scenic Parisian suburbs to the Palace of Versailles. The Palace gently comes into view and after parking in front, you will enter with a timed ticket allowing to skip the main line.

An audio-guide is included, but your tour guide will also accompany you through the hour-long tour of the Palace.

After the main Palace, you will be brought to the market of Versailles where together with your guide you will choose a picnic lunch to enjoy on the Grand Canal, and soak up the view of the grounds and the Palace.

Hopping back into the sidecar, we zip along to a quick restroom stop before entering the Trianon Domaine to walk off the copious picnic lunch.

Spying Marie Antoinette's Temple of Love from her bedroom window, you will also explore the the Queen's Hamlet, where she would delight in distancing herself from the rigours of court life.

Upon exiting the Trianon Domaine, you're back in the sidecar for a relaxing return to Paris to be dropped of where you started, on the Pont Bir Hakeim. Other more convenient drop-off locations can be considered if not too far.

name: Paris: Moulin Rouge Christmas Dinner and Show with Souvenir
shortDescription: Immerse yourself in the magical atmosphere of the Moulin Rouge this Christmastime. Marvel at the Féerie show while enjoying a special French menu.
description:
Spend an evening during the Christmas season in the magical atmosphere of the Moulin Rouge Paris, entry tickets included. Enjoy a performance of the cabaret show, Féerie, paired with a holiday feast of traditional French cuisine. Take home a gift to celebrate your night.
Enter Moulin Rouge and watch as a troupe of 100 artists parades in flamboyant costumes of feathers, rhinestones, and sequins. Marvel at the intricate set designs and enjoy the music performed by 80 musicians and 60 choral singers.
Savor a Christmas dinner featuring a traditional French appetizer, starter, main course, and dessert. Along with your meal, enjoy a half-bottle of Laurent-Perrier La Cuvée champagne and a Mouline Rouge souvenir per couple.

Dinner Menu
Amuse-bouche (appetizer):
• Small half-smoked salmon filet, crab tarama, and wakame salad

Starter:
• Raw marinated scallops, a variety of cabbage in various textures, and caviar

or

• Half-cooked duck foie gras, shavings of homemade duck ham, apple fruit, curly salad with truffle vinaigrette, and gingerbread from Frédéric Lalos (French Craftsperson of the Year in Baking)

Main course:
• Sea bass filet cooked at low temperature, wilted spinach and lobster salpicon, potato gnocchis, and American sauce

or

• Filet of farm poultry in a Rossini style, brioche crumble, roasted salsify, parsnip mousseline, and meat sauce with duck foie gras and black truffles

Dessert:
• Mont blanc filled with blackcurrant, truffled chestnut cream, and Madagascar vanilla chantilly cream

name: Shuttle Service Between Disneyland Paris and CDG/ORY
shortDescription: Get your ticket in advance for the regular shuttle service between CDG and ORY airports and Disneyland Paris. Travel on this easy and safe service in a comfortable coach with free WiFi. Transfers are also available from Disneyland to the airports.
description:
Enjoy a comfortable Magical Shuttle transfer between Charles de Gaulle (CDG) or Orly (ORY) and your Disneyland Paris hotel or another hotel in the surrounding area.

Expect a comfortable ride in a coach equipped with free WiFi on board. From CDG Airport, coach shuttles depart every 45 minutes from 09:00 AM to 18:45 PM to Disneyland Resort hotels, Serris-Val d’Europe and selected hotels. There is a dedicated desk (between 2E and 2F) with greeters to welcome you. Boarding is at Terminal 1.

From Orly Airport (ORY), the shuttle departs every hour from 09:00 AM to 18:45 PM to all Disney hotels. You can always disembark at the Disneyland bus station and transfer to the park’s own shuttle service, which runs every 15 to 20 minutes between all area hotels and the parks.

The Magical Shuttle operates 7 days per week. Please check your hotel reception or tourist board information for return scheduled departure times. Note that on your return journey, it is best to schedule your shuttle departure at least 2.5 hours before your airport check-in time.

name: Paris: Guided Louvre Visit and 2nd Floor Eiffel Tower Visit
shortDescription: Take a full-day tour of Paris with a visit to the Louvre. Followed by a small cruise to the Eiffel Tower. Enjoy a guided tour of the Eiffel Tower and take in the views of Paris from the Second Floor.
description:
Come and visit Paris, the city of lights, and discover its most treasured sights on a full-day excursion along the Seine river. We'll open your eyes to delightful little facts and the history of this beautiful city in a fun day that includes a visit to the Louvre. Visit the Eiffel Tower with your guide and see Paris from the Second Floor of the Eiffel Tower.

You'll begin in the heart of the Louvre museum. Believed by many to be one of the best museums in the world, this exquisite collection of art can overwhelm the visitor. Your guide will help to make sense of its hundreds of rooms and exhibits by showing you the most important paintings and sculptures. Your expert guide can answer any questions you may have, and your visit will be well rewarded with looks into the museum's amazing collection.

Then, board the river shuttle to head down the Seine towards the Eiffel Tower. Your visit to the Eiffel Tower includes access to the second floor with a guide.

name: Paris : Welcome Walking Tour with a Seine River Cruise
shortDescription: Your Tour Guide will welcome you in Paris at the Trocadero square for an 1H Walking and then you will explore Paris on a 1H Seine Cruise River with audio commentary in many languages.
description:
Meet your guide at your arrival in Paris on the Trocadero square, a mythical place with an impressive view of the Eiffel Tower.
Your guide will talk to you at length about this monument which today is the symbol of Paris and was built for the Universal Exhibition of 1889 by the engineer Gustave Eiffel.
Then he will tell you about the different monuments that can be seen from the Trocadero square, you will then pass through the Trocadero gardens and its fountains towards the Eiffel Tower where you will have a time to take unforgettable photos with a spectacular view.
Afterwardsę your guide will accompany you to take the boat for a 1H commented cruise on the Seine to discover Paris and its bridges and museums in another way.
These will undoubtedly be unforgettable moments so don't forget your camera.

name: Paris: Urban Art Murals Walking Tour with an Expert
shortDescription: Learn about the neo-muralism movement as you contemplate the walls painted by the greatest muralists from all over the world with the guidance of a local expert.
description:
Learn about the neo-muralism movement as you contemplate the massive artworks painted by the greatest muralists from all over the world. With the help of passionate professional who has been studying this movement inside out for a minimum of 6 years, learn how the movement developed in Paris and hear the stories behind the murals on the walls.

While concentrating on pieces commissioned by the town hall of Paris' 13th arrondissement and initiated thanks to multiple galleries and projects including Boulevard Paris 13 by Galerie Itinerrance and Seres Queridos, your guide will present you with some of the most influential contemporary artists including Obey, C215, and Jorge Rodriguez-Gerada. You’ll learn about different techniques that are being used on the streets and hear lots of little-known facts along the way.

name: Paris: Montmartre Train Ride w/ Optional Seine River Cruise
shortDescription: Ride through picturesque Montmartre on a miniature train to see landmarks like Sacré-Cœur, Moulin Rouge, and Cabaret Au Lapin Agile. Enjoy exquisite views of Paris on an optional Seine River cruise.
description:
Discover the charming Montmartre neighborhood while riding a small-scale train with hop-on hop-off privileges past historic sites and venues including Sacré-Cœur Basilica, Moulin Rouge, and Lapin Agile. Take a relaxing trip along Paris' Seine River during an optional sightseeing boat cruise.
Board the train at Pigalle Metro Station and begin your journey along the cobblestone streets of the 18th arrondissement while French music plays in the background. Ride past the awe-inspiring Sacré-Cœur and one of the oldest surviving churches in the city, Saint-Pierre de Montmartre.
Prepare yourself for breathtaking views overlooking Paris as you approach the summit of the hilltop. Feel the Bohemian atmosphere while noticing local painters behind their easels and eclectic shop window displays. Understand why famous artists like Picasso were so inspired by this part of the city.
Make your way toward the renowned Moulin Rouge and Au Lapin Agile cabarets, which you can admire from aboard the train. See the outside of the Cemetery of Montmartre as well as the tucked-away Clos Montmartre vineyard.
Explore sites on your own by getting off the train at any of the stops it makes and reboard when you are ready. Book an optional narrated cruise along the Seine River for a relaxing way to take in views of Parisian landmarks such as the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, and Notre-Dame.
The train ride lasts approximately 30 minutes while the optional river cruise lasts 1 hour.

name: Paris: 1.5-Hour Private Kick-Start Tour with a Local
shortDescription: Launch your time in Paris with a 1.5-hour private introductory tour by a local who will show you the best way how to enjoy the city.
description:
Receive a warm welcome to Paris with a private tour that will kick off your time in the city in the best way possible. Discover main attractions and landmarks like Notre Dame and Jardin du Luxembourg in only 90 minutes.
Get up-to-date tips on where locals like to grab a bite and unwind, or what about a unique family-owned restaurant in a local hotspot? On this private tour, your local guide will make sure you see Paris like a local.
Your guide will have all your questions covered and will give you a city orientation to get you acquainted with Paris to help you enjoy the rest of your stay to the fullest.

name: Paris: Gourmet Food Tour with Optional Lunch & Wine Tasting
shortDescription: Take a tour through the city’s vibrant food quarter! Sample a range of fresh, local produce from the many shops and stalls. Opt to add lunch and a flight of wine to complete your gourmet experience.
description:
Discover the vibrant neighborhood of Les Halles, which was formerly known as the 'the stomach of Paris' because it was home to a huge wholesale food market. See how nowadays, this district is still a must-visit spot for food enthusiasts, since it features a wide variety of gastronomic specialty stores and restaurants, alongside kitchen supply stores.

Meet your passionate foodie guide and set off together to explore the local boutiques. Start with classic pastries in a boulangerie, followed by a visit to the city’s oldest patisserie, founded in 1730. Also, try samples of artisanal cheeses in a traditional fromagerie and delicious cured meats from a charcuterie. Admire many specialist food shops - butchers, fishmongers, and vegetable markets, as you amble through the lively streets. 

Then, if you choose the option with lunch, join the local Parisians by having a fresh authentic French lunch at the end of your tour, picking out your favorite foods along the way. You also have the option to end the tour in an award-winning wine bar. Here, pair your foodie discoveries with a flight of top-class wines served by an expert sommelier.

name: Small-Group Canadian Normandy D-Day Juno Beach from Paris
shortDescription: Retrace the footsteps of the Canadian troops who fought for the liberation of France on this small group day trip to Juno Beach and the D-Day sites of Normandy.
description:
On June 6th, 1944 the largest seaborne invasion ever attempted in history took place. The Allied troops waged an extremely difficult attack on the German forces who were entrenched in bunkers along the coast of Normandy. 
More than 14,000 Canadian soldiers landed or parachuted into France on that day. Though the soldiers knew that they were fighting against the odds they carried on with courage and helped to win the battle for Normandy.

During this insightful tour, you will take a guided journey through many of the historical landmarks that are pivotal to this moment in history. 
Take a walk on Juno Beach, just like the Canadian troops did in 1944, you can walk on the same sand they did on that very day. 
Whilst at Juno Beach, your guide will take you to see Juno Beach Center, the most comprehensive museum about the Canadian landings in Normandy. 
Visit the Canadian Cemetery in Beny-sur-Mer. There, stroll through the beautiful cemetery whilst paying your respects to the fallen Canadian soldiers. 
Also see "Hell's Corner," the furthest advance inland taken by Canadian troops on D-Day, 5-miles from the city of Caen. You'll also be able to see Abbey d'Ardenne, a HQ point for the nazis.
Whether you’re a great admirer of military history or someone who is just curious about how the events really played out on D-Day, this tour will help you better appreciate the remarkable acts of courage that took place on Juno Beach. 
For they are well worth learning about and being remembered by all free folk today.

name: Paris by Vintage Motorbike Sidecar
shortDescription: Experience Paris from a different perspective aboard an authentic sidecar of a vintage motorbike. Discover the city secrets as a gentleman driver takes you through little-known streets. Hear unusual and astonishing anecdotes on an unforgettable voyage.
description:
Hop aboard a vintage motorbike sidecar and explore Paris on 3 wheels. Let your driver/guide worry about the traffic as you journey in style. Pass some of the city's iconic monuments and drive along the most prestigious avenues in the world. Travel back in time as you encounter lesser-known heritage sites on small streets and back alleys. Hear entertaining - and often saucy - anecdotes for each secret place you will ride past.

Retro Classic Tour:
Take a 40-minute ride across Paris, passing the main sights such as the Avenue Champs-Elysées, Arc de Triomphe and Eiffel Tower. Marvel at the Champs de Mars, Les Invalides and more. 

Great Escape Tour:
Experience the charm of the French capital on a 1.5-hour sidecar tour. Benefit from the knowledge and experience of your driver/guide as they bring the city to life before your eyes. Choose from 3 different themes/locations: "Bohemian Paris," "Île de la Cité" or the "Latin Quarter."

Retro Night Tour:
Soak up the romance and magic of the "City of Light" by night. See Paris under the moon and stars and by the glow of the street lamps. Get perfect views from a vehicle with no roof or window to obstruct you or spoil the photo stops. Ideal for romancers, libertines and boulevardiers, the intimate tour with courteous driver includes a glass of Champagne in front of the Eiffel Tower.

name: Discover the Heart of Paris by Bike
shortDescription: Uncover the hidden treasures of Paris, impossible to reach by bus or car. During this bike tour, you'll be shown the Paris that Parisians know, home to secret architectural gems and other details you'd never have expected.
description:
Starting from the Beaubourg area, jump aboard your bike and set off on a discovery of the historical center of Paris located on the right-hand side of the River Seine. Begin the tour in the hip Marais quarter with a visit to Village Saint Paul, a village in the center of the city. You'll also get the opportunity to visit the most beautiful of all the royal squares in the capital - the Place des Vosges with its prominent residents.

Cycle past the Picasso Museum before enjoying a break at one of the oldest markets in Paris. Your tour guide will tell you more about the controversial Buren's Columns at the Palais-Royal as well as the glass pyramid in the main courtyard of the Louvre. Your tour will finish on the unmissable Seine Islands, the Ile de la Cité (where Notre-Dame stands) and Ile Saint-Louis.

name: Paris: Louvre Highlights 2 hour Skip the Line Guided Tour
shortDescription: See the best of the Louvre in just 2 hours with a skip-the-ticket-line entrance.
description:
Experience the Louvre, a must-see in Paris, not just for its incredible art but for the history held within its walls. This was once a palace where princes rode their horses up and down the hallways; a sprawling complex fortified to protect the first family of France. 
Go beyond the obvious on the Louvre Highlights Tour, peering behind the artworks to unlock their secrets.
See famous French works like Géricault’s ‘Raft of Medusa,' which depicts the true story of shipwrecked sailors driven to cannibalism. Admire da Vinci’s ‘Mona Lisa’ on your tour, as well. 
At the sculpture gallery, encounter another Italian in Michelangelo’s ‘Slaves’; plus Anthony Canova’s incredibly romantic ‘Psyche Revived by Cupid’s Kiss.’
Get a sense for that other use of the Louvre, as a royal palace. With your guide on hand, see the beautiful ceiling panels and explore a special room filled with crown jewels. As you explore, have headsets to help you hear your guide and to ensure that you don’t get lost. 
Traveling in a small group of just 20 people or fewer (including you), means you’ll also find them easier to interact with and question. All the better since they have all the answers. The best, most qualified licensed guides to lead this Louvre tour. 
Skip the ticket line and enjoy this short (but sweet) adventure into the heart of French art and history.

name: Market Visit and Cooking Class with a Parisian Chef
shortDescription: Learn how to find fresh ingredients at the local French market and prepare a full course meal. Indulge in delicious, gourmet food and pick up hints and tips from your Chef.
description:
Learn how to find high quality, freshly sourced food in the market with your Parisian Chef. Then take part in a culinary class where you will use your ingredients to cook a full course meal of entrée, main course, and dessert.

Take part in an exciting, engaging, and informative cooking class and learn how to cook with fresh, local produce. All levels of cooking experience are welcome, as your experienced chef promises simple recipes which can be remade at home.

The course is offered in the morning between 09:15 and 13:45 from Tuesday to Saturday and participants will of course have the opportunity to taste as well as cook!

name: Paris: Guided Eiffel Tower Tour, Arc de Triomphe and Cruise
shortDescription: Experience the fascinating views of the Eiffel Tower, either from the second floor or the summit along with an English-speaking guide. Then, with your open tickets, visit the Arc de Triomphe and take a 1-hour Seine River cruise any time you like.
description:
See the best of Paris with this tour combining a guided Eiffel Tower visit with tickets to the Arc de Triomphe as well as a river cruise. Accompany your guide to the Eiffel Tower and visit the second floor, with an option to visit the summit. Then, use your Arc de Triomphe and river cruise tickets on any other day before their expiration.  

The Eiffel Tower offers panoramic views of the city—see iconic monuments such as the golden dome of les Invalides and the remains of Notre Dame de Paris. Enjoy a bird’s eye view of the Egyptian obelisk at Place de la Concorde and the magnificent roof of the Grand Palais. If you select the summit option on booking, ascend even higher to see out past the city entirely, and check this activity off your bucket list.  

Then, within 3 months of purchase, board a panoramic river boat for a 1-hour cruise along the Seine River that starts from the base of the Eiffel Tower, with service that runs every 30 to 60 minutes. See some of Paris’s iconic monuments closer up on this relaxing tour through the city.  

You’ll also receive open tickets to visit the Arc de Triomphe, a neoclassical monument built in the ancient Roman style. Located at the center of the city, the view from the top is absolutely worth it—see the streets radiate out from this center point in a star-shaped pattern. At the base, visit the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, which pays tribute to the 1.3 million French soldiers who died during the First World War. Observe the eternal flame being lit at 6:30 PM every night and wander the exhibition that explains the symbolic importance of this monument.

name: Paris Night Bicycle Tour & River Cruise
shortDescription: Explore Paris at night on a bike tour of the “City of Lights” under its evening illuminations. Cycle past city attractions, such as the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame, before enjoying a boat cruise along the River Seine, with complimentary wine.
description:
Take an evening tour of Paris and see the “City of Lights” with its heavenly night-time illuminations. Departing from the Eiffel Tower, the 4-hour tour includes a bike ride past many of Paris’s top attractions, including the Louvre, Academie Française, and Notre Dame Cathedral.

Free bike rentals with helmets are included in the cost of the tour, along with a knowledgeable guide who will take you down Paris’s romantic streets in a leisurely fashion. You will experience the “City of Lights” at it’s best, just as the evening lights come on.

Enjoy a 1-hour boat cruise along the beautiful River Seine. Enjoy free wine as you float past the Hotel de Ville, Musée D'Orsay, and much more.

The night tour is a perfect complement to the day tour, and provides a great evening’s entertainment as you experience Paris as it comes alive at night. Also stop at a classic ice cream parlor to enjoy a refreshing frosty treat.

name: Paris: Marmottan Monet Museum Skip-the-Line Guided Visit
shortDescription: Enjoy a small-group guided visit to the Marmottan Monet Museum in Paris with a professional guide. See the largest collection of Monet paintings in the world with 94 paintings and 29 drawings including the famous Water Lilies and Impression Sunrise.
description:
Enjoy a small-group guided visit to discover this beautiful museum. Join your guide at the entrance to explore this incredible museum, previously a hunting lodge. During this small group visit you will discover Impressionists masterpieces by famous artists including Renoir, Monet, Morisot, Gauguin, Corot and Manet.

Discover the breathtaking Impression Sunrise, Monet's painting that gave its name to the Impressionist movement. Browse the sumptuous collection of Berthe Morisot's work. Enjoy her delicate feminine touch that she dedicated to painting her daughter and her childhood. Finish your visit with the water-lily room, a subject so dear to Monet.

name: Paris: Guided tour of Le Marais, Paris's Gay Neighborhood
shortDescription: Explore Le Marais, known as the gay neighborhood of Paris, and learn about local LGBTQ+ history and culture from a knowledgeable guide. Admire the historic buildings and trendy boutiques as you hear about the best LGBT shops, restaurants, and bars around.
description:
On this unique 2.5-hour tour your guide will show you the best of Paris's lively gay neighborhood, Le Marais. This tour, available from April through October, has an evening start time to allow you to enjoy a relaxed walking tour, and you may choose to stay and enjoy the vibrant nightlife of the Marais at the end of the tour.

Although it is one of the oldest areas of Paris, the Marais' history as a gay neighborhood began in the 1980s. Travel through the decades as you enjoy a delightful mix of historic architecture and chic boutiques. Hear about some of the best shopping, restaurants and other venues that are welcoming LGBT visitors from around the world.

As you walk along the charming streets of the Marais, your guide will share with you their extensive knowledge of Paris's LGBT community and the important people and places that have made both the city and the Marais world-famous gay-friendly destinations.

The tour includes a stop for a snack at a popular local bakery.

name: Lifestyle Tour Around the Louvre
shortDescription: Take a walk through one of Paris' most beautiful neighborhoods with your local and knowledgeable guide who will open the door to these seemingly imposing stores and buildings. Learn the history, and imagine yourself as a part of the royalty!
description:
Paris brings to mind many wonderful things. The city of lights, strolling by the Seine, sipping wine in a cafe, and luxuriating in an oh-so-decadent croissant. Today we will take a "lifestyle tour" around the Louvre, and you will get a sense of the pleasures of the upper-classes in this neighborhood for the past centuries. We'll have a chance to visit the upscale fashion boutiques, famed for their haute-couture and cutting edge styles. We'll stroll through the decadent hotels and dream about the opulent jewelers that line these streets. Your guide will help open the door to these sometimes imposing seeming locations, and you'll learn about the major historical facts and stories that have happened in this gem of an area.

As we wander up the boulevards, you'll begin to get a sense of what royalty must feel like, and your guide will take you step by step along the way. We'll walk up the charming Rue de Rivoli, and get to see a variety of shops sleeted for their quality and originality.

To top off the experience, we'll enjoy two luxury gourmet shop tastings, where you will get to take a bite out of the finer things in life, enjoying your Paris vacation like royalty!

name: Paris: Seine Cruise and Eiffel Tower District Walking Tour
shortDescription: Enjoy the best of Paris with your family, friends, or as a couple with this unforgettable cruise on the Seine and audio-guided walking tour through the Eiffel Tower district.
description:
Enjoy the best of Paris with your family, friends, or as a couple with this unique combo of two activities: an unforgettable 1-hour cruise on the Seine and a 1-hour Eiffel Tower district audio-guided walking tour.

Start your walking tour by following the voice of a local guide on your smartphone. The voice on your phone will accompany you from the sumptuous Place du Trocadéro to Jena bridge. Discover the incredible story of the Eiffel Tower, also known as the Iron Lady that has watched over the city for more than 130 years.

After walking, experience a guided cruise aboard one of the legendary Vedettes de Paris boats. Embark on a fresh look at Paris starting from the Eiffel Tower, passing by Notre Dame and other famous treasures of the Seine. Listen to your guide share anecdotes regarding the City of Light as you sail along the Seine.

You can start your walk whenever you want, alone or with others. Once purchased, your smartphone tour is available for life. As for the cruise, the boat is ready to welcome you every day, and tickets are available one year after purchase.

name: Paris: Flyover Paris in VR & Self-Guided City Audio Tour
shortDescription: See Paris from a bird’s-eye view with an immersive virtual reality flight over the city. Then, explore Paris at your own pace with an audio-guided tour on your smartphone.
description:
Embark on an immersive flight experience over Paris in virtual reality and see the city's most iconic landmarks such as Montmartre, the Eiffel Tower, and the Arc de Triomphe. Afterward, explore Paris with a handy self-guided walking tour, with a variety of tour options available.
From the virtual reality terminal in the heart of the city, set off on a thrilling flight experience as you discover Paris in VR. Soar above the rooftops and see all the famous monuments as you have never seen them before. Admire 360-degree views of Paris as you fly like a bird through the air. 
Continue on your flying adventure as you visit 7 dream destinations around the world. See international landmarks such as the Great Wall of China, Victoria Falls, and Lake Baikal.

After your virtual reality experience, explore the city at your own pace with a self-guided audio tour. Choose one of the 10 available routes and hear stories and anecdotes from professional guides and actors.

name: Paris: Private Museum and Highlights Tour for Families
shortDescription: Immerse yourself into the history, culture, and gastronomy of Paris on this family tour that is especially fun for children. Admire the Louvre Museum, Notre Dame Cathedral, try delicious cakes and chocolates and visit a great museum for the kids.
description:
Discover Paris with your family in a fun way! Enjoy a historical, gastronomic, and cultural tour with a private guide, ideal to enjoy with your kids. Walk through the most charming districts of the city and get lost in its narrow streets, far from the crowds.

Listen to the incredible stories your private guide has to tell you. Enjoy different interactive games with your children and exciting stories such as the famous hunchback of Notre Dame. Explore playgrounds and green spaces to play. Discover the romantic history hidden in the Pont des Arts, along with its endless number of locks. Taste exquisite French pastries in one of the most famous boulangeries, where the children will enjoy a hot chocolate, while you try a traditional Parisian coffee. Relax on the banks of the Seine, in a lovely fountain with colorful sculptures while the children feed the ducks.

Take the metro to enjoy the incredible Museum of Evolution. Say goodbye to your private guide at the entrance to the museum and enjoy it inside for as long as you like. Walk among dinosaurs and mammoths and travel back in time millions of years to learn more about the history of the world.

name: Paris: Amphibious Mini Bus and Canal St-Martin Tunnel Cruise
shortDescription: Head to the Seine River in Paris and travel through the city by amphibious bus. Enjoy a cruise on the Canal St.-Martin. Sail under the tunnel behind the Place de la Bastille. Take in the iconic sights of this stunning city from a different point of view.
description:
Experience a high-speed ride on the Seine River, the most beautiful avenue in Paris!

On this 90-minute combined program, you’ll depart from the Port de la Gare and head down the river to the basin of Est Paris at speeds of more than 40 miles per hour. Then you’ll slow it down a bit with a cruise along the Canal St-Martin tunnels.

If you’re looking for an exceptional team-building activity for your staff, or an unforgettable experience with family or friends, take them on this unique adventure on the Seine. Groups of 10 people can be accommodated on the cruise.

You also might like to dine afterwards on one of the delightful floating restaurants on the river.

name: Paris: Sunrise Run & Sightseeing Small Group Tour
shortDescription: Leave the crowd behind and enjoy a running tour in Paris! Together with your tour hosts, you'll discover by jogging the sights you just cannot miss in one of the most beautiful cities in the world!
description:
If you're a morning person then join this early bird jog and see the main landmarks of Paris! You'll work out and sight-see before breakfast, having plenty of time to visit more in-depth later the places you liked the most during your running tour.


The starting point of the tour will be the Saint-Michel square, in the very heart of Paris. From there, your running guide will lead you on a round tour, at your own pace, past the most famous landmarks of Paris, such as: the Louvre Museum, the Tuileries garden, the Concorde Square, the Champs-Elysées avenue, Hôtel des Invalides, the Eiffel tower, and much more.


Some quick stops are planned for pictures and refreshments along the way. Your tour host will carry your belongings (small items only) inside their backpack and will have water and snacks ready for you whenever you feel like it. All you have to do is to put on some comfortable running gear and to lace up your trainers!

name: From Paris: Normandy D-Day Beaches Day Trip
shortDescription: Take a poignant day trip from Paris to visit Normandy and the WWII D-Day landing beaches. Enjoy a guided tour of the most emblematic sites of the landing and visit the American Cemetery in St Laurent.
description:
Enjoy a full-day trip from Paris to the D-Day Beaches in Normandy in the company of a guide, who'll bring these historic sites to life. Learn about the military operation, and visit the American Cemetery, Arromanches, and Juno Beach.

Board the luxury air-conditioned coach in central Paris and get set to enjoy a unique day in Normandy. Relax and admire the beautiful landscapes of the French countryside.

Visit the well-known American Cemetery at Saint Laurent. Explore this 170-acre site that features 9,387 white marble headstones lined up perfectly across the grass, a memorial, a chapel, and the Garden of the Missing. Follow a small trail down to Omaha Beach, too.
The next stop is in Arromanches, a historic town known for its artificial port that was built to assist the Normandy landings. On D-Day, the harbor saw the unloading of almost 10,000 tons of equipment. You can still make out the floating reinforced concrete Phoenix constructions in the water.

Before returning to Paris, make a short stop near sandy Juno Beach and its cemetery, one of the key D-Day landing beaches for Canadian troops on June 6, 1944. 
Get the opportunity to see everyday objects from life under occupation, maps, and models of military vehicles, as well as film screenings recreating the emotions of D-Day and the Battle of Normandy.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower 2nd Floor Direct Access Entry Ticket
shortDescription: Make the most of your time in Paris with direct access to the most popular monuments in Europe. Enjoy panoramic views of Paris from the first and second floors of the Eiffel Tower by elevator.
description:
Save precious time on a self-guided visit to the Eiffel Tower with a direct access entrance ticket to the 1st and 2nd floors of the most popular attraction in Paris. Benefit from the services of a friendly host who will accompany you to the ticket scan entrance and then leave you to ride the elevator to the 2nd floor at your designated time slot.

Get panoramic views of iconic monuments such as the Notre-Dame de Paris and the golden domes of Les Invalides. Enjoy bird's eye views of the Egyptian obelisk on Place de la Concorde and the magnificent roof of the Grand Palais. See the Louvre Museum and Sacré Coeur basilica from a different perspective, along with other landmarks such as the Pompidou Centre and Pont Alexander III bridge over the River Seine.

Stop at the museum on the 1st floor as you make your way down, and brave the walk on the glass floor 57 meters (187 feet) above street level. Avail of the terrace in the summer or an ice-skating rink in the winter.

name: Paris: Seine River Morning Guided Sightseeing Cruise
shortDescription: Experience Paris from the water on a guide sightseeing cruise along the Seine River.
description:
Discover the secrets and history behind Paris' most emblematic monuments and bridges on a guided morning cruise on the Seine River.
Embark at the foot of the Eiffel Tower and set sail along the Seine River on a comfortable cruise boat.
Enjoy breathtaking views of iconic Paris landmarks from the water. See sights such as the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre Museum, Notre-Dame de Paris, the Orsay Museum, the Petit and Grand Palace, the Concorde Square, Alexandre III bridge, and much more.

name: Paris: Famous Graves of Père Lachaise Small Group Tour
shortDescription: You may not usually consider a cemetery a top sight to see, but Père Lachaise Cemetery in Paris is one of the city’s top attractions. This coveted final resting place contains the graves of some of the world’s most famous artists, writers, and musicians.
description:
Historic and scenic, Père Lachaise Cemetery boasts some of the most expensive and coveted grave real estate in the world. It is the final resting place for famous artists, writers and musicians, from Yves Montand and Simone Signoret to Chopin and Oscar Wilde.

On this 2-hour walking tour you’ll wander through this labyrinth of headstones, trees, and paths as your guide points out the famous graves and eccentricities that make this place so special.

Oscar Wilde’s tomb surely stands out, covered entirely with bright red lipstick from kisses left by visiting admirers. As you pass Chopin’s tomb it seems that you can almost hear his well-known funeral march.

See the final resting place of Molière, the famous French playwright. Famous for irony and satire, Molière, a sick man whose doctors thought he was a hypochondriac, died on stage playing a well man who is a hypochondriac, while the audience cheered him on.

The most visited grave is that of the American rock star, Jim Morrison. His grave and those surrounding it are covered with graffiti from the hordes of fans that come here.

Enjoy a walk through an extraordinary cemetery and relive the lives of some of the world’s greats.

name: Paris: Secret City Tour in a Vintage Car
shortDescription: Discover Paris’ secret charming attractions on a private tour in a vintage Citroën 2CV. Escaping from the crowds at famous monuments, this tour puts the spotlight on the city’s lesser-known sights.
description:
Meet your private guide and hop into a Citroën 2CV. Sit in the passenger seat as your guide takes care of the driving, allowing you to admire the sights. Throughout your tour, enjoy several photo stops and chat with your guide about Paris’ off-the-beaten-path sites as well as your 2VC car. Choose from either a 1.5-hour or a 3-hour tour to suit your schedule.

Avoiding the well-trodden places in the city center, your tour will focus on the city’s hidden gems. Discover the chic delights of Place Vendôme, the elegant square lined with boutiques, jewelers, and glitzy hotels. 
Swing past Kiosque des Noctambules, a contemporary piece of street art by French artist Jean-Michel Othniel, and then stop for photos by Stravinsky Fountain. The water feature is embellished with colorful sculptures that are said to represent running water.

Visit the neighborhood of Le Marais to see Place du Marché Sainte-Catherine, a peaceful square, and learn about the area’s buskers and artists from your guide. Other notable attractions around Le Marais include Hôtel de Sully and Hôtel de Sens, two lavish private mansions. 
At the end of your tour, you’ll be dropped back at your hotel.

name: Paris: Belleville and Le Marais Private Walking Tour
shortDescription: Discover the most authentic Paris districts on this private guided walking tour. See the outside of the Louvre and the Opera Garnier. Feel like a local in the trendy neighborhoods of Belleville and Le Marais.
description:
Experience the best of Paris on foot with your own personal local guide during this private walking trip to the city’s must-see sights and neighborhoods. Visit Opera Garnier, the Louvre Museum, Belleville, Canal Saint-Martin, the Marais, and more. 
On this guided walk through the city, you’ll get to explore characteristic Parisian neighborhoods away from the tourist tide, accompanied by your own local guide.
Visit the hipster quarter of Belleville and walk through its graffiti-filled streets. Then, explore the so-called old Paris, the Marais District, with its charming cobblestone streets, imposing gates, sumptuous hôtels particuliers (grand townhouse), and secret gardens. 
Get to know one of the trendiest quarters of the capital, the cradle of the Parisian avant-garde and also a refuge for contemporary art. 
Make your way along the banks of the Canal Saint-Martin, the perfect walking place for pedestrians, which has become an unmissable meeting point for Parisians, away from the tourist hustle and bustle. Relax and enjoy a coffee in a classic Parisian café.
Later, enjoy one of the most memorable panoramic views of Paris from the rooftop of the famous Galeries Lafayette. Lose yourself in the Galerie Vivienne, one of the most emblematic-covered arcades in Paris.
Before the end of your tour, stop to admire the Opéra Garnier and the Louvre Museum, one of the most prestigious in the world.

name: Private Tour from Paris to Loire Castles & Michelin Lunch
shortDescription: Discover the wonders of the Loire Valley with this VIP private full-day tour from Paris. Take a tour of Chambord Castle, have lunch in a Michelin* restaurant and taste wines at a boutique winery.
description:
Do you want to see splendid Renaissance Castles and taste delicious Loire Valley wines? At the end of this vip 11-hour wine and culture private day tour, you will have fallen in love with Chambord's impressive architecture and with the diversity of Loire Valley wines. 

After an early-morning hotel pick-up in Paris, travel with your knowledgeable guide about two hours south of the city towards Chambord Castle. En route, bite into flaky croissants and pastries while hearing about the wine-making region of Loire and its heritage. Arrive at Chambord Castle in the morning for an audio-guide tour and learn all the secrets behind this magnificent château constructed by King Francis I of France, five hundred years ago. Back in your air-conditioned car, drive through the vineyards of Touraine, Vouvray and Montlouis sur Loire. Admire the colourful landscapes of local grapes.

For lunch, your guide will take you to one of the best restaurants of the region : a Michelin-starred restaurant. The chef's creative course menu is prepared with local products and will be paired to delicious boutique wines of the region. After lunch, your guide will take you in the vineyard to enjoy a beautiful landscape and give you a vine growing introduction course. Then, visit one of the most emblematic wineries of the region and, depending on availability, taste sparkling white wines, dry and sweet white wines, red and rosé wines. Here, you will get to taste authentic Loire Valley wines largely unavailable in the rest of the world. Your guide will drop you back at your hotel in the early evening.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Summit or Second Floor Direct Access
shortDescription: Enjoy direct access to the 2nd floor of the Eiffel Tower. View Paris from above and add access to the summit to go all the way to the top.
description:
Enjoy bird’s eye views of Paris from the second-floor observation deck of the Eiffel Tower.
Meet your guide next to the Eiffel Tower for a brief introduction to the history of the tower. Then, enjoy direct access to the second floor, and hear interesting tales and anecdotes about the tower’s unique history from your guide.
Learn more about the “City of Light,” and enjoy privileged views of the Notre Dame, Louvre, Arc de Triomphe, and Les Invalides. Your guide will then leave you to enjoy the Eiffel Tower at your own pace.
Ascend to the summit, without a guide, at your leisure for even more breathtaking views and enjoy a glass of bubbly in the Champagne Bar (if option booked).
On the way down, make sure you stop on the 1st floor to walk on a new glass floor, 200 feet above the ground.

name: Paris: Grévin Wax Museum Ticket
shortDescription: See your favorite artists and personalities in original life-like wax figures at the historic Grévin Wax Museum in Paris. Sing with Michael Jackson, take a picture with Monica Bellucci, and say hello to Barack Obama and George Clooney!
description:
In the very heart of Paris, more than 200 personalities from the past and the present are waiting for you to experience some unforgettable encounters with your family and friends. Pose alongside some of the most in vogue people on earth for an unexpected and surprising photo!

This has been an unmissable site of Parisian fun since 1882 that welcomes visitors, young and old alike, to share an experience that transcends time. A sumptuous marble staircase, built in 1900, leads you to a world which is one-of-its kind worldwide, beginning with the Hall of Mirrors.

This unique sound and light show, created in 1906 and entirely rebuilt for its centenary has amazed generation after generation of visitors.

The Museum is pleased to welcome its latest characters: Mick Jagger, Lang Lang, Katy Perry and Ranveer Singh




You will also have the opportunity to visit the new "The Voice" area.

name: Paris: Musée de l'Orangerie Reserved Entrance Ticket
shortDescription: Explore one of Paris' finest art museums at your own pace with a reserved access day admission ticket to the Musée de l'Orangerie. Avoid lengthy lines and the hassle of ticket counters.
description:
Discover the Musée de l'Orangerie in your own time with a reserved access entrance ticket. Say goodbye to long waiting lines and waiting for ticket booths to open with your pre-booked ticket. Explore the museum at your own pace without waiting for large group tours to move in sync so as to maximize your time marveling at the renowned art inside.
Visit the Musée de l'Orangerie—an art gallery of impressionist and post-impressionist paintings located in the west corner of the Tuileries Gardens next to the Place de la Concorde in Paris.

Though most famous for being the permanent home for eight Water Lilies murals by Claude Monet, see the museum's other works by Paul Cézanne, Henri Matisse, Amedeo Modigliani, Pablo Picasso, Pierre-Auguste Renoir, Henri Rousseau, Alfred Sisley, Chaim Soutine, and Maurice Utrillo, among others.

Feel a closer connection between the two parts of the collection thanks to the new layout of the Musée de l’Orangerie: Water Lilies and the École de Paris (School of Paris) in the early 20th century. Enjoy the elegant, fluid, educational, and stimulating circuit.

At the entrance to the collection, see large polyptychs by Joan Mitchell (loan from the Musée national d’Art moderne) and large-scale works by the modern 'primitives' (Picasso, Douanier Rousseau, Derain, Modigliani, Matisse, etc.). The monographic galleries allow you to get a new, more up-close, and comfortable perspective of the works.

Simply show your voucher directly at the dedicated entrance for visitors with pre-bought tickets. After a security check, walk straight inside.

name: Paris: Covered Passages 2-Hour Scavenger Hunt
shortDescription: Take your kids on an educational and fun scavenger hunt in the hidden gem of Paris, the Covered Passages. Your private, kid-friendly guide will lead you through the passages to find a special treat as your family learns about its rich history.
description:
Explore the less touristy spots of Paris while keeping your children entertained along the way. Tour the Covered Passages and join your kids as they solve a scavenger hunt. Follow clues to find magical numbers that will unlock the next clue. 
Your expert, kid-friendly guide will be by your side the entire way to help out when needed and to tell you all about the rich history that every passage holds.

This tour is adapted to kids of any age, so your youngsters will be able to participate, whatever their level. The hunt starts at the covered walkways of the magnificent Palais Royal. After obtaining your first magical number, go to the Passages de Deux-Pavillons and discover the mysteries it holds.

Next, venture to the so-called twin passages of Galerie Colbert and Galerie Vivienne. These may be the most opulent of the covered passages, but your youngsters will need to look past its luxurious designs to locate the magical numbers. 
Your young detectives will travel back in time when they step into the Passage des Panoramas.

Journey through time again and land at the Passage Jouffroy. Gaze at the combination of centuries-old wooden décor and modern glass and metal structures as you hunt for your next clue. 
Head to the seventh and final passage for your last magical number. Clandestinely located, Passage Verdeau is the perfect passage for the final clue. 

If you have younger investigators, gathering all of the magical numbers will unlock the location. For your older detectives, there will be a final puzzle to complete with all the numbers you’ve gathered to unlock the hidden destination of the treat. With the location uncovered, collect your treat. 
Once completing the scavenger hunt, head to a café with your guide to sit back and enjoy a warm drink. Reflect on your scavenger hunt or ask your guide about other hidden secrets Paris may hold.

name: Paris: Montmartre Guided Cultural Walking Tour
shortDescription: Discover the beauty of Montmartre on this guided cultural tour. Stop by the Sacré-Coeur basilica, see the houses of artists like Picasso and Van Gogh, and try out the city’s best cafes and bars.
description:
Wander through Paris’ most vibrant district and learn about its history and secrets from your guide. Navigate its charming streets while seeing landmarks like the Sacré-Coeur, Place du Tertre, and the Moulin Rouge. Stop by the Café des Deux Moulins, made famous in the film Amélie. 
Start your tour by the restaurant Chez Ginette, and stroll through the district’s charming squares and side streets on your way to see the houses and studios of artists such as Renoir, Modigliani, Picasso, and Van Gogh, all of whom lived and worked in Montmartre. 
Then, you’ll be guided through the district's winding side streets to some of the city’s best spots for pastries and drinks, such as the famous Café des Deux Moulins. Discover not only the area’s history but also its modern-day culture and best-kept secrets. 
Along the way, visit must-see landmarks including the Sacré-Coeur basilica, and the artistic hub of Place du Tertre. End your tour at the iconic Moulin Rouge cabaret.

name: Louvre and Musée d'Orsay with Reserved Entry Ticket
shortDescription: Enjoy an expert introduction to 2 of the most celebrated museums in Paris on a 5.5-hour tour of the Louvre Museum and Musée d'Orsay. Skip the ticket lines and take an in-depth art walk from Ancient Greece to the masterpieces of the French Impressionists.
description:
Enjoy a combined full-day tour of 2 of the most popular museums in Paris and take a journey through the history of art, from the antiquities of Ancient Greece to the groundbreaking art of French Impressionists and post-Impressionists, such as Renoir and Van Gogh.

Your tour starts at the legendary Louvre Museum. Home to more than 35,000 works of art, and artifacts from antiquity, the Louvre covers more than 650,000 square feet of exhibition space. Tackling this monument to art on your own can be overwhelming, but your guide will compose a chronological story, starting with Ancient Greek mythology. They will lead you to some of the most celebrated pieces, including the enigmatic Mona Lisa, and tell you which works have made the most significant contributions to the evolution of art and civilization.

Following a lunch break, continue to the Musée d'Orsay. Located in a beautiful Beaux Arts building that was formerly used as the Gare d'Orsay railway station, the Orsay focuses on 19th-century French art. Explore the individual styles of artists such as Manet, Renoir, Cézanne, and Gauguin. Learn the secrets surrounding their techniques and discover how a handful of art rebels paved the way for the Impressionist art movement.

Reserved entry ticket access to both museums means you will enjoy quicker entry and can spend more time admiring the art. You are free to stay on and continue exploring at the end of your guided tour.

name: Haussmannian Paris 2-Hour Private Walking Tour
shortDescription: Learn about the greatest urban planning achievement of the 19th century, which completely changed the face of Paris! Enjoy a guided walk that takes in some of the period’s most stunning landmarks, including the Opéra Garnier and the Galeries Lafayette.
description:
Take a 2-hour guided walk in Paris to experience the results of the famous Haussmannian intervention, which was the largest urban planning feat ever undertaken in the city.

In the 19th century the whole city, with the exception of 2 neighborhoods, was flattened and built anew. The plan was designed to create the best planned, the most functional, and above all, the most beautiful city in the world. The program, however, took its toll on many precious buildings and streets that have been forever lost.

During the Haussmannian Paris tour you’ll learn about this massive effort and visit the top examples of the style that was undoubtedly excessive and yet an incredibly unified one.

After you have taken this tour, you’ll never see the city of Paris in the same way again!

The major sites on the tour are the Opéra Garnier, a landmark of the era, Boulevard Haussmann, named after its creator, and the Galeries Lafayette, the most beautiful shopping mall in Paris.

See the Museum of Jacquemart-André, a lavish and opulent villa of the period, the Church of Saint Augustin, an architectural marvel, and Park Monceau, the most elegant park in the city.

name: Paris and the Art of Music: 2-Hour Walking Tour
shortDescription: Walk in the footsteps of the musical greats who lived, studied, and performed in Paris. With your guide you’ll visit sites that were the haunts of Mozart and Stravinsky, and Edith Piaf, Maurice Chevalier, George Gershwin, and Cole Porter as well.
description:
On this 2-hour guided walk you’ll visit Parisian sites linked historically to music, such as the 6th-century Benedictine Abbey of Saint-Germain-des-Prés, Paris's oldest church, where troubadours performed during the Middle Ages.

You’ll also see Marie de Medici's Luxembourg Gardens and Palace, home to court music during the Renaissance, and the Carrefour de Buci, a colorful crossroads notorious for its cabarets between WWI and WWII.

Admire the 18th-century picture-perfect Cour du Commerce Saint-André, a charming street arcade that’s home to Paris's oldest café – a meeting point for street musicians during the French Revolution.

Learn about the religious music of the classical period in the huge 17th-century Baroque Saint-Sulpice Church, noted for its 7,000-pipe organ. It is one of only 3, 100-stop organs in the world. The church's most recent appearance was in a supporting role in The Da Vinci Code.

Finish your walking tour in Furstenberg Square, one of the smallest, most romantic squares in Paris, and a favorite of both Edith Piaf and Maurice Chevalier.

name: Parc Asterix: Private Transfer to and from Paris
shortDescription: Enjoy the comfort of a private transfer service between Paris and Parc Asterix.
description:
Forget the stress when you visit Parc Asterix by booking your private transfer between Paris and Parc Asterix. The transfer service is available every day between 4:00 AM and 12:00 AM, except on the 24th and 31st December when it is available until 6:00 PM. 

Enjoy your comfortable and relaxing transfer service between Paris and Parc Asterix. Your driver will take care of you and will guide you to your destination in total comfort and safety. All you need to do is relax and enjoy the landscape views on your way.

name: Paris: Montmartre 2-Hour Walking Tour
shortDescription: Stroll through the bohemian neighborhood of Montmartre on a 2-hour walking tour of Paris, and feel the cobblestone streets beneath your feet as you follow in the footsteps of Picasso, Hemingway, and more. Enjoy great views from the Sacre-Coeur.
description:
Explore one of the most picturesque areas of Paris on a 2-hour walking tour through Montmartre, starting with the legendary cabaret theater of the Moulin Rouge, located in the city’s Red Light District. Watch artists at work in charming Place du Tertre, a reminder of the time when Montmartre was a true artists' quarter.

Continue to the Dalí Museum, dedicated to the work of the surrealist artist, where over 300 of his original drawings, sculptures, and paintings are on display. A stop at Montmartre Vineyards to discover a secret garden of Paris and source of the famed Le Clos Montmartre.

Then, explore Montmartre Cemetery, last resting place for many of Montmartre’s famous artists, including Dalida and Degas. Continue the art theme at Le Lapin Agile, haunt of artists in the early 1900s. Pablo Picasso's 1905 painting "At the Lapin Agile" helped make the cabaret world renowned.

Visit Le Bateau-Lavoir, a once dingy block of buildings where artists, including Picasso and Modigliani, lived in bohemian squalor.

Finally, end at the magnificent Sacré-Coeur Basilica, dedicated to the 58,000 people that lost their lives during the Franco-Prussian War.

name: Paris: WWII Occupation & Liberation Exploration Game
shortDescription: Embark on a quest and travel back in time to discover Paris during World War II. Explore while reenacting the story of a Polish 18-year-old trying to discover the truth about his great-grandfather.
description:
Explore Paris and learn about the history of the city during the Second World War on this interactive tour designed to teach visitors the history of Paris with this educational outdoor exploration game.
Play the role of a Polish 18-year-old who’s on a mission to piece together the story of his great-grandfather, a heroic resistance fighter in Paris during WWII.

Get ready for an adventure and be prepared to solve challenges as the story unfolds and exact directions on your phone will guide you to the next location.

Begin at Charles de Gaulle Statue, and be prepared for a 1.5-hour adventure through Paris, but feel free to explore at your own pace: pause the game and resume anytime from the location where you paused.
Finish the tour at Quai de Montebello with new knowledge about the history of Paris and the lives of its inhabitants during the war.

Play on your own, in a large group, or in several smaller groups that compete against each other and meet at the final stop of the game.

name: Paris: Gourmet Dinner Cruise on the Seine River & Live Music
shortDescription:
Discover Paris by night during our exceptional gourmet dinner cruise on board of our majestic boat, the Diamant Bleu.
Enjoy the festive ambiance, unique on the Seine, thanks to a live singer&DJ Set!
description:
Starting from Cité de la Mode et du Design, opposite to pier no. 36, quai d'Austerlitz, get on board of our yacht-look-alike boat to enjoy an unforgettable moment while cruising along the Seine river.
Let yourself be amazed by the parisian monuments along the river and its historical bridges, sail along l'Ile de la Cité, the Louvre or the Statue of the Liberty, get yourself a selfie with the Eiffel Tower glittering from our 300m2 rooftop and last but not least, enjoy the unique on the Seine festive atmosphere. A live singer and a DJ Set will entertain you all along the way...

Exquisite dishes prepared on board by our chef and his brigade are there to delight your taste buds.
Several formulas are provided, including only starter, main, desert & 1/2 bottle of water per person or including wine or champagne also.
Our team is always at your disposal in cas you want to add some extras on board (our chef's cocktail, wine, softs or champagne and even birthday cakes on request in advance).

Menu: 

Starters:
• Pumpkin soup, hazelnuts, forest mix and ceps tortellini, bread tuile, chestnut shavings
or
• Egg parfait and its vegetable garden (artichoke puree, carrots, radishes, chioggia beetroot, truffle carpaccio)

Main dish :
• Candied lamb shoulder, caramelised onions, mashed potatoes, pan-fried crunchy vegetables and chickpeas, full-bodied gravy
or
• Fillet of cod, roasted orzo risotto, crunchy vegetables, candied lemon tehina sauce

Deserts :
• Vanilla crunch on its carameliszed pear bed pean nuts passion fruit purée
• Chocolate tart

A vegetarian meal can be made available, under request and at least 48-hours in advance.
Our menu evolves with the seasons. Do not hesitate to check our official website to consult the updated version.
Official website www.le-diamant-bleu.fr

name: From Paris: Giverny and Versailles Private Full-Day Trip
shortDescription: Enjoy this private full-day tour of Versailles and Giverny to experience two of the most popular day-trip destinations outside Paris. Relax with pickup and drop-off services from your hotel in Paris and take advantage of skip-the-line tickets.
description:
Your tour starts in Paris, where you will be picked from your accommodations and hop aboard a minivan for a one-hour drive to the Palace of Versailles.  Here, you will explore the opulent palace, once home to King Louis XIV, King Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette. On your tour, you will view the famous Hall of Mirrors, the Grand Apartments and the Queen's Apartments, as your guide helps bring history to life. Enjoy some free time to wander through the expansive gardens behind the palace. 

After touring Versailles, take a midday break for lunch and continue your journey to Giverny, the long-time home of Claude Monet. When you arrive at Monet's House and Gardens, take some time to wander through the rows of vibrant flowers and stroll over to the water lily pond and Japanese bridge. You can view his workshop and house, where you can admire Monet's collection of Japanese prints on the walls before heading back to Paris.

name: Paris Highlights Full Day Tour
shortDescription: Make the most of your visit to the City of Light. Check off the top items on your must-see list in Paris. Do more in six hours than most people do in three days with this fun-filled tour.
description:
Meet your guide at the Eiffel Tower and ascend the elevator towards the top of this iconic Parisian attraction. Along the way you will learn about Gustave Eiffel himself, and upon reaching the second level you will take a walk around its perimeter to view the city's landmarks. Learn about the tower's lights, construction, paint and get a brief lesson on the proud history of the city.

Next it’s up to the Summit to see Paris from 300 meters in the sky. When you return to the ground level, enjoy a boat cruise on the River Seine for a 30 minute ride filled with views of Paris’ most famous landmarks. In the event that the Summit is closed (at the discretion of the Eiffel Tower staff) your guide will use this extra time to visit other landmarks according to time allowed and the group's preference such as the Latin Quarter or the Arc de Triomphe.

Your next stop is the Ile de la Cite, where you can view the cathedral of Notre Dame from Point Zero, the geographic center of Paris. After your visit to see the cathedral, stroll on this island past the ornate gates of the Palace of Justice, the Conciergerie where Marie Antoinette was imprisoned during the Revolution, and the Saint-Chapelle church. Before you leave the island you will head towards the oldest bridge in Paris, the Pont Neuf.

Cross over the bridge to the right bank and walk alongside the river past the Bouquinistes, or booksellers, and celebrate a tradition that dates back to the 15th century. The last stop is outside the magnificent Louvre Museum, where your guide will escort you through the Royal Courtyard and to the east end of the Historic Axis of Paris, next to the Tuileries Gardens, at the world famous Louvre Pyramid.

If you decide to visit the Louvre, your guide will have insider tips on how to best enjoy the museum. Before you bid farewell, your guide will share history and tips for visiting the nearby Tuileries Gardens, Place de la Concorde, Champs Elysees, and Arc de Triomphe. You will not believe how much you have seen and experienced in just over 6 hours!

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Direct Access 2nd Level & Regular Summit
shortDescription: Admire Paris's top attractions from above with a direct access ticket to the Eiffel Tower's 2nd level. Then ascend to the summit with standard access.
description:
Save time with a pre-booked, direct access ticket to the 2nd level of the Eiffel Tower with this combined entry ticket that includes standard access to the summit. Start with an introduction by a guide and explore the tower at your leisure.
Inside the tower, receive introductory commentary from a guide. Marvel at the beauty of Paris from the 2nd floor and take memorable pictures with your friends or family. 
Admire views of the most famous Parisian landmarks, such as the Arc de Triomphe and the wide Haussmann boulevards, among others.
Continue to the summit with standard access and enjoy the rest of your unlimited time inside the Eiffel Tower. Afterward, if you're up for a chilling moment, you can head to the 1st floor and walk on the glass floor.

name: Paris: Walking Tour of Montmartre
shortDescription: Discover the bohemian district of Montmartre, one of the most beautiful neighborhoods of Paris. Learn about Montmartre, its inhabitants, and life in the French capital.
description:
With your tour guide, explore the world-famous bohemian neighborhood of Paris: Montmartre. Situated at the highest point in the city, this district was home to countless famous artists throughout history. 

On this tour, you'll see the most famous Parisian landmarks situated in this area: see the exciting and flashy Moulin Rouge Cabaret building and the white Sacré Coeur Basilica. 
Visit the lively Place du Tertre, where you can watch artists and portraitists at work. Hear fascinating stories of the history and present of this artists' quarter, drawing you into the spell of the neighborhood of Montmartre.

name: Paris: Direct Eiffel Tower Access & Seine River Cruise
shortDescription: Head up to the 2nd level of the Eiffel Tower with your direct access ticket and admire many of the top attractions of Paris from up above. Upgrade to gain Summit access (optional) and enjoy a 1-hour Seine River cruise.
description:
Save time with a pre-booked, direct access ticket to the 2nd level of the Eiffel Tower on this combined package with a cruise included. Explore the tower at your leisure and enjoy views of the most famous Parisian landmarks, such as the Arc de Triomphe and the wide Haussmann boulevards, among others. 

Marvel at the beauty of Paris from the 2nd floor and take memorable pictures with your friends or family. Continue to the summit with standard access (optional) and enjoy the rest of your unlimited time inside the Eiffel Tower.

Afterwards, embark on a cruise along the Seine River. You’ll have the chance to admire the famous monuments of Paris as you follow the flow of the river through the city. Relax and enjoy a pleasant hour on board.

name: Paris Louvre: 2-Hour Private Tour for Families & Children
shortDescription: A special children’s guide will show your family a few highlights of the Louvre Museum on a private tour that has been specially designed for both adults and kids. You’ll start out at the Mona Lisa before taking in a couple of other special exhibits.
description:
Visiting the Louvre with a special children’s guide is a fantastic way to give kids a taste of this important museum. Covering more than 650,000 square feet of space it is one of the largest, and busiest, museums in the world and an important landmark in Paris.

The Louvre exhibits over 35,000 objects and it is said that it would take a visitor up to 9 months to see them all. Visiting a museum of this size with children may seem like a daunting proposition, but a successful visit is possible.

Your tour guide will focus on 2-3 exhibits to keep the kids from becoming overwhelmed and losing interest or having a meltdown. Many children (as well as adults) are excited about seeing the Mona Lisa, so your visit will start there, and continue on after this requirement has been met!

name: Paris: Gourmet Food Tasting Tour of Medieval Marais
shortDescription: Sample gastronomic treats on a 3-hour food tasting tour of Le Marais and see one of Paris’ most unspoiled neighborhoods along the way. Discover the best-preserved medieval area of the city, as well as the heart of the Jewish community.
description:
Join an expert guide on a 3-hour tasting tour of Le Marais, and discover the local hangouts as you sample delicious food and wine. Start in front of the Centre Pompidou, Europe's largest modern art museum, nestled in an impressive contemporary building. 
Then move on past Notre Dame to the Hôtel de Ville, the city's town hall, on the square where public executions were once carried out.

Pass an iconic bakery whose baguette was named one of the best in Paris. 
Continue to Rue Saint-Croix-de-la-Bretonnerie, the center of the French gay scene, to see one of the oldest streets in Le Marais.
Stop to sample a delicious macaron made by one of the city’s most famous pastry chefs, then enter the heart of the Jewish community.

Discover a vibrant pedestrianized street full of falafel stands and Jewish delis. 
Then continue to a wine and alcohol store to try iconic French liqueurs, such as Cognac, Armagnac, Absinthe, and Old Plum brandy. Feast on French charcuterie, including pâté, rillettes, and ham.
Finally, you’ll walk to Place de la Bastille, passing the former home of the French writer Victor Hugo. The area is full of bars and restaurants, where you can continue to explore the City of Lights on your own.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Direct Access and Evening Cruise
shortDescription: Take advantage of direct access to the Eiffel Tower. Ascend to the viewing platform on the 2nd floor for incredible views of the city on a combined self-guided tour of the tower and illuminations cruise down the River Seine.
description:
See Paris in a different light with a combined direct access Eiffel Tower ticket and a 1-hour illumination cruise that you are free to take at your leisure.

First, ascend to the 2nd floor of the Eiffel Tower to admire the beauty of Paris with your friends, family, or a couple. Soak in the stunning vistas of the city and its monuments, such as the Sacre Coeur, Notre Dame, and Louvre Museum.

Then, see the “City of Lights” illuminated for the night on a 1-hour Illuminations Cruise down the River Seine. Boats depart from a pier just 5 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower, and run every hour in winter and every 30 minutes in the summer. You can use your illumination cruise ticket at any time and day without changing the date.

Experience Paris after dark, and marvel at monuments floodlit for the night, such as the Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame de Paris, and many more. Cruise under romantic bridges, including the historic Pont Alexandre III and Pont Neuf.

name: Paris By Night: 3-Hour Guided Bike Tour
shortDescription: Discover the beauty of Paris after dark on a guided bike tour that takes you to see the illuminated monuments and landmarks of the City of Light. Stop at important sites and enjoy your guide’s commentary on Parisian history and city life.
description:
Your 3-hour bike tour begins at the Parking Etoile-Foch, near the Arc de Triomphe. After picking up your bike you’ll head out with your guide, who’ll take you on a ride through the streets of Paris.
