Stop at all the major attractions, including the Champs-Elysées, Eiffel Tower, Louvre and Notre-Dame, and take in the beauty of the illuminated monuments after dark.

Hear stories about the city’s past and learn more about what life is like in Paris.

This tour is an excellent way to get the know the city when the streets aren’t quite so busy. Feel free to bring some refreshments along with you!

name: From Paris: Mont St Michel and Loire Valley 2 Day Tour
shortDescription: Discover two periods of French history, the Middle Ages at the Gothic Abbey of Mont Saint-Michel and the Renaissance in the prestigious Loire Valley.
description:
Escape the busy city of Paris and immerse yourself in the French countryside on this 2 day trip. The tour departs the city and crosses the western districts of Paris along the Normandy motorway to reach your first destination. 
At Mont Saint-Michel, enjoy a fascinating guided visit of the abbey’s interior and marvel at the Gothic and Romanesque architecture of the building. Spend some free time exploring the rest of the abbey and surrounding village.
After the abbey, head towards Château d’Angers for your overnight stay. Check into your 4-star hotel for the night and relax before the second day of the tour.

On the second day, wake up to a delicious breakfast and begin your journey to the breathtaking Loire Valley. Upon arrival in the valley, visit the Castle Langeais passing by Cunault and Saumur along the way. 
Enjoy a guided tour of the Chenonceau and Chambord castles and learn about the rich history of the people who lived here. Finally, on the return to Paris, marvel at the stunning landscape of the countryside as you travel.

name: Versailles: Private Half-Day Guided Tour from Paris
shortDescription: Witness the beauty and elegance of the famous Palace of Versailles, discover why it is such an important symbol of absolute monarchy, and take a relaxing stroll through the majestic French-style gardens on a half-day private tour of this impressive site.
description:
Discover the beauty and glory of Versailles, a world famous location, on a half-day private tour from Paris with an experienced guide.

You will feel like you travel back in time on this fascinating journey to discover this world famous site, a symbol of absolute monarchy and its impressive and turbulent history. Walk straight in without waiting in line and learn about and explore old French grandeur. You will be able to follow your experienced guide through the majestic rooms, the State Apartments, the Hall of Mirrors and the Queen’s private apartments.

After the tour, you will be able to enjoy a relaxing stroll through the astonishing French-style gardens at your own leisure. You will be returned back to your hotel accommodation at the conclusion of the tour.

name: Fontainebleau Castle Half-Day Tour
shortDescription: Travel to the home of France's royalty since the Middle Ages, Fontainebleau Castle and enjoy one of France's most popular tourist destinations. Take in amazing views of the forest of Fontainebleau before returning to Paris in an air-conditioned minibus.
description:
Travel to the home of France's royalty since the Middle Ages, Fontainebleau Castle and enjoy one of France's most popular tourist destinations. Take in amazing views of the forest of Fontainebleau before returning to Paris in an air-conditioned minibus.

Leave Paris behind for an afternoon getaway into France's past. Let the friendly and knowledgeable driver-guide pick you up from a centrally located office in Paris, aboard an air-conditioned minibus and whisk you away to Fontainebleau Castle, home to France's Kings, Queens, Emperors and Empresses since the Middle Ages.

Enjoy the treasures preserved at Fontainebleau Castle, the royal residence from the 12th century. Visit Napoleon's apartments on the first floor, where you can see a lock of his hair. See the decor of the François I Gallery, one of the most beautiful galleries in France.

View the Trinity Chapel, the King's bedroom and Throne Room, the only remaining Throne Room in France retaining its original furniture. Enjoy some free time to wander through the Chateau's gardens.

Discover the English Garden, formerly the Pine Garden, and visit the mirror-like Carp Pond. Stroll through the Grand Park, with linear paths, star-shaped crossroads and a large canal built under Henri IV.

After uncovering the wonders of Fontainebleau, take in amazing views of the forest of Fontainebleau before returning to Paris in the air-conditioned minibus.

name: From Paris: Private Day Trip to Giverny and Auvers sur Oise
shortDescription: Walk in the footsteps of two of the world's most iconic painters, Claude Monet and Vincent van Gogh, on this day trip from Paris to the small towns of Giverny and Auvers-sur-Oise. With a guide, visit Claude Monet's House and Gardens to see where he lived.
description:
After being picked up from your hotel, you will depart in a luxury vehicle for your one hour drive to Giverny, where you enjoy Claude Monet's home and gardens. 

You arrive early at Claude Monet's House and Gardens, a Norman orchard that Monet turned into a lavish property full of colorful flowers and other vegetation, including cherry trees, tulips, roses, wisteria, weeping willows, and irises. This attraction includes the following:
Monet’s Home: visit the painter's house where he lived with his big family. The yellow dining room, his first workshop, and the kitchen are especially memorable.The Flower Garden: every season and every month, flower beds change, as do tulips, hyacinths, iris, nasturtiums. At any time of the year, find the flower landscapes dear to the impressionist master.The Water Garden: the main subject of painting at the end of his life, Monet liked to spend time there and observe the variations of light and the reflections of his garden on the pond, famous for its water lilies.The Japanese Bridge: see the famous little green bridge crossing his pond with your own eyes.
Your guide will then suggest several different options for a nice lunch in the charming village of Giverny. 

In the afternoon, head to the town of Auvers-sur-Oise, where Vincent van Gogh spent the final days of his life. See the wheat fields and church that he painted, and visit his room at Auberge Ravoux, where he died. You'll also see the twin graves of van Gogh and his brother, before you head back to Paris

name: Square de la Tour Saint Jacques
Decouverte Du Vin Aux Caves Du Louvre
shortDescription:
Caves royales au coeur de Paris, partez à la découverte du vin dans un lieu totalement inédit : les caves du Louvre !

Au 52, Rue de l'Arbre Sec, dans le 1er arrondissement, au coeur du vieux Paris, s’éléve un superbe hotel particulier. Si l’on regarde un peu plus pres, celui-ci appartenait au sommelier du roi Louis XV. Quelques siècles plus tard, ces caves sont toujours dédiées au vin.

Une équipe de passionnées a décidé de les remettre au goût de jour et de les ouvrir au public pour la première fois en proposant une expérience unique pour découvrir ou redécouvrir le vin. 

Pendant 1 heure, laissez-vous guider par un sommelier le long des 600m2 de caves voutées, tout en dégustant du vin !

Vous dégusterez 3 vins durant votre visite et différents thèmes seront abordés tels que la variété du terroir Français et son impact sur le vin, l'identification des différents arômes dans le vin et de ses caractéristiques (astringent, rond, tannique...), l'appellation d'origine protégée, les enjeux des bouchons, choisir son vin en magasin...

Inclus :
• Un guide Sommelier
• Une visite guidée dans le parcours des sens
• La dégustation de 3 vins

Sélection des vins :
Premium : vins plaisirs, producteurs primés et populaires
Classique : vins découvertes - petits producteurs, peu connus mais prometteurs

Dégustation :
• Dégustation de 3 vins parmi la sélection des Caves du Louvre

A savoir
- A partir de 18 ans
- Il vous est fortement conseillé de télécharger l'application "Wine in Paris" afin de profiter pleinement de votre visite.
- Attention : L'abus d'alcool est dangereux pour la santé.

name: Led Zeppelin Symphonic
shortDescription:
Avis à tous les fans de Led Zeppelin ! Pour la première fois en France, découvrez les plus grands titres de Led Zeppelin lors d’un concert symphonique exceptionnel.

Pendant près de deux heures, les trois chanteurs du mythique West End de Londres interprèteront les plus grands succès de Led Zeppelin, accompagnés sur scène par un groupe de rock et les 40 musiciens du Yellow Socks Orchestra !

De Whole Lotta Love à Rock & Roll, Kashmir en passant par Black Dog, Dazed & Confused et - bien sûr - Stairway to Heaven, redécouvrez le répertoire de Led Zeppelin comme vous ne l’avez jamais entendu, entièrement réarrangé pour orchestre symphonique.

Sous la direction artistique de Richard Sidwell – l’homme derrière le succès mondial de Queen Symphonic – le spectacle LED ZEPPELIN SYMPHONIC rend hommage à ce monument du rock britannique qui continue depuis plus de 50 ans à écrire sa légende. Après une tournée triomphale qui a débutée par Londres et Athènes, LED ZEPPELIN SYMPHONIC arrive en France pour trois représentations exceptionnelles qui passeront par Paris, Lyon et Roubaix en octobre 2022
description:

Pendant près de deux heures, les trois chanteurs du mythique West End de Londres interprèteront les plus grands succès de Led Zeppelin, accompagnés sur scène par un groupe de rock et les 40 musiciens du Yellow Socks Orchestra !

Après une tournée triomphale qui a débutée par Londres et Athènes, LED ZEPPELIN SYMPHONIC arrive en France pour trois représentations exceptionnelles qui passeront par Paris, Lyon et Roubaix en octobre 2022

name: Pantheon : Billet Coupe File
shortDescription:
Prenez vos places et découvrez le Pantheon, l'un des plus célèbres monuments de Paris !

Sur la montagne Sainte-Geneviève à Paris, visitez le Panthéon (1764-1790), chef d’œuvre de l'architecte Soufflot. Découvrez les grandes personnalités inhumées dans la crypte, qui dessinent le visage de notre identité nationale. De la colonnade extérieure du dôme, profitez d'un large panorama sur la capitale.

Un édifice grandiose :
L’ambition de Soufflot est de rivaliser avec Saint-Pierre de Rome et Saint-Paul à Londres. Le péristyle monumental s’inspire du Panthéon d’Agrippa à Rome.

Un programme décoratif :
À partir de 1874, des peintures sur toiles marouflées illustrant l’histoire de sainte Geneviève et l’épopée des origines chrétiennes et monarchiques de la France viennent orner le sanctuaire.
La crypte. Une présentation permanente résume la vie et l’œuvre de ceux qui y reposent, de Voltaire et Rousseau à Alexandre Dumas.

Le pendule de Foucault :
Installé en 1851, démonté puis réinstallé en 1995, il prouve la rotation de la terre. 

Les parties hautes :
L’accès au dôme est ouvert d’avril à octobre en visite accompagnée. Pour des raisons de sécurité, l’accès à la colonnade est limité à cinquante personnes.

A savoir :
Dernier accès 45 min avant la fermeture. 
Du 1er avril au 30 septembre : de 10h à 18h30
Du 1er octobre au 31 mars : de 10h à 18h
Fermeture à 16h les 24 et 31 décembre.

Gratuit pour :
- les jeunes de moins de 18 ans ;
- les jeunes de moins de 26 ans, ressortissants de l’U.E. ou résidents réguliers sur le territoire de l'U.E.
- Autres gratuités et tarifs réduits : voir directemnt avec le Panthéon.
- Gratuit le 1er dimanche du mois (du 1er novembre au 31 mars) et lors des Journées du Patrimoine.

Afin d'accéder au Musée, vous devez impérativement présenter le code-barres présent sur ce billet électronique Ticketac (billet imprimé ou sur votre mobile).
Votre billet est valable 6 mois à partir la date d'achat pour un seul passage au contrôle.

Les hauteurs sont fermées jusqu'à nouvel ordre.

name: Paris: Discovery Hop-On Hop-Off and Paris by Night Tour
shortDescription: Hop-on Hop-off and explore Paris by day at your own pace and enjoy the City of Light brilliantly illuminated at night from the open-top-deck of our buses.
description:
Discover the famous landmarks of Paris by day on a hop-on hop-off tour or illuminated at night on an open-top bus tour. See the city’s most famous monuments and buildings from great vantage points and learn about the city’s history from the audio guide. 

During the day, enjoy the largest network of hop-on-hop-off routes in Paris to visit the City of Light, its monuments, and neighborhoods at your own pace. 

Use each and every stop to visit historical sites such as Opera, Louvre Museum, Notre-Dame Cathedral, Sainte-Chapelle, Orsay Museum, Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower, and many more.

Enjoy the flexibility to get off at any time and walk the most charming neighborhoods in Paris the bohemian Montmartre, the buzzing Latin Quarter, the trendy Marais, or the peaceful Ile de Saint Louis.

By night, experience a unique 2-hour tour that will take you past the top landmarks brilliantly illuminated at night. Enjoy breath-taking views of The City of Light in all its splendor from the top deck of our buses.

In both day and night tours, listen to the audio commentary specially designed for our routes available in 5 languages. If you are traveling with children, the fun commentary designed just for kids will entertain them throughout the route.

name: Paris Chocolate Tour and Tastings
shortDescription: Taste some of the world's best chocolates as you stroll through Paris's Left Bank on a 2-hour tour. Learn about France's distinctive artisan chocolates and their production on visits to at least 4 chocolatiers in St. Germain and the Latin Quarter.
description:
Paris is home to some of the world's best chocolatiers. During this delicious and fascinating jaunt through Paris' upscale Left Bank neighborhood, you'll learn what makes the France's artisan chocolates so famous.

Your tour guide is an expert food connoisseur. As you taste Paris's incredible chocolates you will be learning the vocabulary of chocolate, the ins and outs of cocoa percentages, and the art of chocolate tasting. Your guide will take you through Paris's Latin Quarter and St. Germain, to visit at least 4 chocolate shops where you can compare and contrast the exotic and rich flavors.

You'll leave with a thoroughly educated and pleasured palate, along with some exclusive addresses to visit next time you're in Paris.

name: Paris: Notre Dame Outdoor Walking Tour with Crypt Entry
shortDescription: Learn all about the decades of construction of Notre Dame and the fire that almost destroyed centuries of history. Receive your tickets to the archaeological crypt of Paris and see the old city's foundations.
description:
See what remains of the famous Notre Dame Cathedral after the 2019 fire, and marvel at one of Paris' most iconic and historical buildings. Tour the archaeological crypt of Paris and see the old city's foundations on this daytime outdoor walking tour. 
See Notre Dame, an unmissable stop when visiting Paris, and see what remains of the history, tragedy and bright future of this beloved cathedral after the devastating fire in with this Notre Dame walking tour.
Learn how construction began in 1163 and took over a century to finish and relive the night when people all over the world watched in horror as the cathedral filled the sky with ash, hearing what was lost but also what was saved. 
Share in the story of survival thanks to the valiant rescue and recovery efforts of first responders. Walk with a guide around the scene of the fire, as they share first-person perspectives about this historic event. 
Admire the iconic features of the well-known facade, including the towers and legendary gargoyles, reliving the moments when their survival was uncertain.
Get as close as possible to Point Zero, the geographic center of Paris that’s sometimes considered a place of good luck, just steps from the famous cathedral.
Finish the 45-minute walking tour at the entrance to the archaeological crypt below Notre Dame. Learn about this unique site before going underground for a self-guided visit to the very foundations of Île de la Cité, the original Paris.

name: 2-Hour Perfume Creation Course in Paris
shortDescription: Create your own personalized fragrance and become a perfumer. This perfume workshop offer an unforgettable sensorial experience and an innovative way to discover the world of perfume and Parisian refinement.
description:
Imagine a fragrance as unique as you are. Candora is a new French perfume brand with 18 fragrances offering tailor-made fragrance creation. Every woman and man is invited to an exceptional olfactory experience. Learn the art of blending and have the pleasure to create your own personal fragrance.

Embark on a sensational olfactive journey in a friendly atmosphere. Get introduced to French 'Art de Vivre' and the Parisian elegance. Start with an instructive quiz, which will unveil parts of the history of perfumes and the mysteries of fragrance conception. Then, awaken your senses and emotions with the power of smelling as each guest will be able to smell 8 to 10 different fragrances.

Develop your creativity and choose your favorite fragrances and then blend them in a graduated glass. You will adapt the quantity of each ingredient to your taste. Find out if you are oud rose, lavender vetiver, iris cedar or wild herbs.

name: Paris: Guided Bike Tour Like a Local
shortDescription: Explore Paris on a bike trip through charming back streets and neighborhoods. Get insider recommendations, discover city secrets, see iconic monuments, and stop for ice cream or a crepe.
description:
Experience Paris like a local on an amazing bike tour to some of the city's main monuments, and hidden secrets. Pedal the streets of the city center and learn its history as you ride. Venture down charming back streets and stop at a popular street for a snack and a coffee.

Marvel as the famous monuments of the City of Lights are brought to life before your eyes. See landmarks such as the Notre-Dame Cathedral and its Gothic gargoyles, the Pantheon, an ancient Roman amphitheater, and more.

Get off the beaten path and see local sights you might otherwise miss. Cycle at a leisurely pace on a tour suitable for all ages and levels of fitness, and get inside tips from your guide.

name: Paris: Sacré-Coeur and Montmartre Tour with Expert Guide
shortDescription: Visit the inside of Sacré-Coeur, the Basilica of the Sacred Heart with an expert guide. Marvel at the world’s largest mosaic then enjoy an amazing walk around the village of Montmartre.
description:
Explore the outside of the Basilica of the Sacred Heart of Paris, built between 1874 and 1914, and enjoy the artistic and picturesque village of Paris.
Your guided tour begins outside the Sacred Heart. Learn about the exterior and interior of the Basilica from your expert guide. See the largest mosaic in the world, Christ in Majesty, depicting the Sacred Heart of Jesus, worshiped by the Virgin Mary, Jeanne d'Arc, and St. Michael the Archangel.
After the Basilica your guide will take you to the village of Montmartre. 
This neighborhood of Montmartre has always stood apart from the rest of Paris, not just as the large hill in the city’s northern 18th Arrondissement, but as the home to artists, revolutionaries, and outsiders who have played an important part in the unique history of Paris.
These streets hold wild stories and a unique perspective around every corner and the Place du Tertre is one of the most famous squares of Paris. There is no neighborhood more magical than Montmartre.

name: Paris: Wine Museum Guided Tour with Wine Tasting
shortDescription: Discover the secrets of French wine through a sensorial experience in a beautiful wine cellar. Taste three different wines and discuss with your sommelier. This tour is highly interactive and makes learning about wine easy and fun.
description:
Take part in a unique French wine experience in the heart of Paris. The experience takes place right by the Louvre, in stunning 18th century wine cellars that were once used by the King of France himself.

During the visit you will discover the various steps of the wine making process, from the grape to the bottle through a sensory experience. Each one of your 5 senses is stimulated with games, videos and surprising discoveries. The experience is highly interactive and learning about wine suddenly becomes easy and fun.

At the end of the tour, choose and taste the three wines of your choice. The sommelier will teach you the tasting techniques and explain the nuances of French grapes. The wine list changes every week.

name: Paris: Macarons Class, Teatime and To-Go Box
shortDescription: Learn how to make perfect macarons at a 2-hour hands-on class in the Latin Quarter of Paris. Discover the art of authentic macarons, followed by a teatime of drinks, shared stories about French culture, and a to-go box full of your own creations.
description:
Discover the secret to making perfect macarons at a hands-on small group class in the heart of Paris. Typically groups are between 3 to 7 people, making for an intimate experience and full attention from your host.

They will demonstrate and give detailed instructions on how to make macarons using the harder-to-master, but more reliable, Italian meringue technique. Learn to pipe, incorporate a color to your shells, and make a ganache or curd filling.

Once done, sit down to a shared teatime of tea, coffee, fruit juices, and some of your creations. This is the time when your host will share the story of the macaron, and a couple of other interesting stories about French culture - often tongue in cheek.

Before you depart, you will be loaded with a box of your very own creations, which you can share with your friends and family - or eat yourself over the next few days!

name: From Paris: Private Trip to Giverny, Monet's House & Museum
shortDescription: Take a half-day tour outside of Paris to Giverny, the former home of the Impressionist master Claude Monet. With a private guide, explore the pastoral house, garden and water lily pond where he lived and worked, plus visit the Museum of Impressionism.
description:
Your tour will start with a pick-up from your Paris hotel by your private guide for the roughly 1.5-hour drive by minivan to Giverny, where you will walk in the footsteps of Claude Monet. 

Upon arrival at Claude Monet's house and gardens, stroll with your guide through the rows of vibrant flowers in front of Monet's pink and green home. Visit the water lily pond and Japanese Bridge (pont Japonais), which you'll recognize from some of the Monet's best-known paintings. Admire the variety of vegetation, including cherry trees, tulips, roses, wisteria, weeping willows and irises. Explore the interior of the house, and see the kitchen, dining room, living space, bedrooms and the painter's collection of Japanese prints. As one of the leaders of the Impressionist movement of the 19th century, Monet introduced more perception, emotion and light into art of his age, and he spent almost 40 years developing his Giverny property. You'll also stop by his workshop. 

Afterward, head to the Musée des Impressionnismes (Museum of Impressionism), honoring Impressionist artists around the world. The museum depicts the history of this favorite art genre and features The Garden, designed by landscape painter Mark Rudkin, which offers a colorful nod to the themes dear to the Impressionists. Check out the permanent gallery, Monet Around, to learn about the influence Monet and his contemporaries had on the generations that followed them, and visit the temporary exhibitions. Your tour will end with a return to Paris for hotel drop-off.

name: Magnificence on Every Corner - Paris Walking Tour
shortDescription: Explore the heart of Paris on a guided walking tour and admire marvels such as the Notre-Dame Cathedral and Sainte-Chapelle.
description:
Start the exploration of the city from Ile de la Cité, the historical heart of Paris where the Notre Dame Cathedral stands.
Enjoy Notre Dame Cathedral from the outside and learn about its incredible history.
Walk the Medieval streets in the Latin Quarter and feel like a local.
With a local professional guide, witness some of the city’s most famous landmarks.
Indulge in a session of sightseeing, discovery, and exploration.
Besides witnessing fascinating gems of Paris, during the tour, you will hear various stories delivered in a friendly, charming way.

name: Paris: Christmas Food Tour with Local Guide
shortDescription: Embark on a walking tour with a Christmas twist on this food tour of Paris. Sample festive French delicacies and admire the sights of the city lit up with Christmas lights.
description:
Immerse yourself in Paris' festive gastronomy on this walking tour. This tour is designed to showcase the best seasonal French cuisine while exploring the illuminated streets of the City of Light. Enjoy up to four tastings washed down with mulled wine and hot chocolate.
Meet your guide in the vibrant Les Halles shopping district to begin your tour. Stroll to four different food outlets and enjoy samples at each. Listen to your local guide's explanations of the history and traditions of the city as you stroll. 
Warm up with a comforting cup of mulled wine or hot chocolate as you stroll past the best Christmas light installations in the city. 
The tour will end at the starting point. Feel free to ask your guide for recommendations on the best places to eat, drink, and visit in the city. They will also be happy to direct you back to your hotel.

name: From Paris: 2-Day Normandy & Brittany Tour
shortDescription: Spend 2 days exploring Normandy and Brittany and discover the history and beauty of these places. Travel away from Paris to the coast, stopping in the communes of Rouen, Honfleur, Arromanches, Caen, Saint-Malo, and Mont Saint-Michel.
description:
Discover the historic D-Day Beaches on a 2-day trip around the stunning French regions of Normandy and Brittany.

Detailed Itinerary

Day 1: Paris - Caen (Meals: D)
Take the Normandy motorway and make your first stop at Rouen for a walking tour in the old town before continuing to Honfleur. On the way between Rouen and Honfleur, enjoy a view of the newly built Pont de Normandie, a cable-stayed bridge.

Take free time for lunch once in Honfleur, then continue to the beaches of Normandy and pass by the landing area at Omaha Beach. Visit the American cemetery of Saint-Laurent, stop off in Arromanches, and then continue on for dinner and an overnight stay at Novotel Caen (or similar).

Day 2: Caen - Paris (Meals: B)

Leave Caen in the direction of Saint-Malo located in the Brittany region. Take a guided tour of the town, including a walk along the ramparts and the cathedral. After free time for lunch, depart for Mont-Saint-Michel, the frontier between the Brittany and Normandy regions.

Continue your afternoon with a guided visit of the abbey and free time for strolling and shopping, before returning to Paris.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower Hosted Tour, Seine Cruise and City Tour
shortDescription: Experience Paris with this combination tour. Organize your own itinerary including a bus tour and a Seine River cruise. Head to the Eiffel Tower’s 2nd or 3rd floors (if option selected) for spectacular views of the city – with direct access!
description:
See the best of Paris on a combination tour. Take a cruise along the Seine, see the city from the Eiffel Tower, and admire highlights on a bus tour. Learn about the City of Lights with an audio guide.
Visit iconic Parisian neighborhoods and monuments, enhanced with 3D reconstructions, 2D before and after slides, and 360-degree views of the interiors, enriched with audio commentary.  

Cruise along the Seine River on a glass-enclosed trimaran and see the city from the river. Soak up the spectacular views of the Musée d'Orsay, Notre-Dame Cathedral, the Louvre, Concorde Square, the Chaillot Palace, and other major sites.

On the river cruise, enjoy audio commentary and music with the provided headsets. Hear the history behind the famous sites that you pass. The audio is available in 13 languages and features a children's version, available in French only.

Visit the most famous monument in Paris - the Eiffel Tower. Ascend to the 2nd floor for stunning views of the City of Lights. Upgrade your tour to go all the way up to the summit for even more breathtaking views (if summit option selected).

name: Paris: Outdoor Walking Escape Game
shortDescription: Get ready to investigate Paris while visiting this beautiful city and explore with an outdoor escape game. Enjoy the top monuments Paris has to offer while solving a mystery along the way.
description:
Get ready to explore Paris in a new way with this exciting mystery game and sightseeing tour. Try this 2-hour investigation around Madeleine church.
Discover the Madeleine neighborhood in a very engaging and entertaining way with this unique tour. Solve clues, puzzles, and riddles, while learning about the city in a fun and exciting tour format.

Meet at the starting point and be introduced to the plot of the hunt and the itinerary. Nothing needs to be brought except comfortable footwear and excitement for an adventure.
Begin and end the tour in front of Madeleine Church. See the sumptuous Palais Garnier and the most luxurious square in the world: Place Vendôme, home to the famous Ritz Palace and the biggest names in haute couture as you explore on this tour. 
Walk along the beautiful Rue de Rivoli before solving the mystery in Place de la Concorde. Admire the breathtaking view on the Champs-Elysées, The Tuileries Garden, and the two greek temples that nowadays are home to Madeleine Church and The National Assembly.

Take the tour at any pace, but two hours is advised and is the average. In the event of getting lost, tour organizers are nearby and able to provide help.

name: Louvre Museum: Mona Lisa Without the Crowds Last Entry Tour
shortDescription: Get unobstructed views of the Mona Lisa without the crowds at the end of the day. Skip the ticket line and you’ll spend 3 hours viewing the very best artwork in the Louvre with an art historian, learning what makes these masterpieces so world-renowned.
description:
Skip the ticket line at the Louvre Museum at the end of the day to see masterpieces of art without the crowds. Follow a carefully designed route through the galleries to reach the Mona Lisa just as the museum is closing.
Tested and perfected, your itinerary inverts the normal Louvre route, allowing you to see much more than other visitors who are on normal tours that try to fit the rest of the museum into 1.5 hours.
Discover treasured landmarks, such as the historic foundations of the Kings’ Palace Moat. Marvel at ancient Greek and Roman sculptures, including the legendary Venus de Milo. Gaze in awe at Michelangelo’s Slaves and many other great works by French artists such as Delacroix and Géricault.
Admire the crown jewels of the former French monarchy, the Winged Victory monument, and works from the Italian Renaissance by Caravaggio, Raphael, and Da Vinci. End in front of the Mona Lisa after the crowds have left to get a better appreciation of her enigmatic beauty.

name: Secret Paris 3-Hour Bike Tour
shortDescription: Get off the usual tourist path and discover the secret sites of Paris on a 3-hour bike tour. A local guide will take you to some of the “City of Lights” hidden locations, exploring the street art, city markets and leafy side lanes like a true Parisian.
description:
Join a local guide and discover the most beautiful places of Paris on a 3-hour bike tour. Experience Paris like a local as you discover city gems, and learn what makes the city tick.

Depart from near the Notre Dame, and pedal off well-worn tourist paths to unearth the true soul of Paris. Feel like you are filming scenes from a romantic movie as you explore secret squares, see hidden stairways, and uncover the well concealed alleyways of the city center.

The places you visit are top secret; that’s why it’s a “Secret Paris” tour! Put a little faith in your trusty guide as they take you behind the scenes of one of world's most beautiful cities. To keep the romance burning, stop for refreshments at an idyllic city oasis.

Ideal for those that want to lose themselves in the romance and charm of Paris, the tour also covers plenty of history from the 2,000-year-old story of Paris.

name: Paris: Dinner at Ginger Restaurant & Show at Crazy Horse
shortDescription: Taste a delicious South Asian menu at the Ginger restaurant followed by watching a spectacular show at the Crazy Horse. Gaze at the dancers and visual effects as you sip on champagne with this ticket.
description:
Access to the show and half bottle of champagne Crazy Horse (or two other drinks) per person followed or preceded by dinner at the restaurant "Ginger"
At the Ginger: enjoy excellent and refined Southeast Asian cuisine.
Starters:Baby spinach leaves with pinion, parmesan & truffle infused oilTuna tartar & avocadoChicken fried spring rolls
Main Courses:Sauteed beef with (black Angus) onions, sesame and snow peasGrilled chicken with lemongrassTuna tataki, sesame sauceSides: rice, fried noodles or broccoliDesserts:Lemon sorbet & crystallized gingerMochi ice (3 pieces: Vanilla, Chocolate, Mango, Rasberry-lychee)Coconut milk tapioca with mangoSoft chocolate cakeThe dinner is served per person with red or white wine

At the Crazy Horse : the most sensual dancers in the world, legendary acts, stunning visual effects...Immerse yourself in the creative and sophisticated world of Crazy Horse Paris with the show "Totally Crazy !"

Monday through Friday :

- For the 8pm show, dinner is at 9:45pm
- For the 10:30pm show, dinner is at 8pm

Saturday:

- For the 7pm show, dinner is at 9pm
- For the 9:30pm show, dinner is at 7:30pm
- For the 11:45pm show, dinner is at 9:30pm

name: Paris: Family Dinosaur Tour in the Natural History Museum
shortDescription: Discover the dinosaurs in the Natural History Museum in Paris on a family-friendly private tour. Marvel at their skeletons, as well as those of other animals. Hear about the history of life with your friendly, knowledgeable guide.
description:
If you're looking for a family-friendly activity on your trip to Paris, you'll enjoy this private tour of the dinosaur exhibits at the Natural History Museum. Your guide will lead you into the world of dinosaurs and other animals from the prehistoric period and share lots of playful stories, anecdotes, and riddles along the way.

On arrival at the Museum of Natural History, your guide will accompany you directly to the Anatomy Gallery. You will discover an impressive collection of animal skeletons, including that of a 20-meter-long whale. You'll also discover the gigantic skeletons of Diplodocus, Allosaurus, and Triceratops. Explore a time long ago in the prehistoric world of dinosaurs and mammoths, and arrive back in the 21st century with a little more knowledge about the history of life on earth.

name: Paris: Private Food Tour – 10 Tastings with Locals
shortDescription: Get a taste of Paris and enjoy 10 of the best tastings the city offers. This tour covers all grounds with a combination of savory, sweet, and drinks plus city highlights in between food stops.
description:
Eat your way through Paris's culinary scene on a private food tour. Go on a delicious journey as you try 10 of the best food items beloved by the locals: from savory to sweet and local drinks; this tour leaves every foodie satisfied.
Enjoy a bite of 3 types of ultimate classic cheese plus 2 types of meat and crepe in their authentic, local flavor. Each tasting is typical of the local cuisine and hand-picked by a local guide passionate about food. 
Visit Le Viaduc des Arts, Hotel de Ville de Paris, and The Pletzl, plus other remarkable spots in between food stops, and learn about their history and cultural relevance from your knowledgeable guide.

name: Paris: Beer Bike Bar With Drinks Included
shortDescription: Pedal, chat, laugh, and drink as you enjoy awesome views of Paris. Be looked after by an amazing team and see Paris from a different perspective.
description:
Hop on the beer bike bar to have fun while exploring Paris from a fresh angle. Imagine discovering the most beautiful views of Paris while in a rolling bar, sipping a cold beer or a glass of wine.

Experience Paris in a completely new and original way, with your friends, colleagues, or family. Travel at your own pace since it is you who will be pedalling the bike around the city. Laughter and a good time are guaranteed on this beer bike tour.

The beer bike bar is a moving bar for up to 10 people. Cycle through Trocadéro, with amazing views of the Tour Eiffel. Go inside Foch Garden, around the Arc de Triomphe, and along the Champs Elysées.

name: Paris: Seine Cruise and Self-Guided Walking Tour
shortDescription: Admire beautiful views of Paris with your family or friends on an unforgettable guided Seine cruise. Hop off to explore the city's secrets at your own pace on a unique audio-guided tour on your smartphone.
description:
Guided Cruise:
Starting at the Eiffel Tower, cruise on a comfortable boat down the river for a taste of elegant Parisian life. Glide past the Grand Palais, the Louvre, Musée d'Orsay, and Notre Dame Cathedral. Your guide will entertain you throughout the leisurely cruise with anecdotes and intriguing historical facts.

The Paris cruise goes as far as the Institute of the Arabic World at the Ile Saint-Louis before returning you to the Eiffel Tower, and it's the most relaxing way to sightsee in Paris and is the only way to explore the city free of traffic noise and congestion.

1 City Tour of your choice:
After your cruise, hop off to explore the stunning capital at your own pace with an audio-guided walking tour. Start whenever you want and follow the voice of your guide from the Rewind Application: all stories trigger automatically as you walk. Choose between 10 available tours in Paris such as:

Secret Montmartre
From small hidden passages to the famous Sacré-Coeur Basilica, discover the fascinating village of Montmartre. Discover the origins of Montmartre over 1500 years ago and the legendary stories of artists like Picasso, Amélie Poulain. Visit the mythical cabarets and learn the origins of the famous windmills as well as the iconic Sacré-Cœur Basilica.

Paris Street-Art
Admire majestic works of art by the world's greatest street artists and learn about the history of street art.

Eiffel Tower
Discover the incredible story of the Eiffel Tower. "The Big Iron Lady" has been watching over the city and its inhabitants for more than 130 years

name: From Paris: Day Trip to Bruges with Seasonal Canal Cruise
shortDescription: Embark on a full-day guided trip to Bruges from Paris. Visit city highlights, including Ten Wijngaerde, the Basilica of the Holy Blood, and the Belfry, and take a cruise down the picturesque canals.
description:
Escape Paris for the day and cross the border to the capital of the West Flanders region of Flemish Belgium. The full-day tour, with round-trip transfers from central Paris, will take you to the UNESCO World Heritage city of Bruges, sometimes referred to as the “Venice of the North.”

Enjoy a guided walk of the historically rich center, admiring the gothic-style City Hall, the ornate Renaissance architecture of the Place du Bourg, and the 12th-century Basilique du Saint-Sang (Basilica of the Holy Blood), among other attractions. Free time will be allocated for lunch at a local restaurant, where you can enjoy Belgian specialties, such as traditional moules frites (mussels and French fries) and an extensive selection of Belgian beers.

A visit to the Groeningemuseum, home to Flemish master painters, such as van Eyck and Hieronymous Bosch is a popular way to spend an afternoon in Bruges. Alternatively, shop for handmade lace and Belgian chocolates in the city’s boutique stores. 
During the summer season, choose the guided option to enjoy a boat cruise along some of the most famous canals of Bruges, built as far back as the 12th century.

name: Louvre Museum Highlights: 2-Hour Private Guided Tour
shortDescription: Explore the vast collection of art in the Louvre Museum in private and at your own pace. Your expert guide will provide historical information and relate interesting stories behind the masterpieces.
description:
Follow your guide to the heart of the Louvre Museum and witness masterpieces from the Middle Ages to the 19th century. This private tour is priced for a group of up to 6 persons and your ticket includes admission to the permanent collections.

Your knowledgeable private guide will provide commentary with clarity and enthusiasm. Hear about the enigmatic Mona Lisa, for example, on a tour that matches your pace and interests. 

Have the opportunity to see major historical pieces from around the world. Admire the pearls of the Italian Renaissance, the Egyptian period, the French Revolution, and many more.

name: Paris: Louvre and Musée d'Orsay Private Tour
shortDescription: Discover some of the most beautful art in Paris on a private 5.5-hour tour of the Louvre and Orsay Museum. A national museum guide will lead you on an unforgettable tour to see masterpieces by Rembrandt, Da Vinci, Renoir, and much more.
description:
Discover masterpieces of French art on a private tour of 2 of the most famous museums in Paris. The Louvre and Musée d'Orsay are the essential duo for art lovers, and this full-day tour includes priority entry to both.

Your guide will pick you up at your hotel and take you to the Carrousel du Louvre, where you can admire the majestic architecture of the museum before skipping the long lines to enjoy a 2 hour tour tailored to your interests. See magnificent art by Rembrandt and Delacroix, as well as Leonardo da Vinci’s legendary Mona Lisa, and the famous Greek statue of the Venus de Milos.

After some free time for lunch, reconnect with your guide at 13:30 in front of the Orsay Museum. The former train station is now home to one of the most beautiful collections of Impressionist art in the world. Discover more than 4,000 works from the second half of the 19th century, including paintings by Renoir, Monet, Van Gogh, Gauguin, Rodin, and Maillol.

Hear fascinating stories about the artists and their most famous works on a tour that can always be tailored to your interests.

name: 1.5-Hour Paris Segway Night Tour
shortDescription: Enjoy this 1.5-hour Segway Night Tour starting from the center of Paris and going past the classic points of interest. This tour will show you what makes Paris the true city of lights!
description:
This 1.5-hour tour is a chance to discover Paris from a different and, perhaps, edgier, diverse and more romantic angle.

The tour start from central Paris where your guide will meet you and show you how to ride your Segway. Following a safety briefing, you'll begin to learn some interesting facts about Paris from your experienced guide.

During your experience, expect to see the Hotel des Invalides, Pont Alexandre III, Musee D'Orsay, the Louvre, Place de la Concorde, Petit Palais, Grand Palais, Eiffel Tower, Champ de Mars and Ecole Militaire. Enjoy the stunning sunset behind the pyramid of the Louvre, admiring the Eiffel Tower lit up at the end of your trip.

name: Discover Paris' Marché d’Aligre: 2-Hour Market Tour
shortDescription: Discover the bustling market culture of Paris during a 2-hour tour through the colorful Marché d’Aligre. Peruse the stalls of tapenades, spices, flowers, and coffees, and make your way to the attached flea market to shop for some interesting souvenirs.
description:
Discover a side of Paris often forgotten by tourists and visit the colorful Marché d’Aligre. When it comes to Paris markets, the Marché d’Aligre is about as lively as they come, bordering the vibrant North African shops and comprised of two market spaces: the indoor Marché Couvert Beauvau and the outdoor street market.

Visit the rare covered market, one of the last 20 remaining from the original "les passages couverts" or covered passages nestled behind Paris' great boulevards. Stroll through the rows of stalls and peruse the vast selections of tapenades, spices, flowers, and coffees, among other things, and then head over to the connecting flea market for some bizarre finds.

name: Paris: Latin Quarter Walking Tour with Wine Tastings
shortDescription: Enjoy an insider's journey through the Latin Quarter, the oldest neighborhood of Paris. Embark on a guided tour of the charming district, including hidden vineyard visits and delicious wine tastings.
description:
Become surrounded by history as you step into Paris' oldest neighborhood: the Latin Quarter. Join your guide on a walking tour through quaint narrow roads, picturesque buildings, and even hidden vineyards. Learn about the area's long-standing tradition of wine production and taste some local wines.
Start your tour at Jardin des Plantes, the second oldest park in Europe, where you'll discover one of the city's hidden vineyards. Stand outside the place where the wines of Paris were stored until the 1950s. Move on to another hidden vineyard to enjoy your first wine tasting. 
Continue on to the Place de la Contrescarpe, revisiting the literary giants of the quarter. Descend the Montagne Sainte Geneviève toward the Rue des Ecoles for your second tasting, accompanied by small shared plates of seasonal vegetable-based dishes. 
Pass by the Place Maubert, stopping to admire Notre Dame on your way across the Île-de-la-Cité. Arrive at the Île-Saint-Louis for your final tasting. Explore the world of natural wines, sampling at least 3 different wines, accompanied by cheeses, vegetables, and some of the best bread in Paris.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower City Tour with Louvre River Cruise
shortDescription: Get a comprehensive overview of Paris on a small group tour. Enjoy direct access to the 2nd floor of the Eiffel Tower for panoramic views, explore the Louvre Museum, see the damaged Notre-Dame Cathedral, and enjoy a cruise down the River Seine.
description:
Admire the Sacré-Cœur Basilica and get stunning views of Paris from Montmartre. Visit Place du Tertre and see a reconstructed windmill before taking the subway to the Île de la Cité, where Paris began. The City of Light started on this very island, growing from a Roman outpost into the most populous and prosperous city in Europe. Above it rises, Notre Dame. Severely damaged by a recent fire, she still stands proudly in the heart of the city; testament to the genius of its design and the endurance of France. Your guide will bring you as close as the ongoing restoration will permit to give you the best views possible.

You’ll then cross the river into the historic Latin Quarter with its Gothic churches and winding, cobbled, streets ending at Place Saint-Michel, a gathering place for locals and visitors alike. A short walk down the Seine brings you to the Louvre, where you’ll enjoy a 1-hour lunch break (with recommendations from your guide), before diving into the largest art museum in the world, to see some of its most spellbinding works of art (including the famous Mona Lisa).

Say goodbye to your guide at the Eiffel Tower and get a ticket for a 1-hour cruise on the River Seine to use at your leisure, as well as a direct access ticket to go to the 2nd floor of the Eiffel Tower. Get breathtaking views of the "City of Lights" and its iconic monuments.

name: Paris: "Live, Laugh, Love along the Seine" City Game
shortDescription: Follow clues and solve puzzles on your quest from the grounds of the Louvre Museum, through the quaint Saint-Germain-des-Prés, the lively Latin Quarter, and onto Île de la Cité. Enjoy a romantic adventure - best played with someone you love.
description:
Discover Paris’s fascinating history and attractions while solving clues around the city center. Experience the charms of the French capital as you embark on a quest with your friends, significant other, or family.

Follow the clues from one place to another to watch the secret story of each location unfold. Get all the instructions via email after booking and begin your adventure.

Play competitively in teams or in a group as you solve the romantic riddles hidden in Paris. Explore at your own pace and sightsee along the way. Visit city highlights like the Louvre, the Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel, and the Saint Germain des Pres Quarter while uncovering the romantic tales behind each turn.

name: Paris: Private 1-Hour Sightseeing Segway Tour
shortDescription: Glide through Paris and see the city's most famous sights on a Segway. Learn about the city's history, interesting facts, and local tips from your guide along the way.
description:
Explore Paris by a Segway i2 and see more of the city in less time. On this private 1-hour sightseeing tour enjoy commentary from your local guide and have a unique Parisian experience.

Start your tour near the National Residence of the Invalids, a historical complex dedicated to France's military history. From here, glide past the beautiful Alexandre III Bridge, built for the Paris Exposition in 1900. See some of the city's most classical buildings, the Grand Palais and Petit Palais, which currently serve as museums.

Afterward, make your way to the largest and most evocative square in Paris, Place de la Concorde, located at the eastern end of the Champs-Élysées. Your tour concludes with a spectacular view of the iconic Eiffel Tower.

name: Paris: Photography Class for Beginners
shortDescription: Discover how to communicate with your camera with the help of a professional photographer in this 3-hour private course. Learn to use aperture, shutter speed, and ISO settings to get the perfect shot.
description:
Discover all the possibilities offered by your DSLR, hybrid, bridge, or compact camera equipped with manual mode. During this 3-hour class, your instructor will guide you through the main settings you need to master in order to obtain the perfect images.

Meet your instructor, a passionate professional photographer, at any place you like in Paris. If you don't have your own camera, you will be loaned one for no additional cost. Get ready to understand how to communicate your vision to the camera so that it always gives you what you really want.

This private class will be personally tailored to your individual needs. Learn how to get the perfect depth of field, how to stop or show the movement of the subject, how to always get your subject in focus, and how to make perfect use of the natural light. Receive a booklet at the end of the course to recap all the advice your instructor gave you so you can continue practicing your new skills.

name: Paris: Monuments Tour in a Motorcycle Sidecar
shortDescription: Feel the wind in your hair as you drive down Paris's grand boulevards in a motorcycle sidecar. Tour the city from the road and see landmarks like Arc de Triomphe, Opéra Garnier, and the Eiffel Tower
description:
See Paris's major landmarks on a tour that takes you around the city in a motorcycle sidecar. Ride across to the right bank and down the grand boulevards designed by Haussmann to see the Arc de Triomphe, the Louvre, and Eiffel Tower. 
Your tour begins at Pont Bir-Hakeim, from where you will cross over to the right bank and stop between the wings of the Palais de Chaillot at the Place du Trocadero. Have a short introduction to Paris with a view across the Seine River to the Eiffel Tower. 
Then zoom down Baron Haussmann's boulevards before regaling in stories from the Napoleonic dynasty at the majestic Arc de Triomphe and the Opéra Garnier. Go as far as the Louvre to take photos and then return via the Champs Elysées and Pont Alexandre III with a stop at the foot of the Eiffel Tower.
Your ride around Paris concludes back at the Pont Bir Hakeim where you will walk away with new memories, and enough recommendations from your guide to go create more fun experiences.

name: Paris: 3-Hour Interactive History Walking Tour
shortDescription: Engage your family with an entertaining adventure in the heart of Paris while solving riddles and exploring history. Learn about the city in a fun way with your private, family-friendly guide and activity booklets during this 3-hour walking tour.
description:
Entertain your teens and family with an informative and playful walking tour in Paris to discover its history. Your passionate guide will lead you through the history of Paris and give each of your kids an activity booklet to help uncover quirky stories and facts along the way. Travel through time from the Middle Ages to the French Revolution to grasp the building blocks of Paris as its known today.

Begin your journey in antiquity by meeting your cheery guide near one of the most impressive Gallo-Roman sites in Paris, the Cluny Thermae. Travel through time again to reach the Latin Quarter. Spot remnants of the Middle Ages and other periods to observe the epic history that still shows itself in the streets of Paris today.

Stroll a bit further to reach Paris’s two natural islands on the Seine River, Ile de la Cité and Ile Saint Louis. Walk along the Cité Island and observe the iconic Gothic jewel of Notre Dame, poised in all her glory. Then meander through the charming, village-like streets of Ile Saint Louis to discern its medieval architecture and atmosphere.

Next, step into the Marais district, the heart of historical Paris. Private mansions, hidden gardens to splendid churches, your guide will show you timeless wonders that you will see only in this neighborhood, behind closed walls and secret passages.

Sit back and relax in a typical Parisian café for a well-deserved break. Enjoy a delicious pastry and warm drink while your guide recounts more tales of the past for you. Finally, head toward Bastille Square for your last history lesson. Recall the events of July 14, 1789 and the famous Storming of La Bastille. Try to visualize how the fortress once stood and see what revolutionary symbol now occupies the square before concluding your tour.

name: Paris Champs-Élysées 2-Hour Private Walking Tour
shortDescription: Explore the Champs-Élysées and its monuments on a private guided walk that takes you along one of the world's most elegant avenues. Admire its symmetry, its epic width and luxury, and learn about its surprising history and great importance historically.
description:
On this 2-hour private guided Champs-Élysées tour you’ll visit one of the principal shopping areas of Paris, and may be somewhat surprised to learn that it used to be a simple park that was home to bars and third-rate theaters.

During the walking tour your guide will introduce you to both sides of the mythical Champs Elysees. Learn about its connection to Roman mythology and to Napoleon, and how the avenue relates to the Paris of the 19th century as well as the Paris of today.

Principal sites visited on the tour include Place de la Concorde, the Luxor Obelisk, Hôtel de Crillon, Petit Palais, Grand Palais, Avenue des Champs-Élysées, Avenue Montaigne, Ladurée macaron shop, and the Arc de Triomphe.

name: Secrets of the Left Bank free tour: From Notre Dame to Pantheon (Available in English)
description:
See what 2,000 years of civilization can produce on this tour of Left Bank. Explore the area of Notre Dame, Sorbonne University and the Pantheon. 

Immerse yourself in the fine art of student life, Paris-style. Walk the secret medieval streets and discover the cozy cafés you can get back to. Learn more about Victor Hugo, Cyrano de Bergerac and Hemingway and find out about their connexion to the neighborhood. Stroll the side of Paris that has art, ideas and revolution in it. 
Tour ends near metro station: Cluny, and RER station Luxembourg.


Important information: 
- Lasts around 90 minutes, in English, along a short and comfortable route 
- Engaging and enthusiastic, born-and-raised local guide 
- This is a free tour: At the end of the tour, pay what you want. 
- We walk rain or shine. In hot weather, we keep to the shade, and the guide brings fans for everyone. So just look for the guide in a pink vest!

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Discover the French Renaissance in the Luxembourg Gardens (Available in )
description:
The Senate Palace, the fabulous French-style gardens and of course ladies and gentlemen who admire art and history, the Luxembourg Gardens that are worth (at least) an hour's walk as you have to stop first to admire the architectural details of the palace, a perfect example of the French Renaissance, imported by Leonardo Da Vinci. Later I will tell you the myths and anecdotes of the life of the royalty of the time that hide the gardens and that you cannot miss! With this free tour, I propose a trip back in time to the time of the great names of the Renaissance: Marie de Medicis, Henri IV, and many more!

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Emily in Paris TV series guided tour! (Available in English, Spanish, French)
description:
Bonjour!
 
Did you enjoy the adventures (and misfortunes) of our Netflix heroine Emily in Paris?

Want to walk in her high heel shoes and see it all by yourself? Experience Emily's life in the very first EIP tour crafted to follow her steps in the City of Lights. If you don't end up meeting your Gabriel, at least you will enjoy an authentic "pain au chocolat". À bientôt!

Places we'll visit:

  • Emily's apartment building
  • Boulangerie Moderne
  • Gabriel's restaurant
  • Emily's workplace 
  • Royal Palace Gardens
  • Le Louvre
  • and much more!


The tour starts at the Pantheon (5th district) and finishes around Opera-Louvre (1st district)

Please note that the minimum number of participants for this tour is 8 adults. 

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Tour in Italiano del centro di Parigi lungo la Senna (Available in Italian)
description:
*** tour not suitable for children under 16 ***

The ideal tour to start your trip to Paris! Learn about the history of the French capital with an Italian guide as you admire the various monuments along the Seine River, from the Main Town Hall to the Louvre Pyramid, passing Notre Dame Cathedral and France's first royal palace.

An itinerary full of history, and curious facts along with tips for your stay in Paris.

Among the various monuments along our path:

  • the Hôtel de Ville in Paris
  • the Notre Dame Cathedral
  • the Holy Chapel
  • The Conciergerie
  • the Pont Neuf
  • the Institute of France
  • the Pont des Arts
  • The Louvre and its famous Pyramid
  • Avenue de l'Opera


 *** the tour is not recommended for children under 16 ***

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free tour under the sky of Paris (Available in Spanish)
description:
This free tour is, perhaps, your first encounter with the beautiful Paris, which is why I want to propose that you visit it together to discover it and fall in love with it.
The most emblematic places, the characters that inhabited them and some picturesque stories that nestle in them will be the pillars of this tour that, I assure you, will be unforgettable and will make you promise to visit it again.


Some of the places we will visit are:

  • hotel de ville
  • Notre Dame Cathedral.
  • Palais de justice, Sainte-Chapelle, Conciergerie.
  • Pont Neuf.
  • Louvre Museum.
  • Louvre pyramids.
  • Triumphal Arch of the Carrousel.
  • Jardin des Tuileries.


After 2 hours 30 minutes we will go through them and, as they say that the first impression is the one that is never forgotten, I leave you the proposal to live this unforgettable experience of walking together under the sky of Paris.


⚠ ️ Note: Reservations for groups larger than 6 adults are not accepted without prior notice. This includes under more reservations using other names. The tour format is NOT private. If you wish to join your group on the tour, there is a prepaid group fee that must be applied before beginning the visit. You can also book a private tour on any available date⚠️

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Paris: Disneyland® Tickets and Shuttle Transport
shortDescription: Hop aboard the Disneyland® Paris Express shuttle bus for a magical day out for the whole family. Enjoy this unique experience with transportation from the center of Paris and entrance tickets to the Disneyland® parks or the Walt Disney Studios® Park.
description:
The Disneyland® Paris express shuttle offers a new way of getting from the center of Paris to the Disneyland® parks. This package includes transportation and entrance to the Disney® parks.

The Disneyland® Paris express shuttle offers 3 strategic bus stops in the heart of Paris with attractive prices for the whole family. There are stops located at Eiffel Tower, Gare du Nord, Opéra and Châtelet. You'll find more details for each of these strategic stops in the meeting point section. 

The shuttle features air-conditioning to ensure a comfortable ride.

name: Paris: Arc de Triomphe Entry with Seine Cruise
shortDescription: Explore Paris from its highest point with skip-the-line Arc de Triomphe tickets followed by a cruise past some of the city's most iconic landmarks along the Seine River.
description:
Enjoy the perfect day out in Paris with a combo package that grants you priority entrance to the Arc de Triomphe and a river cruise on the Seine, each of which can be used at the time of day which suits you best.

At the Arc de Triomphe, skip the long lines and head straight up to the top of the monument to admire iconic views of the Champs-Elysées. Climb to a height of 50 meters to reach the viewing platform for views of the surrounding streets that will make the 284-step climb worthwhile. You may also witness the lighting of the eternal flame every night at 6:30 pm or visit the tomb of the Unknown Soldier at the foot of the monument.

Afterward, head to the Bateaux Parisiens for a cruise on the River Seine. Relax and take in views of some of Paris' most iconic landmarks, including the Louvre, the Musée d'Orsay, Notre Dame de Paris, and some of the city's many bridges. You can also admire Paris institutions such as the Eiffel Tower and the Hotel du Ville from a unique perspective.

name: Paris: Eiffel Tower, Seine River Cruise, and Louvre Tour
shortDescription: If you only have a short stay in Paris, this tour takes in the highlights. See the Eiffel Tower, the Seine, and the Louvre, in one day. To see Louvre you must choose the option with Louvre.
description:
See all the world-renowned highlights of Paris in just one day. Take an elevator ride up the Eiffel Tower, join a scenic Seine cruise, pass by the Notre Dame Cathedral, and add an optional visit to the Louvre Pyramid on this guided tour of the city.
Meet your local guide near the Eiffel Tower - be the first in line, avoid the crowds, and appreciate the amazing views of Paris from the 2nd or top floor (depending on the option you choose). Learn everything you need to know about the construction of the tower and the life of Gustave Eiffel.

In the late morning, continue your tour with a boat ride on the Seine River to discover Paris and its waterfront landmarks such as the Orsay museum, the Louvre Museum, the Conciergerie, the Alexandre III Bridge, and the Notre-Dame de Paris Cathedral. 
Then, get the train to the Louvre Museum and experience the atmosphere of Paris like a local, but also hear the most interesting facts about the train system and walk along the Seine River with your guide until you reach the world's largest museum, the Louvre. Listen to your guide give important information about its history and decide how to best enjoy your time inside. 
Most notably, see the Mona Lisa in person and explore the Italian and French painting departments or the antique Egyptian and Greek departments.
